Teaser: Cardiac function improved in mice with induced heart failure administered a piece of RNA that controls the calcium-pump gene SERCA2a, long tied to HF     pathophysiology.

Headlines: EU OKs Diabetes Drug Empagliflozin, to Be Known as Jardiance
Teaser: Empagliflozin, the third in a new class of oral drugs for type 2 diabetes, has been given a positive opinion by the EU CHMP and so is expected to be     approved in Europe soon, which will be its first market.

Headlines: New Data on Bisphosphonates-AF Link: Should FDA Revisit?
Teaser: In a new meta-analysis, both oral and IV bisphosphonates were tied to a greater risk of new-onset AF; the researchers advise careful patient selection and     closer monitoring of high-risk patients.

Headlines: New Guidelines Extend Statins to 13M More Americans
Teaser: Of the 12.8 million Americans who would be eligible under the new ACC/AHA cholesterol guidelines, more than 10 million new prescriptions would be for     patients in primary prevention.

Headlines: WHO Joins Clamor to Make New Hepatitis C Pills Affordable
Teaser: The World Health Organization wants a 'concerted effort' to drive down the cost of new hepatitis C drugs that offer a cure for the liver-destroying virus but are unaffordable for most infected people worldwide.

Headlines: Studies Cast Doubt on Need to Stockpile Influenza Drugs
Teaser: Systematic reviews of neuraminidase inhibitor studies based on internal clinical trial documents lead researchers to question the utility of drug stockpiles.

Headlines: Zogenix Files Suit Against State Ban on Zohydro ER
Teaser: After a decision by Massachusetts to ban the controversial single-entity hydrocodone, the company has filed for a restraining order, saying FDA regulatory authority 'simply should not be usurped by individual states.'

Headlines: NSCLC Patients Without EGFR Mutations Better on Chemo
Teaser: Chemotherapy may be preferable to targeted agents in patients with non-small cell lung cancer without EGFR mutations, suggests a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: Positive Topline Results for New Schizophrenia Drug
Teaser: Once-monthly treatment with aripiprazole lauroxil, a new injectable, long-acting antipsychotic, significantly reduces positive and negative symptoms in schizophrenia patients.

Headlines: Identifying Patients Who Respond to Immunomodulator MK-3475
Teaser: Early data show that PD-L1 tumor expression signifies better response to the investigational immunotherapy agent MK-3475 in patients with melanoma or lung cancer.

Headlines: First-in-Class Drug Shows Activity in Advanced Blood Cancers
Teaser: Early data suggest that a novel IDH2 mutant inhibitor is effective in relapsed and refractory acute hematologic cancers.

Headlines: Preeclampsia: Low-Dose Aspirin May Prevent Poor Outcomes
Teaser: Daily low-dose aspirin appears to prevent morbidity and mortality from preeclampsia, according to a systematic review for the USPSTF, but potential rare or long-term harms could not be ruled out.

Headlines: Ultrasensitive 'Liquid Biopsy' May Detect Many Solid Tumors
Teaser: A next-generation sequencing-based method for circulating tumor DNA analysis achieves both an ultra low detection limit and broad patient coverage at a reasonable cost, researchers say.

Headlines: Novel Treatment Strategy in Melanoma Misses End Point
Teaser: A vaccine for advanced melanoma just missed significantly improving overall survival

Headlines: Atopic Dermatitis Symptoms in Children Are Persistent
Teaser: Symptoms of atopic dermatitis in children appear to persist into the second decade of life, and often longer.

Headlines: AAO Rolls Out Comprehensive Patient Registry
Teaser: Data will help clinicians improve patient care and researchers conduct better studies, ophthalmologists say.

Headlines: Most ICD Athletes Can Play Sports Without Cardiac Risks
Teaser: Two debaters, citing similar research, both make the case that most athletes with heart problems requiring an implantable cardioverter defibrillator should     be allowed to participate in sports.

Headlines: NIMH Tightens Up Funding Criteria for Clinical Trials
Teaser: In an effort to improve the development of treatments for psychiatric disorders, the NIMH has changed its funding policies for future clinical trials, including timelier reporting of results.

Headlines: Darapladib Fails to Reduce CVD Risk in STABILITY
Teaser: pproximately one in five patients treated with darapladib stopped taking the investigational Lp-PLA2 inhibitor because of adverse effects, including     malodorous feces, urine, and skin.

Headlines: Hepatitis C Drug Trials to Take Spotlight at Liver Congress
Teaser: The European Association for the Study of the Liver International Liver Congress 2014 will feature phase 3 data on all-oral regimens for hepatitis C.

Headlines: Medical Marijuana: What the Research Shows
Teaser: Dustin Sulak, DO, is a doctor on the front lines of medical marijuana.

Headlines: JAMA Review: Stop One-Size-Fits-All Mammography
Teaser: After reviewing 50 years of mammography screening data, a pair of researchers conclude it is time to individualize the testing.

Headlines: FDA Panel Recommends 2 New Anti-MRSA Agents
Teaser: FDA anti-infectives panel recommends approval of 2 antibacterial agents to help fight healthcare- and community-acquired bacterial infections.

Headlines: HEAT-PPCI: Heparin Bests Bivalirudin in STEMI, Amid Heated Debate
Teaser: UPDATED // The HEAT-PPCI took heat like no other trial on the last day of the ACC 2014 meeting, with panelists and other observers protesting the unexpected results     and the ethics of the unique study design.

Headlines: Swiss Medical Board: Stop Widespread Mammography Screening
Teaser: An advisory body in Switzerland has proposed that the country end systematic breast cancer screening with mammography.

Headlines: FDA Warns Against Morcellation in Hysterectomy, Myomectomy
Teaser: The FDA is discouraging the use of laparoscopic power morcellators because of the risk of spreading cancerous tissue, which could significantly worsen the patient's likelihood of long-term survival.

Headlines: Ketamine: New Potential as Rapid PTSD Treatment
Teaser: In addition to a headline grabber as a rapid treatment for major depression, the anesthetic agent ketamine shows promise as a novel and fast-acting therapy for chronic PTSD.

Headlines: Peginterferon Boosts Hep B Treatment Response to Entecavir
Teaser: Adding pegylated interferon to nucleos(t)ide analog treatment of hepatitis B could increase the chances for discontinuation of treatment and thereby reduce costs.

Headlines: Structural Brain Differences Seen in Casual Marijuana Users
Teaser: The study is the first to show structural brain differences in young occasional marijuana users vs controls and raises questions about the legalization of recreational marijuana, researchers say.

Headlines: Chinese Herb Equals Methotrexate in Rheumatoid Arthritis Study
Teaser: The traditional Chinese medicine 'thunder god vine' (Tripterygium wilfordii Hook f) was  noninferior to methotrexate for treating RA, and the combination was better than methotrexate used alone.

Headlines: Human Cytomegalovirus Blocks Erythropoietin Synthesis in CKD
Teaser: Kidneys from patients with CKD were positive for human cytomegalovirus protein (hCMV), and  high blood levels of hCMV immunoglobulin G  were associated with anemia, a study has shown.

Headlines: Ranibizumab Holds Visual Line in Real-World Study
Teaser: A postmarketing study shows that previously treated and treatment-naïve patients had good visual acuity results at 1 year, with a low incidence of adverse ocular events.

Headlines: Chemotherapy 'Vastly Underutilized' in Bladder Cancer
Teaser: Neoadjuvant use hovers at 4%, whereas adjuvant chemotherapy is increasing in popularity, according to data from the Ontario Cancer Registry.

Headlines: Fecal Calprotectin Distinguishes Organic From Functional Disorder
Teaser: Fecal calprotectin is a non-invasive test that helps clinicians distinguish between organic inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and functional disorder (irritable bowel syndrome, or IBS), according to new research from the UK.

Headlines: Investigational ADC Shows Signs of Activity in Melanoma
Teaser: Early phase 1 data show that experimental DEDN6526A is well tolerated, and several patients achieved clinical benefits.

Headlines: FDA Approves Weekly Injectable Albiglutide (Tanzeum) for T2D
Teaser: Albiglutide, to be marketed as Tanzeum, is a once-weekly injectable glucagonlike peptide 1 receptor agonist.

Headlines: NSAIDs Double Bleeding Risk With Anticoagulants for DVT/PE
Teaser: Patients taking anticoagulants for deep vein thrombosis or pulmonary embolism should not take NSAIDs or aspirin for pain and should instead reach for     acetaminophen, researchers caution.

Headlines: Diabetes Prevalence Rose Substantially in 20 Years
Teaser: Despite improvements in glycemic control in patients with diabetes, obesity and confirmed diabetes rates have increased substantially over the course of the last 2 decades.

Headlines: Atlas of Human Brain Development Released
Teaser: New project facilitates research into human brain development and brain-based disorders, such as autism.

Headlines: Calcium/CVD Risk Debate Gets New Fodder From Analysis
Teaser: The meta-analysis contradicts previous studies suggesting that calcium supplements could increase the risk of MI.

Headlines: Novel Aerosol Spray May Provide On-Demand Anxiety Relief
Teaser: A synthetic neuroactive steroid in the form of an aerosol spray works like a pheromone to rapidly reduce symptoms of social anxiety.

Headlines: Mechanism for Ipilimumab Pituitary Toxicity Identified
Teaser: Expression of CTLA-4 on pituitary endocrine cells could underlie hypophysitis secondary to CTLA-4 blockade with ipilimumab, which has implications for care.

Headlines: Investigative CDK Inhibitor Shows Promise in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Early data show that LY2835219 has clinical activity in a number of cancer types, including hormone receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer.

Headlines: Pregnancy Complications in Women With Eating Disorders
Teaser: Women with a history of eating disorders were at higher risk of a range of pregnancy-related complications, a new study from Finland found.

Headlines: FDA Approves Ceritinib for ALK-Positive Lung Cancer
Teaser: This is the second targeted agent specifically for ALK-positive non-small cell lung cancer patients, indicated for patients who have already used crizotinib.

Headlines: Analysis Attacks Stem-Cell Data in CHD, Another Gives Tepid Support
Teaser: UPDATED // Reports on dozens of autologous stem-cell trials in CHD are riddled with inconsistencies and errors, claims a review; other researchers, hopeful about the     therapy, decry the poor quality of evidence.

Headlines: Light Therapy Effective for Daytime Sleepiness in PD
Teaser: Exposure to bright light reduces daytime sleepiness in patients with Parkinson's disease.

Headlines: Psoriatic Arthritis: Golimumab Safe, Effective at 5 Years
Teaser: Long-term safety and efficacy were sustained for golimumab in psoriatic arthritis, with little difference between 50- and 100-mg doses, authors report.

Headlines: Testosterone and CV Risk? No Quick Answers
Teaser: Another prestigious entity--this time the Lancet--is wading into the debate over the cardiovascular risks of testosterone prescriptions in older men,     warning against leaning too heavily on observational studies.

Headlines: Photobiomodulation in Diabetic Macular Edema
Teaser: Patients with non-center-involving diabetic macular edema (NCDME) may benefit from photobiomodulation, a new case series suggests.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAN 2014?
Teaser: Medscape discusses changes to the program and expected highlights of the American Academy of Neurology's 66th Annual Meeting, beginning this weekend in Philadelphia.

Headlines: Upping Coffee Consumption Protects Against Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Healthy individuals who began to drink more coffee saw a protective effect against future development of type 2 diabetes, compared with those who didn't     change their caffeine habits.

Headlines: New Center to Improve Research Quality Launches at Stanford
Teaser: A new center, led by John Ioannidis, MD, DSc, and Steven Goodman, MD, MHS, PhD, has been established to evaluate how scientific research is conducted and try to incentivize the use of best practices.

Headlines: Cancer Drug Trials That Should, But Won't, Be Done
Teaser: Clinical trials comparing older, cheaper cancer drugs with newer, more expensive agents that are only marginally more effective would make a lot of economic sense, an new essay claims.

Headlines: Drug Improves Vision in Idiopathic Intracranial Hypertension
Teaser: This is the first strong evidence that acetazolamide works in this condition, lead author of the NORDIC IIH study says.

Headlines: Siltuximab: First-Ever Drug for Castleman's Disease
Teaser: The FDA has approved the first-ever drug treatment for Castleman's disease, a rare blood disorder similar to lymphoma.

Headlines: Vitamin D No Help in Fall Risk, Large Meta-Analysis Shows
Teaser: Meta-analysis of 20 studies shows vitamin D supplements do not reduce the risk of falling in the elderly.

Headlines: TARGET: STROKE Cuts Door-to-Needle Time, Improves Outcomes
Teaser: New data from the quality improvement program confirm that reducing the time from hospital arrival to administration of thrombolysis is safe and linked to less bleeding, better outcomes in stroke.

Headlines: More Smoking Equals Lower Quality of Life
Teaser: A review of studies that looked at quality of life (QoL) among people who smoke showed a consistent, negative relationship between smoking and QoL, often in a dose-dependent manner.

Headlines: Radical Surgery for Mesothelioma: Still Controversial
Teaser: The role of radical surgery in the treatment of malignant pleural mesothelioma has been the subject of much heated debate in the last few years, and it remains controversial, say experts.

Headlines: Liquid Biopsy May Guide Treatment Decision in Bladder Cancer
Teaser: A blood test performed before radical cystectomy in patients with urothelial cancer of the bladder could identify the presence of circulating tumor cells, which are predictive of outcome, study shows.

Headlines: Ramucirumab (Cyramza) Receives FDA OK for Stomach Cancer
Teaser: The new drug blocks the blood supply to tumors that cannot be surgically excised or that have metastasized after chemotherapy.

Headlines: Canada Clears Umeclidinium (Incruse) for COPD
Teaser: The long-acting muscarinic antagonist is indicated for long-term maintenance bronchodilator treatment of airflow obstruction in adults with COPD.

Headlines: Regular VEGF Inhibitor Dosing Better in Macular Degeneration
Teaser: Patients treated with a reactive as-needed approach, rather than a proactive approach, could lose visual acuity that cannot be regained, a new analysis suggests.

Headlines: FDA Approves Vorapaxar (Zontivity) to Cut MI, Stroke Risk
Teaser: The new drug is a first-in-class antiplatelet agent. Support for the approval comes from the 25 000-patient TRA 2P     TIMI-50 trial.

Headlines: Natalizumab Improves Walking and Physical Abilities in MS
Teaser: Post hoc analysis of the AFFIRM study shows natalizumab improves performance on a walking test in patients with MS; new results with prolonged-release fampridine on walking from the MOBILE study.

Headlines: Antipsychotics, Mood Stabilizers May Reduce Violent Crime
Teaser: Antipsychotic therapy in individuals with severe mental illness may have potentially large effects on real-world outcomes, including violent crime, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Integrin Antagonist Shows Promise in Ulcerative Colitis
Teaser: AJM300, under development in Japan, is the first oral alpha-4 integrin antagonist to show clinical benefit in inflammatory bowel disease.

Headlines: Frailty Scoring System Predicts Postop Mortality in Elderly
Teaser: A new multidimensional frailty scoring system predicted postoperative mortality in elderly patients better than established methods, according to a new study.

Headlines: New ASCO Guidelines Address HER2-Positive Breast Cancer
Teaser: New ASCO guidelines recommend HER2-targeted therapy for most patients with HER2-positive advanced breast cancer, using trastuzumab, pertuzumab, and taxane for first-line treatment.

Headlines: Recombinant Growth Factor Reduced Cartilage Loss in Knee OA
Teaser: Recombinant human fibroblast growth factor 18 missed the primary efficacy endpoint of a randomized, placebo-controlled study but slowed cartilage loss in some parts of the osteoarthritic knee.

Headlines: VEGF Blockade May Slow, but Not Halt, Progression in DME
Teaser: High VEGF, as well as glucotoxicity or other causes, may hasten progression of retinal nonperfusion in diabetic macular edema, suggesting ranibizumab may not prevent retinal capillary closure.

Headlines: Big Baby Bottles Mean More Calories
Teaser: For bottle-fed infants, use of a larger bottle encourages overfeeding, leading to the intake of a gallon of extra formula, on average, over the course of month.

Headlines: India: Cancer Incidence Increasing, Mortality High
Teaser: Although incidence of cancer is low in India compared with that in high-income countries, mortality is high and government commitment to cancer care is urgently needed.

Headlines: Pricey WHI Trial Paid Off in Reduced CVD, Cancer Costs
Teaser: Researchers estimate that $260 million was money well spent on a 2002 study of combined hormone therapy to prevent CVD. Cost savings in cancers and CVD averted have been in the billions.

Headlines: Alemtuzumab Extension Shows Durable MRI Effects in MS
Teaser: Imaging findings after 3 years' follow-up in the CARE-MS studies show most patients are still free of MRI activity. Treatment also slowed the yearly rate of brain volume loss, researchers say.

Headlines: Topical Eye Gels Do Not Inhibit Povidone-Iodine Antisepsis
Teaser: Despite concerns, topical lidocaine gels applied prior to cataract surgery do not compromise the antibacterial effect of povidone-iodine, new research shows.

Headlines: 'Rising Star' in Diabetes Field, Michaela Diamant, Dies at 51
Teaser: Visionary, brilliant, and honest: these were the 3 words that best described Dr. Michaela Diamant, says one of her closest friends and former mentor. Dr.     Diamant died recently, at the age of just 51.

Headlines: Deltyba Approved for Multidrug-Resistant TB in Europe
Teaser: The European Commission has approved delamanid (Deltyba) for the treatment of pulmonary multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.

Headlines: Improved Survival in Cancer Patients With High Vitamin D
Teaser: Higher levels of vitamin D have again been linked to improved outcomes in several different cancers, including better overall and cancer-specific survival.

Headlines: Glucantime Side Effects in Leishmaniasis Not Worse in Children
Teaser: Cutaneous leishmaniasis treatment with systemic meglumine antimoniate (Glucantime, Sanofi Aventis) is generally fairly well tolerated in children and the rate of adverse events is similar to that seen in adults.

Headlines: Pixantrone a 'Milestone' for Aggressive Relapsed B-cell NHL
Teaser: Patients with aggressive B-cell non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (NHL) who have failed after second-line therapy have few options: now pixantrone can be used in Europe.

Headlines: What's Hot at APA 2014?
Teaser: Promised attention-grabbers at this year's APA Annual Meeting include more on the DSM-5, translational science, mental illness in youth, clinical ethics, and even a few celebrity sightings.

Headlines: HRS Sessions to Honor the Wireless Revolution in Healthcare
Teaser: From the opening plenary to many of the 18 late-breaking trial presentations, this year's theme focuses on medical device interactivity and networking and     how they're changing healthcare.

Headlines: Pfizer to Apply for Early Approval of Breast Cancer Drug
Teaser: Pfizer on Friday said it planned to seek U.S. approval for palbociclib, its experimental drug for advanced breast cancer, in the third quarter.

Headlines: Nighttime Hypertension Best Predictor of MI and Stroke
Teaser: For every 10-mm-Hg increase in nighttime systolic blood pressure, the risk of cardiovascular outcomes was increased 25%. In contrast, daytime and clinic     hypertension failed to predict the future risk of MI or stroke.

Headlines: 'Worsening HF' Poorly Understood, Predicts Death in Acute HF
Teaser: It nearly doubles six-month mortality, independently, in patients already hospitalized for acute heart failure, suggests a pooled analysis of four acute-HF     drug trials.

Headlines: Which New Oral Anticoagulant for Stroke Prevention in AF?
Teaser: Researchers compared safety and efficacy outcomes in the large phase 3 trials of four NOACs and identified knowledge gaps in translating these trials into     clinical practice.

Headlines: Obesity Ups Mortality Risk in Young Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: Obesity is associated with a higher risk for breast cancer mortality, but only in premenopausal women with estrogen-receptor-positive disease.

Headlines: BMJ Withdraws Statement on Statin-Related AEs
Teaser: Two research papers erroneously cited that 20% of patients develop statin-related adverse events, a figure that is based on observational data. These     statements have been withdrawn and BMJ will review next steps.

Headlines: Positive New Results for Eteplirsen, Drisapersen in DMD
Teaser: Results of open-label extension studies suggest that treating boys with Duchenne muscular dystrophy earlier and for longer periods of time with exon-skipping drugs may improve outcomes.

Headlines: Indoor Lifestyle Linked to Myopia in Children
Teaser: Increased time spent indoors is associated with the development of myopia in children; spending time outdoors may have a protective effect.

Headlines: Kidney Injury and Statins? New Analysis Disputes Link
Teaser: A new meta-analysis focused only on randomized clinical trials found no signal of increased adverse renal events with high-potency statins, something a         larger observational study reported last year.

Headlines: Chagas Disease Drug Disappoints, but Offers Hope
Teaser: Posaconazole for Chagas disease has shown disappointing outcomes, yet hopeful signs for the future, in a clinical trial.

Headlines: Resveratrol Does Not Reduce CVD Risk, Prolong Life
Teaser: Resveratrol has been shown to have antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties in vitro and in animal models, but this study suggests it won't help     individuals live longer or protect them from heart disease or cancer.

Headlines: ARUBA Long-Term: Medical AVM Management Still Better
Teaser: Medical management of patients with unruptured arteriovenous malformations is likely to be superior to an interventional approach over the long term, according to a new modelled analysis of the ARUBA trial.

Headlines: Therapy Dogs in Pediatric Oncology: Measuring the Impact
Teaser: An ongoing clinical trial is examining the impact of dogs on the quality of life of children with cancer.

Headlines: Experts Clash Over Testosterone Cardiovascular Risks
Teaser: Research indicating a cardiovascular risk with testosterone therapy has led to new warnings, and now, a backlash against these warnings.

Headlines: Evolocumab Boosts LDL Reduction on Top of Statins
Teaser: The LAPLACE-2 study, a trial adding evolocumab to moderate- or intensive statin therapy that resulted in significant further reductions in LDL cholesterol     levels, is now published in JAMA.

Headlines: FDA Review Finds No Increased Risk of MI With Dabigatran (Pradaxa)
Teaser: UPDATED // The latest FDA study to tackle dabigatran's risk/benefit profile also found fewer ischemic strokes, intracranial bleeds, and deaths with dabigatran but     fewer major GI bleeds with warfarin.

Headlines: Metformin Linked to Reduced Risk for Glaucoma
Teaser: The geroprotective effects of the diabetes drug, which mimic caloric restriction, might help prevent late-onset open-angle glaucoma.

Headlines: CT Texture as New Imaging Biomarker in Melanoma
Teaser: A new study shows that CT texture analysis can predict the survival of patients with metastatic melanoma who are receiving antiangiogenic therapy.

Headlines: Boceprevir Combo Helpful in Compensated HCV Cirrhosis
Teaser: In well-compensated cirrhotic patients with HCV-1, peginterferon/ribavirin along with boceprevir appears to have a generally favorable benefit-risk profile, according to pooled data from phase 3 studies.

Headlines: Hope Remains for Fecal Transplant in Ulcerative Colitis
Teaser: Some people with active ulcerative colitis achieved remission after fecal microbiota therapy, despite overall negative findings. The approach needs further study, investigators believe.

Headlines: FDA Clears Dalbavancin (Dalvance) for Acute Skin Infections
Teaser: The antibacterial agent is the first designated as a Qualified Infectious Disease Product (QIDP) to receive FDA approval.

Headlines: CHMP Endorses Peginterferon-Beta-1a, Not Laquinimod, in MS
Teaser: After a second look at laquinimod, the EMA panel maintains that the benefits don't outweigh the potential risks of the drug.

Headlines: Obinutuzumab for CLL, EU Approval Recommended
Teaser: European approval has been recommended for obinutuzumab and an extended indication for ofatumumab, both in chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

Headlines: Europe Says No to Bevacizumab (Avastin) for Glioblastoma
Teaser: The European authorities have recommended against approval for an extended indication for bevacizumab for glioblastoma.

Headlines: Response to Social Alcohol Use May Predict Future Abuse
Teaser: Twenty-something heavy social drinkers who report greater stimulation and 'liking' of the substance's effects are more likely to develop alcohol use disorder in their 30s.

Headlines: What's Hot at the ASCO Annual Meeting This Year?
Teaser: Celebrating its 50th anniversary gives some pause for reflection, but the meeting will also look ahead to the progress that still needs to be made.

Headlines: New Approach to Bedside Communication for Locked-In Syndrome
Teaser: Technology using bedside near-infrared spectroscopy is allowing communication with a patient with ALS who was completely locked in for than 2 years, breaking the 'unbearable silence.'

Headlines: 4KScore Predicts High-Grade Prostate Cancer, Prebiopsy
Teaser: A blood test used extensively in Europe compared favorably with an online risk calculator in an American study.

Headlines: Premature Ejaculation Guidelines: A Toolbox for Clinicians
Teaser: The International Society for Sexual Medicine has published new guidelines and a unified definition of premature ejaculation that could lead to better diagnosis and treatment.

Headlines: Magic Wand? 2 Novel Systems for Diabetic Foot Enter Trials
Teaser: A "wand" that deploys radiofrequency to ablate infected tissue and another device that delivers high-concentration antibiotics directly to diabetic foot     infections have both entered human trials.

Headlines: Gene Test for Prostate Cancer Validated: Triumph or Worry?
Teaser: It is the largest study of gene-based testing as a prognostic factor in men treated conservatively for prostate cancer, and it has sparked debate.

Headlines: Role of Fetal, Maternal Genetics in Different Preeclampsia Phenotypes
Teaser: Different manifestations of preeclampsia may have distinct maternal and fetal genetic underpinnings, according to a review of 'mined' data from more than 700 studies.

Headlines: Antibiotic Scripts for Bronchitis Common Despite Guidelines
Teaser: Providers continue to inappropriately prescribe antibiotics for bronchitis, despite 40 years of research showing they are ineffective.

Headlines: FDA OKs Vedolizumab for Ulcerative Colitis, Crohn's
Teaser: The FDA has approved vedolizumab for treatment of patients with moderately to severely active ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease.

Headlines: Lung Cancer Therapy Based on Genomics Improves Survival
Teaser: Drugs that target genetic mutations found in lung adenocarcinomas may be more successful in treating patients than using a one-size-fits-all approach, such as chemotherapy.

Headlines: PARADIGM HF Teases With Visions of New Paradigm for CHF
Teaser: The trial's remarkable history was partly behind palpable excitement at the conference over its early termination due to significant benefit from a novel     agent vs enalapril in chronic heart failure.

Headlines: Pancreatic Cancer Meeting Highlights New Aggressive Approaches
Teaser: Biomarkers, anti-CD47 monoclonals, and gemcitabine/radioimmunotherapy  deployed in new surge against pancreatic cancer.

Headlines: Diabetes High Among Latinos, but No Single 'Hispanic' Profile
Teaser: Hispanics in the US live longer than other ethnic groups despite having one of the highest rates of diabetes. Yet there is no such thing as the "average"     Latino profile, new study findings reveal.

Headlines: STEMI in Women: Same Plaques, Same Stent Outcomes: OCTAVIA
Teaser: A unique study looking at evolving AMI in vivo has determined that the pathophysiology of STEMI is nearly identical in men and women, refuting the theory     of physiological gender differences.

Headlines: Hepatitis C Drug Simeprevir (Olysio) Cleared in EU
Teaser: The protease inhibitor is indicated for treatment of adults with hepatitis C genotype 1 and 4 infection in combination with other drugs.

Headlines: Two New Trials: AIs Work in Premenopausal Breast Cancer Too
Teaser: Tamoxifen alone has been the standard approach in young women with hormone-receptor-positive breast cancer; aromatase inhibitors (AIs) plus ovarian suppression may play a role, new research shows.

Headlines: Bevacizumab, Cetuximab Have Similar Survival Benefits in CRC
Teaser: Adding either bevacizumab or cetuximab to chemotherapy yielded equal benefits in metastatic colorectal cancer (CRC).

Headlines: ASCO Sounds Alarm on Declining Federally Funded Research
Teaser: Cancer experts and their patients are moving into a new era in the United States; critically important, clinically relevant research is starting to dry up because of a lack of federal funds.

Headlines: Sunday at ASCO: Hot News From Plenary Session
Teaser: The plenary session today will hear potentially practice-changing results in breast and prostate cancer, and reassuring results in colorectal cancer.

Headlines: Ibrutinib Improves CLL Survival and the Praise Flows
Teaser: The highly targeted agent garners praise from clinicians for its effectiveness and mild adverse-effect profile in patients with relapsed chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

Headlines: Breast Cancer With Bone Mets: Less Zoledronic Acid Is Fine
Teaser: Women with breast cancer and bone metastasis can scale back on the use of a bone-building drug over time and apparently still get the same benefit, new research suggests.

Headlines: Warming Up to HEAT-PPCI: SCAI Panel Probes Trial . . . Gently
Teaser: Two months after its first release, HEAT-PPCI was again the discussion topic for a panel of experts, amid growing calls for cath labs to consider what the     controversial results mean for STEMI care.

Headlines: White House Concussion Summit Puts Focus on Youth Sports
Teaser: New partnerships will put around $86 million toward funding new research and development in the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of traumatic brain injury.

Headlines: EGFR Inhibitor Fails to Improve Biliary Cancer Survival
Teaser: BINGO is the third to show no effect on survival of monoclonal antibodies designed to inhibit EGFR, which is often overexpressed in biliary cancers.

Headlines: Fewer Complications With RF Ablation of Barrett's Esophagus
Teaser: Both radiofrequency (RF) ablation and complete endoscopic resection are effective, but a meta-analysis finds fewer post-treatment complications with RF.

Headlines: e-Cigarette Use: Monkey See, Monkey Do
Teaser: Young adults who watch others use e-cigarettes have an increased desire to smoke e-cigarettes and traditional tobacco cigarettes.

Headlines: FDA OKs Natesto, First-Ever Nasal Testosterone Treatment
Teaser: The new product reduces the risk for exposure to women and children and may offer greater convenience…or not.

Headlines: Insurers Scrutinize Drug Costs After USD 84,000 Sovaldi Surprise
Teaser: Shocked by the rapid adoption of a new $84,000 hepatitis C treatment, U.S. health insurers are trying to make sure they aren't blindsided by other drugs being developed.

Headlines: Study Backs Isoniazid for HIV Patients on ART in High TB Areas
Teaser: Isoniazid can reduce the risk of tuberculosis in HIV patients on antiretroviral therapy, according to a new clinical trial.

Headlines: T-cell Changes: Why Only Some Respond to Ipilimumab
Teaser: Changes in the T-cell repertoire after ipilimumab or tremelimumab predicted survival in advanced prostate cancer or metastatic melanoma, but best responders maintained clones present before treatment.

Headlines: Fat-Storage Gene Identified in Amish, Implicated in Diabetes
Teaser: Intriguing new evidence gathered from an Amish population shows how a deficiency in a key enzyme that breaks down fat appears to increase the risk for type     2 diabetes; it could provide a novel drug target.

Headlines: Nintedanib Slows Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis Progression
Teaser: The tyrosine kinase inhibitor slowed the decline in lung function over a year in 2 phase 3 trials, providing hope for another therapeutic option for these patients.

Headlines: It Ain't Over: Renal Denervation Data Dominate EuroPCR
Teaser: The program for Europe's premier interventional meeting was plump with renal denervation live cases, how-to sessions, new data, and devices. The         message: don't give up on this just yet.

Headlines: Diabetes Drug Eyed as Obesity Treatment
Teaser: Already approved for the treatment of diabetes, the incretin mimetic liraglutide is now being investigated as a potential weight-loss drug.

Headlines: Stroke Risk Highest in the 4 Weeks After Acute Zoster
Teaser: Stroke risk diminishes during the 6 months after zoster and may be reduced by antiviral drugs.

Headlines: FDA Panel Delivers Mixed Verdict on KAMRA Corneal Inlay
Teaser: The FDA's Ophthalmic Devices Advisory Committee wrestled with flawed trial data that suggested efficacy but yielded some safety concerns, leading to overall uncertainty about benefit versus risk.

Headlines: Next-Generation Sequencing Nabs Culprit in Brain Infection
Teaser: Ultrafast analysis of CSF DNA plus a rapid bioinformatics pipeline helped physicians find and fight neuroleptospirosis in a patient with severe combined immunodeficiency.

Headlines: What's Hot at EULAR 2014
Teaser: TNF-alpha inhibitors, biosimilars, and the IL-17 pathway are just a few of the topics on the EULAR program that have its scientific chair excited.

Headlines: Fingolimod Reduces Annual Brain Volume Loss in MS
Teaser: Results of 2 trials show that fingolimod decreases the annual rate of brain volume loss in patients with MS. Setting thresholds compared with healthy adults may help to define disease-free activity.

Headlines: Cutting-Edge Science Tops ADA Agenda in San Francisco
Teaser: The American Diabetes Association 74th Scientific Sessions has a jam-packed menu on a wide range of topics, with attendees having to tough it out to the last day for the President's Oral Session.

Headlines: Dalbavancin, Oritavancin  Safe, Effective for Skin Infection
Teaser: Two new antibiotics, dalbavacin and oritavancin, were similar to vancomycin in treating serious skin infections requiring intravenous antibiotics.

Headlines: Insufficient Evidence for Moxduo Approval, FDA Says
Teaser: The FDA indicates there's insufficient evidence to support approval of the combination morphine-oxycodone agent.

Headlines: Declines in eGFR Good Predictor of CKD Progression
Teaser: Declines in eGFR of at least 30% are associated with the risk for end-stage renal disease and mortality; researchers hope it can replace the doubling of serum creatinine as a clinical trial end point.

Headlines: New Drug Combos Promising in Higher-Risk Rhabdomyosarcoma
Teaser: Temsirolimus combined with chemotherapy increased event-free survival in rhabdomyosarcoma, but the addition of irinotecan did not improve outcomes, new research shows.

Headlines: Antidepressant-Related Weight Gain: Not All Agents Equal
Teaser: Data for a 12-month period show modest differences in the amount of weight patients taking common antidepressant medications are likely to gain.

Headlines: Blood Pressure Meds May Up AMD Risk, 20-Year Study Suggests
Teaser: Beaver Dam Eye Study researchers have linked vasodilator blood pressure medicines with a higher risk of developing early age-related macular degeneration.

Headlines: FDA Cancer Chief Says 'Escalating' Drug Prices Can't Continue
Teaser: By law, Dr. Richard Pazdur, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration's cancer drug czar, is not allowed to consider the cost of treatments his agency reviews, only whether they are safe and effective.

Headlines: UK Scientific Panel Backs Potential 'Three-Parent' IVF Babies
Teaser: A British expert scientific panel gave its backing to potential new 3-way fertility treatments that would for the first time allow genetically modified embryos to be implanted into women.

Headlines: Is Ipilimumab Useful for Earlier-Stage Melanoma?
Teaser: A randomized placebo-controlled trial provides relapse-free survival results for patients with stage III disease.

Headlines: National Cohorts Support Shaky Part of ICD Evidence Base
Teaser: Seminal primary-prevention ICD trials included only a handful of patients with LVEF 30% to 35%; the study addresses persisting questions about devices in     that group, with implications for reimbursement.

Headlines: Hope on Horizon for Newer Obesity Drugs in Europe?
Teaser: The lack of obesity drugs in Europe was the focus of much discussion at the European   Conference on Obesity last week. Hopes are high that     bupropion/naltrexone and liraglutide will soon be approved there.

Headlines: ALTTO Disappoints Clinicians and Upends Research
Teaser: Adding lapatinib to trastuzumab does not improve outcomes in the adjuvant setting, in contrast to what was seen in the neoadjuvant setting.

Headlines: FDA OKs Aloxi for Chemo-Induced Nausea, Vomiting in Children
Teaser: The FDA has approved palonosetron HCL (Aloxi, Eisai Inc and Hensinn Group) injection for the prevention of chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting in children aged 1 month to less than 17 years.

Headlines: PCOS Pregnancy: More Low-grade Inflammation, Greater Risk
Teaser: Chronic low-grade inflammation of PCOS worsens during pregnancy and is associated with greater risk for poor outcome.

Headlines: Targeted Drug Combo Improves Outcomes in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: The combination of 2 investigational drugs, olaparib and cediranib, holds promise as a nonchemotherapy approach to ovarian cancer.

Headlines: First-Ever ADA Guidance Specifically for Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: The American Diabetes Association has issued the first-ever position statement focusing on type 1 diabetes as a separate entity from type 2. The statement also provides a new pediatric HbA1c target.

Headlines: Lifestyle, Metformin, Can Delay Diabetes, 15-Year DPP Data Show
Teaser: It is possible to delay or prevent the development of type 2 diabetes in people at very high risk of the disease, 15-year data from the Diabetes Prevention     Program indicate. But many questions remain.

Headlines: Pregnancy Possible in Lupus Patients Taking Belimumab
Teaser: Successful live births are possible in women with lupus who conceive while taking belimumab, new research shows.

Headlines: Bitopertin Disappoints as Schizophrenia Treatment
Teaser: News for bitopertin as a possible treatment for schizophrenia is disappointing, as 5 of 6 phase 3 studies have been discontinued for not reaching their primary endpoints.

Headlines: Which New Hypertension Guidelines Are the Best?
Teaser: Three separate hypertension guidelines were released last year. Speakers at HYPERTENSION 2014 were tasked with convincing the audience which set of     recommendations is the best.

Headlines: iPad Performance Testing in MS
Teaser: New iPad-based walking speed, balance, and other measurements in patients with multiple sclerosis can be done without the need for a technician.

Headlines: BRAF Inhibitor Is Effective in Hairy Cell Leukemia
Teaser: The drug could be important for the many patients who lose response or relapse with the most effective conventional therapies.

Headlines: Ultrasound Better Than Biopsy in Giant Cell Arteritis
Teaser: Cranial ultrasound might be a better first-line tool than temporal artery biopsy for identifying patients with giant cell arteritis, who need prompt treatment.

Headlines: ACC/AHA Lipid Guidelines: A Step up in Diabetes Care, or Not?
Teaser: The new guidelines for treating diabetic patients who have high cholesterol either greatly improve patient care or miss the mark, according to 2 experts     debating the issues here.

Headlines: Europe  Starts Cardiac Safety Review of Higher-Dose Ibuprofen
Teaser: The EMA will evaluate the cardiovascular risks associated with high doses of ibuprofen taken over long periods of time.

Headlines: Natalizumab Continued Past 24 Months Safely in MS
Teaser: Results from the TY-STOP observational study show patients with MS safely continued natalizumab past 24 months and had less disease activity vs going to a different drug or stopping all together.

Headlines: Doctors Urge Quick Action on Bill to Develop New Antibiotics
Teaser: Deadly superbugs with antibiotic resistance ought to spur Congress to pass legislation that would make it easier to bring new antibiotics to market, a coalition of healthcare groups has said.

Headlines: Mega Hypertension Study Defines Risk for 12 CVD Outcomes
Teaser: New data from a study of 1.25 million primary care patients has drummed home the substantial burden of hypertension and identified some new observations on how blood pressure affects 12 different manifestations of cardiovascular disease, including various forms of stroke.

Headlines: A Good Shake-up Needed in HF Biomarker Research: Report
Teaser: It's a call to action, with proposals aimed at streamlining the field of biomarker-guided heart-failure therapy, coauthored by some of the biggest names in     heart-failure research.

Headlines: Levodopa Best Choice for Initial Parkinson's Treatment
Teaser: The largest ever drug trial in Parkinson's disease found that levodopa beats dopamine agonists and monoamine oxidase type B inhibitors in terms of patient-reported mobility, quality of life, and other measures.

Headlines: Computer Use Linked to Dry Eye, Change in Tears
Teaser: A study of Japanese office workers has suggested that lengthy computer use is linked to dry eye disease and decreases in Mucin5AC, a component of tears.

Headlines: Once-Daily Tedizolid Effective for Acute Skin Infections
Teaser: Once-daily tedizolid  given for 6 days is similarly effective and has similar adverse effects as linezolid given twice daily for 10 days in the treatment of acute skin and skin structure infections.

Headlines: mHealth Apps Should Be Reviewed and Certified, Experts Argue
Teaser: Unbiased reviews and certification of apps would greatly increase their value to physicians and patients alike, but the practical elements of such a system are unclear.

Headlines: Radioactive Stents in Pre-irradiated Esophageal Cancer
Teaser: Radioactive esophageal stents may have some advantages compared with standard stents in patients with recurrent unresectable esophageal cancer who have had external radiotherapy, but could also pose extra bleeding risks.

Headlines: FDA Clears First Long-Acting Hemophilia A Drug (Eloctate)
Teaser: Eloctate requires fewer injections when used to prevent or reduce the frequency of bleeding than currently available products.

Headlines: MRD Status Might Be Feasible End Point in CLL Treatment
Teaser: Having no minimal residual disease (MRD) is an important treatment end point for some types of leukemias; this might include chronic lymphocytic leukemia, new research shows.

Headlines: A 4-Week Hep C Cure? Bristol to Test Drugs With Gilead's Sovaldi
Teaser: In the race to find a faster cure for hepatitis C, Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said it will test its experimental antiviral drug combination with Gilead Sciences Inc's blockbuster drug Sovaldi (sofosbuvir).

Headlines: APOC3 Mutations Tied to Low Triglycerides, Healthy Heart
Teaser: (updated) High triglycerides rather than low HDL cholesterol may be a major culprit in heart disease, two large genetic studies suggest.

Headlines: Long-term VNS Safe, Effective for Resistant Depression
Teaser: Long-term use of vagal nerve stimulation is safe and effective in treatment-resistant depression.

Headlines: Add-on Lurasidone Beneficial in Bipolar Disorder
Teaser: Lurasidone is an effective add-on for bipolar I patients inadequately relieved of their depressive symptoms with lithium or valproate alone, according to pooled data from 2 trials.

Headlines: Student Exposure to Marketers Affects Prescribing Knowledge
Teaser: The amount of time physician trainees spend interacting with industry reps has been associated with  the trainees' knowledge of evidence-based prescribing and odds of recommending brand-name drugs.

Headlines: Plasma Kisspeptin Level May Predict Miscarriage
Teaser: Women who had a miscarriage had 60% lower kisspeptin levels early in pregnancy compared with women who had a healthy pregnancy, new research indicates.

Headlines: New Antibiotic Tedizolid (Sivextro) Approved by FDA
Teaser: Tedizolid phosphate is the second antibiotic for acute skin infections that the agency has okayed in the last 5 weeks.

Headlines: Uptake of PrEP Can Be High, Demo Project Shows
Teaser: Gay and bisexual men who were offered HIV pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) as part of a comprehensive prevention program had high levels of adherence to the regimen.

Headlines: Parkinson's Biomarker Project Finds Tau Reduction in PD
Teaser: First observations from the Parkinson's Progression Markers Initiative have shown some interesting findings characterizing biological changes, including a reduction in CSF levels of tau.

Headlines: Expert: Pharma Should Fund Diet/Exercise Arm in Drug Trials
Teaser: A proposal from a professor of public health was prompted by a trial of a weight loss intervention in postmenopausal women with breast cancer that was defunded.

Headlines: Balance Test May Boost Illness Awareness in Schizophrenia
Teaser: Patients with schizophrenia often lack awareness about their illness, but a commonly used test for balance could increase such insight, a proof-of-concept study indicates.

Headlines: Screening At-Risk Patients for Liver Cancer: Uncertain
Teaser: A new meta-analysis neither recommends nor refutes screening of high-risk patients for liver cancer, and high-level evidence is lacking.

Headlines: Arnold Relman, Medicine's Long-time Conscience, Dies at 91
Teaser: The former editor of the New England Journal of Medicine called on his profession to resist the profit motive of the 'medical-industrial complex.'

Headlines: LDL-C May Not Be Best Predictor of CVD Risk in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: The traditional cardiovascular disease risk marker LDL cholesterol may not be useful in patients with type 1 diabetes, a large Swedish observational study     suggests.

Headlines: Thrombolytic Therapy for PE: Balancing Benefits, Risks
Teaser: Thrombolytic therapy is associated with lower rates of death but increased risks of major bleeding and intracranial hemorrhage in patients with pulmonary embolism (PE), a meta-analysis finds.

Headlines: FDA Panel Mixed on Implanted Weight-Loss Device
Teaser: An FDA advisory panel split votes on an implant device for severe obesity treatment.

Headlines: Multiple Myeloma Compound Gets Orphan Drug Status
Teaser: KRN5500 is a spicamycin derivative that exhibits antimyeloma effects by impairing both myeloma cells and osteoclasts.

Headlines: Heparin-Free Dialyzer Effective in High-Risk Patientsn
Teaser: An anticoagulant dialyzer is as successful as standard-of-care saline flushes or online predilution in hemodialysis patients at high risk of bleeding, with no increase in adverse events.

Headlines: Similar Neurologic Outcomes for Blast and Nonblast TBI
Teaser: A new study finds no differences in headache, depression, posttraumatic stress, and other outcomes between military personnel with a concussive traumatic brain injury caused by a blast and soldiers whose injury was due to a nonblast event.

Headlines: Corrected: 5 Myths About Brain Metastases
Teaser: Out-of-date misconceptions often influence or even guide the care of patients with cancers that spread to the brain, say the authors of a new report.

Headlines: Tumor Paint Lights Up Cancer Cells, Facilitates Surgery
Teaser: A novel product that illuminates cancer cells during surgery can help remove all malignant cells and eliminate the damage to healthy tissue.

Headlines: Largest Study to Date: Transgender Hormone Treatment Safe
Teaser: A multicenter study of more than 1500 patients receiving cross-sex hormone therapy for at least a year showed that most side effects were minor, providing     reassurance on safety.

Headlines: Improved Glycemic Control in Diabetes Cuts CV Risk: CREDIT
Teaser: An observational trial of real-world patients with type 2 diabetes suggests that patients newly started on insulin who can lower their HbA1c      levels also reduce their medium-term risk of CVD events.

Headlines: Inhaled Insulin: What to Tell Patients
Teaser: Get ready to answer patients' questions about Afrezza, a new inhaled-insulin product.

Headlines: PREVAIL Published: Watchman Safe in AF Patients
Teaser: The PREVAIL study, which was pulled from the ACC late-breaking clinical-trials session after an embargo break, is now published. The Watchman device will     need a third FDA advisory panel meeting before getting to market, though.

Headlines: New Product Improves Survival in Refractory Metastatic CRC
Teaser: The investigational product TAS-102 improved survival, compared with placebo, in metastatic colorectal cancer (CRC) refractory to all other therapies.

Headlines: Second-Line Gefitinib Doesn't Improve Esophageal Cancer Survival
Teaser: Gefitinib does not improve overall survival in patients with esophageal cancer that progresses after chemotherapy, but it does produce a significant improvement in odynophagia, researchers report.

Headlines: FDA Approves Inhaled Insulin Afrezza for Diabetes
Teaser: The FDA approved the short-acting inhaled insulin product Afrezza for both type 1 and type 2 diabetes, but not for smokers or patients with chronic lung disease.

Headlines: EU Panel Endorses Daclatasvir (Daklinza) for Chronic Hep C
Teaser: Daclatasvir is the first in a new class of antivirals that block the action of NS5A, a protein which is essential for HCV to replicate.

Headlines: Novel Form of Irinotecan Ups Survival in Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: A new version of a standard chemotherapy has shown improved survival in patients with metastatic pancreatic cancer previously been treated with gemcitabine.

Headlines: Local Infiltration Analgesia Relieves Pain in Some Joint Surgeries
Teaser: Local infiltration analgesia (LIA) provides effective analgesia early after total knee arthroplasty but has limited efficacy after total hip arthroplasty, according to results of a systematic review.

Headlines: Chronic Migraine Puts Heavy Burden on Families
Teaser: Patients report feeling angry and guilty, avoiding sexual intimacy, and missing vacations and other important family events.

Headlines: FDA Panel Votes Against Accelerated Approval for Olaparib
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommends waiting for phase 3 data before considering approval for olaparib as maintenance therapy for recurrent ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Drug Lessens Psoriatic Plaques While Reversing Baldness
Teaser: Tofacitinib reversed baldness in a 25-year-old man with plaque psoriasis and alopecia universalis.

Headlines: EPO Induces Hippocampal Growth, Cognitive Improvement
Teaser: Erythropoietin produced growth in the left hippocampus and improved verbal memory in patients with depression and bipolar disorder in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Once-Weekly Growth Hormone Treatment Feasible in Adults, Kids
Teaser: Experimental long-acting growth-hormone drugs show promise for reducing the number of injections from daily to weekly, or fewer, in children and adults     with growth-hormone deficiency.

Headlines: No CV Risk With Olmesartan in Diabetics, Says FDA Review
Teaser: The US FDA has completed its safety review of olmesartan in diabetic patients, stating there is no clear evidence of increased cardiovascular risk     associated with the angiotensin-receptor blocker.

Headlines: Positive Results With Combo Tx for Opioid Dependence
Teaser: Orexo AB announced new topline results of 2 clinical trials with a combination of buprenorphine and naloxone for buprenorphine induction and plans to pursue approval of an expanded label in the US.

Headlines: More on HF Hospitalization With Gliptins in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A new post hoc analysis of the VIVIDD study with the DPP-4 inhibitor vildagliptin in patients with type 2 diabetes and heart failure has shown that the drug is not associated     with an increase in hospitalizations for HF.

Headlines: Antioxidants Appear to Be Harmful in Cancer Patients
Teaser: Antioxidant supplements have not been shown to prevent cancer, but there is also concern that they could be harmful in patients who already have cancer.

Headlines: Home Cervical Ripening May Be a Viable Option
Teaser: For women who undergo cervical ripening at home, outcomes and hospital time to delivery remain similar relative to those who undergo cervical ripening in the hospital.

Headlines: HEAT-PPCI Questions? More Answers from Dr Rod Stables
Teaser: The HEAT-PPCI trial was published last week. In an in-depth interview, the study's senior investigator tackles the many questions that have been raised     about the study's design and results.

Headlines: Do Probiotics Protect Newborns Against Eczema and Allergies?
Teaser: Probiotic treatments had little to no effect in preventing eczema in newborns in a recent study, but they may still reduce some food allergies, researchers suggest.

Headlines: 'Reassuring' Data on Fertility Drugs and Cancer Risk: Study
Teaser: A 30-year follow up study finds that clomiphene and other ovulation-stimulating drugs do not raise the risk of breast and gynecologic cancers, with a few caveats.

Headlines: Novel Agent Volasertib Doubles Responses in AML
Teaser: Older patients with acute myeloid leukemia (AML) are not good candidates for intensive induction therapy, but an experimental agent might bolster the effectiveness of a standard treatment.

Headlines: FDA OKs Another Topical Drug  for Onychomycosis (Kerydin)
Teaser: The drug is the first oxaborole antifungal for topically treating this infection in the toenail. The FDA approved another topical remedy just last month.

Headlines: Antibiotics Postcholecystectomy Do Not Prevent Infection
Teaser: After cholecystectomy for acute calculous cholecystitis, infection rates were the same with or without antibiotics.

Headlines: How to Fix a Broken Market in Antibiotics
Teaser: The drugs don't work - and neither does the market, when it comes to antibiotics.

Headlines: Chemotherapy-Free Combo Is Tested in CLL
Teaser: To avoid the toxicity of chemotherapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), standard rituximab treatment was combined with lenalidomide. The results disappointed an expert.

Headlines: Meta-analysis Questions Post-MI Use of Beta-blockers
Teaser: UPDATED // While beta-blockers reduce reinfarction and angina in the post-MI setting, there is no reduction in the risk of mortality. More important, the analysis     showed an increased risk of heart failure and cardiogenic shock with beta-blockers when used post-MI.

Headlines: Newest Drug for ALK-Positive NSCLC Approved in Japan
Teaser: The newest drug to target specifically ALK-positive non-small-cell lung cancer, alectinib (Roche), has been granted its first approval worldwide in Japan.

Headlines: Doxycycline Fails to Slow Diabetic Retinopathy Progression
Teaser: Doxycycline does not appear to improve retinal function or slow diabetic retinopathy progression in patients with mild to moderate nonproliferative diabetic retinopathy (NPDR), according to results from a proof-of-concept clinical trial.

Headlines: First Approval for PD Inhibitor: Nivolumab for Melanoma
Teaser: Japan is the first country in the world to grant approval for the first programmed death (PD) inhibitor, nivolumab, for use in melanoma.

Headlines: Anti-VEGF Improves Quality of Life in Macular Degeneration
Teaser: When patients' vision improved when receiving ranibizumab, their quality of life improved too.

Headlines: New Data on Peripheral Nerve Blocks for Headache
Teaser: Study shows combination nerve blocks are common and patients are generally satisfied with the degree of pain relief.

Headlines: The Sitagliptin Saga: More Evidence for Possible HF Hazard
Teaser: Initiating the drug in patients with diabetes who already have HF may elevate the risk of subsequent HF hospitalization, suggests a retrospective         analysis from a national US cohort.

Headlines: Roche Biotech Drug Offers New Way to Fight Asthma
Teaser: Quilizumab, an experimental antibody drug from Roche, has produced promising results in mid-stage tests for asthma, offering a new way to fight the breathing disorder.

Headlines: Cameron Enlists Ex-Goldman Economist in Global Superbug Fight
Teaser: Prime Minister David Cameron called on Wednesday for global action to tackle the threat of drug-resistant superbugs and said Britain planned to take a leading role in finding ways to spur the development of new antibiotics.

Headlines: Experimental Ebola Drugs Should Be Tried in Africa, Some Say
Teaser: People at high risk of dying in West Africa's Ebola outbreak should be offered experimental medicines to see if they work, the head of an influential global health charity said.

Headlines: CTA for Suspected CAD Affects Downstream Treatment, Outcomes
Teaser: Clinicians are successfully intensifying statin therapy based on CAD extent and severity at CT angiography: lipids come down, and it seems to be improving     outcomes, a cohort study suggests.

Headlines: Tau Imaging Strong Predictor of Memory Loss
Teaser: Tau protein in key brain areas of cognitively normal older individuals is strongly correlated with memory loss over time.

Headlines: Peer Mentoring Helps Moms of Developmentally Disabled Kids
Teaser: Moms of children with neurodevelopmental disabilities benefit from cognitive behavioral interventions delivered by peer mentors.

Headlines: Melanoma Drug Combination Trial Stopped
Teaser: An interim analysis showed that the combination of a MEK inhibitor and BRAF inhibitor provided better survival than a BRAF inhibitor alone.

Headlines: Top HIV/AIDS Researchers Killed on Malaysian Jet
Teaser: An unconfirmed number of the world's leading HIV/AIDS researchers were among the 298 people killed on a Malaysian passenger jet that was shot down in eastern Ukraine.

Headlines: New Study Finds Diabetes Risk Rises With Statin Adherence
Teaser: An observational study confirms previous data showing an increased diabetes risk with statins, adding the "dose-response" element by examining risk by     adherence. But benefits still outweigh risks.

Headlines: ADHD Drugs Not Tested for Safety, Efficacy Over Time
Teaser: A review of ADHD clinical drug trials shows the majority of studies were too small and too short to effectively assess long-term safety and efficacy of the agents or detect rare adverse events.

Headlines: Potassium Supplements With Loop Diuretics May Up Survival
Teaser: What seemed the likeliest mechanism for such a benefit from empiric potassium supplementation was challenged by another finding from the propensity-matched     cohort analysis.

Headlines: Simple Eye Tests to Detect Alzheimer's Disease in the Works
Teaser: Two novel, noninvasive, and relatively simple eye tests show promise as potential screening tools for early Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: 'Major Step' to Identify 'Financial Toxicity' From Cancer
Teaser: A questionnaire has been developed to measure financial stress in cancer patients and help clinicians identify those most at risk.

Headlines: 'Mind Expanding' Effect of Psilocybin Visible on Imaging
Teaser: A new imaging study shows how the psychedelic psilocybin, the active agent in magic mushrooms, works on the brain.

Headlines: 'Optimistic' News on Dementia Incidence
Teaser: There are fewer new cases of Alzheimer's in developed nations, a trend experts attribute to higher education levels and more aggressive treatment of cardiovascular disease.

Headlines: Omega-3 Fatty Acids May Prevent ALS
Teaser: A new analysis of diet from more than 1 million people followed for up to 24 years has shown an inverse association between intake of omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids and risk for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

Headlines: Novel Tamoxifen Gel Could Reduce Adverse Effects
Teaser: A tamoxifen gel applied directly to the breast produces antiproliferative effects similar to those produced by oral tamoxifen, but with fewer systemic effects.

Headlines: Moxibustion May Alleviate Arthritis Knee Pain
Teaser: Moxibustion, an Eastern medicine technique, may alleviate osteoarthritis-associated knee pain and improve physical function for weeks after therapy, according to a new study.

Headlines: Analysis Questions Beta-blockers in Stable CHD Patients
Teaser: In an analysis of 26 000 patients discharged after their first CHD event, the benefit of beta-blockers in stable CHD patients was observed only among those     with a recent MI, report investigators.

Headlines: Group Diabetes Education Better Than Individual Counseling
Teaser: Diabetes education delivered in a group setting produced better clinical outcomes than individual patient appointments in a real-world setting in the     province of Ontario.

Headlines: Biologic Agent Has Benefit for Skin Disease in Early Trials
Teaser: Patients with atopic dermatitis treated with dupilumab experienced rapid, significant improvements in disease signs, symptoms, and associated biomarker levels in early clinical trials.

Headlines: Canada OKs Aptiom as Add-On Therapy in Epilepsy
Teaser: Eslicarbazepine (Aptiom) is indicated as adjunctive therapy for partial-onset seizures associated with epilepsy in adults who do not respond adequately to conventional therapy.

Headlines: Latest HIV Cure Data Expected at AIDS 2014, More Hep C News
Teaser: Scientists and policy makers will gather next week at the largest global HIV meeting, where trial results for TURQUOISE-1 and PHOTO-2 will be presented.

Headlines: Omalizumab Effective for Chronic Hives up to 24 Weeks
Teaser: The 300-mg dose of omalizumab was most effective compared with placebo, but symptoms recur after treatment is discontinued.

Headlines: Oral Hepatitis C Drugs Helping Patients Coinfected With HIV
Teaser: Results from TURQUOISE-1 and PHOTON-2 show that interferon-free regimens are achieving impressive response rates with few adverse events in patients coinfected with hep C and HIV.

Headlines: Type 1 Diabetes: No Delay With Low-Dose Otelixizumab
Teaser: Low-dose otelixizumab was safe but did not preserve beta-cell function in patients with newly diagnosed type 1 diabetes in a phase 3 trial; GSK has started a new dosing study.

Headlines: Fish Oil May Guard Against Alcohol-Related Brain Damage
Teaser: An omega-3 compound found in fish oil may lower the risk for alcohol-related brain damage, potentially by decreasing neuroinflammation.

Headlines: Crenezumab Fails in Alzheimer's but Is There a Silver Lining?
Teaser: Clinical trial results for the experimental antiamyloid agent crenezumab show the drug failed to reach primary endpoints, but improvements in the mildest cases suggest a silver lining.

Headlines: First US Prevalence Data on ALS
Teaser: A first report on the prevalence of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis in the United States shows the prevalence is 3.9 cases per 100,000.

Headlines: Weight Not a Factor in Emergency Contraception: EMA Panel
Teaser: Levonorgestrel and ulipristal emergency contraceptives are effective for all women, regardless of body weight, a European Medicines Agency panel has concluded.

Headlines: Once-Weekly Dulaglutide Is Noninferior to Daily Liraglutide
Teaser: In a rare head-to-head trial of two GLP-1 receptor agonists, once-weekly dulaglutide was similar to once-daily liraglutide in efficacy and         tolerability.

Headlines: Drug Target Linked to Antiphospholipid Syndrome
Teaser: The mammalian target of rapamycin complex pathway is activated in the vascular lesions that occur in patients with antiphospholipid syndrome.

Headlines: Diabetes Drug Linked to Lower Dementia Risk
Teaser: Long-term use of pioglitazone may protect against dementia, possibly by suppressing neuroinflammation, new observational data hint.

Headlines: New Classification of Gastric Cancer Spurs Targeted Therapy
Teaser: A landmark study has identified 4 distinct subtypes, each with its own characteristic and potentially 'druggable' targets.

Headlines: Sunitinib or Everolimus First-Line for Kidney Cancer?
Teaser: A phase 2 randomized comparator trial has found that first-line everolimus is not as effective as first-line sunitinib, and has a different toxicity profile.

Headlines: Raltegravir Not Better Than NRTIs for Refractory HIV
Teaser: Raltegravir showed no benefits over nucleoside reverse-transcriptase inhibitors when used in combination with a protease inhibitor as second-line HIV therapy.

Headlines: HDL-Raising Drugs: No Value in the Statin Era?
Teaser: In the era of widespread statin use, investigators say studies testing fibrates, niacin, and CETP inhibitors do not support raising HDL         pharmacologically to reduce clinical outcomes.

Headlines: Idelalisib (Zydelig) Approved for CLL and Lymphoma
Teaser: This oral drug has been generating great excitement among researchers, who welcome it as an alternative to chemotherapy.

Headlines: Infertility: Novel Egg Maturation Method Shows Promise
Teaser: A single injection of kisspeptin-54 triggers egg maturation sufficient to result in fertilization, embryo implantation, and successful live birth.

Headlines: Mobile Polysensors Offer New Potential for Patient Monitoring
Teaser: HealthPatch MD can track a variety of vital signs and activity; FDA cleared for hospital use, it may also soon be applied in home monitoring.

Headlines: Federal Cervical Cancer Screening Program Saves Lives
Teaser: Cervical cancer screening through the National Breast and Cervical Cancer Early Detection Program resulted in more than 10,000 life-years gained.

Headlines: Probiotics Benefit Blood Pressure in Meta-Analysis
Teaser: The reduction in systolic blood pressure with probiotic consumption was modest at 3.5 mmHg, although investigators did observe larger reductions among         individuals with elevated BP at baseline.

Headlines: Psychiatrist Fired as 'Payback' for Marijuana Research?
Teaser: Psychiatrist and researcher Sue Sisely claims the University of Arizona fired her as 'payback' for her pursuit of research into marijuana as a potential treatment for PTSD.

Headlines: Venous Angioplasty of CCSVI in MS Fails in Controlled Trial
Teaser: Venous angioplasty for blood flow restriction in MS yields no clinical benefit in a blinded, sham-controlled trial, prompting a call to abandon this 'therapeutic misadventure.'

Headlines: Shift in Research Strategy Needed to Forestall Ills of Aging
Artemisinin-Resistant Malaria Spreads, Threatens Gains
Teaser: Artemisinin-resistant malaria is prevalent in mainland Southeast Asia; investigators are testing a new, potent antimalarial that could help in the fight.

Headlines: Diagnosing Parkinson's Disease Still Challenging
Teaser: The ability to make an accurate diagnosis of Parkinson's disease on clinical findings has not improved substantially in the last 2 decades, a new study has found.

Headlines: One-Dose Antiemetic Eases Chemo-Induced Nausea, Vomiting
Teaser: A single oral dose of netupitant plus palonosetron at the beginning of a chemotherapy cycle prevented nausea and vomiting for most cancer patients.

Headlines: New EU Privacy Regulations Seen as Threat to Cancer Research
Teaser: Eight major European cancer organizations have endorsed the European Society for Medical Oncology challenge to proposed new European Union data protection regulations.

Headlines: Low-Carb, Low-Saturated-Fat Diet Benefits Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: In contrast to previous studies of low-carb diets, this one also limits saturated fats and includes a physical-activity intervention.

Headlines: Alirocumab Safely Lowers LDL Cholesterol in Nine Trials
Teaser: The top-line results from nine clinical trials showed that patients receiving alirocumab had larger reductions in LDL cholesterol at 24 weeks compared with     placebo or an active comparator.

Headlines: Musculoskeletal Pain on Stopping Imatinib: Should We Worry?
Teaser: A first report on a withdrawal syndrome documents patients with chronic myelogenous leukemia with musculoskeletal pain after imatinib withdrawal.

Headlines: Apremilast Shows Promise for Inflammatory Rosacea
Teaser: The oral phosphodiesterase inhibitor apremilast relieves signs of inflammatory rosacea, according to a pilot study in patients with moderate to severe disease.

Headlines: New Tuberculosis Regimen Works Faster, Costs Less
Teaser: The new once-daily oral regimen known as PaMZ appears to work on both drug-sensitive and multidrug-resistant tuberculosis.

Headlines: Plasma Panel Linked to Progression From MCI to Alzheimer's
Teaser: A panel of 10 key blood proteins linked to disease progression, if replicated, could assist in clinical trials; however, the work has drawn some skeptical assessments.

Headlines: ALTTO Fallout Focuses Debate on the Meaning of pCR
Teaser: The debate about the use of pathologic complete response (pCR) as a surrogate for survival, sparked by the ALTTO results, is gathering momentum.

Headlines: Obinutuzumab for CLL Approved in EU
Teaser: The new anti-CD20 antibody performed better than its predecessor rituximab in a head-to-head trial, but will it replace the older drug?

Headlines: Three Screening Tools Help Identify Psoriatic Arthritis
Teaser: Three screening tools can help identify psoriatic arthritis (PsA) so patients can receive timely treatment, new research suggests.

Headlines: Antibiotic Research Funding Inadequate in the United Kingdom
Teaser: Present levels of antibiotic research funding in the United Kingdom are inadequate to resolve the crisis of antibiotic resistance and should be increased substantially, experts report.

Headlines: Enamel Lesions: An Expert Interview With Jeffrey Fellows
Teaser: Many dentists ignore recommendations to restore only those lesions that pierce enamel and reach dentin. A new study identifies some factors in these decisions.

Headlines: Lower LDL-Cholesterol Levels Still Best, Study Shows
Teaser: Individuals with LDL-cholesterol levels less than 50 mg/dL had a significantly lower risk of major cardiovascular events compared with individuals who had     higher LDL-cholesterol levels, according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: Ibrutinib in CLL: Indication Expanded, Benefit Confirmed
Teaser: The FDA has extended the use of the drug to also cover use in patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) with a chromosome 17p deletion.

Headlines: Green-Plant Membranes Cut Urge for Tasty Food, Spur Weight Loss
Teaser: Eating green plant membranes every day can help people lose weight by reducing their urge for palatable food, a new study in 38 women suggests.

Headlines: FFR- and IVUS-Guided PCI Do Not Reduce Mortality
Teaser: The diagnostic modalities are used to identify functionally significant lesions, but a new observational study examines whether their use confers a     survival advantage in a real-world setting.

Headlines: New Tumor Classification Could Change Therapy for Many
Teaser: The classification of tumor types on the basis of molecular data instead of tissue of origin could lead to treatment changes for at least 10% of cancer patients.

Headlines: FDA OKs Oritavancin (Orbactiv) for Skin Infections
Teaser: Oritavancin is the third new antibacterial cleared by the FDA this year in its campaign to overcome antibiotic resistance.

Headlines: Ebola Emergency Turns Spotlight on Experimental Drugs
Teaser: With hundreds of patients in Africa suffering the devastating effects of Ebola, health experts are scrambling to determine which drugs might offer the best experimental treatment.

Headlines: WHO Consulting Ethics Experts on Experimental Ebola Drugs
Teaser: The use of an experimental drug to treat two U.S. charity workers infected with Ebola virus has prompted the World Health Organization to consider the implications of making such treatments more widely available.

Headlines: HIV May Protect Against Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: Chronic HIV-related immune suppression and/or antiretroviral drug therapy may be protective against multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Another Gene Mutation Increases Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: A report links mutations in PALB2 with a significantly increased risk for breast cancer, and suggests that this gene is next in importance after BRCA1 and BRCA2.

Headlines: Vitamin D and Dementia: A Very Close Tie
Teaser: Individuals who are deficient or severely deficient in the 'sunshine vitamin'  are at greatly increased risk for all-cause dementia.

Headlines: Will Polypill Help CV Outcomes? Ongoing Trials Seek Answer
Teaser: The wave of new studies should greatly expand the polypill evidence base; so far, little has been shown beyond improved treatment adherence and blood pressure and cholesterol levels.

Headlines: WHO Urged to Allow Experimental Drugs in 'Dire' Ebola Outbreak
Teaser: Three of the world's leading Ebola specialists called on Tuesday for experimental drugs and vaccines to be offered to people in West Africa, where a vast outbreak of the deadly disease is raging in three countries.

Headlines: Conditional EU Approval of Muscular Dystrophy Drug Applauded
Teaser: For the Muscular Dystrophy Association, the go-ahead for a targeted drug offers 'tangible hope' to patients with Duchenne muscular dystrophy.

Headlines: Midlife Hypertension Linked to Steeper Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Elevated blood pressure may be less detrimental in the elderly than in younger people when it comes to cognitive decline.

Headlines: Tree Nuts Improve Glycemic Control in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A new systematic review and meta-analysis shows that replacing carbohydrates with tree nuts may help lower HbA1c and fasting glucose in those with type 2     diabetes.

Headlines: IBS, Chronic Idiopathic Constipation: New Guidelines Issued
Teaser: New irritable bowel syndrome and constipation treatment guidelines offer up-to-date recommendations on drug therapy and diet.

Headlines: Experimental Ebola Serum Grown in Tobacco Leaves
Teaser: ZMapp, the experimental treatment rushed to two Americans infected with Ebola in Africa, is grown in specially modified leaves of tobacco -- a plant better known for harming health than healing.

Headlines: FDA 'Stands Ready' to Work With Companies Developing Ebola Drugs
Teaser: The worst Ebola outbreak in history is heaping new pressure on U.S. regulators to speed the development of treatments for the deadly virus, which has killed more than 700 people since February.

Headlines: Dosing the NOACs in Atrial Fib: Can We Do Better?
Teaser: The next stage of new oral anticoagulant research in AF could explore innovative dosing strategies. But few expect a return to schemes as onerous as     warfarin's regular INR monitoring.

Headlines: Guilt by Association? Cesarean Delivery and Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Familial and environmental factors, rather than method of birth, may be to blame for a 15% increase in diabetes risk seen in children born via cesarean or instrument-assisted vaginal delivery.

Headlines: Large-Scale HIV Test-and-Treat Strategy Viable
Teaser: A large-scale trial in which residents are offered HIV testing and treatment is feasible at a population level.

Headlines: FDA Expands Approval of Pompe Disease Drug
Teaser: On the basis of new data available since the approval of Lumizyme, the FDA has expanded approval to include patients younger than 8 years, as well as eliminating the REMS program attached to the drug.

Headlines: Price of New Cancer Drugs as High as Market Can Bear
Teaser: Reflecting on the high cost of a new lung cancer drug, which is actually the second in its class, a prominent oncologist argues that prices are set as high as the market will bear.

Headlines: Jury Out on Histamine-2 Receptor Antagonists for Pediatric GERD
Teaser: There is little high-quality evidence to support the efficacy and safety of histamine-2 receptor antagonists (H2RAs) for pediatric gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), researchers said.

Headlines: Insulin Market Heats Up as Biosimilars and Newer Forms Emerge
Teaser: The insulin market worldwide is heating up as biosimilars, ultralong-acting insulin formulations, and highly concentrated forms of insulin all vie for     approval and market share.

Headlines: Antipsychotics Linked to Acute Kidney Injury
Teaser: Use of atypical antipsychotic medications may increase the risk for acute kidney injury in elderly patients, causing researchers to call for their use in this population to be reevaluated.

Headlines: Extreme Medicine: The Search for New Antibiotics
Teaser: Pampering leafcutter ants with fragrant rose petals and fresh oranges may seem an unlikely way to rescue modern medicine, but scientists at a lab in eastern England think it's well worth trying.

Headlines: Sclerosis: Autologous Cell Transfers May Help Patients
Teaser: A new study has found that injections of adipose-derived stromal cells into the fingers of patients with systemic sclerosis decreased pain and increased function.

Headlines: TNF Inhibitors for RA: No Link to Breast Cancer
Teaser: Swedish researchers have found no link between TNF inhibitors used to treat  rheumatoid arthritis and breast cancer recurrence.

Headlines: Where Will Cologuard Fit Into CRC Screening?
Teaser: Yet another colorectal cancer (CRC) screening option is now available, but will Cologuard be more used than other noninvasive tests?

Headlines: Exclusive: NewLink Says Ebola Vaccine Trial Could Start in Weeks
Teaser: NewLink Genetics Corp, which licensed an Ebola vaccine developed by Canadian government scientists, has enough doses on hand to launch the first human safety trial of an Ebola vaccine this summer.

Headlines: Substantially Increased Risk for Cancer With Higher BMI
Teaser: The largest study to date has confirmed that obesity increases the risk for cancer, and has quantified the extent of that increase, which is particularly high for uterine cancer.

Headlines: Biomarker Panel Could Improve Detection of Esophageal Cancer
Teaser: A new 4-protein biomarker panel could improve detection of esophageal cancer, and might help guide treatment.

Headlines: Neurostimulation for Pain: Earlier May Be Better
