Teaser: Stimulation of the spinal cord, peripheral nerves or areas of the brain is clinically effective and cost-effective and in many cases should be done earlier in the treatment course.

Headlines: Moderate Sodium Intake Tied to Lower CVD Events: PURE
Teaser: Based on fasting morning-urine sodium levels, a large study reports that a moderate rather than low estimated dietary sodium intake was linked to better     clinical outcomes; one expert is not convinced.

Headlines: Cognitive Decline a Harbinger of Stroke?
Teaser: Cognitive decline is well known to occur after stroke, but it also occurs before stroke, and may well signal risk.

Headlines: WHO Backs Use of Experimental Treatments for Ebola
Teaser: It is ethical to offer unproven interventions as potential treatment or prevention in the ongoing Ebola outbreak, a WHO panel of medical ethicists has concluded.

Headlines: U.S. Emergency Labs Ready to Work on Ebola Drugs If Asked
Teaser: All three U.S. facilities established to quickly make vaccines and therapeutics in the event of a major public health threat say they are standing by to support any U.S. government effort to scale up a treatment for Ebola.

Headlines: Clinical Trial to Start Soon on GSK Ebola Vaccine
Teaser: A clinical trial of an experimental vaccine against the deadly Ebola virus is set to start shortly, according to British drugmaker GlaxoSmithKline, which is co-developing the product with U.S. scientists.

Headlines: Deal With Sanofi Means Inhaled Insulin on US Market in 2015
Teaser: A deal between the manufacturer of the newly approved inhaled insulin and Sanofi-Aventis, a market leader in insulin products, will see Afrezza launched in     the US in 2015.

Headlines: Viral Reservoir Seen 'Strikingly' Soon After HIV Infection
Teaser: A reservoir of HIV is established much sooner after infection than was previously thought; measuring that reservoir is the next big challenge.

Headlines: A Solution to Ibrutinib Resistance in MCL?
Teaser: A new clinical trial addresses the issue of nearly universal drug resistance with ibrutinib in the treatment of mantle cell lymphoma (MCL).

Headlines: Clinical-Trial MI Patients Not Like Real-World MI Cases
Teaser: Not only are MI patients in trials different from real-world cases, but the number of eligible MI patients participating in clinical trials is declining,     down from 5.2% in 2008 to 3.4% in 2011.

Headlines: Sierra Leone 'Hero' Doctor's Death Exposes Slow Ebola Response
Teaser: When two American aid workers recovered from Ebola after being treated with an experimental drug, the grieving family of Sierra Leone's most famous doctor wondered why he had been denied the same treatment before he died from the deadly virus.

Headlines: Happiness an Attainable Goal in Schizophrenia
Teaser: Happiness may be an attainable goal for at least some patients with schizophrenia and is associated with positive psychosocial attributes that can be enhanced.

Headlines: Liberian Doctor Who Received Rare Ebola Drug ZMapp Dies
Teaser: One of three African doctors infected with Ebola and treated with the experimental drug ZMapp has died in Monrovia, Liberian Information Minister Lewis Brown said.

Headlines: Doctors in Developed Nations Must Know How to Spot Ebola
Teaser: Doctors in the United States, Europe and around the world need to stay current on the ongoing Ebola outbreak in West Africa and know how to recognize it and the steps to take to protect themselves and others.

Headlines: Poor Prognosis for Incidental AF Detected by Monitoring
Teaser: What should clinicians do with an incidental finding of AF detected by monitoring in asymptomatic patients? Do they fare worse than those without AF? A new study attempts to determine the prognosis of these difficult-to-treat patients.

Headlines: Obesity Prevention Trial Nets Mixed, Debated Results
Teaser: Study authors highlighted secondary benefits in an obesity-prevention trial, although the primary endpoint was not met; other researchers say this is overly optimistic.

Headlines: Ebola Therapies and Vaccines Need Priority, Support
Teaser: Editorials published this week by major infectious disease experts call for support and prioritizing development of Ebola therapies and vaccines while maintaining momentum in controlling the outbreak.

Headlines: 2 U.S. Ebola Patients Released From Hospital
Teaser: Two Americans infected with Ebola as they cared for patients in West Africa have fully recovered and have been discharged from the Atlanta hospital where they were treated, officials said.

Headlines: Study Questions Harm of Blood Transfusions in AMI
Teaser: Studies have suggested that blood transfusions in AMI increase the risk of death by three- or fourfold. A new analysis, however, offers a "scathing rebuke" to that position.

Headlines: FDA Clears Blood Test to Help Diagnose Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: The zinc transporter 8 autoantibody test helps determine whether a person has type 1 diabetes and not type 2 or gestational diabetes.

Headlines: FAST MRI: A 3-minute MRI for Breast Cancer Screening
Teaser: An accelerated MRI screening protocol for breast cancer that takes just 3 minutes is as good as a regular MRI that takes 21 minutes, and more accurate than digital mammography.

Headlines: Tekmira Drug Saves Monkeys With Marburg Fever
Teaser: An experimental drug from Tekmira Pharmaceuticals Corp helped lab monkeys recover from the most deadly strain of Marburg virus, a close cousin of Ebola, even after symptoms appeared.

Headlines: Experimental Ebola Drugs Needed for 'Up to 30,000 People'
Teaser: Up to 30,000 people could have used experimental treatments or vaccines so far in the world's worst outbreak of Ebola currently plaguing West Africa, British scientists said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Blood Transfusions Lower Risks for Children With Sickle Cell
Teaser: Children with sickle cell anemia and asymptomatic neurologic injury were 58% less likely to suffer a repeat cerebral infarction while undergoing regular blood transfusions, according to a small study.

Headlines: Rare Case Has Implications for Alzheimer's Drug Development
Teaser: A man with normal brain function despite no detectable apolipoprotein E suggests that lowering cerebral apoE levels might be a new avenue for intervention in Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: Combination Therapy Optimizes Recovery in Severe Depression
Teaser: Combination treatment with psychotherapy and antidepressant medication appears to optimize rates of recovery in patients with severe, nonchronic major depression.

Headlines: Knowns and Unknowns: Lancet Reviews Lipids in CVD
Teaser: The European Society of Cardiology is just over 10 days away, and given the onslaught of new data that will be presented, three papers in the Lancet review     what is known and not known about lipids in CVD.

Headlines: Leave the Car at Home: Active Commuting Lowers BMI, Body Fat
Teaser: People who use public transit or walk or cycle to work have lower BMIs and less body fat than employees who take the car.

Headlines: FDA Clears Eliglustat (Cerdelga) for Gaucher Disease
Teaser: The new drug proved as effective as enzyme replacement therapy in treating the rare genetic disease in a clinical trial.

Headlines: Highly Sensitive cTnT Safely Rules Out MI in One Hour
Teaser: A highly sensitive assay for cardiac troponin T has the ability to safely and effectively rule-out/rule-in acute MI within one hour in patients presenting     to the emergency department with chest pain, according to the results of a new study.

Headlines: New-Generation DES Match BMS Stent Safety Beyond One Year: SCAAR
Teaser: Dubbed the "SCAAR scare," data presented in Barcelona in 2006 first raised alarms about the risk of stent thrombosis with DES. Fittingly, in Barcelona     again, new data offer reassurances.

Headlines: PARADIGM-HF: New Drug Class Outclasses ACE-I in Chronic HF
Teaser: Although observers are cautious, one expert writes hopefully that the trial "may well represent a new threshold of hope for patients with heart failure."

Headlines: Gout Linked to Increased Vascular Disease Risk
Teaser: Patients with gout, particularly women, have increased risk for vascular disease, according to findings from a retrospective, matched Danish cohort study.

Headlines: Gene Studies of Ebola Show Virus Is Mutating Fast
Teaser: Genetic studies of some of the earliest Ebola cases in Sierra Leone reveal more than 300 genetic changes in the virus as it leapt from person to person, changes that could blunt the effectiveness of diagnostic tests and experimental treatments.

Headlines: Wanted: 60 Volunteers to Test Ebola Vaccine in Middle England
Teaser: Fancy testing an Ebola vaccine? It may sound scary but the scientist behind the British trial of a shot that has so far only been given to monkeys sees little risk and is optimistic he will drum up enough volunteers.

Headlines: August 29 News Podcast
Teaser: Hear a review of the top cardiology stories for the week ending Aug 29.

Headlines: 'Strikingly Effective' Approach for Depression in Cancer Pts
Teaser: A new integrated program for treating depression in cancer patients was 'strikingly more effective' than current standard of care.

Headlines: Stroke a Race Against the Clock, Review Confirms
Teaser: A large meta-analysis of individual-patient data confirms that thrombolysis given promptly after ischemic stroke boosts odds of good outcome, regardless of age or stroke severity.

Headlines: Health Law Spurs Focus on Faster Drug Development
Teaser: The Cures Acceleration Network’s mission is to fund research that can be speedily transformed into treatments and to streamline the drug-approval process.

Headlines: Add-on Guanfacine Helpful for Stubborn ADHD
Teaser: Children and adolescents who don't respond well to psychostimulant monotherapy may benefit from adding guanfacine extended-release, research confirms.

Headlines: Canada's Immunovaccine Inc Says Test of Ebola Vaccine Promising
Teaser: Four monkeys survived the Ebola virus after being injected with a vaccine that included Immunovaccine Inc's technology, the tiny Canadian company said.

Headlines: Psoriatic Arthritis Factors Can Affect Employment Status
Teaser: Employer awareness and helpfulness  positively affected the employment status of psoriatic arthritis patients; older age and disease duration of 2 to 5 years  increased the risk for unemployment.

Headlines: MERS: Low Transmission Rates in Household Contacts
Teaser: A study in Saudi Arabia has suggested positive results for less than 5% of household contacts tested for MERS.

Headlines: ICAAC to Showcase 'Extraordinary' Ebola Efforts
Teaser: From the emergence of new infections to the resurgence of old ones, the 54th Interscience Conference on Antimicrobial Agents and Chemotherapy will explore new ways to fight bugs.

Headlines: Daclatasvir (Daklinza) for Chronic Hepatitis C Cleared in EU
Teaser: The potent oral antiviral, indicated across multiple HCV genotypes and in combination with other oral drugs, yields cure rates of up to 100%, the manufacturer says.

Headlines: What's Going to Be Hot at ESC Congress 2014
Teaser: A novel HF therapy; progress with LDL; new uses for old meds; and fresh insights into treatments that didn't pan out: all reminders of how far cardiology     has come and how much further it has to go.

Headlines: Ketamine May Curb Suicidal Thoughts
Teaser: Ketamine administered to patients expressing suicidal thoughts was associated with an increased wish to live and a decreased wish to die independently of the drug's rapid antidepressant effect.

Headlines: Rinse Eases Symptoms of Oral Mucositis in Cancer Patients
Teaser: The first randomized controlled trial of products for oral mucositis suggests that an oral rinse improves many symptoms of oral mucositis, compared with placebo.

Headlines: JAK Inhibition Restores Hair in Alopecia Patients
Teaser: In keeping with results in murine studies, pharmacological inhibition of Janus kinase (JAK) family protein tyrosine kinases led to recovery of hair growth in three patients with alopecia areata.

Headlines: Moxifloxacin Struggles Against Current TB Drugs: REMox Trial
Teaser: Although a shorter, moxifloxacin-containing regimen did not measure up to standard tuberculosis therapy, the drug shows promise, experts say.

Headlines: New Data on Neoadjuvant Chemo and Breast Cancer Recurrence
Teaser: If breast cancer specialists could identify which patients were unlikely to experience disease recurrence after neoadjuvant chemotherapy, radiation therapy might be avoided. A new study has insights.

Headlines: WHO Urges Drug Companies, Regulators to Speed Ebola Work
Teaser: The World Health Organization (WHO) called for pharmaceutical companies and regulatory agencies to work together to accelerate development of safe and efficient drugs and vaccines against Ebola.

Headlines: Continuous Lenalidomide Plus Dexamethasone FIRST in Myeloma
Teaser: For older multiple myeloma patients ineligible for transplantation, interim results from the FIRST trial suggest that continuous lenalidomide and dexamethasone is better than the standard of care.

Headlines: What's Hot at ASTRO 2014
Teaser: A major clinical trial in prostate cancer and a rare plenary presentation of preclinical data highlight the upcoming meeting.

Headlines: FDA Okays First PD Inhibitor: Pembrolizumab for Melanoma
Teaser: The first of a new class of programmed death (PD) inhibitor drugs has been approved in the United States, much earlier than expected.

Headlines: Find It, Treat It: 'Lousy' Prognosis for Asymptomatic AF
Teaser: Incidentally detected AF in asymptomatic, ambulatory AF carries a bad prognosis, say investigators. The goal should be to treat it, but it has to be found     it first. A group of Australian researchers are now pushing for better community screening and treatment of silent AF.

Headlines: Chimerix Says Antiviral Shows Promise Against Ebola
Teaser: Chimerix Inc said its lead experimental drug showed promise against the deadly Ebola virus in laboratory testing at the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the National Institutes of Health.

Headlines: Third Patient With Ebola Returning to US
Teaser: A physician who is the third American infected with Ebola will be coming back to the United States, although it is not yet known when that will be, according to the CDC.

Headlines: Researchers Identify Molecular Differences in AD Brains
Teaser: Findings implicate cortex-specific hypermethylation across a region in the ANK1 gene in brains donated by patients with Alzheimer's.

Headlines: TASTE at One Year: No Gains from Thrombectomy in PCI for STEMI
Teaser: Hopes for the strategy of prestenting thrombus aspiration in primary PCI have been deflated or at least put on hold pending a much larger trial expected     next year.

Headlines: RA: Effect of 'Complete Disease Control' on Pain, Function
Teaser: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis who have more complete disease control had better outcomes than those who did not.

Headlines: Beta-Blockers No Use in HF Patients With Atrial Fibrillation
Teaser: A large meta-analysis that pulled patient-level data on HF and AF found a major benefit for beta-blockers in patients in sinus rhythm, but no such benefit     in those with atrial fib at baseline.

Headlines: Teva Finds Positive Results in Advanced Trials of Reslizumab
Teaser: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries said a drug under development had positive results in reducing the frequency of clinical asthma exacerbations in two advanced trials in patients with moderate to severe asthma.

Headlines: No Survival Benefit but Increase in Bilateral Mastectomy
Teaser: Women diagnosed with unilateral breast cancer are increasingly opting for bilateral mastectomy, but a study of nearly 190,000 women shows no survival benefit with this aggressive approach.

Headlines: Increasing Rates of Acute HCV Among Young Americans
Teaser: The incidence of acute hepatitis C infection is rising rapidly among Americans aged 30 years and younger, especially those living in non-urban areas, according to U.S. data.

Headlines: New ASCO Guideline for HER2-negative Advanced Breast Cancer
Teaser: The American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) has issued a new guideline for the treatment of patients with HER2-negative advanced breast cancer.

Headlines: PARADIGM-HF: Some Say, 'A New Day in Heart Failure'
Teaser: "I'm having difficulty being critical of this one," said one expert on the trial of an agent tailor-made to supplant ACE inhibitors for heart failure. But     is this just the honeymoon phase?

Headlines: Can Beta-Blockers Be Stopped Post-AMI With Preserved LVEF?
Teaser: The ESC downgraded its beta-blocker recommendations in STEMI and NSTEMI patients with no HF, while US guidance still recommends their use out to three     years. New data call that into question.

Headlines: 15-Year Data Show Better Survival in Elderly AMI Patients
Teaser: There has been a significant improvement in one-year mortality rates over a 15-year period among those aged 75 years and older. Better access to PCI and     improved medications are the likely reason.

Headlines: Generic GA Shows Equivalence on MRI Endpoints in MS
Teaser: A generic version of the MS drug glatiramer acetate looked similar to the branded product (Copaxone) in terms of reduction in MRI lesions and side effects in the GATE study.

Headlines: Ebola Highlights Slow Progress in War on Tropical Diseases
Teaser: Some of the world's most gruesome diseases are finally getting a bit of attention.

Headlines: FDA Panel Endorses Liraglutide as Obesity Treatment
Teaser: An FDA committee voted 14 to 1 in favor of liraglutide as an obesity treatment, stipulating that lingering safety questions be addressed in         postmarketing studies.

Headlines: Osteoporosis Drugs Lower Fracture Risk, but Best One Unclear
Teaser: There are very few head-to-head trials of pharmacologic treatments for osteoporosis; thus, reviewers are left to summarize trials and observational studies of individual drugs.

Headlines: Lessons on Ebola Preparedness From the US and Canada
Teaser: A doctor from Emory advises other hospitals on Ebola preparedness, and a Canadian doctor describes the lessons he learned from a false alarm.

Headlines: Genetic 'Hotspot' Found in High-Risk Endometrial Cancer
Teaser: Younger patients with type I endometrial cancer who have a characteristic mutation in the CTNNB1 gene were more likely to have poor prognosis.

Headlines: A Polypill in the US? FDA Panel Debates Possibility
Teaser: The "paradigm-shifting" treatment strategy gained a small foothold on the climb toward approval when a Food and Drug Administration advisory committee     cautiously supported its availability and use among select patients.

Headlines: FDA Grants Expanded Indication for Enzalutamide (Xtandi)
Teaser: The oral androgen receptor inhibitor is now approved as first-line therapy for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

Headlines: TKIs May Be New Treatment Option for ALL Subtype
Teaser: A new study uncovered the genetic complexity of Ph-like ALL and pointed to tyrosine kinase inhibitors as potential new treatments.

Headlines: Experimental Interventions Invited on Ebola Frontline
Teaser: Relaxed restrictions on experimental Ebola interventions, recently announced by the World Health Organization, are welcome news.

Headlines: The 'Family Business' Behind the Flurry of PD-1 Inhibitors
Teaser: Discoveries from a duo of scientists at the Dana-Farber Cancer Center and Harvard Medical School have contributed to understanding how tumors hijack the PD-1 pathway and evade immune recognition. Their patents were licensed nonexclusively to 7 pharmaceutical companies, helping spawn the flurry of PD-1 inhibitors in cancer immunotherapy.

Headlines: Data Reanalysis Changes 35% of Trial Conclusions
Teaser: When researchers reanalyze randomized clinical trial data, the results change in 1 of 3 cases, a new study has shown. This finding strengthens the case for broader disclosure of research data.

Headlines: Pain and Depression Treatment Possible in Fibromyalgia
Teaser: A new study shows that patients with fibromyalgia who have comorbid depression can be treated with pregabalin for pain relief while remaining on antidepressants.

Headlines: Low-Dose Fish Oil Shows Reduced Seizures in Epilepsy
Teaser: After several negative trials, the possibility of treating epilepsy with fish oil has seen a glimmer of hope with a new study suggesting a significant benefit with a lower dose than previously tested.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Panel Calls for Sunscreen Safety Testing
Teaser: As sunscreens have evolved during the last 40 years from 'suntan lotion' to preventive medicine, the FDA is just now grappling with ensuring their safety.

Headlines: What's Hot at MSBoston 2014?
Teaser: The joint meeting of ACTRIMS and ECTRIMS, already boasting higher than expected attendance, kicks off this week in Boston.

Headlines: IMPI: No Immunotherapy Benefit in Tuberculous Pericarditis
Teaser: Although prednisolone might be appropriate in some patients, the authors propose, neither the glucocorticoid nor M indicus pranii immunotherapy improved survival in the 1400-patient trial.

Headlines: The Changing Face of Opioid Addiction
Teaser: The 50- to 69-year-old age group represents the fastest growing subpopulation of opioid addicts in the United States.

Headlines: FOCUS: More MI Survivors Adhere to Polypill Than Three Pills
Teaser: In this trial of diverse, international patients who had an MI, a polypill boosted drug-adherence levels compared with taking multiple pills, but still,     only about half of the patients were compliant at nine months.

Headlines: Up to 25% of Child Deaths Preventable in Wealthy Countries
Teaser: In a series of articles, researchers have detailed factors associated with child deaths and what might be done about them.

Headlines: TRANSLATE-ACS: No MACE Benefit With Prasugrel in ACS
Teaser: The results run counter to TRITON-TIMI 38, but the researchers of the observational analysis say the results are intended to provide a glimpse of how     prasugrel is being used in real-world clinical practice.

Headlines: What's Hot at ESMO 2014
Teaser: New data promise to be practice changing, and will change the standard of care for melanoma, prostate, and lung cancer, among others.

Headlines: RT for Breast Cancer Does Not Up Risk for Lymphedema
Teaser: Researchers uncovered good news about radiation therapy and the risk for arm swelling from a large trial of node-negative breast cancer patients.

Headlines: 'Scary' Decline in Funding for Cancer Research
Teaser: The impressive progress in cancer treatment that has been made in recent years is in serious danger of faltering because of research budget cuts, says the American Association for Cancer Research.

Headlines: Practice Changing (Again): Stereotactic RT for Lung Cancer
Teaser: Latest results on stereotactic body radiation therapy (SBRT) for lung cancer are reassuring and should continue to change practice, say researchers.

Headlines: Lawyer Grills DePuy Over Safety Studies for Pinnacle Hips
Teaser: An executive at DePuy Orthopaedics Inc defended the company's assessment of safety risks associated with metal-on-metal Pinnacle hip implants in a Dallas court from a lawyer who said the company had neglected to perform critical safety testing.

Headlines: Single-Fraction RT for Bone Mets Should Be 'Standard'
Teaser: In the first-ever 'real world' study of palliative radiotherapy for bone metastases, single and multiple fractions were equivalent.

Headlines: Contrave, Newest Weight-Loss Option: FAQs
Teaser: The FDA's approval of a new prescription weight-loss pill offers yet another option for the more than one-third of American adults who are obese.

Headlines: Gene in Greenland Inuit Ups Type 2 Diabetes Risk by 50%
Teaser: Recently published research presented at EASD reveals a dramatically increased risk for type 2 diabetes among Inuit individuals carrying 2 copies of a     newly identified gene variant.

Headlines: Daclizumab in MS: More Detail on Phase 3 Results
Teaser: Full final results of the DECIDE trial show 'impressive efficacy and manageable safety,' with daclizumab HYP, the lead investigator reports.

Headlines: Generics Beat Brand-Name Statins for Patient Adherence and Improving Outcomes
Teaser: Generics are cheaper than their branded cousins, which results in better adherence, say investigators. And by taking lipid-lowering medications more         frequently, clinical outcomes are improved.

Headlines: Light From BRIGHT: More Fuel for Bivalirudin-Heparin Debate
Teaser: US cardiologists are finally getting a look at the Chinese BRIGHT trial, heralded as the first three-way randomization of bivalirudin, heparin, and heparin     plus a GP IIb/IIIa inhibitor.

Headlines: Drug-Eluting Balloon Falls Short of Stenting in DES ISR
Teaser: Drug-eluting balloons might help operators avoid repeat "wallpapering" of vessels with recurring restenosis. Pitted against a second-generation DES in RIBS     IV, however, the strategy fell short.

Headlines: As Used, Spironolactone Doesn't Cut 30-Day HF Readmissions
Teaser: It's probably a reflection of a long-recognized problem, say researchers; patients in clinical practice just aren't a lot like those in clinical trials.

Headlines: Antibiotics Prescribed for Kids at Twice Expected Rate
Teaser: Physicians need more tools to help distinguish between viral and bacterial illnesses.

Headlines: Vitamin D Doesn't Prevent Calcium Drop After Gastric Bypass
Teaser: Sharp decreases in calcium absorption were observed even when gastric bypass patients maintained adequate vitamin D levels, with the level of decline     correlating with the percentage of weight loss.

Headlines: Dead or Treading Water: Experts Debate Renal Denervation
Teaser: Interventionalists at TCT 2014 packed a room to listen to two experts debate the merits of renal denervation for resistant hypertension. Much was said, but     at the end of the day their agreement was that there is still a lot to learn.

Headlines: New Hyperkalemia Drug Safe, Effective in Phase 3 Trial
Teaser: A phase 3 trial has shown that ZS-9, an experimental drug for hyperkalemia, is safe and effective, including in patients on RAASi therapy.

Headlines: PARTNER TAVR Deaths at Five Years: Sobering and Remarkable
Teaser: Most of the inoperable aortic-valve-disease patients from this pivotal trial died within a few years of the study's launch. But data on the limited survivors offer some insights that experts say will influence their practice.

Headlines: Natpara Recommended by FDA Panel for Hypoparathyroidism
Teaser: The recombinant human parathyroid hormone product Natpara has been recommended for approval for the treatment of hypoparathyroidism by a US Food and Drug Administration advisory committee.

Headlines: Alemtuzumab for MS: Encouraging 4-Year Data
Teaser: Latest data continue to show low rates of relapse and new lesions, with brain atrophy said to be slowed to 'almost normal.'  But safety issues are still a concern for some.

Headlines: K-Binder Averts Hyperkalemia Over One Month: Top-Line Results
Teaser: A phase 3 trial of the potassium sequestrant ZS-9 met its primary end point by averting recurrent hyperkalemia compared with placebo, said ZS Pharma in a     short announcement.

Headlines: High-Dose RT Is a 'Conundrum' in Localized Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A major phase 3 trial compared high- and standard-dose radiation therapy in intermediate-risk, localized disease. The results cast doubt on the dose that American practitioners most commonly use.

Headlines: Ebola Drug Trials to Be Fast-Tracked in West Africa
Teaser: Experimental Ebola drugs including compounds from Mapp Biopharmaceutical, Sarepta and Tekmira will be tested in affected West African states for the first time in a bid to fast-track trials, the Wellcome Trust said.

Headlines: 'Polyherbacy' a Common Challenge in Pain Patients
Teaser: With chronic pain patients the leading drivers of the multi-billion-dollar dietary supplement industry, clinicians are put to the test to place things in perspective.

Headlines: Technology Empowers Patients, Doctors to Solve Problems
Teaser: In a Silicon Valley talk, healthcare technologist Indu Subaiya explained how digital advances can empower people to break through impasses in medical research.

Headlines: Single Radiation Dose for Malignant Spinal Cord Compression
Teaser: A single but higher dose of radiation preserves mobility in patients, and is cheaper and more convenient than lower doses given over several days.

Headlines: Pioneering Trial of Radiation in Aggressive Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Patients with high-risk prostate cancer should be treated with long-term hormone therapy and high-dose radiation, a new study concludes.

Headlines: One Antidepressant Dose Causes Rapid Brain Changes
Teaser: An imaging study reveals rapid and dramatic changes in functional connectivity throughout the brain after a single dose of an SSRI antidepressant.

Headlines: Mycophenolate Mofetil Cuts Relapse in MS Variant NMO
Teaser: MMF reduced the frequency of relapse  while stabilizing or improving disability in patients with neuromyelitis optica spectrum disorder, a new study shows.

Headlines: New International Guidelines for Advanced Breast Ca Released
Teaser: International experts urge more research to find better treatments for women with advanced breast cancer, a 'historically neglected patient population.'

Headlines: Infarct Size Post-PCI Predictive of Mortality at One Year
Teaser: The assessment of infarct size can provide important prognostic information at one year, a study shows. Primarily a research tool, infarct size can help     plan guide STEMI studies given its reliability as a surrogate marker.

Headlines: Idelalisib (Zydelig) Approved in Europe
Teaser: The first-in-class oral agent is now approved in the EU for the treatment of chronic lymphocytic leukemia and follicular lymphoma.

Headlines: Synthetic Marijuana Now a Worldwide Problem
Teaser: Consumption of synthetic cannabinoids, aka K2 or Spice, has increased all over the world - despite law enforcement and regulatory control measures, reports a new NIDA-led study.

Headlines: FDA Panel Rejects New Oral Testosterone Replacement Drug
Teaser: The FDA advisory panel split slightly on the efficacy and safety of Rextoro for testosterone replacement, as well as the standards to judge the prodrug.

Headlines: FDA Approves Once-Weekly Dulaglutide for Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: The glucagon-like peptide-1 receptor agonist was evaluated in 6 clinical trials involving more than 3000 patients.

Headlines: White House Unveils Plan to Battle Antibiotic Resistance
Teaser: President Barack Obama today laid out a broad strategy to combat superbugs and charged a new government task force to develop the necessary tactics to carry it out.

Headlines: VEGF Inhibitors Work Equally Well in Diabetic Macular Edema
Teaser: The controversial result from a cross-trial comparison suggests treatment gains are similar across therapeutic options and occur early in patients with diabetes treated for macular edema.

Headlines: No Brainer: Cap and Drape Reduce Radiation Exposure
Teaser: Two simple tools, a lead pelvic drape and a nonlead surgical cap, can help reduce radiation exposure to operators during PCI cases.

Headlines: PET-CT Better Than CT in Follicular Lymphoma
Teaser: PET-CT is better than conventional contrast-enhanced CT in evaluating patients with follicular lymphoma, and should become the gold standard, say researchers.

Headlines: WHO Sees Small-Scale Use of Ebola Vaccines in January
Teaser: The WHO said it expected to begin small-scale use of two experimental Ebola vaccines in West Africa early next year and in the meantime, transfusions of survivors' blood may offer the best hope of treatment.

Headlines: In NSCLC After Progression on First-line TKI, What Next?
Teaser: Once a patient with EGFR-positive non-small cell lung cancer stops responding to first-line tyrosine kinase inhibitor, how should therapy proceed?

Headlines: 'Unprecedented' Survival in Metastatic Breast Cancer
Teaser: Pertuzumab plus trastuzumab adds a 15-month survival benefit in HER2-positive metastatic breast cancer.

Headlines: Anamorelin: First Ever Drug for Cancer Cachexia?
Teaser: The drug, a mimetic of the so called 'hunger hormone' ghrelin, significantly increased lean body mass and body weight in cancer patients with cachexia.

Headlines: Rolapitant Reduces Chemo-Induced Nausea and Vomiting
Teaser: An investigational NK-1 receptor antagonist as demonstrated a significant effect in both acute and delayed phases.

Headlines: Afatinib Shows Modest Benefit in Head and Neck Cancer
Teaser: Afatinib, already approved for lung cancer, showed an improvement in progression-free, but not overall, survival, in head and neck cancer.

Headlines: FDA Warns of Small Cardio, Cerebrovascular Risk With Xolair
Teaser: The agency hedged its warning by saying the findings come from a manufacturer's safety study with 'weaknesses.'

Headlines: Genomic Entrepreneurs Promise to Personalize Medicine
Teaser: Companies say they are ushering in a new age of individualized medicine.

Headlines: EC's CHMP Recommends Combo Inhalers for COPD, Asthma
Teaser: The committee has endorsed the combination of aclidinium bromide/formoterol fumarate for COPD, and a budesonide/formoterol combination for COPD and asthma.

Headlines: Laquinimod in MS: Latest Safety Data 'Reassuring'
Teaser: The latest pooled data from the extension phases of the major phase 3 studies show no new adverse effects and no signal of any type of cancer.

Headlines: Nicox Glaucoma Drug Effective in Late-Stage Studies
Teaser: French pharmaceutical firm Nicox unveiled positive topline Phase 3 results for its glaucoma drug and said, if approved by regulators, the product could reach peak annual sales of over $1 billion worldwide.

Headlines: Metformin May Lower TSH Levels in Those With Hypothyroidism
Teaser: Reduced TSH levels were seen among diabetes patients taking metformin rather than a sulfonylurea when they also had hypothyroidism. The effect wasn't seen     in those with normal thyroid function.

Headlines: Metformin in Diabetes: Evidence Overwhelming, or Unclear?
Teaser: The drug is old and widely used for type 2 diabetes, but disagreement exists as to whether the data support its use; 2 experts at EASD faced off in a     lively debate.

Headlines: PML in MS Patients Making Natalizumab-to-Fingolimod Switch
Teaser: A new report describes several cases of PML seen in patients with MS receiving fingolimod, all but 1 of which were treated previously with natalizumab. Authors say this patient had neuromyelitis optica, not MS, with atypical features.

Headlines: After Sinking in, PARADIGM-HF Critiqued at HFSA Sessions
Teaser: On reflection, after seemingly universal praise right after the trial's recent unveiling, leaders of the field aired a few reservations; the PIs sought to     answer some of the questions raised.

Headlines: Failed HCV Drug Cardiotoxic in 40% of Treated Patients
Teaser: When analyzing the 34 patients treated with BMS-986094, researchers found that 14 had some form of systolic dysfunction. Those cases of low LVEF might have     remained undetected, given that troponin and BNP levels were relatively normal.

Headlines: Has Choosing Wisely Altered American Breast Cancer Practice?
Teaser: A new study hints that the campaign to reduce non-evidence-based medical tests and procedures, ongoing for 4 years, might have changed the prescribing of radiotherapy in early-stage breast cancer.

Headlines: Progress Stalled in Diabetic Foot Ulcers; Major Unmet Need
Teaser: Experts say diabetic foot ulcers remain a huge problem and the development of effective therapies has stalled for the past 2 decades.

Headlines: Laser-Doppler-Imager Flare Detects Early Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: A new technique that detects foot skin response to heat distinguished between people with and without diabetes and correlated with changes in triglycerides     and HbA1c.

Headlines: ORIGINALE: Fewer Cases of New Diabetes With Insulin
Teaser: The 2.5-year follow-on study from the ORIGIN trial confirms the neutral effect of insulin glargine on CV events and cancer, while indicating that insulin     may be able to reduce development of new diabetes.

Headlines: Crowdsource the Integrity of Published CV Research? A Debate
Teaser: Players in a raucous controversy over discredited research, pulled papers, and beta-blocker guidelines propose that accountability for the medical     literature's accuracy be spread around.

Headlines: Family-Based Therapy Best Treatment for Teen Anorexia
Teaser: A new study adds to a growing body of evidence supporting the value of parent involvement in combating adolescent anorexia nervosa.

Headlines: Enterovirus, Neonatal Diseases Showcased at AAP Conference
Teaser: The conference will focus on a range of issues, from clinical trials in pediatric populations to new guidelines for asthma and the immunoprophylaxis of respiratory syncytial virus in infants.

Headlines: Fish Oil Does Not Prevent AF Recurrence
Teaser: In addition to failing to reduce AF recurrence in low-risk patients not currently taking conventional antiarrhythmic drug therapy, there was no reduction     in markers of inflammation and oxidative stress.

Headlines: EASD/ADA to Lobby for Better Device Regulation in EU and US
Teaser: Regulatory control of devices used to treat diabetes, such as insulin pumps, is woefully inadequate in Europe and still leaves a lot to be desired in the     US, say the European and US diabetes societies.

Headlines: GSK, NewLink Working to Bring Ebola Vaccines Online
Teaser: Both GlaxoSmithKline and NewLink Genetics are working to boost their capacity to make Ebola vaccines, with a goal of a 'very significant increase in scale during the first half of 2015,' the WHO said.

Headlines: Teen Pregnancies Plummet With Free Contraception, Education
Teaser: Teenagers offered free birth control rarely got pregnant and were more likely to choose long-acting methods compared with national averages.

Headlines: Big LDL-C Reductions With Evolocumab in FH Patients
Teaser: The PCSK9 inhibitor evolocumab reduced LDL cholesterol in patients with homozygous and heterozygous FH, with an editorial suggesting the drug class could     become a standard of care for these difficult-to-treat patients.

Headlines: Exercise Boosts Kids' Cognitive Performance, Brain Function
Teaser: Moderate to vigorous physical activity may enhance cognitive performance and brain function in children.

Headlines: Failed Cancer Vaccines Might Live Again With New Immune Drugs
Teaser: Using vaccines to fight cancer is a field littered with failures but experts believe it is possible the approach could get a new lease of life if such shots are combined with a new class of drugs called checkpoint inhibitors.

Headlines: Low Vitamin D Levels Not Likely Cause of Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A large database analysis investigating 4 genetic variants associated with vitamin-D concentrations finds no significant "unconfounded" relationship with     the development of type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Big Plans: ASCO Targets Obesity-Cancer Link
Teaser: In a new position statement, ASCO commits to 'promoting' changes to reduce the impact of obesity on cancer risk and outcomes. But does weight loss improve survival?

Headlines: Tonix Pharma's Pain Drug Fails Mid-Stage Study
Teaser: Tonix Pharmaceuticals Holding Corp said its lead pain drug failed the main goal of a mid-stage study.

Headlines: Corneal Microscopy Detects Diabetic Autonomic Neuropathy
Teaser: A study shows close correlation of corneal-nerve parameters with standard measures of diabetic autonomic neuropathy, yielding good sensitivity and     specificity for making the diagnosis.

Headlines: New Standard in Melanoma: Combo of BRAF and MEK Inhibitors
Teaser: For patients with BRAF-mutation positive melanoma, the combination of a BRAF and MEK inhibitor works better than BRAF inhibitor alone.

Headlines: Radiation Therapy Adds No Survival Benefit in Mesothelioma
Teaser: Adding high-dose radiotherapy to a regimen of chemotherapy and surgery does not delay or prevent local recurrence.

Headlines: Varenicline Label Changes Downplay Suicide Risk
Teaser: New data suggest lower neuropsychiatric risks with the smoking cessation drug varenicline. The FDA is set to review these new safety data at an upcoming meeting.

Headlines: Open Payments Web Site Debuts, Ready or Not
Teaser: Release of industry payments under the Sunshine Act on September 30 means a cloudy day for physicians worried about accuracy and angry about the government spotlight.

Headlines: Oncologist Sentenced to 10 Years for Poisoning Colleague
Teaser: A breast cancer specialist was sentenced for aggravated assault after lacing her sex partner's coffee with ethylene glycol. The victim is also an oncologist at the M.D. Anderson Cancer Center.

Headlines: New Test to Identify PML Risk With Natalizumab in MS
Teaser: The test, which detects low levels of L-selectin in the blood, is said to have a sensitivity of about 90%, and even higher rates when combined with JC virus antibody status.

Headlines: China Military-Linked Firm Eyes Quick Approval of Ebola Drug
Teaser: A Chinese drugmaker with close military ties is seeking fast-track approval for a drug that it says can cure Ebola, as China joins the race to help treat a deadly outbreak of the disease.

Headlines: Survey Describes Tumor Boards in US
Teaser: Data on tumor board attendance and what is discussed at the meetings are limited. A new survey fills in some of the gaps.

Headlines: Maker of Ebola Drug ZMapp Seeks to Boost Output
Teaser: California-based Mapp Biopharmaceutical Inc is making progress in efforts to boost production of the experimental Ebola treatment ZMapp, as the deadly virus continues to spread through West Africa and beyond, the company said Friday.

Headlines: HIV: Non-Efavirenz Regimens Effective in Initial Treatment
Teaser: Phase 3 results from an AIDS Clinical Trials Group RCT suggest that regimens lacking efavirenz have similar efficacy in initial HIV treatment, and raltegravir has better tolerability.

Headlines: FDA OKs First Combo Drug (Harvoni) for Hepatitis C
Teaser: The new antiviral drug, which includes the ultraexpensive Sovaldi, also is the first that does not require administration with interferon and ribavirin to treat these infections.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Drug-Coated Balloon for Vascular Disease
Teaser: The approval comes after a unanimous vote in favor of approval from the FDA's Circulatory System Devices Panel in June.

Headlines: Novel Combo Approved for Chemo-induced Nausea and Vomiting
Teaser: Novel combination of netupitant and palonosetron (Akynzeo) has been FDA approved for the prevention of chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting.

Headlines: Wide Utility of Model Predicting Troglitazone Hepatotoxicity
Teaser: What if scientists could predict adverse events of drugs in development that may not show up in animal studies or the relatively limited clinical testing     that goes on preapproval?

Headlines: Single-agent Cyclophosphamide for GVHD Prophylaxis
Teaser: Could a single drug replace the cocktail that is currently used to prevent graft vs host disease (GVHD) after stem cell transplantation?

Headlines: Chimerix Drug Used for Ebola Shows Promise Against Adenovirus
Teaser: Chimerix Inc said its experimental oral antiviral, which was used earlier this week to treat the first Ebola patient diagnosed in the United States, improved the survival rate of patients with respiratory infection with adenovirus.

Headlines: Gene Therapy for SCID-X1 Safer in Second Iteration
Teaser: An improved viral vector in gene therapy for X-linked severe combined immunodeficiency treated the genetic disease without causing leukemia, as occurred in the first trial.

Headlines: Policy Changes Considered as Specialty Drug Spending Surges
Teaser: The October 2014 issue of Health Affairs is devoted to quantifying the recent explosion of "specialty drugs" and exploring ways of reigning in costs while maximizing their benefit.

Headlines: BrainStorm Gets FDA Fast-Track Status for ALS Stem Cell Therapy
Teaser: Israel's BrainStorm Cell Therapeutics said the U.S. Food and Drug Administration has designated its adult stem cell treatment as a 'fast-track' product for the treatment of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS).

Headlines: New Marker for Better Chemo Response in NSCLC?
Teaser: A small study suggests that expression of thymidine synthase could be a marker for better chemotherapy response, but a lung cancer expert is not convinced.

Headlines: Risk-Calculator Flaws Not Explained by Statin Use
Teaser: In an attempt to understand why the WHS cohort had a lower 10-year risk of ASCVD than that using the ACC/AHA risk calculator, researchers asked whether patients starting statins or undergoing revascularization moved the goalposts.

Headlines: 'Medical Food' Bests Ibuprofen in Chronic Low Back Pain
Teaser: Study showed theramine, an amino acid blend, alone or combined with ibuprofen is better than ibuprofen alone in patients with chronic low back pain.

Headlines: Financial Conflicts Tied to Influenza Drug Review Results
Teaser: Authors with financial conflicts of interest were more likely to favorably assess the effects of neuraminidase inhibitors than authors with no conflicts.

Headlines: Egg-Rich Diet Not Harmful in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A new Australian study explores the differences in lipid levels seen between type 2 diabetes patients randomized to a diet low in egg consumption (less     than 2 eggs per week) vs high (12 per week).

Headlines: Keys to 'Exceptional Responders' to Cancer Drugs Sought
Teaser: Researchers will use tumor DNA profiling to examine why anticancer drugs produce prolonged remission in some patients but not others.

Headlines: UK Cost Agency NICE Rejects Another Roche Cancer Drug
Teaser: Another new cancer drug from Roche, this time for treating leukaemia, has been rejected by Britain's healthcare cost-effectiveness agency NICE on the grounds that data about its value is uncertain.

Headlines: EU CHMP Completes Review of Ponatinib, Finalizes Warnings
Teaser: The European Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use has now recommended strengthening its warning for ponatinib.

Headlines: Sequencing Radium-223 and Docetaxel in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A prespecified analysis of the ALSYMPCA data suggests radium-223 can be used in sequence with docetaxel in metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

Headlines: Short TB Therapies Fail in Larger, Longer Trials
Teaser: Three phase 3 trials have suggested that shorter therapy with fluoroquinolones is not as good as standard therapy and highlight research issues in TB drug development.

Headlines: Long-Acting Anesthetic Effect Achieved With Neosaxitoxins
Teaser: The novel site 1 sodium channel blocker, which belongs to the class of paralytic shellfish toxins, significantly prolonged time to partial and complete recovery.

Headlines: Metastatic Cancer Neglected in New US Clinical Trial Group
Teaser: Cooperative clinical trial groups sponsored by the National Cancer Institute have been reorganized. Metastatic disease is largely left out of the largest group's research agenda.

Headlines: Could Exercise Help Preserve Beta Cells in Type 1 Diabetes?
Teaser: British scientists are proposing that clinical trials should examine the role of exercise to help preserve beta-cell function in type 1 diabetes.

Headlines: Atopic Dermatitis: Online Follow-up Effective
Teaser: Online care may be a partial cure for dermatologist shortages; a study has shown that online physician communication was just as effective as in-person office visits for atopic dermatitis.

Headlines: Systemic Estradiol Absorption Low With Vaginal Capsule
Teaser: In early studies, a solubilized estradiol capsule was associated with lower systemic absorption compared with the currently available tablet.

Headlines: Same Data, Contradictory HIV Guidelines
Teaser: Five sets of HIV treatment guidelines from expert organizations around the world have been issued or updated this year, but the recommendations are inconsistent.

Headlines: Wait on Radiation After Surgery for Glioblastoma
Teaser: Although delaying the start of adjuvant radiation therapy in other cancers may be detrimental, patients with glioblastoma multiforme may benefit from a 30- to 35-day hiatus after surgery, new data suggest.

Headlines: More Births on the Way After Uterus Transplant
Teaser: Two more women with uterine factor infertility, once considered untreatable, are now pregnant.

Headlines: Flu Drug Aimed at Ebola May Also Fight Norovirus, Study Finds
Teaser: An experimental Japanese flu drug that has hit the headlines because of its potential to fight Ebola may also work against norovirus, the winter vomiting bug, British researchers said.

Headlines: New Biologic for Psoriasis Gets FDA Panel Nod of Approval
Teaser: FDA advisory panel unanimously recommends secukinumab, a new biologic drug class, for the treatment of plaque psoriasis in adults.

Headlines: Chronic Fatigue: NIH Literature Review Faulted
Teaser: The draft document highlighted the difficulty in defining myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome and the dearth of good data, but some critics find bigger faults with the draft itself.

Headlines: Use of Unapproved Menopausal Hormone Therapy Skyrockets
Teaser: The use of compounded 'bioidentical' menopausal hormone therapy not approved by the FDA has surged since the 2001 publication of the Women's Health Initiative.

Headlines: First Dallas Nurse With Ebola to Be Transferred to NIH
Teaser: Nina Pham, the first nurse to be stricken by Ebola after caring for a patient in Dallas, Texas, who later died, is being transferred to the National Institutes of Health in Bethesda, Maryland.

Headlines: Advanced Lung Cancer Missed in Primary Care
Teaser: An analysis of more than 20,000 lung cancer cases in the United Kingdom shows that the diagnosis is being missed by primary care physicians.

Headlines: FDA Approves Two Drugs for Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
Teaser: The US Food and Drug Administration has approved nintedanib (Ofev) and pirfenidone (Esbriet) for the treatment of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

Headlines: Embryonic Stem Cells Improve Vision, Appear Safe at 22 Months
Teaser: Phase 1/2 studies conducted in the United States are the first to report the long-term safety and possible biological activity of human embryonic stem cell transplants in human disease.

Headlines: Striatal Imaging Biomarker May Show Early Huntington Disease
Teaser: A novel phosphodiesterase 10 striatal imaging biomarker may be able to identify individuals with early Huntington disease, according to a small pilot study.

Headlines: Adding CSF to Ipilimumab Improves Survival in Melanoma
Teaser: Adding the granulocyte macrophage colony stimulating factor (GM-CSF) sargramostim to the immunological improved both survival and toxicity.

Headlines: Drug Plus Cognitive Training May Help Manage Tinnitus
Teaser: Treatment with D-cycloserine plus computer-based cognitive training was associated with improvements in self-reported cognitive deficits in a pilot study in patients with tinnitus.

Headlines: What's Hot at the Liver Meeting 2014
Teaser: Nearly 10,000 hepatologists and hepatology health professionals are expected to attend the annual Liver Meeting, which returns to Boston, its home of many years.

Headlines: Survival Equally Excellent in AIS and MIA Lung Cancer
Teaser: The uniformly excellent survival rates of patients with early adenocarcinoma lung cancer questions the need to subclassify into two tumor types.

Headlines: Despite Label, Ospemifene Eases Multiple Menopause Symptoms
Teaser: Ospemifene is indicated for menopause-related dyspareunia, but it can relieve dryness as well. Still, some experts urge caution because it carries thrombotic risks similar to low-dose estrogen.

Headlines: Rheumatoid Arthritis: TNF Inhibitors Linked to Less Fatigue
Teaser: Patients with rheumatoid arthritis report substantial improvement of fatigue after beginning anti-tumor necrosis factor alpha therapy.

Headlines: Antiretroviral Combos With Emtricitabine Outdo Lamivudine
Teaser: First-line tenofovir-based antiretroviral regimens containing lamivudine are associated with a greater risk for virologic failure in HIV than those with emtricitabine, report Dutch investigators.

Headlines: Benefits of Aclidinium Persist to 1 Year for COPD
Teaser: The long-acting muscarinic receptor antagonist aclidinium bromide continued to be effective for up to 52 weeks, according to the ACCORD COPD II extension study.

Headlines: Graves' Orbitopathy: Double Vision Worse With Less Disease
Teaser: The counterintuitive findings mean that Graves' orbitopathy patients should be screened for restrictions in eye motility, which seems to correlate most     with double vision, say the researchers.

Headlines: Tiotropium Showing Promise in Pediatric Asthma
Teaser: A drug and device combination already approved for COPD and effective in adults with asthma could provide an option for children with refractory disease.

Headlines: PV-10 in Metastatic Melanoma: Rapid Responses Led to Phase 3
Teaser: The product is injected directly into cutaneous melanoma lesions, but also improves noninjected lesions by an immunologic effect.

Headlines: Muscle Activation Delayed in Peripheral Diabetic Neuropathy
Teaser: Delays in extensor muscle activation in patients with peripheral diabetic neuropathy may help explain increased risk of falling; resistance training may     help.

Headlines: Adult Asthma Linked to Higher Dementia Risk
Teaser: A new study points to a dose-response relationship, with more emergency department visits and hospital admissions raising the risks.

Headlines: Cord Blood Transplant: In Children, One Will Do
Teaser: A randomized study has shown that clinical outcomes for children receiving two units of cord blood are similar to those for children receiving one unit.

Headlines: 'MR CLEAN' Polishes Stroke Outcome With Endovascular Therapy
Teaser: Endovascular therapy on top of intravenous thrombolytic was safe and effective in improving functional outcomes in anterior circulation strokes, a study showed. Benefit occurred even for the oldest patients.

Headlines: Key Blood Chemistry Changes Seen After PFO Closure
Teaser: The findings suggest there's more to the risk for stroke associated with patent foramen ovale than simply allowing clots to pass to the brain.

Headlines: Platelet Activation Seen as Key to MI, Pneumonia Link
Teaser: Patients with community-acquired pneumonia showing MI soon after hospitalization had elevations in multiple platelet-activation markers. But were the MIs really due to thrombus-mediated ischemia?

Headlines: Cocoa Flavanols May Reverse Age-Related Memory Decline
Teaser: High levels of dietary cocoa flavanols boost activity in the dentate gyrus and may reverse age-related cognitive decline, say US scientists.

Headlines: Asthma Action Plan Improves Outcomes
Teaser: A web-based tool folds NHLBI guidelines into a personalized action plan, reducing emergency department visits, oral steroid use, and exacerbations.

Headlines: WHO Expects Around 200,000 Ebola Vaccine Doses by Mid-2015
Teaser: The World Health Organization (WHO) set out plans for speeding up development and deployment of experimental Ebola vaccines, saying hundreds of thousands of doses should be ready for use in West Africa by the middle of 2015.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Panel Views Intraocular Lens Favorably
Teaser: The FDA Ophthalmic Device Panel has voted nearly unanimously in favor of Alcon's combination product that corrects both presbyopia and astigmatism.

Headlines: Abusive Head Trauma Has Deep, Prolonged Effect on Children
Teaser: More than half of children with abusive head trauma die before age 21 years. Researchers say their findings call for more aggressive prevention strategies and more awareness of signs.

Headlines: PARAMEDIC: No Advantage for Mechanical vs Manual CPR
Teaser: Results of the PARAMEDIC trial show no advantage for mechanical compressions using the LUCAS-2 device vs manual CPR.

Headlines: Cholesterol Guidelines Still Stirring Debate 1 Year Later
Teaser: In a packed AHA session, two experts, including one who was on the new cholesterol guidelines writing committee, debated the relative merits of abandoning     LDL-cholesterol targets. One year on, the new guidelines are still causing a reaction among physicians.

Headlines: DAPT: Long-Term Dual Antiplatelets After Stenting a Risk/Benefit Balancing Act
Teaser: Four new studies, including the long-awaited Dual Antiplatelet Therapy study, have shown the question of optimal thienopyridine duration does not have  a "one-size-fits-all" answer.

Headlines: STOPAH: Only Steroid Reduces Alcoholic Hepatitis Death Risk
Teaser: In more than 1000 adults with severe alcoholic hepatitis, prednisolone was associated with a lower 28-day mortality rate; pentoxifylline offered no benefit.

Headlines: One Third of Ophthalmologists Join IRIS Registry
Teaser: With information on 10 million patient visits, the Intelligent Research in Sight (IRIS) database is expected to lead to improved care, faster clinical trials, and lower costs.

Headlines: No Clear Winner for Relief of Diabetic Neuropathy Pain
Teaser: Which is the best drug for painful diabetic neuropathy? A new systematic review has generated some interesting observations.

Headlines: FDA Addresses Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy Drug Delay
Teaser: The agency has requested additional data, pushing back the expected date for submission of the experimental drug eteplirsen, but recognizes the 'dire urgency of the situation.'

Headlines: High-Risk Plaque, Liver Disease Tied to Metabolic Syndrome
Teaser: Computed tomography can be used to image both high-risk plaque and nonalcoholic fatty liver disease, thereby facilitating analysis of their shared pathology.

Headlines: Immunotherapy for Metastatic Cancer Linked to Thyroid Disease
Teaser: Novel therapies for the treatment of metastatic malignancies show effects on thyroid function; closer monitoring of patients at risk is urged.

Headlines: After Hep C Cure, Companies Target Next Big Liver Disease Market
Teaser: Now that new medicines promise to cure millions of hepatitis C patients in coming years, drugmakers including Gilead Sciences Inc are turning their attention to other liver diseases.

Headlines: Guideline Emphasizes Prophylactic Platelet Transfusion
Teaser: Group urges judicious use of platelet transfusion to reduce patient risk and use resources wisely.

Headlines: AHA Sessions to Feature Long-Awaited Lipid, Stent Trials
Teaser: Expected are new insights into antiplatelet therapy with stents, LDL lowering, aspirin for primary prevention, and other topics, and more opportunities     than ever for interacting with presenters.

Headlines: Smoking Linked to Increased Risk for Second Cancers
Teaser: Patients with smoking-related primary cancers are at an increased risk of developing and dying from second smoking-related cancers.

Headlines: New Treatments, Guidelines, and the Microbiome at ACR 2014
Teaser: The American College of Rheumatology (ACR) meeting will feature cutting-edge research in ankylosing spondylitis, psoriatic arthritis, lupus, and the role of the microbiome in autoimmune diseases.

Headlines: RA: Patients in Remission Benefit From Etanercept Taper
Teaser: In patients with RA who achieve remission while taking etanercept and methotrexate, tapering the combination maintained remission better than methotrexate only or placebo.

Headlines: COX-2 Inhibitors Linked to Stroke Mortality
Teaser: New data show the previously reported increased risk for cardiovascular events with these pain meds includes increased stroke death; risk was driven by older drugs, such as etodolac and diclofenac.

Headlines: Do Patients With Diabetes Need to Fast for Lipid Tests?
Teaser: Increasing evidence suggests fasting for lipid tests may not be necessary and could be dangerous for some diabetes patients, but an overall shift away from     the practice will likely take time.

Headlines: Kidney Week Takes New Paths in Science and Medicine
Teaser: The American Society of Nephrology has a high-powered line-up of topics and clinical trial results, and the latest in patient management.

Headlines: USPSTF: No Evidence for Routine Vitamin D Screening
Teaser: The elusive target of an optimal level of vitamin D and lack of standardized screening tool cloud evidence needed to support a recommendation for routine     screening, says the USPSTF.

Headlines: Big Data in Oncology: Costly Fad or Invaluable Tool?
Teaser: Having more and more data on patients and their cancers will improve care, say advocates. But not all that dramatically, say critics.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Secukinumab, Apremilast for Psoriasis
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency committee has recommended secukinumab and apremilast for moderate to severe plaque psoriasis and apremilast for active psoriatic arthritis.

Headlines: IMPROVE-IT: 'Modest' Benefit With Ezetimibe in Post-ACS Patients
Teaser: UPDATED // It's taken 9 years to learn whether or not adding ezetimibe to statins provide any clinical benefit in post-ACS patients. The answer: yes, it does, but the     benefit is modest. What this means in the real world will likely be debated for many months to come.

Headlines: New Biomarker Predicts PARP Response in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: A new biomarker can predict which ovarian tumors will respond to PARP inhibition over and above tumors that express the BCRA1 and 2 mutation.

Headlines: In NEJM, Clues to Which Melanomas Respond to Immunotherapy
Teaser: When it works, immunotherapy such as ipilimumab can work extraordinarily well. New research provides insights into why some patients with metastatic melanoma respond to ipilimumab while others remain unresponsive.

Headlines: CKD: Exercise May Improve Pain, Physical Function
Teaser: Patients with  chronic kidney disease improved on fitness tests and quality-of-life measures after  completing a 12-week exercise program.

Headlines: GPs Have Many Misconceptions About Allergies
Teaser: General physicians who are not board-certified in allergy and immunology have knowledge gaps that need to be corrected for patient safety, report investigators.

Headlines: One in Five With Type 2 Diabetes Nonresponsive to Exercise
Teaser: The newly described phenomenon of "exercise resistance" appears to be an epigenetic phenomenon in which glycemia and body composition don't improve with exercise.

Headlines: Vitamin D Deficiency Predicts Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Another study supports a link between low vitamin D and increased risk for cognitive decline in aging adults.

Headlines: Why Are Drug Costs So High in the United States?
Teaser: Drug prices are higher in the United States than anywhere else in the world; many critics feel that it is not sustainable and it is time to change the status quo.

Headlines: Added Value of Biodegradable-Polymer DES Questioned
Teaser: Researchers said they saw no advantage against late stent thrombosis for the biodegradable-polymer Nobori stent. In a different study, the Synergy stent was noninferior to the Promus Prime DES.

Headlines: Trans Fat Linked to Worse Memory
Teaser: A new study finds an association between higher consumption of foods containing trans fats and reduced word memory in men of working age.

Headlines: AMD Model May Predict Progression
Teaser: A new statistical model, if validated in more research, may help ophthalmologists predict progression of age-related macular degeneration.

Headlines: Amoxicillin Adverse Effects Underreported, Underrecognized
Teaser: Data on adverse events are missing from many clinical trial publications, according to a new systematic review.

Headlines: Endocarditis Cases Rise After Predental Antibiotic Use Falls
Teaser: A UK study today reports a sharp increase in the cases of endocarditis in the 5 years following the 2008 guidance that recommended stopping prophylaxis     prior to dental surgery. But this should not alter practice, they caution.

Headlines: Laws Spreading That Allow Terminal Patients Access to Experimental Drugs
Teaser: Earlier this month, Arizona voters approved a referendum that allows terminally ill patients to receive experimental drugs and devices. It’s the fifth state to approve a “right-to-try” law this year.

Headlines: HDL Functionality Inversely Linked With CVD Events
Teaser: The findings, say researchers, support "retiring" the HDL-cholesterol hypothesis--the idea of raising HDL cholesterol to reduce the risk of cardiovascular     disease--to focus on measures of HDL function.

Headlines: ODYSSEY ALTERNATIVE: PCSK9 Inhibitor for Statin Intolerance
Teaser: Many patients in the small trial who had been "statin-intolerant" managed to stay on low-dose atorvastatin; for those who can't, alirocumab could prove to     be a good alternative, it suggested.

Headlines: ASCO Calls for Medicaid Reform in Cancer Care
Teaser: Many low-income Americans are not receiving quality cancer care even with Medicaid, and many more remain completely uninsured.

Headlines: Dextromethorphan/Quinidine Combo Controls PBA in Dementia
Teaser: A preparation of dextromethorphan and quinidine reduced the frequency of pseudobulbar affect (uncontrollable episodes of laughing or crying) in patients with dementia, a study shows.

Headlines: New Data Released on Tofacitinib in Unexpected Pregnancy
Teaser: The recommendation that women avoid pregnancy while on the oral Janus kinase inhibitor stands, but it isn't all bad news for those who have an unplanned pregnancy.

Headlines: Ipilimumab in Uveal Melanoma: Long-Lasting Responses in 25%
Teaser: The first trial of ipilimumab in patients with uveal melanoma has shown some long-lasting responses in a patient population with poor prognosis.

Headlines: CT Contrast Agent Does Not Increase Risk for Kidney Injury
Teaser: A CT contrast agent was unrelated to nephropathy, dialysis, or death, even among those with poor renal function or predisposing comorbidities.

Headlines: Statins Do Not Reduce Fracture Risk: JUPITER Analysis
Teaser: In JUPITER, investigators included fracture as a prespecified secondary end point to determine whether the LDL-lowering drugs reduced the risk of incident     bone breaks of all types.

Headlines: Corrected: Benign Paroxysmal Positional Vertigo, Seasonal Vitamin D Changes
Teaser: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV) is more common during seasons when vitamin D levels are low, according to new research.

Headlines: Oral Resveratrol Stabilizes Amyloid in Alzheimer's
Teaser: Oral resveratrol and its metabolites penetrate the central nervous system and affect a biomarker of Alzheimer's disease in mild to moderate disease, a phase 2 study has shown.

Headlines: FDA Panel Warns Against Certain Back Pain Injections
Teaser: Because of possibly catastrophic neurological risks, an FDA committee has recommended contraindication of particulate corticosteroid injections in the cervical spine, using a transforaminal approach.

Headlines: Most Dementia Patients Never Screened
Teaser: Evaluations can identify reversible factors that contribute to cognitive decline and lead to improved quality of care, researchers say.

Headlines: Aspirin Often Used Needlessly With OACs in AF: SPRINT-AF
Teaser: Researchers warn that low-dose aspirin is not a benign drug, with an underappreciated risk of bleeding, so only patients with an indication should be         taking it.

Headlines: FDA Approves Software for Noninvasive Cardio Studies
Teaser: The program identifies coronary artery blockages by calculating fractional flow reserve based on CT scans of a patient's heart, all without cardiac catheterization.

Headlines: Immunotherapy: Extending Its Reach, Predicting Responses
Teaser: Immunotherapy with checkpoint inhibitors has already made an impact on oncology, but how to predict which patients respond remains a big issue.

Headlines: Beta-Blocker, ARB Similarly Protective of Aorta in Marfan's
Teaser: There was no placebo in the trial that saw similar aortic-root dimension changes from treatment with atenolol or losartan. If standard therapy with         atenolol helped, perhaps losartan did too?

Headlines: High Price Tag for Cologuard Confirmed, but Test Is Welcomed
Teaser: The first stool DNA test for colorectal cancer has its high price tag confirmed, but experts argue that it is worth using if it increases screening rates.

Headlines: Hyperbaric Oxygen No Better Than Sham After Concussion
Teaser: A study of military service members has shown that both hyperbaric oxygen and sham air compression improved postconcussion symptoms, possibly because of a strong placebo effect.

Headlines: What's Hot at 2014 San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium?
Teaser: The largest meeting on breast cancer in the world always has breaking news, and symposium cochairs give a hint of what is to come this year.

Headlines: JCO Withdraws Editorial on Cetuximab for Metastatic CRC
Teaser: The editorial critiqued the negative findings of a major clinical trial and discouraged clinicians from following the trial investigators' conclusion.

Headlines: Antiviral Sensitizes HPV Cervical Cancer to Chemoradiation
Teaser: An antiviral agent shown to enhance sensitization to chemoradiation in HPV-expressing tumor cell lines in the laboratory may translate into clinical benefit in patients with HPV-related cervical cancer.

Headlines: What's Hot at 2014 ASH
Teaser: Some studies with immediate clinical implications and others that offer hope for the future will be unveiled at the annual meeting of the American Society of Hematology.

Headlines: HIV: Earlier Therapy May Be Better
Teaser: Initiating antiretroviral therapy for patients with HIV on the basis of time, rather than CD4+ counts, could help more patients achieve immunologic normalization.

Headlines: No Benefit From Ultrasound Screening in Dense Breasts
Teaser: Supplemental ultrasound screening for women with dense breasts on mammography has few benefits and high costs.

Headlines: FDA Okays Aripiprazole for Acute Schizophrenia Relapse
Teaser: The FDA has approved a labeling update for the long-acting injectable antipsychotic aripiprazole.

Headlines: First Top-flight Evidence of TKI Benefit in AML
Teaser: The first evidence from a randomized trial shows a clinical benefit for younger patients with AML when sorafenib is added to a standard therapeutic regimen.

Headlines: Epithelial Ultrastructure Altered in Eosinophilic Esophagitis
Teaser: Patients with active eosinophilic esophagitis (EoE) have changes in their epithelial ultrastructure that return to normal after treatment, new findings show.

Headlines: Practice-Changing Study in HIV-Related Lymphoma
Teaser: Patients with HIV infection and lymphoma have been considered unsuitable for stem cell transplantation because of immunosuppression. A new study rewrites that script.

Headlines: First-Time Finding in Posttransplant Hodgkin Lymphoma
Teaser: In high-risk Hodgkin lymphoma patients, the ADC drug brentuximab vedotin extended progression-free survival following transplantation.

Headlines: 'Unprecedented Results' in Relapsed Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: Adding carfilzomib to standard therapy improved progression-free survival in patients with relapsed disease, and may be a new standard of care.

Headlines: What's Hot at American Epilepsy Society 2014
Teaser: Medical marijuana, SUDEP, and generic equivalents and are just some of the topics neurologists and others are expected to discuss at the American Epilepsy Society annual meeting.

Headlines: New Eating Disorder Guidelines Released
Teaser: The first eating disorder guidelines to incorporate DSM-5 diagnostic criteria have been released.

Headlines: Novel Oligosaccharide Shows Benefits in Alzheimer's
Teaser: Oligomannurarate binds multiple regions of amyloid-beta and is associated with clinical improvement in mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease, as well as changes in biomarkers.

Headlines: EU Green Light for Liraglutide in Diabetes With Renal Disease
Teaser: Drugs for type 2 diabetes that can be used without dose adjustment in patients who also have kidney disease are few and far between. But trials are being     conducted, and one new option has emerged.

Headlines: Gene Testing in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: Deleterious gene mutations are found in a large proportion of triple-negative breast cancer patients, emphasizing the importance of gene testing in this patient population.

Headlines: First Drug for Polycythemia Vera Approved by FDA
Teaser: Ruxolitinib has become the first drug for polycythemia vera to be approved by the FDA; the drug is already marketed for use in myelofibrosis, another bone marrow disorder.

Headlines: Selective Laser Trabeculoplasty for Primary Angle-Closure Glaucoma
Teaser: Selective laser trabeculoplasty (SLT) is effective in the short term for treating primary angle-closure glaucoma (PACG), although complete success is more common with prostaglandin analog, a new clinical trial shows.

Headlines: Antacids May Help Improve Outcomes in Head and Neck Cancer
Teaser: Validation is needed, but a new study shows that histamine-2 receptor antagonists and proton-pump inhibitors improved overall survival in patients with head and neck cancer.

Headlines: Wide Variation in Hospital Bleeding Rates Post-PCI
Teaser: Investigators suggest bleeding complications following PCI should be used as a performance measure at hospitals.

Headlines: NCCN Updates Prostate Cancer Guidelines
Teaser: There are major changes in imaging, molecular testing, and the systemic treatment of castration-resistant disease.

Headlines: Study Supports Multiple Lesion-Directed Biopsies at Colposcopy
Teaser: Taking multiple directed biopsies during colposcopy increases detection of high-grade squamous intraepithelial lesions (HSILs), precursors to cervical cancer, new research shows.

Headlines: Colon Neoplasia More Common in UC-PSC Than Crohn's-PSC
Teaser: Patients with primary sclerosing cholangitis (PSC) and ulcerative colitis (UC) may have a more severe disease course and a greater risk of colon neoplasia and colectomy, than patients with PSC and Crohn's disease (CD), new findings suggest.

Headlines: CDC: Advise Hetero Men, Boys, on HIV Benefit of Circumcision
Teaser: Proposed guidance for clinicians states that the procedure evidently reduces the risk for HIV infection in heterosexual males, but not for men having sex with men.

Headlines: CRP Levels Tied to Statin Effects on Contrast Nephropathy
Teaser: C-reactive protein levels could potentially help identify patients at elevated risk of acute kidney injury related to contrast medium who might benefit from statin protection, researchers say.

Headlines: NIH Shutters the National Children's Study
Teaser: Problems with study design, management, and cost doomed the study, which would have tracked 100,000 children from birth to adulthood.

Headlines: Low GI May Not Add Cardiovascular Benefit to Low-Carb Diet
Teaser: In overweight adults without diabetes, adding the concept of glycemic index to an already-healthy low-carb diet is probably overkill and doesn't provide     further gains, a new study indicates.

Headlines: Bleeding Risk Climbs With Anticoagulant Bridging in AF
Teaser: To bridge or not to bridge? That is the question invoked frequently in clinical practice; another analysis argues against the practice. Upcoming trials could nail down the answer.

Headlines: Everolimus Does Not Overcome Trastuzumab Resistance
Teaser: Inhibiting the PI3K/mTOR pathway did not improve progression-free survival when added to chemotherapy and trastuzumab in women with advanced breast cancer.

Headlines: LMWH Best for VTEs in Cancer, But There's a Catch in US
Teaser: The largest study of its kind found that LMWH was better than warfarin at preventing a recurrence of blood clots in cancer patients. Does the margin of improvement justify the greater cost?

Headlines: Social Media Potentially Addictive, Linked to Substance Abuse
Teaser: A survey of university undergraduates suggests that excessive social media use can be addictive and is linked to substance abuse and problems with emotion regulation and impulse control.

Headlines: DCIS Test Identifies Patients With Low Recurrence Risk
Teaser: A new Oncotype test identifies patients with ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) who are at low risk for recurrence and for the development of invasive breast cancer.

Headlines: Fulvestrant Survival Advantage in Advanced Breast Cancer
Teaser: New survival data from the FIRST trial show a survival advantage for the injectable fulvestrant over the standard of care, oral anastrozole.

Headlines: Stem Cell Therapy May Someday Replace Corneal Transplants
Teaser: Mesenchymal stem cells from human limbus regenerated the stroma of corneas in mice, providing a possible autologous alternative to cornea transplants.

Headlines: IBD Treatment Varies Widely Across Major US Referral Centers
Teaser: The treatment of patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) varies widely across major U.S. referral centers, according to a new study.

Headlines: New Algorithm for Treatment of Premenopausal Breast Cancer
Teaser: Results from the Suppression of Ovarian Function Trial (SOFT) are practice changing for a subgroup of premenopausal women with breast cancer.

Headlines: Immunotherapy for GI Cancers: 'More Work to Be Done'
Teaser: Among the new approaches under development are approaches that convert   nonimmunogenic tumors so that they respond to immune-based therapies.

Headlines: Ebola Vaccine Trial Halted Temporarily After Joint Pains
Teaser: A clinical trial of an Ebola vaccine developed by Merck and NewLink has been halted temporarily as a precautionary measure after four patients complained of joint pains, the University of Geneva Hospital said.

Headlines: Bevacizumab Works in Triple-Negative Breast Cancer Subtype
Teaser: New results could reignite interest in the use of bevacizumab in breast cancer, especially in a subtype of triple-negative disease.

Headlines: Progesterone Fails in Traumatic Brain Injury
Teaser: The negative results of two large phase 3 trials dash hopes that neuroprotective progesterone could improve functional outcomes in acute TBI.

Headlines: Pain Med Linked to Hypoglycemia
Teaser: Tramadol, an opioid analgesic, was associated with an increased risk for hospitalization for hypoglycemia, especially in the first month of use, in a new study.

Headlines: Just-Approved Gardasil 9 Packs More HPV/Cancer Protection
Teaser: The new vaccine covers nine types of human papillomavirus, five more than the original Gardasil.

Headlines: Breast Cancer With High TIL Levels: Skip the Trastuzumab?
Teaser: A provocative study suggests that HER2 breast cancer patients with high levels of stromal tumor infiltrating lymphocytes may not need trastuzumab (Herceptin).

Headlines: Exotropia: Patching, Observation Both Effective
Teaser: Children aged 3 to 10 years with intermittent exotropia saw little deterioration in their condition after 6 months, whether treated with part-time patching or observation.

Headlines: PsA: Skin, Synovium Gene Expression Tied to Drug Response
Teaser: Comparison of skin and synovial fluid global gene expression in psoriatic arthritis correlated with drug responses.
