Headlines: Entecavir Lowers HBV Reactivation Risk Better Than Lamivudine
Teaser: A new randomized trial has suggested that entecavir is better than lamivudine for preventing HBV reactivation and HBV-related hepatitis in patients with non-Hodgkin lymphoma who are receiving R-CHOP.

Headlines: Hypertension Adds to Genetic Risk in Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: For those carrying the APOE ε4 gene, hypertension increases the risk for brain amyloid accumulation in Alzheimer's disease and in cognitively normal adults over 70.

Headlines: Long-term Treatment of Gout Is Suboptimal
Teaser: Too few eligible patients receive the currently recommended urate-lowering therapy, a new study finds.

Headlines: Glaucoma Drug Shows Visual Preservation Over 2 Years
Teaser: Glaucoma drug trial shows effectiveness in a relatively short amount of time.

Headlines: Experimental Drug May Stop Vascular Leak in Ebola
Teaser: FX06, an experimental drug shown in animal studies to reduce dengue hemorrhagic shock, may improve vascular leak syndrome in Ebola, according to a case study.

Headlines: FDA Approves Liraglutide (Saxenda) for Weight Loss
Teaser: At a higher dose than used for diabetes, liraglutide now becomes the fifth drug available in the United States for treating obesity.

Headlines: Achillion Data Shows Promise of Shorter Hep C Treatment
Teaser: Data from Achillion Pharmaceuticals Inc's hepatitis C drug trials showed the company could develop a shorter-duration treatment rivaling offerings from Gilead Sciences Inc and Abbvie Inc.

Headlines: PsA: TNF Inhibitors May Reduce Disease Activity Long-term
Teaser: More than two thirds of patients with psoriatic arthritis who were receiving tumor necrosis factor alpha blockers  achieved a state of minimal disease activity in a recent study.

Headlines: Acute Cardiac Care Doesn’t Suffer During AHA, ACC Sessions
Teaser: Are the big US cardiology meetings good for patient care in unexpected ways? Less PCI while doctors are away doesn’t raise 30-day mortality, so is PCI overused? Some say maybe, others say no.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nivolumab (Opdivo) for Advanced Melanoma
Teaser: The FDA has granted a highly anticipated accelerated approval to the PD-1 inhibitor nivolumab for advanced melanoma.

Headlines: 'NEDA' Measure Predicts MS Disability
Teaser: A tool measuring disease activity -- 'no evidence of disease activity' or NEDA --may be moved to the bedside where doctors can use it to individualize care for patients with multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: Hypoglycemia Predicts CV Events in Type 1 and 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Hypoglycemia does not portend well when it comes to the risk for cardiovascular events and death in both type 1 and type 2 diabetes, according to a new     study in a contemporary patient population.

Headlines: Friend or Foe: The Great e-Cigarette Debate
Teaser: Are e-cigarettes a welcome addition to the smoking cessation armamentarium or are they gateway devices to smoking with potentially serious hidden health concerns?

Headlines: FDA Approves Viekira Pak for Hepatitis C
Teaser: Depending on its price, the new combo drug could give physicians and patients a less expensive alternative to Sovaldi and Harvoni.

Headlines: FDA Approves Olaparib (Lynparza) for BRCA Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: The approval follows a resubmission of new data after an advisory committee recommended against approval earlier this year.

Headlines: AD Diagnosis Not Swayed by Belief in Amyloid Hypothesis
Teaser: Dementia experts would use amyloid PET scan data in diagnosing Alzheimer's, regardless of whether they believe amyloid caused the disease, a study shows.

Headlines: 87% Complete Remission Rate With Nilotinib in ALL
Teaser: Low-intensity chemotherapy plus nilotinib was highly effective in older patients, and might be an alternative to stem cell transplantation.

Headlines: Endovascular Stroke Therapy Proven at Last: MR CLEAN Published
Teaser: The first trial  to show benefit on functional outcomes of an intra-arterial interventional approach for stroke vs the current standard of care has been published to wide acclaim from experts.

Headlines: Solutions Needed to Stem Cancer Costs, ASH Experts Say
Teaser: Cancer cost is rising, especially for new drugs, and solutions are needed to stem the tide while offering quality care to patients.

Headlines: Statin Benefits Similar in Women, Men at Equal Risk
Teaser: A combined analysis of patient-level data from "all of the large statin trials" should alleviate concerns that women don't benefit from statins nearly as much as men, according to a leading researcher in the field.

Headlines: Saxagliptin: A Therapy Option in Diabetes and Renal Failure
Teaser: The largest-ever trial to examine use of a diabetes medicine in patients with renal failure has published its findings. Other megatrials in this     population, which is challenging to treat, are ongoing.

Headlines: Misguided Aspirin Use in 1 in 10 Heart-Clinic Patients
Teaser: Clinicians "should get into the habit of calculating 10-year CVD risk and then having a discussion with the patient as to risk vs benefit," before considering aspirin, a researcher said.

Headlines: FDA Clears Enteral Suspension (Duopa) for Parkinson's
Teaser: Duopa (AbbVie) enteral suspension is given via a portable infusion pump that delivers carbidopa and levodopa into the small intestine for 16 hours to reduce motor fluctuations.

Headlines: Biogen Experimental Drug Shows Evidence of Optic Nerve Repair
Teaser: An experimental drug from Biogen Idec Inc showed evidence of biological repair of the optic nerve in a mid-stage study in patients with acute optic neuritis, an inflammation of the optic nerve that can lead to vision loss.

Headlines: New Cancer Diagnosis Linked to Increased Stroke Risk
Teaser: A diagnosis of cancer -- particularly lung, pancreatic, or colorectal cancer -- is associated with an increased short-term risk for stroke, a new study suggests.

Headlines: FDA Okays Carbidopa/Levodopa ER (Rytary) in Parkinson's
Teaser: Approval of the extended-release carbidopa-levodopa formulation was based on positive results in a trio of phase 3 studies of patients with early and advanced PD.

Headlines: e-Cigarettes Need Research and Regulation, Say AACR and ASCO
Teaser: In a joint policy statement, AACR and ASCO have called for further research and more stringent federal and state regulations regarding the use and sale of electronic nicotine delivery systems

Headlines: New Type of Antibiotic May Be Less Prone to Resistance
Teaser: A novel antimicrobial compound effectively kills gram-positive bacteria, but showed no evidence of resistance in animal tests.

Headlines: Molecular 15-Minute Flu Test Cleared for Physician Offices
Teaser: The nucleic acid-based test, more accurate than older rapid influenza tests, had been limited to certain kinds of laboratories. The FDA expects to approve more such molecular tests for medical-office use.

Headlines: FDA Okays MRI Contrast Agent (Gadavist) in Infants
Teaser: The gadolinium-based contrast agent gadobutrol (Gadavist, Bayer Healthcare) is the first approved for children under 2 years of age.

Headlines: CABG Costs More Than PCI but Is a 'Reasonable Value'
Teaser: CABG for stable multivessel disease has a greater cost than PCI, both during the index hospitalization and over the patient's lifetime, but given the     better outcomes with surgery, it is a cost-effective revascularization strategy, say investigators.

Headlines: Israel's BrainStorm Says Stem Cell Drug Benefits Most Patients in ALS Trial
Teaser: Israel's BrainStorm Cell Therapeutics said final results from a clinical trial of its adult stem cell treatment in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS) were positive, with most patients showing a slowing in the disease's progression.

Headlines: Maternal Depression Linked to Risky Behavior in Kids
Teaser: Children of mothers with depression are at significantly increased risk of engaging in delinquent behaviors and substance abuse in adolescence.

Headlines: Higher-Dose Vancomycin Ups Risk for Pediatric Kidney Damage
Teaser: Clinical trials in children are needed to establish dosing guidelines not extrapolated from those for adults.

Headlines: Anti-TNF Best at Preventing Postsurgery Relapse in Crohn's
Teaser: Anti-TNF appears to be more effective than mesalamine, antibiotics, and budesonide.

Headlines: Biomarkers Stratify Patients With Acute Graft-Versus-Host Disease
Teaser: A score based on three biomarkers can classify patients with acute graft-versus-host disease (GVHD) into clinically meaningful risk strata, according to research from the Blood and Marrow Transplant (BMT) Clinical Trials Network.

Headlines: Denosumab an Effective Alternative to Bisphosphonates
Teaser: Physicians should consider the monoclonal antibody denosumab as an effective alternative osteoporosis treatment for postmenopausal women who find it difficult to adhere to oral bisphosphonates, new research shows.

Headlines: Barrett's Esophagus: First-line Endoscopic Therapy Validated
Teaser: Six-year results from a 500-patient UK registry have confirmed the value of first-line endoscopic mucosal resection before radiofrequency ablation for Barrett's esophagus-related neoplasia.

Headlines: Stem Cell Transplants May Halt MS Progression
Teaser: High-dose immunosuppressive therapy plus autologous hematopoietic cell transplant can induce sustained remission in patients with MS, interim data suggest.

Headlines: Dalcetrapib Benefits Genetic Subgroup of ACS Patients: Analysis
Teaser: The researchers say the results open the door for a prospective genetic-based clinical trial     testing the CETP inhibitor in appropriate patients.

Headlines: Sunitinib Active in Advanced Thymic Carcinoma
Teaser: Sunitinib is active in advanced thymic carcinoma, concludes the first clinical trial of the drug in heavily pretreated patients.

Headlines: ASCO: 'High-Risk' Project 'Must Be Done'
Teaser: The organization has been claiming that CancerLinQ will revolutionize cancer care for months. Now they have a technology partner to help them.

Headlines: New Eye Scan Predicts Peripheral Neuropathy in Diabetes
Teaser: Could corneal confocal microscopy represent a new technique for predicting peripheral diabetic neuropathy? The data suggest so, but there are still some     hurdles to overcome.

Headlines: FDA Approval of 'Novel' New Drugs Up Sharply in 2014
Teaser: The agency credits last year's higher output to various programs designed to speed much needed drugs to market.

Headlines: Palbociclib for Breast Cancer Inches Toward FDA Approval
Teaser: Palbociclib, the first CDK 4/6 inhibitor, has shown a doubling of progression-free survival in postmenopausal women with ER-positive, HER2-negative advanced-stage breast cancer.

Headlines: New AHS Review of Acute Migraine Treatments
Teaser: The assessment, which will form the basis of new US clinical practice guidelines, represents the first update to treatment recommendations in 15 years.

Headlines: Obama Pushes Genomic Research in State of Union Speech
Teaser: "I want the country that eliminated polio and mapped the human genome to lead a new era of medicine ," the president said.

Headlines: Oxytocin May Help Frontotemporal Dementia
Teaser: Intranasal oxytocin given twice daily for 1 week showed preliminary signs of improvement in apathy and loss of empathy in patients with frontotemporal dementia.

Headlines: Clinical Cancer Advances in 2014: CLL Is the Winner
Teaser: This year in its annual review of clinical cancer advances, the American Society of Clinical Oncology has, for the first time, announced a winner.

Headlines: Tapentadol Toxicity in Children
Teaser: Most pediatric patients exposed to this novel analgesic (Nucynta) had no major effects, but there were 2 cases with life-threatening events, poison center reports show.

Headlines: Novel MET Inhibitor Elicits 'Dramatic Response' in GI Cancer
Teaser: In a subset of patients, more than half achieved a response to investigational agent AMG337, in an early-phase study.

Headlines: Hepatitis C: Value of Expanded Screening Unclear
Teaser: Expanded HCV screening in large birth cohorts has been endorsed as cost-effective by some experts, but others have cautioned that screening could do more harm than good.

Headlines: New Test IDs Early-Stage Melanoma With Metastatic Risk
Teaser: A 28-gene signature could help identify patients with stage I or II melanoma who are at risk for future metastases.

Headlines: Testosterone to Treat Castration-Resistant Prostate Cancer?
Teaser: A pilot study has shown that pharmacologic doses of testosterone along with etoposide can reduce PSA levels and shrink tumors in some men with asymptomatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

Headlines: TAVR Benefit, Risk Information Deficient on Most Hospital Websites
Teaser: Patients may have unrealistic expectations of the transcatheter procedure from only the website promotions, researchers say, so it's all the more important for cardiologists to offer a balanced view.

Headlines: Novel Triglyceride Oil May Treat Huntington's
Teaser: The oil is thought to replace key intermediates needed for cellular energy production, which may be deficient in Huntington's disease.

Headlines: Research Investment Down in United States, Up Globally
Teaser: The percentage of funding coming from the United States has dropped from 57% to 44% in recent years. Meanwhile, China tripled its investment. Experts make a plea for alternative funding streams.

Headlines: Plaque Types Aid in Identifying Ischemic Lesions
Teaser: A new study suggests the type of atherosclerotic plaque might provide additional information beyond the degree of coronary stenosis. Investigators describe adverse plaque characteristics associated with ischemia-causing lesions.

Headlines: Ethnic Differences in Breast Cancer Survival Due to Biology
Teaser: The variation in breast cancer survival by ethnic group can largely be attributed to intrinsic tumor biology, a new study has concluded.

Headlines: FDA Okays Vyvanse for Binge Eating Disorder
Teaser: The FDA announced it has expanded the use of a drug approved for ADHD to treat binge eating disorder.

Headlines: Darunavir/Cobicistat (Prezcobix) Combo Pill Clears FDA
Teaser: The fixed-dose combination of the antiretroviral drug darunavir (800 mg) and the pharmacokinetic enhancer cobicistat (150 mg) is for adults with HIV-1 infection and no darunavir resistance mutations.

Headlines: Isolated Systolic Hypertension in Young Adults Ups CVD Risk
Teaser: In younger and middle-aged adults, isolated systolic hypertension is not "benign," as many may have thought until now, new research shows.

Headlines: Novel Technique Might Enhance Radioguided Surgery
Teaser: A novel tool for radioguided neurosurgery might improve identification of  residual cancer cells and has lower radiation exposure for patients and surgeons.

Headlines: 'Practice Changing' MRI Recommendations in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: New recommendations on the use of MRI in the management of multiple myeloma and related disorders are practice changing for one set of patients.

Headlines: Consent for Biobank Donations High in US Survey
Teaser: Donors want the simple courtesy of knowing how their tissues are being used, says the author of 'The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks.'

Headlines: Chondroitin-Glucosamine Reduced Pain in Knee Arthritis in RCT
Teaser: A chondroitin sulfate/glucosamine product provided as much relief as celecoxib for patients with moderate to severe knee OA pain in a randomized trial, but some experts were unconvinced.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Timeline: Quiet 100 Years and Then Boom
Teaser: A timeline of developments in the treatment of breast cancer reveals great change in the past 20 to 30 years, according to two experts.

Headlines: Chest Pain, MI Rule-Out? More Noninvasive Testing Unhelpful
Teaser: A study questions the value of a continued predischarge search for ischemia by coronary CT or stress testing in such patients already cleared by ECG and biomarkers.

Headlines: Plan Fails to Cut Ventilator Use in Critically Ill Children
Teaser: Although a sedation protocol resulted in some improvements, the primary outcome of reduced time on mechanical ventilation was not met in a large multicenter trial.

Headlines: Clopidogrel-PPI Interaction Questioned in Meta-analysis
Teaser: Randomized trials say no such interaction exists but observational studies suggest otherwise, concludes a new analysis. But are the observational studies "hopelessly confounded," as an expert insists?

Headlines: Docs 'Astonished': ED Drugs Tied to Prostate Cancer Return
Teaser: The erectile dysfunction (ED) drugs often used after radical prostatectomy might increase the rate of the cancer's biochemical recurrence.

Headlines: COPD: Multiple Measures Needed to Avoid Overdiagnosis
Teaser: Patients with a low forced expiratory volume in 1 second/forced vital capacity and a low forced expiratory volume in 1 second may be at higher risk for adverse outcomes, according to a large study.

Headlines: Morphine Unsafe for Some Children After Tonsillectomy
Teaser: Ibuprofen in combination with acetaminophen is safe and  effective analgesia for children after tonsillectomy.

Headlines: FDA Approves Triferic for Iron Replacement in Dialysis
Teaser: The agency, however, did not require the postapproval studies on the agent's extended use that an FDA advisory committee had recommended.

Headlines: Elevated 'Lipid-Years' in Young Adulthood Tied to Later CHD
Teaser: Like pack-years of smoking, "lipid-years" of exposure to high cholesterol is another independent risk factor for CAD in later life, an expert says, based     on new research.

Headlines: Robert Califf Named FDA Deputy Commissioner
Teaser: Robert Califf, long affiliated with Duke University, will leave Durham, NC, for Washington, DC, where he will serve in a senior leadership role within the     FDA.

Headlines: Suspend Dozens of Drugs Based on Flawed Studies, EMA Says
Teaser: The drugs recommended for suspension in the EU are commonly prescribed generics. The firm providing the problematic data also figures into drugs approved by the FDA, which as not yet taken action.

Headlines: Seniors Commonly Mix Alcohol With Meds
Teaser: Although many US adults of all ages put themselves at risk by mixing drugs and alcohol, this dangerous practice is especially prevalent in the elderly.

Headlines: Complete Mesocolic Surgery Improves Outcomes in Colon Cancer
Teaser: Complete mesocolic excision, a new way of performing surgery in patients with stage I-III colon cancer, is shown to improve disease-free survival. So why are we waiting?

Headlines: Raising Systolic BP Target May Hike Stroke Risk
Teaser: New observational data show raising the recommended SBP threshold from 140 to 150 mmHg in JNC 8 may lead to more strokes, especially for minorities.

Headlines: No Association Between Metformin Use and Lung Cancer
Teaser: Outcomes differed by smoking history and tumor type, however, although these findings were not significant. More research is needed before any firm     conclusions can be drawn, say the researchers.

Headlines: Do Societies Play It Too Safe With Choosing Wisely Lists?
Teaser: Low-value items on CW lists  may divert attention from procedures that truly drive up costs, experts say. The ABIM Foundation chief says singling out one test ignores the CW program's overall benefit.

Headlines: Lenvatinib Highly Beneficial in Advanced Thyroid Cancer
Teaser: The investigational agent lenvatinib significantly increased progression-free survival and response rates in patients with iodine-131 refractory thyroid cancer in a phase 3 trial.

Headlines: New Wave of Drugs Poised to Shake up Glaucoma Treatment
Teaser: For the first time in 20 years, patients suffering from the eye disease glaucoma may soon have new treatments as several young companies look to shake up the $5.6 billion global market

Headlines: Blood Cancer Drugs May Offer 'Reasonable Value for Money'
Teaser: Despite the outcry over the high cost of many of the new drugs, a new analysis suggests that they 'may provide reasonable value for money.'

Headlines: What's Hot at ISC 2015?
Teaser: An eagerly awaited array of endovascular trials crowd the program this year, and, if positive, could mean a sea change for acute stroke treatment.

Headlines: Axitinib Shown to Be Active in Resistant CML and B-ALL
Teaser: Axitinib, a VEGFR inhibitor used in the treatment of kidney cancer, has surprisingly now shown activity in certain hematologic malignancies.

Headlines: Web-Based Diabetes Tool Helps Latino Patients Meet A1c Targets
Teaser: In low-income, urban Latino patients with type 2 diabetes and poorly controlled glycemia, HbA1c levels improved and patients were less distressed when     educators used a "diabetes dashboard."

Headlines: Danish Study: No Excess Pancreatitis Risk in Incretin Users
Teaser: Researchers found that users of all diabetes drug classes had elevated pancreatitis rates, which became nonsignificant after adjustment for confounders.

Headlines: Eight Specific Signs of Impending Death in Cancer Patients
Teaser: A study of cancer patients has identified eight clinical signs predictive of death within 3 days, which could help decisions about comfort care.

Headlines: One in 12 Pediatric Emergency Visits Related to Medications
Teaser: Medication-related issues were to blame for 1 in 12 pediatric visits to the emergency department in a recent study; 65% of the visits were potentially preventable.

Headlines: Patient Voices Essential, as Docs Underreport Toxicities
Teaser: The voices of cancer patients are essential when it comes to reporting toxic effects in clinical trials because physicians tend to under-report.

Headlines: Coronary Sinus 'Stent' Improves Angina in Small Trial
Teaser: It's a stent that narrows, not widens, raising coronary sinus pressure and maybe boosting myocardial perfusion. Experts praise the study's sham control but stress the approach is far from proven.

Headlines: FDA to Simplify 'Compassionate Use' Drug Applications
Teaser: A form that once took as many as 100 hours to complete would take 45 minutes under an FDA proposal to speed unapproved, investigational drugs to patients with life-threatening conditions.

Headlines: Early Menopause Linked to Chemical Exposure in Women
Teaser: Women with the highest levels of endocrine-disrupting chemicals found in a wide variety of household and personal-care products enter menopause earlier     than those with lower levels.

Headlines: Novel Drug Approved for Breast Cancer: Palbociclib (Ibrance)
Teaser: A new drug for breast cancer with a novel mechanism of action was granted accelerated approval by the FDA two months ahead of schedule.

Headlines: Troponin-T Levels Predict New AF in Large Cohort Study
Teaser: Levels of the biomarker may highlight a remodeling process in the genesis of some AF independently of traditional AF risk factors.

Headlines: U.S. Proposes Effort to Analyze DNA From 1 Million People
Teaser: The United States has proposed analyzing genetic information from more than 1 million American volunteers as part of a new initiative to understand human disease and develop medicines targeted to an individual's genetic make-up.

Headlines: Head CT Scans May Be Overused in Emergency Departments
Teaser: Unless a patient presenting with syncope or dizziness is older, has a focal neurologic deficit, or has recent head trauma, a head CT is unlikely to be useful, researchers have found.

Headlines: Defibrotide Significantly Boosts Survival in VOD
Teaser: Defibrotide significantly improved outcomes across all subgroups of patients who developed veno-occlusive disease after stem cell transplant.

Headlines: Add Radiation to Androgen Deprivation for Locally Advanced Prostate CA: Study
Teaser: Radiotherapy added to androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) improves survival with locally advanced prostate cancer, according to eight years' worth of data from a clinical trial.

Headlines: Low Viral Load Ebola May Be Helped by Experimental Drug
Teaser: The antiviral favipiravir reduced mortality from 30% to 15% in patients with a lower viral load, but had no effect in more serious cases, preliminary results show.

Headlines: Gene Variant Linked to Increased Toxicity of Vincristine
Teaser: A previously unknown gene variant has been linked to increased risk and severity of vincristine-induced peripheral neuropathy in children with acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

Headlines: ARDS: Driving Pressure May Help Predict Survival
Teaser: In patients with acute respiratory distress syndrome who are on ventilators, driving pressure was associated with survival in a recent analysis of data from previously reported trials.

Headlines: FDA Approves Panobinostat for Relapsed Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The first-in-class agent has been granted accelerated approval, despite having been voted down by the advisory committee late last year.

Headlines: CBT, Hypnotherapy, Probiotics May Ease Kids' Tummyaches
Teaser: Several non-pharmacological treatments may be effective for children with functional abdominal pain disorders, according to a systematic review published February 9 in Pediatrics.

Headlines: New Evidence of Varicella-Zoster in Giant Cell Arteritis
Teaser: A new study links varicella-zoster virus to GCA; researchers suggest that antivirals might be added to corticosteroids for treating patients with this condition.

Headlines: Diabetic Macular Edema: Three VEGF Inhibitors Similar
Teaser: A median of 9 to 10 injections, given on an as-needed basis, improved vision in eyes with center-involved diabetic macular edema.

Headlines: Study: Surveillance Is for Middle-Risk Prostate Cancer Too
Teaser: Active surveillance might be useful in 'favorable' intermediate-risk disease, American researchers say about their study of more than 5000 men.

Headlines: Brentuximab as First Salvage Therapy in Hodgkin's Lymphoma
Teaser: Brentuximab vedotin alone or with chemotherapy is effective in preparing patients with relapsed or refractory Hodgkin's lymphoma for transplantation.

Headlines: Alternative to Overall Survival in Prostate Cancer Trials?
Teaser: Radiographic progression-free survival correlates with overall survival in patients with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer.

Headlines: Multiple HTN Meds a Risk in Frail Elderly With 'Low' Systolic BP
Teaser: Consider comorbidities and frailty with antihypertensive polymedication in the elderly, as the applicable guidelines tend to be based on "more robust elderly individuals," propose researchers.

Headlines: First Vaginal Insert for Fecal Incontinence Clears FDA
Teaser: The Eclipse System includes an inflatable vaginal balloon that puts pressure through the vaginal wall onto the rectal area, thereby reducing fecal incontinence episodes.

Headlines: Many LGBT Medical Students Stay in the Closet
Teaser: Many lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgendered medical students conceal their sexual or gender identity for fear of discrimination, new research shows.

Headlines: Anticoagulate Intermediate-Risk AF Patients, Says Group
Teaser: It's a gray area--whether or not to prescribe oral anticoagulation to AF patients with a CHA2DS2-VASc score of 1 (or 2 for women)--but one expert says the     risk of stroke is high enough to err on the side of prescribing.

Headlines: CADISS: Antiplatelet, Anticoagulant Equal in Cervical Dissection
Teaser: The first randomized comparison of antiplatelet vs anticoagulant therapy for cervical artery dissection finds no difference in recurrent stroke, although event rates were very low.

Headlines: Type 1 Diabetes Increases Psychiatric Risk in Children
Teaser: Children diagnosed with type 1 diabetes have an increased risk for psychiatric disorders, including attempts at suicide, that appear to be connected to the stress of having the disease.

Headlines: Old Age Alone Should Not Rule Out ICDs: Pooled Analysis
Teaser: Based on a pooled analysis of existing clinical-trial evidence, increasing age alone should not nix the implantation of ICDs in suitable candidates.

Headlines: Next-Generation HIV and Hep C Treatment Plans Ahead at CROI
Teaser: Researchers spell out what's next for antiretroviral therapy after excitement about the Mississippi infant fades. Hepatitis C experts target genotype 3 as the next population needing therapies.

Headlines: Stimulant May Speed Antidepressant Response Time in Elderly
Teaser: Methylphenidate combined with the antidepressant citalopram significantly reduced time to depression remission in elderly patients.

Headlines: FDA Approves Nivolumab, First Immunotherapy for Lung Cancer
Teaser: Approved 3 months ahead of schedule, nivolumab is the first immunotherapy to have shown a survival benefit in non-small cell lung cancer.

Headlines: Profiling Reveals Potential Targets in Rare Bladder Cancer
Teaser: A multimodal molecular analysis has identified biomarkers and mutations that may be able to guide therapy in small cell bladder carcinoma.

Headlines: Preanesthesia Sedative Unnecessary, RCT Data Suggest
Teaser: Sedation does not improve patient satisfaction with the perioperative experience; in addition, it prolongs recovery.

Headlines: India's Natco Pharma Ties Up With Gilead on Hepatitis C Drugs
Teaser: India's Natco Pharma Ltd said on Monday it has agreed a deal with Gilead Sciences Inc to supply generic copies of the U.S. drugmaker's chronic hepatitis C medicines, including $1,000-a-pill drug Sovaldi, in 91 developing nations.

Headlines: Peanut Patch to Treat Allergy in the Works
Teaser: Epicutaneous immunotherapy delivered daily with a patch could be a simple and safe alternative for peanut allergy, new research has shown.

Headlines: Weight Loss Reduces Atrial Size, Pericardial Fat in AF Patients
Teaser: The imaging substudy provides a possible mechanism of action underlying the benefits of weight loss in obese and overweight subjects with AF.

Headlines: Younger Women Not in Tune With Heart Health
Teaser: Women in their 30s, 40s and 50s don't seek preventive care for heart disease, aren't very good at gauging their risk for heart attack and often delay seeking treatment for symptoms of acute myocardial infarction (MI), a new study shows.

Headlines: Chronic Fatigue Syndrome: Immune Alterations Seen Early
Teaser: Patients with recent-onset myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome had distinct alterations in plasma immune signatures in an analysis of data from two large multicenter cohort studies.

Headlines: Greater CAD Progression in Poor Responders to Statins
Teaser: A report suggests physicians should continue to monitor LDL-cholesterol levels to determine whether patients are getting the required reductions     suggested in the new guidelines.

Headlines: Latanoprostene Bunod Beats Timolol for Ocular Pressure
Teaser: The experimental drug latanoprostene bunod improves ocular perfusion pressure more than timolol, during both day and night, a new study shows.

Headlines: New Guidance on Managing Anticoagulant-Associated ICH
Teaser: A new study has clinical implications for managing anticoagulant-associated intracerebral hemorrhage in the acute phase and long-term.

Headlines: Pimecrolimus for Eczema May Have No Added Cancer Risk After All
Teaser: Topical pimecrolimus as a treatment for eczema may have no significant cancer risk, contrary to a U.S Food and Drug Administration warning, according to new research published online February 18 in JAMA Dermatology.

Headlines: Vagal Nerve Stimulation Encouraging in Stroke Rehab
Teaser: A preliminary clinical study suggests that vagal nerve stimulation as an aid to rehabilitation in stroke patients is safe and feasible, with some encouraging signs of efficacy.

Headlines: Too Many Scans for Aggressive Lymphoma in Clinical Trials
Teaser: Patients with aggressive lymphoma treated with curative intent should not have to receive the large number of scans that are mandated in clinical trials.

Headlines: 'Game-Changing' Research in Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: The most comprehensive description to date of genomic events in pancreatic carcinogenesis has identified a patient subgroup with exceptional responses.

Headlines: Emanuel Proposes $2B Prize to Address Antibiotic Crisis
Teaser: Offering prize money for the development of new antibiotic classes is a win-win for all, because as of right now, 'the bacteria are winning.'

Headlines: Lenalidomide Now for Newly Diagnosed Multiple Myeloma Patients
Teaser: The FDA has expanded the indication for lenalidomide to include newly diagnosed multiple myeloma patients.

Headlines: Daily 2-Hour Patching Improves Moderate, Severe Amblyopia
Teaser: Daily patching in 3- to 7-year-olds brings 33% of amblyopic eyes within one line of the other eye in moderate amblyopia, and 11% in severe amblyopia.

Headlines: Oral Treatment for Muscle Cramps May Help Patients With MS
Teaser: The idea behind a possible new treatment for spasticity in multiple sclerosis patients came serendipitously -- in a boat on the open sea.

Headlines: US Healthcare Worker With Ebola Arrives at NIH in Bethesda
Teaser: The individual, who had volunteered at a Sierra Leone facility for patients with Ebola, will be admitted to a special infectious-disease containment unit at the NIH Clinical Center.

Headlines: Psychedelics Do No Harm, May Do Good
Teaser: Another study has failed to show a link between psychedelic drug use and mental illness and in fact suggests these drugs may be beneficial.

Headlines: In NSCLC, Why Some Patients Respond to Immunotherapy
Teaser: A new study provides insights into what makes some tumors respond to the new PD-1 inhibitor immunotherapy drug, pembrolizumab.

Headlines: FDA Heads Into Uncharted Territory of 'Biosimilar' Drugs
Teaser: The FDA's approval of the first biosimilar in the United States may be the first of many, or it may prove to be an exception, given that the approved biosimilar had years of data in Europe to support its use.

Headlines: Exercise May Provide 'Motor Reserve' in Older Age
Teaser: Like the 'use it or lose it' concept behind cognitive reserve, a new study suggests physical activity could protect motor function against age-related effects of small vessel disease.

Headlines: Compound Trawl IDs Potential Beta-Cell Proliferation Drug
Teaser: Screening of over 100,000 compounds has identified a plant-derived drug that increases beta-cell proliferation and improves glycemic control but has a     major drawback.

Headlines: HCV RNA Does Not Always Mean Treatment Failure
Teaser: The presence of low levels of HCV RNA at the end of short-duration therapy with direct-acting antivirals does not always signify treatment failure, new data suggest.

Headlines: Ocular Therapeutix Eye Drug Meets Goal in Late-Stage Study
Teaser: Ocular Therapeutix Inc said its lead eye drug reduced pain and inflammation in patients following cataract surgery in a late-stage trial.

Headlines: Gout Associated With Reduced Risk for Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Patients with gout had a 24% reduced risk of developing Alzheimer's disease compared with matched control participants; the risk reduction may be because of the neuroprotective effects of uric acid.

Headlines: First Therapy for High-Risk Neuroblastoma Approved by FDA
Teaser: Dinutuximab, an antibody targeting glycolipids on the neuroblastoma cell, used in combination with other therapies has been shown to improve survival.

Headlines: ACC 2015: Contemporary Cardiology and San Diego Sunshine
Teaser: With no mittens or parkas needed, this year's sessions should have a lot to say about everyday practice,   from imaging for chest pain, to enhancing MI     intervention, to transcatheter-valve procedures.

Headlines: Apple Unveils iPhone Tool to Build Research Apps
Teaser: The first five apps made with ResearchKit, for Parkinson's disease, breast cancer, diabetes, heart disease, and asthma, rely on the phone's microphone, touchscreen, and motion sensor to collect data.

Headlines: Focal Instead of 'Sledgehammer' Approach to Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Focal therapy for prostate cancer leads to good cancer control rates and causes less damage, says pioneer.

Headlines: Clinics Unaware They Had Simulation Saline, CDC Finds
Teaser: The CDC has continued its investigation into adverse events related to a nonsterile simulation intravenous saline solution intended only for training, but inadvertently given to patients.

Headlines: Websites Marketing Genetic Cancer Tests Oversell Benefits
Teaser: Websites marketing personalized cancer care services often overemphasize benefits and downplay limitations, and offer genetic tests of questionable value.

Headlines: Aspirin Resistance Linked to More Severe Strokes
Teaser: Individuals who exhibit resistance to aspirin may be more likely to have severe strokes than those who respond to the drug, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Anacetrapib Provides Large LDL-Lowering Benefit in FH
Teaser: Anacetrapib allowed significantly more FH patients to attain their LDL-cholesterol treatment goals, but researchers are urging caution with the agent     because two others in the class have failed in large clinical-outcomes trials.

Headlines: Physician Safe After Ebola Needlestick, Experimental Vaccine
Teaser: Although there was no clear evidence of Ebola infection, the patient's response was consistent with a response to the experimental vaccine.

Headlines: Hemophilia B: Lentiviral Vector Safe, Effective in Dogs
Teaser: Lentiviral vectors effectively delivered factor IX genes to dogs with hemophilia B, ameliorating symptoms; experiments in mice ruled out insertional mutagenesis.

Headlines: National Cancer Institute Director Dr Harold Varmus Stepping Down
Teaser: Deputy Director Dr Douglas Lowy will take over as acting NCI director April 1, 2015.

Headlines: Baroreflex-Activation Device Shows Promise in Heart Failure
Teaser: "If the results of our study are confirmed in a larger pivotal trial, baroreflex activation therapy may become standard therapy for heart-failure     patients," the lead investigator said.

Headlines: Antisense Drug Highly Effective Against Crohn's Disease
Teaser: The antisense drug mongersen restored transforming growth factor beta signaling in Crohn's disease, inducing clinical remission and response in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Why Are There No Generic Insulins?
Teaser: Since the discovery of the life-saving hormone in 1921, successive improvements have kept insulin under patent protection until very recently, but even     biosimilars might not dramatically cut the cost.

Headlines: Mutations Now Drive Therapy for Metastatic NSCLC
Teaser: Evidence-based guidelines from the National Comprehensive Cancer Network highlight a shift to genotype-based therapy.

Headlines: Cancer Care 2015 Report: Advances Made, Problems Persist
Teaser: ACSO reports that cancer care has never been better in this era of scientific and technological advances, but pressing issues challenge healthcare delivery.

Headlines: MAGNA: Fish-Oil Supplementation May Lower Thrombosis Risk
Teaser: The MAGNA study of more than 600 patients with suspected CAD suggests fish-oil supplementation may decrease inflammation and thrombogenicity, especially in     those not taking statins.

Headlines: Soon: Survival Results for Metastatic Breast Cancer Drug
Teaser: Can palbociclib improve overall survival? It's would be rare achievement for a systemic therapy in this setting.

Headlines: ADA, EASD Call for Better Insulin-Pump Safety Standards
Teaser: Citing the lack of transparency and a uniform approach to the collection of insulin-pump safety and efficacy data, US and European diabetes professional     societies call for improved standards.

Headlines: MATRIX: Radial PCI Bests Femoral-Access in ACS Patients
Teaser: For high-risk ACS patients undergoing invasive management, transradial access cut the risk of net adverse clinical events by 17% vs the transfemoral     approach. It should now be the default PCI access strategy, say researchers.

Headlines: China Drug Approval Backlog Jumped by a Third Last Year
Teaser: China had more than 18,500 drugs waiting for approval at the end of 2014, up by a third from a year before, the official Center for Drug Evaluation said on Friday, reflecting industry concern that it is getting harder to get medicines approved in the China market.

Headlines: NCCN Guide on CLL to Shift Toward Targeted Therapies
Teaser: Chemotherapy may soon take a backseat to ibrutinib as standard first-line therapy for chronic lymphocytic leukemia, investigators say. Changes in practice guidelines will likely follow.

Headlines: More Studies Support Testosterone CV Safety, Debate Continues
Teaser: Two new analyses suggest that there is no increased risk for venous thromboembolism or cardiovascular events with testosterone treatment, but experts say     the definitive trial has yet to be done.

Headlines: PET/MRI Valuable in Diagnosis of Pelvic Malignancies
Teaser: Simultaneous PET/MRI imaging proves to be a valuable diagnostic modality for staging of pelvic malignancies and detection of recurrences, metastases.

Headlines: Low Stroke, Mortality Rates With New Sapien Valve
Teaser: The PARTNER II trial tested the new Sapien 3 valve from Edwards Lifesciences, and investigators were very excited with the low stroke and mortality rates     at 30 days in a mixed cohort of patients with varying surgical risks.

Headlines: CTA Improves Diagnostic Certainty in Chest-Pain Patients
Teaser: SCOT-HEART investigators say CTA reduced the need for further stress testing, increased use of invasive coronary angiography, and resulted in more focused treatment regimens.

Headlines: OSLER Studies Trumpet Long-term Efficacy of PCSK9 Inhibitors
Teaser: Long-term findings from the OSLER and ODYSSEY trials for potentially practice-changing PCSK9 inhibitors show, as expected, dramatically reduced LDL-C but also--tentatively--reduced cardiac events.

Headlines: CTA Does Not Reduce Hard Events vs Functional Tests
Teaser: UPDATED // The PROMISE study, designed to test whether CTA offered an advantage over functional testing for the reduction in hard clinical end points, showed no     advantage of CTA over other testing modalities.

Headlines: Genetic Sensitivity to Warfarin Linked with Bleeding
Teaser: The analysis from ENGAGE AF-TIMI 48 links variants in two genes known to alter the pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of warfarin with bleeding-events rates.

Headlines: FDA Okays Saphris for Pediatric Bipolar Disorder
Teaser: The FDA has approved another atypical antipsychotic for the treatment of pediatric patients with bipolar 1 disorder.

Headlines: Online Petition Against High Drug Prices Goes Live
Teaser: Cancer patients are the group most affected by high drug prices, and they are now becoming activists.

Headlines: Trial Has Lessons for Search for 'the Perfect Anticoagulant'
Teaser: Allergic reactions cut short a major trial of the REG1 anticoagulant-antidote drug pairing, but researchers seem undeterred in their search for a safer, controllable anticoagulant for use in PCI.

Headlines: Documentary Captures 'Heroics' of Oncologists, Patients
Teaser: 'The Emperor of All Maladies' documentary will raise awareness of what cancer is all about and will make people better appreciate cancer specialists.

Headlines: FDA OKs Anthrasil for Inhalational Anthrax
Teaser: Anthrax immune globulin (Anthrasil) will be stored in the US Strategic National Stockpile to facilitate its availability in response to an anthrax emergency, the FDA said.

Headlines: Chondrocyte Therapy Effective in Knee Cartilage Repair
Teaser: Patients undergoing knee cartilage repair fare slightly better with autologous chondrocyte implantation, a new study has shown, but that might not be enough to justify the cost.

Headlines: MOOD-HF: SSRI No Better Than Placebo in Depressed CHF Patients
Teaser: A new study makes the case for not using escitalopram in CHF patients who are depressed, as there were no differences with placebo in hospitalizations,     deaths, or even depression scores.

Headlines: Cancer Immunotherapy 'Has Entered Mainstream'
Teaser: A series of articles on harnessing the immune system for therapy highlights cancer as the field where most progress has been made.

Headlines: Hip Osteoarthritis Linked to Increased Mortality
Teaser: Radiographic hip osteoarthritis was associated with increased mortality, perhaps as a result of decreased physical activity. Hip replacement provided some protection.

Headlines: AJULAR: Ulnar Access Viable Alternative to Radial for PCI
Teaser: The AJULAR study suggests that ulnar-artery catheterization is safe and effective and may cause fewer spasms than the more common radial approach,     especially when done by experienced operators.

Headlines: Alirocumab Effective Against LDL-C Top of Max-Dose Statin
Teaser: Statins increase plasma concentrations of PCSK9, the target of alirocumab, but an analysis suggests high-dose statin therapy won't interfere with the PCSK9     inhibitor's benefit.

Headlines: Melanoma Trial Halted as Pembrolizumab Bests Ipilimumab
Teaser: For the first time, an anti-PD-1 therapy has demonstrated a survival advantage over the standard of care.

Headlines: Extended Post-PCI DAPT Best in Patients With, Without ACS
Teaser: "Continuation of dual antiplatelet therapy for 30 months should be strongly considered in both ACS and non-ACS patients who have tolerated 1 year of     treatment," say researchers.

Headlines: The Unseen Costs of Hypoglycemia in Diabetes
Teaser: Hypoglycemic episodes are more common than previously thought and have a significant impact on patient outcomes and healthcare costs, attendees of the     recent Diabetes UK meeting heard.

Headlines: New Drug Greatly Reduces Amyloid in CSF, Plasma
Teaser: A once-daily, oral secretase inhibitor greatly reduces levels of amyloid in plasma and CSF with a prolonged effect, a study shows. The compound works regardless of APOE epsilon 4 carrier status.

Headlines: PCI as Good as CABG for Left Main CAD: 5-Year PRECOMBAT Data
Teaser: The findings "support current clinical guidelines stating that left main stenting is a feasible revascularization strategy for patients with suitable     coronary anatomy," according to the researchers.

Headlines: High-Frequency SCS Raises Bar on Chronic Pain Relief
Teaser: Randomized trial results show double the pain relief and remission with an investigational high-frequency spinal cord stimulation device of those with conventional, lower-frequency SCS.

Headlines: Antiviral Promising in Early HPV Trial
Teaser: The experimental drug ranpirnase has the potential to be the first antiviral treatment for human papillomavirus (HPV).

Headlines: No Suicide Risk With Varenicline?
Teaser: A comprehensive meta-analysis shows no evidence of neuropsychiatric effects of varenicline, but the study has its detractors.

Headlines: AD/PD: Neurodegeneration Meeting Explores New Approaches
Teaser: Better treatments for Alzheimer's and Parkinson's diseases will require drugs to stop or slow their progression, not just treat symptoms. The AD/PD meeting in Nice is producing a wealth of approaches.

Headlines: MATRIX: Bivalirudin Reduced Mortality vs UFH in ACS Setting
Teaser: On its primary MACE end point, the MATRIX study missed in showing the superiority of bivalirudin over unfractionated heparin in ACS patients undergoing     PCI, but mortality and bleeding advantages were observed.

Headlines: New Market for Liver Disease Spawns Race for Better Testing
Teaser: As drugmakers develop new medicines to battle a liver disease epidemic, they have created an urgent need for better diagnostics to select patients for treatment and assess their drugs' effectiveness.

Headlines: Lithium Still Best Medication for Preventing Bipolar Relapse
Teaser: Lithium remains the best medication for preventing bipolar relapse.

Headlines: Antidepressants at Normal Doses Linked to First-Time Seizures
Teaser: Antidepressants administered in therapeutic doses to depressed patients have been linked to an increased risk for first-time seizures.

Headlines: Secondary-Prevention Statins Underprescribed at ACS Discharge
Teaser: There were 'higher rates of undertreatment for eligible patients with low LDL-C levels,' say authors of the analysis, who added that strategies for improving those disparities are worth considering.

Headlines: FDA to Investigate Bayer's Essure Contraceptive Device
Teaser: Petitioners allege that Bayer falsified medical records from clinical trials, failed to report adverse events, misled the public and the FDA about the device, and used defective materials in the device.

Headlines: Young Parental Age May Double Child ADHD Risk
Teaser: Children born to parents younger than 20 years have an increased risk for ADHD, particularly if both parents are young.

Headlines: Retinal Vein Occlusion Associated With Stroke
Teaser: The association between RVO and stroke appears to be stronger for younger patients than for middle-aged or older patients.

Headlines: European Project for Flexible Drug Approvals Moves up a Gear
Teaser: A European project to streamline drug approvals moves up a gear next week when regulators sit down with the first company to have an experimental product assessed under a new flexible pilot scheme.

Headlines: Medullary Thyroid Cancer Guidelines: New Risk Classes and More
Teaser: The new guidelines reflect advances in the diagnosis and treatment of patients with medullary thyroid cancer over the past 6 years and draw attention to     the need for further research.

Headlines: Controversial IP Route Trumps IV Chemo for Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: Even with long-term evidence of the superiority of intraperitoneal (IP) over intravenous (IV) chemotherapy for advanced ovarian cancer, controversy lingers.

Headlines: SGLT-2 Inhibitor/GLP-1 Agonist Doubles Weight Loss in Diabetes
Teaser: Adding an SGLT-2 inhibitor to a GLP-1 agonist in patients with type 2 diabetes appears to have an additive effect in terms of weight loss, a small new     study suggests.

Headlines: Solution for Japanese Cancer Crisis 'Counterproductive'
Teaser: A system that will allow Japanese cancer patients rapid access to drugs that have not yet been approved has many problems, experts say.

Headlines: Abiraterone Before Chemo Improves Survival: Label Update
Teaser: The FDA has updated the labeling on abiraterone acetate to reflect its expanded indication, and clinical trials results on which the indication was based have now been published.

Headlines: An Epilepsy Drug to Prevent Cognitive Decline?
Teaser: In a preliminary trial, low doses of levetiracetam reduced overactivation in the hippocampus that is linked to mild cognitive impairment, and also improved memory.

Headlines: New 'Gold Standard' Protocol Sizes Up Alzheimer's Burden
Teaser: A robust association between hippocampal volumes and disease burden in Alzheimer's demonstrated that using the new gold standard harmonized protocol for measuring hippocampal atrophy.

Headlines: Glyburide Tied to Greater Neonatal Risk Than Insulin in GDM
Teaser: The largest study to date of glyburide vs insulin for gestational diabetes identifies an increased risk of adverse neonatal outcomes with glyburide;     however, insulin may not be best for all women.

Headlines: New AASM Quality Measures for Common Sleep Disorders
Teaser: As healthcare providers become increasingly pressured to provide quality care, the American Academy of Sleep Medicine has developed quality measures for the five most common sleep disorders.

Headlines: Ohr Pharma's Eye Drug Fails in Mid-Stage Study, Shares Plunge
Teaser: Ohr Pharmaceutical Inc said its experimental eye drug failed the main goal in a mid-stage study as a combination therapy, sending the company's shares plunging 64 percent in premarket trading on Friday.

Headlines: Ketorolac Similar to Corticosteroid for Knee Osteoarthritis
Teaser: Intra-articular ketorolac shows efficacy similar to that of corticosteroid injections in the treatment of knee osteoarthritis, a new study shows.

Headlines: Researchers Call for ACL Injury Prevention in US Football
Teaser: With video analysis, researchers have shown that American football players would benefit from a knee-injury prevention program similar to the ones developed for soccer.

Headlines: NEPA Combo for CINV Nears Approval in Europe
Teaser: In Europe, approval has been recommended for combination netupitant and palonosetron to prevent chemotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (CINV) in cancer patients.

Headlines: Marijuana Compound May Reduce Seizures in Severe Epilepsy
Teaser: The largest open-label study of its kind to date shows seizures were reduced by more than 50% in patients with Dravet or Lennox-Gastaut syndromes.

Headlines: Polygene Test Can Predict Risk for Breast Cancer
Teaser: A new polygenic risk score can be used to predict a woman's risk for breast cancer, especially when it is added to other information.

Headlines: Hydrogel Device Protects Rectum During Prostate Cancer RT
Teaser: The new SpaceOAR device, which protects the rectum from damage during radiotherapy (RT) of the prostate, has just been cleared for clinical use by the FDA.

Headlines: Gene Therapy Superior to Haploidentical HSCT for SCID-X1
Teaser: Gene therapy led to faster immune reconstitution and resolution of infections in SCID-X1 patients than did haploidentical hematopoietic stem cell transplantation.

Headlines: Underweight Tied to Higher Dementia Risk
Teaser: New data contradict the theory that being overweight in midlife may increase the risk for dementia but rather show it to protect against dementia.

Headlines: Marker for Early Beta Cell Loss After Islet Cell Transplantation
Teaser: Plasma GDA65 can be used to detect early beta cell loss after intraportal islet cell transplantation in patients with diabetes, researchers have found.

Headlines: New Guidelines for Spondyloarthritis Imaging Issued by EULAR
Teaser: Experts have produced the first evidence-based recommendations for the use of imaging in the diagnosis and management of axial and peripheral spondyloarthritis, but not everyone is convinced.

Headlines: Novel Drug Targets 'Huge Unmet Need' in Schizophrenia
Teaser: A novel drug with a unique mechanism offers a much-needed treatment option to improve cognitive impairment in schizophrenia.

Headlines: HIV: New Antibody Therapy Shows Promise in Patients
Teaser: A broadly neutralizing HIV-1 antibody, 3BNC117, lowered viral load for weeks, suggesting a novel route to prevention and treatment.

Headlines: Societies Post Circulatory Support Pump Consensus Statement
Teaser: An expert consensus statement spells out how percutaneous mechanical circulatory support devices can be used in multiple typical clinical scenarios and     calls for a national registry for these devices.

Headlines: New Strain of Acinetobacter Identified in Fatal Outbreak
Teaser: Experts caution that infection control precautions and effective antimicrobial stewardship become critical in the face of such a superbug.

Headlines: 'Baron of Botox' Dr Fredric Brandt Dead at Age 65
Teaser: The world-renowned dermatologist committed suicide at his home in Coconut Grove, Florida, after reportedly suffering from depression.

Headlines: Arts and Crafts Linked to Lower Risk for Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Painting, woodworking, being socially active, and using a computer are all activities that could delay conversion from normal cognition to mild cognitive impairment in patients in their 80s, a new study shows.

Headlines: Adapalene, Benzoyl Gels Reduce Acne
Teaser: Topical gel combinations of adapalene and benzoyl peroxide are safe and effective in the long-term management of acne, new research shows.

Headlines: No Cognitive Benefit of Lower Temp After Cardiac Arrest
Teaser: Further analysis of the largest study of its kind showed no difference in quality of life and cognitive outcomes with target temperatures of 33 degrees C and 36 degrees C in patients with out-of-hospital cardiac arrest.

Headlines: Is Ipilimumab Ready for the Adjuvant Treatment of Melanoma?
Teaser: With ipilimumab already used for the treatment of first-line metastatic melanoma, how strong is the evidence for its use in the adjuvant setting?

Headlines: Most Weight-Loss Programs Come Up Wanting
Teaser: Only two commercial weight-loss programs have enough evidence to support claims that they help people lose weight and keep the weight off.

Headlines: Low Vitamin D Common in Early-Stage Psychosis
Teaser: Vitamin D deficiencies are much lower in individuals with first-onset psychosis compared with mentally healthy persons. Further, vitamin D levels predict function and mood over the long term.

Headlines: AAP's Bronchiolitis Guidelines Praised, but Contentious
Teaser: AAP's updated bronchiolitis guideline, which calls for less aggressive interventions, draws strong praise and debate from clinicians.

Headlines: Finasteride Safety Questionable in Androgenic Alopecia
Teaser: Pooled data do not prove the safety of finasteride for androgenic alopecia (AGA), with sexual side effects in particular not adequately evaluated, according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: Blood, Urine Tests for EGFR as Alternatives to Lung Biopsy
Teaser: Testing for EGFR mutations in plasma and urine circulating tumor DNA offers alternatives to lung tissue biopsies in patients with NSCLC.

Headlines: FDA OKs Botox for Adults With Upper Limb Spasticity
Teaser: The FDA has approved an expanded indication for Botox for the treatment of adults with upper limb spasticity.

Headlines: 'Astonishing': Tumor Gone After One Dose of Immunotherapy
Teaser: Combination immunotherapy has had great success in clinical trials, including this remarkable response.

Headlines: Oral Insulin May Thwart Type 1 Diabetes in High-Risk Kids
Teaser: In the pilot Pre-POINT study, a high dose of oral insulin altered the immune response in children at high risk of developing type 1 diabetes; a vaccine     could be 10 years away, the authors speculate.

Headlines: Two Doctors Share $500K Albany Prize in Medicine
Teaser: Karl Deisseroth, MD, PhD, and Xiaoliang Sunney Xie, PhD, have been jointly awarded the $500,000 Albany Medical Center Prize in Medicine and Biomedical Research for 2015.

Headlines: New AAN/AES Guideline on First Unprovoked Seizure in Adults
Teaser: Experts recommend clinicians approach patients on an individualized basis in terms of whether to treat with an antiepileptic drug following a first unprovoked seizure.

Headlines: One in Five Melanomas Undetectable After Immune Drug Combo
Teaser: Combining nivolumab and ipilimumab also resulted in nearly a quarter of patients having their advanced melanoma become undetectable. Experts are excited.

Headlines: Sunitinib Improves PFS in Small-Cell Lung Cancer
Teaser: In small-cell lung cancer, maintenance therapy with sunitinib was shown to provide significantly longer progression-free survival in a phase 2 study.

Headlines: Vandetanib for Medullary Thyroid Cancer: Manageable Toxicity
Teaser: A study of patients with advanced medullary thyroid cancer who received vandetanib outside of a clinical trial showed that this drug can be effective, with     mostly manageable adverse effects.

Headlines: In Advanced Lung Cancer Subset, Agent Has 45% Response Rate
Teaser: The PD-1 inhibitor pembrolizumab shows durable antitumor activity, and high PD-L1 tumor expression identifies a group most likely to respond.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAN 2015?
Teaser: A rundown of changes to the program and expected highlights of the American Academy of Neurology 67th Annual Meeting, beginning this weekend in Washington, DC.

Headlines: Hepatitis C Will Share Spotlight This Year at Liver Congress
Teaser: Specialists will learn how to prioritize hepatitis C drugs, and hear more about fatty liver disease, hepatocellular cancer, and the noninvasive assessment of liver disease.

Headlines: 'First Clinical Evidence' of Remyelination in MS
Teaser: Researchers report what they call 'the first clinical study to show evidence of proof of biology for remyelination in multiple sclerosis':  improved optic nerve conduction in optic neuritis.

Headlines: Experimental e-Cigarette Use in Youth on the Rise
Teaser: E-cigarette use has been linked to current smoking, but low prevalence of regular use suggests a contribution to nicotine addiction is unlikely.

Headlines: Pay-for-Delay Drug Deals: Do They Hurt or Help Patients?
Teaser: Do pay-for-delay deals increase costs and delay generic drug entry into the market, or do they actually lower costs and make generics available sooner?

Headlines: Antidepressant Washout Safe in Resistant Depression
Teaser: Taking patients with treatment-resistant depression off antidepressant medication for a period in order to initiate a new antidepressant agent appears to be safe.

Headlines: Zoledronic Acid Ups BMD in Seniors Without Cutting Fractures
Teaser: A single infusion of zoledronic acid improved BMD over the course of 2 years in frail institutionalized elderly women with osteoporosis, but this improvement did not translate to better outcomes.

Headlines: Elijah Saunders, 'Visionary' on Hypertension in Blacks, Dead at 80
Teaser: Advocate for cardiovascular care in black patients, Dr Elijah Saunders died last week. Colleagues say his passion was teaching about the     "silent killer" of hypertension.

Headlines: Micra Miniature Leadless Pacemaker Gains CE Mark
Teaser: Micra TPS, a miniaturized leadless pacemaker lodged into the myocardium of the right ventricle via catheter, is now approved in Europe with a CE Mark     designation. It joins Nanostim on the market.

Headlines: Aspirin Does Not Reduce Mortality in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Aspirin use was not associated with a reduction in the risk for prostate cancer death in a large study of men in the United Kingdom.

Headlines: Cough Medicine Ingredient May Improve Alzheimer's Agitation
Teaser: A drug that includes an agent commonly found in cough medicine is showing promise for the treatment of agitation in patients with Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: ED-Initiated Buprenorphine Helps Opioid Addicts Recover
Teaser: Opioid-dependent patients who start buprenorphine in the emergency department with referral to primary care are more likely to still be engaged in addiction treatment 30 days later.

Headlines: B Vitamin Promising in Progressive Multiple Sclerosis
Teaser: A phase 3 study found that patients taking pharmaceutical-grade biotin had significant improvement compared with placebo recipients.

Headlines: T-VEC Injection for Melanoma Recommended for FDA Approval
Teaser: Injected directly into the melanoma lesion, the product contains genetically modified herpes virus and a gene for a colony stimulating factor.

Headlines: Tight HbA1c Control in Type 1 Diabetes Reduces Eye Surgery
Teaser: A few years of tight glycemic control in type 1 diabetes can greatly reduce the risk for diabetes-related ocular surgery decades later, a new analysis of     data from the DCCT/EDIC reveals.

Headlines: LVADs in HF: Weigh Complication Risks, Not Just Survival Odds
Teaser: Strokes and cognitive decline are among the risks, despite longer survival and quality-of-life gains, results that should help physicians establish realistic expectations for patients getting LVADs.

Headlines: Two New Drugs for EGFR+ Lung Cancer That Has Progressed
Teaser: Third-generation EGFR inhibitors AZD9291 and rociletinib will soon offer a new option for some patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC).

Headlines: Vena Cava Filters Do Not Add to Anticoagulant Therapy
Teaser: The vascular filter is implanted to prevent blood clots but appears to deliver no benefit over and above treatment with anticoagulants among patients with pulmonary embolism.

Headlines: Mediterranean Diet Linked to Larger Brain Volume
Teaser: Adherence to the Mediterranean diet is linked to larger brain volume in the elderly, suggesting the diet has the potential to prevent brain atrophy and, by extension, preserve cognition.

Headlines: Novel Brain Stimulation May Boost Creativity, Treat Depression
Teaser: Low-energy brain stimulation can increase creativity via alpha oscillations, boosting creativity and potentially providing a novel treatment for depression.

Headlines: Low Serotonin, Depression Link a Myth?
Teaser: The efficacy of selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors in treating depression is a myth that has distracted doctors and patients alike for decades, says a UK psychiatrist.

Headlines: Alcoholic Hep C Patients May Need Rehab More Than Meds
Teaser: Expensive direct-acting antiviral agents might not be cost-effective for patients with chronic hepatitis C infection who abuse alcohol, a new study has shown.

Headlines: Experimental Drug Safe, Effective in Schizophrenia
Teaser: An experimental agent with a novel mechanism of action may offer a safe and effective treatment option for schizophrenia with a better side effect profile than atypical antipsychotics.

Headlines: Higher CVD Risks Reported for Hodgkin's Lymphoma Survivors
Teaser: The longest follow-up to date of Hodgkin's lymphoma survivors has confirmed an increase in cardiovascular risks compared with the general population.

Headlines: Statins in Everyone 75 and Older? Could Be Cost-Effective: Analysis
Teaser: Perhaps, but "even very modest adverse effects attributable to statins tip the balance in the direction of harm," says an observer, who adds, regarding statins in this group, "Less is more."

Headlines: Europe OKs First PD Inhibitor, Nivolumab
Teaser: Nivolumab has been recommended for approval for first-line use in metastatic melanoma in the European Union.

Headlines: Topical Gel Promising in Migraine
Teaser: A ketoprofen gel applied on the face over transgeminal nerve endings is effective in migraine treatment and an alternative to those who can't take oral NSAIDs.

Headlines: Positive Results for Status Epilepticus Drug
Teaser: Results of phase 1/2 study of new agent for super resistant status epilepticus called 'very exciting' by researchers; a phase 3 trial is planned for later this year.

Headlines: Clozapine-Induced Myocarditis Overlooked?
Teaser: A purportedly higher incidence of clozapine-induced myocarditis in Australia has led researchers there to warn that this adverse drug reaction is being overlooked elsewhere.

Headlines: Is Biomarker-Guided Treatment Coming to Prostate Cancer?
Teaser: The PARP inhibitor olaparib was active against prostate cancer in a clinical trial; a genetic panel appears to predict response.

Headlines: 'Cautionary Lesson' About Metformin for Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: Clinicians who are prescribing metformin for this very-difficult-to-treat cancer should know the practice might not have any strong supporting evidence.

Headlines: Contrave Safety Study Stopped, Investigators Livid
Teaser: Investigators say that Orexigen, the makers of Contrave, leaked the inconclusive results of the LIGHT study in regulatory filings and then delayed when     another interim analysis suggested a lack of CV benefit.

Headlines: Microbiome, Immune Therapies, Biologics Showcased at DDW
Teaser: The joint sponsors of Digestive Disease Week are working together to focus on top areas in gastroenterology, with less redundancy and more collaboration.

Headlines: 14 Cancer Centers, IBM Install Supercomputer in Clinic
Teaser: Like other big data initiatives in oncology, this one is much hyped. But it is also further along.

Headlines: Pulmonary Fibrosis and COPD to Headline Thoracic Meeting
Teaser: New drugs for pulmonary fibrosis and the subtyping and treatment of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease will be highlights of the ATS meeting, which is marking a milestone anniversary this year.

Headlines: CBT Equal to Light Therapy for SAD
Teaser: Cognitive-behavioral therapy is as effective as light therapy in the treatment of seasonal affective disorder.

Headlines: FDA Okays Senza SCS System Without Tingling for Chronic Pain
Teaser: The FDA has approved the Senza spinal cord stimulation system, the first such system to relieve pain without paresthesia.

Headlines: Prasugrel Real-World ACS Use Limited to 'Healthiest'
Teaser: Just one in five ACS patients from large clinical centers receive prasugrel, and the agent appears limited to only those with the lowest possible risk of     bleeding, according to new analysis.

Headlines: Questions Linger for Orbital Atherectomy in Calcified Lesions
Teaser: The MACE rate with orbital atherectomy was comparable with another analysis of patients with severely calcified lesions in HORIZONS/ACUITY, but a lack of a     comparator arm leaves lingering questions.

Headlines: J&J to Consult Ethics Panel for 'Compassionate Use' Requests
Teaser: The drug manufacturer will act on recommendations from a committee of bioethicists, physicians, and patient representatives formed by the New York University School of Medicine.

Headlines: HRS Sessions Celebrate Innovation in the 'Athens of America'
Teaser: At the party: a tip of the hat to the ICD on its FDA-approval pearl anniversary and 2 days of late-breaking trials with poisoned epicardial fat pads,     wireless CRT electrodes, and other fascinations.

Headlines: Bill Aims to Expand Drug Indications Minus Randomized Trials
Teaser: The latest draft of 21st Century Cures wins kudos for budgeting more for NIH, but some experts still worry that it would lower the scientific bar for FDA approvals.

Headlines: Rethinking Adjuvant Chemotherapy in Rectal Cancer
Teaser: The best available evidence does not support a survival advantage with adjuvant chemotherapy when patients receive preoperative chemoradiation and adequate surgery, two oncologists say.

Headlines: At Last: Megatrial to Compare Secondary-Prevention ASA Dosages
Teaser: 325-mg or 81-mg daily aspirin? A nonprofit has announced plans to fund a randomized trial, to the tune of $14 million and with a projected 20,000 patients, to pin down the better answer.

Headlines: Total Resection of Brain Tumor Extends Survival
Teaser: Even when abnormal areas surrounding a glioblastoma multiforme tumor are removed, survival increases, but some warn that quality of life should be considered.

Headlines: Clash Over Need, Feasibility of Informed Consent in STEMI Trials
Teaser: STEMI patients can be sedated and in no shape to sign, so delaying the informed-consent process can help clinical-trial enrollment, says one expert.     Another says that slope is way too slippery.

Headlines: New Antibiotics Promising in Pneumonia, Abdominal Infection
Teaser: Alternatives to treat drug-resistant bacteria are on the horizon, including a macrolide for community-acquired pneumonia and a tetracycline derivative for complicated abdominal infections.

Headlines: Lariat for LAA Closure in AF Needs Lassoing, Say Experts
Teaser: The device, cleared for use without clinical-trial scrutiny, needs more rigorous testing if its use in left-atrial-appendage closure is to continue in AF, say researchers based on their analysis.

Headlines: Retinal Gene Therapy: Long-term Results Less Than Expected
Teaser: Gene therapy for RPE65-associated Leber's congenital amaurosis enabled people to see, but the benefit diminished as photoreceptors continued to degrade in patients treated in two trials.

Headlines: New Corneal Endothelial Treatments Tested
Teaser: Injected cultivated cells and Rho kinase inhibitor eye drops look like promising treatments for corneal endothelial dysfunction, a researcher reports.

Headlines: What's Hot at ASCO 2015?
Teaser: This year's meeting focusses on 'transforming data into learning' to speed up the process of applying results from clinical trials into patient care.

Headlines: Shorter Course of Radiation Has Benefits in Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: A 5-day course of radiation is as effective, and may even be better, than standard 6-week radiotherapy for locally advanced pancreatic cancer.

Headlines: Chronic Vardenafil Treatment Has CV Benefits in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Six months of vardenafil therapy in type 2 diabetes lowers inflammation, improves endothelial function, and prompts a rise in testosterone levels in a     small study in hypogonadal men.

Headlines: SABR as Effective as Surgery for Early NSCLC?
Teaser: Stereotactic ablative radiotherapy might be as effective as lobectomy for patients with early operable non-small cell lung cancer, a pooled analysis suggests.

Headlines: Oral Steroids Have Little Effect in Patients With Sciatica
Teaser: A short course of prednisone has been linked to slight functional improvement, but no pain benefit in patients with acute lumbar radiculopathy.

Headlines: Free Testosterone May Help Diagnose Hypogonadism
Teaser: Measuring low free testosterone as well as total testosterone may provide a better diagnosis of testosterone deficiency, a new analysis from the world's     largest study of aging men indicates.

Headlines: Not All Biologics Equally Safe for Patients With Psoriasis
Teaser: A disease registry study has presented a comprehensive comparison of serious infection rates between biologics most commonly used to treat psoriasis.

Headlines: Experimental Kappa Opioid Appears Safe and Effective
Teaser: New phase 2 trials show that an experimental kappa opioid agonist, CR845, can reduce pain with few adverse effects and without much potential for abuse.

Headlines: Screen Accurately Identifies Autism at an Early Age
Teaser: A screening tool based on parental responses to a 30-item screen shows excellent accuracy in identifying children with autism at a very early age.

Headlines: World's First Medical Cannabis Registry Launched
Teaser: The province of Quebec, Canada, becomes the first in the world to launch a registry for users of medical marijuana.

Headlines: Drug Combo Targets Common Cystic Fibrosis Gene Abnormality
Teaser: Results from the phase 3 TRAFFIC and TRANSPORT trials suggest the oral combination of lumacaftor and ivacaftor improves lung function and curbs exacerbations.

Headlines: Novel Devices  Noninferior to RF Ablation in AF Patients
Teaser: Two novel technologies emerged as promising alternatives to radiofrequency ablation in different studies, with both a cryoballoon and a visually guided laser balloon turning in noninferior results.

Headlines: New Indian Drug Saroglitazar Targets 'Diabetic Dyslipidemia'
Teaser: Saroglitazar, a dual PPAR agonist that differs structurally from other related compounds, improved lipid profiles and lowered HbA1c without causing edema     or weight gain.

Headlines: Miniaturized Leadless Pacemaker Impressive Early
Teaser: The leadless Micra, which is delivered into the right ventricle, impressed investigators with a low rate of serious adverse events among patients who     benefit from a single-chamber ventricular pacemaker.

Headlines: Two MRI-Compatible ICDs Pass Safety and Efficacy Hurdle
Teaser: Two new ICDs, both with modified firmware and hardware to make them safe for the MRI machine, were not adversely affected when patients underwent a series of whole-body MRI scans.

Headlines: 'Bionic Pancreas' Research Brings Device Closer to Real Life
Teaser: Thus far, four clinical trials have shown that the duel-hormone system can bring blood glucose to near-normal levels without risking "lows" in         real-life settings.

Headlines: New Agent Active in Refractory Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
Teaser: Treatment with TAS-102 improved survival in heavily pretreated patients with metastatic colorectal cancer, including those refractory to fluorouracil.

Headlines: What's Hot: Your Guide to APA 2015 Annual Meeting Highlights
Teaser: Psychiatrists from around the world will head to the Great White North (aka Canada) this weekend to attend the American Psychiatric Association's annual meeting in Toronto.

Headlines: US Endocrinologists React to Contrave Safety Study Halt
Teaser: Attendees at an obesity session at the AACE annual meeting expressed concern about the early data release and subsequent study halt, but most said they'd     still prescribe the drug.

Headlines: Chemo Upfront Ups Survival in Advanced Prostate Cancer
Teaser: The largest randomized trial ever conducted in prostate cancer has shown a survival benefit from adding chemotherapy upfront to hormonal therapy.

Headlines: Saturday at ASCO: Changes for Prostate Cancer & Melanoma
Teaser: Among the news released today are studies that have potential to change current practice in prostate cancer and melanoma.

Headlines: FDA Clears Sirolimus (Rapamune) for Rare Lung Disease
Teaser: Sirolimus is the first drug approved in the US to treat lymphangioleiomyomatosis (LAM), a very rare, progressive lung disease that primarily affects women of childbearing age.

Headlines: PD-1 Drug Doubles Responses in Head and Neck Cancer
Teaser: The overall response rate seen with pembrolizumab in patients with advanced disease was called 'remarkable' by a study investigator.

Headlines: Evolocumab Safe, Effective in Mixed Hyperlipidemia: Study
Teaser: The investigational PCSK9 inhibitor evolocumab safely lowers LDL-cholesterol in patients who also have elevated triglycerides, say researchers, based on their pooled analysis of clinical trial data.

Headlines: Time to Legally Reclassify Psychedelic Drugs, Experts Say
Teaser: Psychedelic drugs should be legally reclassified so that researchers can more easily test their therapeutic potential in clinical psychiatry and other areas of medicine, experts say.

Headlines: The Big Four at ASCO Friday
Teaser: Highly anticipated nivolumab and pembrolizumab results will be among the four clinical trials released opening day of the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) meeting in Chicago.

Headlines: Echo-CRT Subanalysis: Still No Benefit for Narrow QRS in HF
Teaser: New findings may put the "last nail in the coffin" for CRT use in patients with QRS duration of 120 to 130 ms, say researchers, adding that the findings     could have guideline implications.

Headlines: Mindfulness and Monitoring Devices Aid Weight Loss
Teaser: Clinicians are helping patients lose weight with techniques such as mindfulness education and monitoring devices.

Headlines: Anti-Adhesion Molecule Sticks in Ulcerative Colitis
Teaser: The investigational mucosal addressin cell adhesion molecule met its primary and secondary end points in the TURANDOT trial and does not appear to increase the risk for infection, say investigators.

Headlines: Soy Supplement Did Not Improve Asthma
Teaser: Soy isoflavones did not improve lung function or clinical outcomes in patients older than 12 years with poorly controlled asthma in a randomized clinical trial.

Headlines: Record-Breaking 40K Use App to Join Heart Study
Teaser: More than 40,000 people downloaded a smartphone app and joined a global study, demonstrating that big data can be harnessed at minimal cost, which might revolutionize the way research is done.

Headlines: Ulcerative Colitis: Histology Predicts Long-term Outcomes
Teaser: Histological remission may predict long-term outcomes better than endoscopy, according to a new study.

Headlines: TITRATION: Regimens for PARADIGM Drug Safe for HF Patients
Teaser: Whether up-titrated quickly or more conservatively, the much talked about ARNI achieved treatment success with very few adverse events, say researchers,     noting that it extends PARADIGM data.

Headlines: Anticoagulant Use Safe in Patients With Brain Metastases
Teaser: Therapeutic anticoagulation does not increase the risk for intracranial hemorrhage in cancer patients with brain metastases.

Headlines: New Drug Treatments for Basal Cell Carcinoma
