Teaser: New studies in patients with advanced basal cell carcinoma show long-term safety of vismodegib, and also profile a new drug, sonidegib, which is awaiting approval.

Headlines: EMA Removes BP Drug From Hyderabad Suspension List
Teaser: Otherwise, EU regulators are sticking to their recommendation to suspend dozens of generic drugs because of flawed clinical trials conducted in Hyderabad, India.

Headlines: Green Light for Cancer Immunotherapies in Europe
Teaser: The EU authorities have recommended for approval pembrolizumab for melanoma, nivolumab for lung cancer, and dinutuximab for neuroblastoma.

Headlines: Brain Stimulation Techniques Promising for Resistant OCD
Teaser: DBS is enjoying something of a comeback with new research on this and other modes of brain stimulation showing encouraging results in treatment-resistant obsessive- compulsive disorder.

Headlines: Diabetes: Personalized Care During Eye Checks Has No Benefit
Teaser: Adding personalized education and risk assessment to routine eye exams does not improve glycemic control among patients with diabetes, a randomized trial showed.

Headlines: Uninterrupted Rivaroxaban Feasible in AF Ablations, in Study
Teaser: Event rates were low, but no major bleeding complications and no thromboembolic events occurred in the ablation group that had rivaroxaban maintained     during the AF procedure.

Headlines: Ebola Drug Development Slowed by Lack of Patients
Teaser: Ebola drug development is facing hurdles, but vaccine trials are moving at unprecedented rates, with trials that usually take years to implement getting under way within weeks.

Headlines: 'Guarded Enthusiasm' Builds for PCSK9 Inhibitors
Teaser: The excitement is real, but with next week's FDA advisory panels on two new PCSK9 inhibitors, physicians are starting to think through tough questions     about how to actually use the agents in clinical practice.

Headlines: Diabetes Linked to ALS Risk
Teaser: New research suggests that type 2 diabetes is associated with a lower risk for amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, while type 1 diabetes is linked to higher risk for the disease.

Headlines: Access Health Record at Push of Button When Evidence Lacking
Teaser: A green-button function is being tested in electronic health records to help direct treatment of similar patients when data from randomized controlled trials are not available.

Headlines: Argentinian Cardiologist Dr Liliana Grinfeld Dies at 71
Teaser: A pioneer in interventional cardiology, and the first female in Argentina to put in a stent, Dr Grinfeld passed away at age 71 after a long illness,     according to media reports.

Headlines: Moderate Exercise Reduces Risk for Gestational Diabetes
Teaser: Moderate exercise during pregnancy reduces the risk for gestational diabetes and decreases maternal weight gain, according to a meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials.

Headlines: IMPROVE-IT Published: Ezetimibe Lowers LDL, Reduces Events
Teaser: In an editorial, two experts argue IMPROVE-IT supports the LDL-cholesterol-lowering hypothesis—that lower LDL, regardless of how it is achieved, is     better—and that there's nothing uniquely beneficial about ezetimibe.

Headlines: Ill Travelers Returning From West Africa Most Likely to Have Malaria
Teaser: While Ebola virus disease (EVD) is on everyone's mind, ill travelers returning from West Africa are far more likely to have malaria, according to findings from the GeoSentinel Surveillance Network.

Headlines: Many UK GPs Using Drugs No Longer Recommended for Gonorrhea
Teaser: Many family physicians in the United Kingdom are prescribing antimicrobials no longer recommended for gonorrhea, but most prescribe appropriate antimicrobials for chlamydia.

Headlines: Novel Testosterones May Overcome Oral Dosing Hurdles
Teaser: New oral formulations appear to normalize testosterone levels in hypogonadal men and could help overcome the challenges associated with oral dosing.

Headlines: Effects of Alemtuzumab in MS Persist at 4 Years
Teaser: Positive effects of the drug in patients with  relapsing-remitting multiple sclerosis who have very active disease may continue to 4 years.

Headlines: Online Education Improves Borderline Personality Symptoms
Teaser: An online psychoeducational intervention improves several symptoms of borderline personality disorder, including self-harm and overall psychosocial functioning.

Headlines: NCI Spearheads Largest Precision Medicine Trial
Teaser: The national initiative, part of President Obama's plan to find treatments for cancers that have not responded to traditional therapies, will start enrolling thousands of patients next month.

Headlines: What Patients Gain by Reading Their Doctor's Notes
Teaser: MedStar Health's Web portal allows physicians to share office notes with patients.

Headlines: New Immunotherapy Costing $1 Million a Year
Teaser: The new data being presented at the ASCO meeting are showing remarkable promise with immunotherapies, but these drugs cost too much.

Headlines: Potential Practice Change in Management of DCIS
Teaser: In a major clinical trial, an aromatase inhibitor was more effective than tamoxifen in preventing disease recurrence.

Headlines: Animals Ease Social Anxiety in Kids With Autism
Teaser: Companion animals, such as dogs, cats, and even guinea pigs, may be a helpful addition to treatment programs designed to help children with autism improve their social skills and interactions with other people.

Headlines: Icosabutate Shows Promise in Lowering Triglycerides in Humans
Teaser: This structurally enhanced omega-3 fatty acid safely and effectively lowered triglycerides levels at a much smaller dose than natural omega-3 fatty acids,     in a proof-of-concept study.

Headlines: Million Hearts Model Rewards Physicians for Prevention
Teaser: The Million Hearts Cardiovascular Risk Reduction Model will test rewarding physicians for reducing 10-year predicted risk for atherosclerotic heart disease across their high-risk patient populations.

Headlines: Elective Neck Dissection: New Standard of Care?
Teaser: A new study may resolve the question of whether neck dissection should be elective or therapeutic in early oral cancers.

Headlines: Social Anxiety? Fermented Foods May Help
Teaser: Fermented foods likely rich in probiotics may help curb social anxiety, particularly in those with a high degree of neuroticism.

Headlines: Risk for Asthma Treatment Failure Rises With Age
Teaser: Age was tied to higher risk for asthma treatment failure in a large cohort study.

Headlines: Hope Ahead? Varying Approaches Progress Artificial Pancreas
Teaser: A new study suggests glucagon may add benefit, but whether that outweighs its cost and complexity remains unclear. Other studies show progress with both single- and dual-hormone systems.

Headlines: Smartphone Overuse May Affect Hand Function
Teaser: A new study shows frequent smartphone users have an enlarged median nerve, as well as impaired hand function and pinch strength compared with those who use their phone less often.

Headlines: Blood Pressure, Proteinuria Reduction Key in IgA Nephropathy
Teaser: For the majority of patients with IgA nephropathy, optimal supportive care is as protective against loss of renal function over time as immunosuppression, data from the STOP-IgAN show.

Headlines: New Radiotracer Ups Detection of Prostate Metastases
Teaser: A radioactive 'minibody' that targets prostate specific membrane antigen can detect metastatic prostate disease better than conventional imaging.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Mepolizumab for Severe Eosinophilic Asthma
Teaser: An FDA panel has recommended mepolizumab for add-on maintenance treatment in patients aged 18 years or older with severe eosinophilic asthma.

Headlines: Weight Loss Doesn't Lower Obesity-Related Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: Breast cancer risk rises with increasing weight in postmenopausal women, but does not fall again with weight loss.

Headlines: Early Eculizumab Treatment Improves Outcomes in Atypical HUS
Teaser: Rapid diagnosis and early initiation of eculizumab helps patients with atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome (HUS) recover normal renal function, a new analysis shows.

Headlines: Improved Survival in Sarcoma for First Time With Eribulin
Teaser: Survival benefit was 2 months, but there was no reduction in tumor burden, and there was significant toxicity and cost. The results contrasted with those for trabectedin.

Headlines: Approve PCSK9 Inhibitor Evolocumab, FDA Panel Recommends
Teaser: UPDATED // In a lopsided vote, FDA advisors put its support behind evolocumab, as it had done for alirocumab the previous day. It even more broadly supported use of the novel LDL-lowering agents for FH.

Headlines: TECOS: No CVD Risks or Heart Failure With Sitagliptin
Teaser: UPDATED // The TECOS study showed sitagliptin was not associated with any signal of cardiovascular risk and, importantly, absolutely no increase in the risk of heart     failure, a signal that has been observed with other DPP-4 inhibitors.

Headlines: Fasting Late at Night Good for the Brain
Teaser: Eating less during late-night hours may help curb the deficits in concentration and alertness that accompany sleep deprivation.

Headlines: Quadruple Anti-HCV Regimen Highly Effective in HCV/HIV Coinfected Individuals
Teaser: A four-drug anti-HCV regimen provides sustained virological responses (SVR) in most individuals coinfected with HCV and HIV, researchers from France report.

Headlines: No CV Benefit With Lixisenatide in ELIXA, but Results Reassure
Teaser: The first cardiovascular outcomes study with a GLP-1 agonist for type 2 diabetes shows no signal of cardiovascular harm with lixisenatide, reassuring     doctors this is a safe, if expensive, way to lower glucose.

Headlines: RA: Dendritic Cell Vaccine Suppressed Immune Dysfunction
Teaser: Autologous dendritic cells conditioned by exposure to citrullinated peptides were able to correct some rheumatoid arthritis-related immune problems in patients with high-risk HLA-DRB1 alleles.

Headlines: Bill to Speed FDA Approvals Includes Rewards for Pediatric Drugs
Teaser: Advocates for children with rare diseases are watching closely a congressional effort to streamline the nation’s drug approval process because the bill includes a provision extending a federal program that rewards companies making remedies for these young patients.

Headlines: Leukemias May Respond to ALK Inhibitors
Teaser: Researchers discovered ALK mutations in two leukemia patients, and laboratory studies suggest leukemias with these mutations may respond to ALK inhibitors.

Headlines: Ranolazine Lowers HbA1c in Diabetic Patients
Teaser: The antianginal agent ranolazine lowered HbA1c levels when given as monotherapy, or with a sulfonylurea, in patients with type 2 diabetes. But it did not work when used with metformin.

Headlines: No Mortality Risk With Sulfonylureas, Meta-Analysis Shows
Teaser: Although the meta-analysis suggested treatment with sulfonylureas was not associated with total or cardiovascular mortality, another researcher says the     issue is not settled yet.

Headlines: CARDIO-FIT: Structured Exercise May Lower AF Recurrence
Teaser: Is it time to officially start prescribing exercise to patients? Experts say "yes" when it comes to managing those with atrial fibrillation, "particularly     in a strategy of rhythm control."

Headlines: Persistent Barriers Exist to Breast-Conserving Therapy
Teaser: More women with early-stage breast cancer are receiving breast-conserving therapy, but demographic and socioeconomic disparities persist.

Headlines: New Data on CGRP Monoclonal Antibodies for Migraine Prevention
Teaser: Phase 2 data on calcitonin gene-related peptide monoclonal antibodies show efficacy and safety as potential novel migraine preventives, but experts say larger and longer studies are needed.

Headlines: Registry to Assess AEDs in Epilepsy With Intellectual Disability
Teaser: Treating physicians, as well as caregivers and patients with intellectual disabilities, who are typically excluded from clinical trials, will be able to keep abreast of relevant information on prospective treatments.

Headlines: Dabigatran Reversal Agent Effective in Clinical Test
Teaser: The study included patients requiring urgent surgery, as well as those with life-threatening bleeding, but in all cases the dabigatran antidote effectively     reversed the anticoagulant effect of the oral thrombin inhibitor.

Headlines: New Multiple Myeloma Regimen Is Also Effective in Elderly
Teaser: A treatment regimen of lenalidomide and low-dose dexamethasone shows significant improvements in progression-free survival in patients over 75 similar to those under 75.

Headlines: Sumatriptan Less Effective in Migraine With Aura
Teaser: A large-database analysis reveals reduced efficacy for sumatriptan in migraines with aura, but the drug still works for some.

Headlines: New Drug for Rett Syndrome?
Teaser: Research shows that a new investigational drug is safe, well tolerated, and effective in managing core symptoms of this neurodegenerative genetic disorder.

Headlines: Natalizumab SC Similar to IV Every 4 Weeks for MS
Teaser: A randomized comparison finds subcutaneous and intravenous administration of natalizumab similar when given every 4  weeks, but the company, Biogen, has decided not to pursue the product after all.

Headlines: Medicine Meets Milan at EHRA EUROPACE-CardioStim 2015
Teaser: The joint meeting promises to show off leading-edge electrophysiology science and technologies in a historic setting packed with high fashion, art, and     even a World Expo.

Headlines: After DKA Warning, Avoid SGLT2-Inhibitor Use in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: A case series finds 13 episodes of euglycemic diabetic ketoacidosis associated with SGLT2-inhibitor use in both types of diabetes; the authors advise avoiding     these agents in those with type 1 diabetes.

Headlines: Immunotherapy: Backbone of Future Lung Cancer Treatment?
Teaser: Dr Roy Herbst shares his views about the future of treatment choices in NSCLC. In his opinion, immunotherapy will be the backbone onto which other modalities are added.

Headlines: HPV16 Antibodies Signal Even Better Oral Cancer Outcomes
Teaser: Serum biomarkers - or the lack thereof - may be helpful in identifying patients who need more aggressive or alternative therapies.

Headlines: Physicians Are Biggest Influencer of Hospice Enrollment
Teaser: A new study finds that physician characteristics are the strongest predictor of whether a patient will be referred to hospice care.

Headlines: Self-Delivered Speech Therapy Feasible for Aphasia in Stroke
Teaser: A speech therapy program self delivered daily by use of a tablet application significantly improved language scores in chronic stroke patients with aphasia, in a new pilot study.

Headlines: WHO Adds 16 New Cancer Drugs to Essential Medicines List
Teaser: In the first full review of cancer drugs in 15 years, WHO has added 16 new drugs to its essential medicines list, but the challenge is how low- and middle-income nations will pay for them.

Headlines: Dietary Supplement May Help Treat Cocaine Dependence
Teaser: The dietary supplement citicoline may help treat cocaine dependence in patients with bipolar disorder, but its effects appear to diminish over time.

Headlines: For Refractory CLL, Venetoclax's Complete Response Rate Is Tops
Teaser: The combination therapy of the novel anti-BCL-2 drug venetoclax and rituximab shows encouraging results in the treatment of refractory CLL, according to early results from an ongoing clinical trial.

Headlines: Smoking Cessation: Intensive Interventions by PCPs Help
Teaser: Smokers are more likely to quit when physicians recommend medications and counseling and arrange follow-up. Less-intensive interventions have no significant effect but are a good start.

Headlines: Personalized Schizophrenia Treatment on the Way?
Teaser: Schizophrenia patients with a specific gene deletion respond to clozapine at a lower median dose, a finding that points to the feasibility of personalized treatment.

Headlines: Antifungal Pretreatment Does Not Increase Fungal Resistance in Mycotic Ulcers
Teaser: Brief treatment with antifungal medication does not increase the rate of fungal resistance in mycotic corneal ulcers, according to findings from the Mycotic Ulcer Treatment Trial I (MUTT I).

Headlines: Vitamin D Augments Effect of Weight Loss in Older Women
Teaser: Vitamin D supplementation augments the benefits of weight loss on systemic inflammation linked to cancer and chronic disease.

Headlines: Health Groups Sue FDA for Gilead Hepatitis C Drug Trial Data
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration was sued by two advocacy groups seeking to force the faster disclosure of clinical trial data that helped Gilead Sciences Inc win approval for two blockbuster hepatitis C drugs.

Headlines: New AHA/ASA Guideline Recommends Endovascular Stroke Therapy
Teaser: The American Heart Association/American Stroke Association (AHA/ASA) has updated its guidelines on endovascular treatment for acute ischemic stroke -- giving a strong recommendation for its use in certain patients -- based on the influx of recent clinical trial results.

Headlines: High-Dose Baclofen Supports Abstinence in Alcoholism
Teaser: High-dose baclofen supports abstinence among alcohol-dependent patients compared with placebo and is reasonably well tolerated.

Headlines: CHMP Backs Three Drugs for Rare Diseases
Teaser: The EMA committee backs treatments for lysosomal acid lipase deficiency, alpha1-proteinase inhibitor deficiency, and Leber's hereditary optic neuropathy.

Headlines: Novel Drug Mechanism Addresses Parkinson's Psychosis
Teaser: An antipsychotic drug with a novel, nondopaminergic mechanism may allow better treatment of Parkinson's psychosis and better use of dopaminergic drugs. A study has shown persistent efficacy.

Headlines: SPG Stimulation Alleviates Cluster Headache
Teaser: An implanted device on the market in some European countries and in clinical trials in the United States provided 2-year pain relief in two thirds of patients with refractory cluster headache.

Headlines: New Biomarker May Predict Suicide
Teaser: The kynurenine pathway is emerging as a possible way of detecting suicidality in at-risk depressed teens, researchers say.

Headlines: Women: Fewer CIEDs vs Men, Higher Survival Rates After Implant
Teaser: "Big data" of nearly 270,000 patients with CIEDs show that even with lopsided distribution, women have lower mortality incidence rates, at least after     receiving specific device types.

Headlines: New 'Multiple-Source' DBS Device Looks Good for Parkinson's
Teaser: The first clinical study with a new-generation system of deep-brain stimulation for Parkinson's disease has shown promising results.

Headlines: Another PFO Closure Study Yields Mixed Migraine Results
Teaser: The latest trial to investigate patent foramen ovale closure as potential treatment for refractory migraine has again yielded overall negative results but suggests possible benefit for those with aura.

Headlines: 'Smart Insulin Patch' for Diabetes Is Years From Human Trials
Teaser: Study in mice suggests that a new smart insulin patch rapidly responds to changing blood sugar levels with low risk for hypoglycemia, but human trials are     still a distance away.

Headlines: Taxane Benefits in Early Breast Cancer Have Staying Power
Teaser: Long-term clinical trial results support the use of paclitaxel once weekly and docetaxel once every 3 weeks following chemotherapy in women with stage II or III operable breast cancer.

Headlines: BP Increases Over 25 Years Linked With LV Dysfunction
Teaser: In CARDIA, many participants were not hypertensive at age 18 to 30 years, but chronic exposure to higher blood pressure was independently related to LV     dysfunction 25 years later, report investigators.

Headlines: LEVANT 2 in Print: Drug-Coated PTA Balloon Still Seeking Role
Teaser: The paclitaxel-coated balloon for peripheral disease gained US approval based on this comparison against a standard balloon, but an expert says that a more     useful trial would have compared it with a drug-eluting stent.

Headlines: New Ways to Evaluate Gliomas Will Enhance Practice
Teaser: Genetic sequencing can identify tumor groupings that seem to share closer prognostic and clinical features than those defined by histopathological evaluation.

Headlines: Less Than 10% of Post-MI Patients Receive an ICD
Teaser: While respecting the right to self-determination, an older patient should have the same opportunity as his/her younger counterpart to choose an ICD for     primary prevention, according to an editorial.

Headlines: Half of Athletes at Top of Game After Repeat Knee Surgery
Teaser: Many athletes can continue to play sports after multiple surgeries to fix a damaged knee ligament, but only about half of them perform as well as they did before their injury, an analysis of previous research suggests.

Headlines: Smoking Accelerates Ankylosing Spondylitis Damage
Teaser: Smoking interacts with the epigenetic factors related to ankylosing spondylitis, contributing to radiographic progression, new research shows.

Headlines: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis: Novel Treatment Promising
Teaser: Acute exacerbation of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis is a major problem that, until now, had no good solution.

Headlines: House Passes 'Cures' Bill to Hasten Drugs to Market
Teaser: The 21st Century Cures Act enjoys support from major medical societies and disease groups, but critics say it would lower the bar for proving that new products are effective and safe.

Headlines: Are Cetuximab Study Critics Acting Like Don Quixote?
Teaser: A group of investigators said the drug should not be used in a specific type of metastatic colorectal cancer. A group of critics disagrees. The argument continues.

Headlines: FDA Strengthens NSAID Warning for Heart, Stroke Risks
Teaser: The stronger warning follows a comprehensive review of new safety information by the FDA.

Headlines: REACH Registry Shows Extent of CV Events in Diabetics
Teaser: For sure, CV risk is raised in diabetes. "But what I think was interesting and more novel from this analysis was that we also showed just what a high risk patients with diabetes have for heart failure."

Headlines: CABG Survival Advantage in Diabetics vs Modern DES Challenged
Teaser: Drug-eluting stents in diabetics have "closed the gap" vs CABG for cutting mortality, questioning bypass surgery's class 1 indication, researchers say. Another expert has "real skepticism" about the results.

Headlines: Early Adult Lung Function Linked to Development of COPD
Teaser: Longitudinal cohort analysis suggests low FEV1 before age 40 years contributes to COPD later.

Headlines: Pinaverium Effectively Treats IBS Symptoms in RCT
Teaser: Patients with irritable bowel syndrome who took pinaverium had significant improvement in abdominal pain and stool consistency compared with patients who took placebo in the double-blind trial.

Headlines: Meta-analysis Reassures on Clopidogrel With PPIs
Teaser: Investigators say any increased ischemic risks observed among clopidogrel-treated patients who receive a PPI has more to do with their baseline     comorbidities than a real finding.

Headlines: FDA Approves Valsartan/Sacubitril (Entresto) for Heart Failure
Teaser: Its approval having bypassed the advisory-panel step and after impressing most observers in a major randomized trial, the novel agent is seen as something of a landmark in chronic heart-failure therapy.

Headlines: New Scanning Study Points to Osteoporosis/Heart Disease Link
Teaser: A UK study found that people with ischemic heart disease have lower bone-mineral density in the wrist; findings point to a common etiology.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Moves to Community Cancer Setting
Teaser: A first-of-its-kind initiative aimed to facilitate the adoption of immuno-oncology in the community cancer setting has just been launched by the Association of Community Cancer Centers.

Headlines: As Cuba-US Relations Thaw, Potential Medical Advances Grow
Teaser: Cubans gain access to resources and recognition of innovations; the US can learn from innovations in wound care, family medicine, and immunology and about healthcare that excels with minimal spending.

Headlines: Diabetes Drug 'Supertrialists' Dominate Literature
Teaser: A study finds that a handful of researchers, a majority of them academics, contribute to the lion's share of diabetes drug clinical trials.

Headlines: Another Stent Bests Drug-Coated Balloon for DES Restenosis
Teaser: For now, "the strategy of stenting a stent, even if not perceived as particularly elegant, should be the default approach for most lesions presenting with     DES restenosis," an expert concludes.

Headlines: Virtual Reality Tool May Predict Early Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: A virtual reality tool used to assess functional impairment in schizophrenia may be useful for assessing cognitive impairment and Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: Simple Test May Help Predict the Need for Repeat Colonoscopy
Teaser: A simple genetic test based on blood biomarkers may help to identify which individuals should undergo repeat colonoscopy for colorectal cancer.

Headlines: Healthy Eating Beats Exercise to Limit Weight Gain in Pregnancy
Teaser: A pilot study in Europe suggests healthy eating is better than physical activity for reducing weight gain in obese pregnant women, a difficult-to-treat     group.

Headlines: Cystic Fibrosis  More Deadly for Hispanics, Data Suggest
Teaser: Researchers found worse lung function in Hispanic children with CF by age 6 years and a nearly threefold greater risk of death.

Headlines: Current Diagnostic Criteria for COPD Inadequate, Experts Say
Teaser: The inclusion of population-specific, statistically defined, lower-limits-of-normal airflow obstruction are necessary to improve diagnosis of COPD.

Headlines: Anti-NGF Therapy for Cancer Pain: More Research Needed
Teaser: Terminally ill cancer patients receiving fulranumab show a high responder rate and improved BPI-SF scores, despite the lack of significant improvement in pain.

Headlines: Stem Cells Show Promise as Type 2 Diabetes Treatment
Teaser: Mesenchymal precursor cells, which have anti-inflammatory properties, appeared safe and showed glucose-lowering efficacy in a small pilot study.

Headlines: Drug Dosages Questioned in Diabetic Macular Edema Trial
Teaser: Experts wonder whether increased doses might eliminate the advantages seen with aflibercept over bevacizumab and ranibizumab in a diabetic macular edema trial.

Headlines: Prosthetic Retinal Implant: Long-term Results Promising
Teaser: The safety and efficacy of a retinal prosthesis system for patients blinded by degenerative eye disease were confirmed in an international clinical trial.

Headlines: FDA OKs Epiduo Forte Gel for Acne
Teaser: Adapalene 0.3% and benzoyl peroxide 2.5% (Epiduo Forte, Galderma) gel is indicated for the treatment of moderate to severe acne vulgaris in patients aged 9 years and older.

Headlines: UPBEAT: Diet Plus Exercise Doesn't Prevent Gestational Diabetes
Teaser: The large randomized controlled UPBEAT trial finds a behavioral intervention combining diet and exercise does not prevent gestational diabetes or     large-for-gestational age infants in obese pregnant women.

Headlines: Severe RA: SB4 Biosimilar as Effective as Etanercept
Teaser: The biosimilar SB4 was therapeutically equivalent to etanercept in a phase 3 study, but a patent decision may keep it unavailable in the United States until 2028.

Headlines: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis: New Guidelines Released
Teaser: New guidelines take into consideration several major clinical trials that have been published in the last few years.

Headlines: Novel Microinjection Promising for Macular Degeneration
Teaser: Microinjections of the experimental drug RTH258 can be used to effectively treat age-related macular degeneration, early results suggest.

Headlines: New Oral Vaccine Protects Children From Helicobacter Pylori Infection
Teaser: A new oral recombinant vaccine protects children against infection with Helicobacter pylori, researchers from China report.

Headlines: Pneumonitis an Adverse Effect of PD-Inhibitor Immunotherapy
Teaser: Clinicians treating melanoma with programmed cell death (PD) inhibitors report autoimmune pneumonitis as a rare but potentially serious toxic effect.

Headlines: Alzheimer's Dementia Pathologies Differ by Race
Teaser: Brain autopsies show higher rates of mixed-dementia pathologies in blacks compared with whites, yet most Alzheimer's therapy research has been based on white populations.

Headlines: Cancer Patients Start Protest Group Like ACT UP
Teaser: MET UP just formed in the last few months but already has a demonstration planned for the fall in Washington, DC.

Headlines: Nutrient Supplements Ease Anxiety, Stress Due to Disasters
Teaser: A new study provides more evidence that micronutrient supplements can help anxiety and stress following natural disasters.

Headlines: Early Treatment Trial to Headline AIDS Conference
Teaser: Results from the START trial, stopped early because data showed that people with HIV have a much lower risk for AIDS if they start treatment early, will be presented, along with other pivotal work.

Headlines: Women's Brains Hit Hardest by Long-term Stimulant Abuse
Teaser: Gray matter volumes were found to be significantly reduced in women who have been dependent on stimulant drugs, say US researchers, who found no brain volume changes in men who were dependent.

Headlines: High Burden of Comorbidities in Heart-Failure Patients
Teaser: "The healthcare delivery system routinely fails to account for this complexity," note experts, on how common it is for patients with heart failure to have multiple chronic aging-related disorders.

Headlines: Chemoradiotherapy Widens Options in Rectal Cancer
Teaser: Patients with resectable low rectal cancer could safely undergo chemoradiotherapy and then watchful waiting as an alternative to surgery.

Headlines: Iressa Back in the US for Lung Cancer, Now as First-Line
Teaser: Finally, the targeted therapy is available again in the United States.

Headlines: FDA Clears New Agent for Schizophrenia, Major Depression
Teaser: The FDA has approved brexpiprazole, a novel D2 dopamine partial agonist, for adults with schizophrenia and as add-on therapy to antidepressant medication in adults with major depression.

Headlines: What Now, ARNI? Experts Ponder Newly Arrived Heart-Failure Drug
Teaser: Although enthusiasm is widespread, "we aren't ready to offer this to everyone who comes to our office," says one expert. "Especially because we didn't have     the benefit of an FDA panel review."

Headlines: Chest Pain, No CCTA-Detected Major CAD Can Allow Early Discharge
Teaser: A new study shows that "CT is effective in patients who don't have [CAD], and it gets them home more quickly," says an expert.

Headlines: SWOG Trial Defines a Regimen for Biliary Cancer
Teaser: Adjuvant capecitabine and gemcitabine followed by radiotherapy and capecitabine was well tolerated and effective in the treatment of extrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma and gallbladder carcinoma.

Headlines: Physical Activity May Help Treat Dementia
Teaser: While some research focuses on new pharmaceutical agents, other studies are making headway in another promising intervention -- exercise.

Headlines: HIV Cure Advancing From Isolated Cases to Clinical Trials
Teaser: HIV research is evolving from exceptional cases of long-lived remission to early clinical trials in which scientific theories are being put to the test.

Headlines: Oncologists Protest High Prices of Cancer Drugs, Again
Teaser: Concern that the high price of drugs is harming cancer patients is raised once again -- this time in an editorial signed by 118 cancer specialists.

Headlines: AIs, Bisphosphonates Save Lives in Postmenopausal Breast Ca
Teaser: Aromatase inhibitors (AIs) and bisphosphonates both reduce early breast cancer recurrence and mortality in postmenopausal women.

Headlines: Investigational Drug Added to Donepezil Shows Promise in AD
Teaser: Adding 5-HT6 receptor antagonist RVT-101 to standard therapy with donepezil in adults with mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease resulted in improved cognition and function.

Headlines: Inhaled Steroids Exacerbate Pollution's Effect on Asthma
Teaser: Exposure to pollution had a greater effect on children with asthma who used inhaled corticosteroids compared with their peers who used a placebo.

Headlines: HIV Pre-exposure Prophylaxis Popular in High-Risk Patients
Teaser: In public health clinics, there is broad interest in pre-exposure prophylaxis from men who have sex with men and transgender women, studies conducted in Brazil and the United States indicate.

Headlines: Only One in 210 Obese Men Reach Healthy Weight
Teaser: Few obese people ever obtain and maintain a normal weight, despite various weight management strategies in clinical practice, according to a UK study.         Better obesity prevention is needed, stress researchers.

Headlines: Single-Pill Hep C Treatment Effective in Patients With HIV
Teaser: A study in which patients coinfected with hepatitis C and HIV achieved response rates of 96% may erase the bias that HIV patients don't do well on direct-acting antivirals for hepatitis C.

Headlines: Nodal Radiation Offers No Survival Benefit in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Nodal radiation reduces disease recurrence and lowers the risk for metastatic disease but does not improve overall survival, according to two large studies.

Headlines: Europe Approves Pembrolizumab for Advanced Melanoma
Teaser: The immunotherapy is okayed for use in the first-line setting and in patients already treated.

Headlines: Vasopressin: A Novel Treatment Target for Autism?
Teaser: Blood levels of vasopressin not only correlate with levels of the hormone in the brain but also predict Theory of Mind scores in autistic children, offering hope of a novel therapeutic target.

Headlines: Solanezumab Shows Potential Disease-Modifying Effect in AD
Teaser: An extension study with novel delayed-start design suggests early treatment with solanezumab in mild AD has benefits on underlying disease progression.

Headlines: Rivastigmine Improves Gait, Reduces Falls in Parkinson's
Teaser: Rivastigmine improved gait in patients with Parkinson's disease and reduced frequency of falls. Falls are a major concern for patients, and fear of falling can lead to loss of mobility and social isolation.

Headlines: Women With MCI Decline Twice as Fast as Men
Teaser: Women with mild cognitive impairment decline twice as fast as men with MCI, and also have a much higher risk for cognitive problems after surgery and general anesthesia.

Headlines: One Target, One Treatment? Not for Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Promising new therapeutic candidates for Alzheimer's target multiple disease-related proteins and may have benefit in other neurodegenerative diseases.

Headlines: Wearable Sensors Accurately Gauge Parkinson's Mobility
Teaser: Wearable activity sensors are valid alternatives to self-report diaries to assess Parkinson's disease duration and trips outside the home, and beat diaries for space traveled, a study shows.

Headlines: Early-Phase NOAC, VKA Therapy: Similar Bleeding, Stroke Risk
Teaser: Thus, physicians must be just as cautious when initiating dabigatran or rivaroxaban as when initiating a vitamin-K agonist, the authors of this French     nationwide cohort study say.

Headlines: 'Stepwise' Pharmacotherapy May Lower Congestion in Acute HF
Teaser: An intensified medication treatment process that decreases cardiorenal syndrome symptoms without causing further kidney deterioration could have wide-spread     implications in the future, say researchers.

Headlines: DBS for Severe Depression Fails in First Sham-Controlled Trial
Teaser: Deep brain stimulation failed to improve treatment-resistant depression in the first randomized sham-controlled study. However, experts believe continued research is clearly warranted.

Headlines: IP Chemo Ups Survival in Ovarian Cancer, So Why Limited Use?
Teaser: Intraperitoneal (IP) chemotherapy has been shown to improve survival, compared with conventional chemo, but only about half of eligible patients received it in a new study.

Headlines: Parkinson's May Spread From Gut to Brain via Vagus Nerve
Teaser: New observational data support theory that Parkinson's disease may begin in the gastrointestinal tract and spread through the vagus nerve to the brain.

Headlines: Epidemic of Breast Cancer Resurgeries in the US
Teaser: Resurgery after lumpectomy for breast cancer is a problem of epidemic proportions and could be reduced with cavity shaving.

Headlines: First Scientific Transgender Health Journal Coming Soon
Teaser: US publisher to launch journal focused on scientific and clinical research to further understanding and to improve healthcare for transgender people.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer Divided Into Five Distinct Types
Teaser: UK researchers claim to have developed the most accurate gene signatures for classifying prostate cancer into aggressive and less aggressive subtypes.

Headlines: Improved LVEF May Negate Need for ICD: More Study Needed
Teaser: "How much improvement [in LVEF] is enough to say someone is safe without ICD therapy? We really don't know," an expert says, although a new study helps     shed some light on this.

Headlines: FDA OKs Azelaic Acid (Finacea) for Papulopustular Rosacea
Teaser: Azelaic acid 15% foam is for topical treatment of the inflammatory papules and pustules of mild to moderate rosacea.

Headlines: No Gains Seen for ICDs Put in During Acute Hospitalizations in HF
Teaser: Researchers say providers should consider "delaying the decision to implant a primary ICD until the patient has been discharged and can be reevaluated in the outpatient setting."

Headlines: Novel Drug 'Remarkable' in Tenosynovial Giant Cell Tumor
Teaser: A novel drug shows promise in the treatment of a rare tumor that attacks joints and leaves patients disabled and in pain, and is usually treated with surgery.

Headlines: Microbleeds Linked to Reduced Cerebral Blood Flow
Teaser: The abnormalities in blood flow were seen even in asymptomatic patients, a new study shows.

Headlines: RITA-3: Routine Invasive NSTEMI Care Survival Gain Gone at 10 Years
Teaser: The influential trial's 10-year results take some shine off the routine invasive strategy; symptom-driven invasive care can be "perfectly reasonable" for low- and intermediate-risk patients, say researchers.

Headlines: TTP488: From Futility to Fast Track for Alzheimer's
Teaser: A drug once deemed futile to continue to study has garnered such positive final analyses that regulators have given the green light to push forward with it.

Headlines: Did HHS Cancel Proposed FDA Limits on Mercury Fillings?
Teaser: "We are still working on securing (HHS) clearance," an FDA official told an attorney in a lawsuit seeking to ban the use of dental amalgam in pregnant women, nursing mothers, and children aged less than 6 years.

Headlines: Medicare Costs Down in Last 6 Months of Life
Teaser: Hospitalizations for end-of-life care and all-cause mortality and hospitalization rates fell among fee-for-service Medicare beneficiaries from 1999 to 2013.

Headlines: Bystanders Get Better Cardiac Arrest CPR, AED Outcomes vs EMS
Teaser: "It has become increasingly apparent that the involvement of bystanders is an important and necessary component" of recent increases in survival from out-of-hospital arrest, says one observer.

Headlines: IOM Report on Noninvasive Neuromodulation: State of the Art
Teaser: The Institute of Medicine has released a report on a workshop focusing on regulatory, ethical, safety, and other issues surrounding the growing use of noninvasive neuromodulation devices.

Headlines: Dengue Vaccine Candidate Shows Uneven Efficacy
Teaser: A new dengue vaccine candidate lowers the risk for dengue infection, but the vaccine's role among younger patients is still unclear.

Headlines: Coffee May Lower Risk for Colon Cancer Return
Teaser: The more caffeinated coffee patients drank on a daily basis, the better the associated risk reduction.

Headlines: BRAF May Be a Good 'Target' in Nonmelanoma Cancers
Teaser: Early findings from a 'basket study' suggest that BRAF V600 may be a targetable oncogene in malignancies other than melanoma.

Headlines: Cataract Surgery Safe, Efficacious in Setting of Wet AMD
Teaser: Cataract surgery appears to be safe and efficacious in eyes receiving anti-VEFG injections for wet age-related macular degeneration, but patients still need to be carefully monitored after surgery.

Headlines: Apps Can Help Health Habits, but Proof Is Poor: AHA Statement
Teaser: Mobile health tools such as apps and activity sensors have "great potential" to help people improve lifestyle habits, and their use should be encouraged,     despite the absence of evidence supporting their use to date, according to the AHA.

Headlines: Dementia Drugs Linked to Serious Weight Loss
Teaser: Cholinesterase inhibitors, commonly used to treat dementia, are associated with significant, potentially serious, weight loss in elderly dementia patients.

Headlines: Therapy, Control of Multiple CV Risk Factors May Increase Survival
Teaser: Protocol-guided therapy led to an improved risk profile and outcomes in patients with both CHD and diabetes, providing "powerful evidence" for its use as a     standard of care, say experts.

Headlines: Author Slammed Over Claims Technology Harms Young Brains
Teaser: A BMJ editorial criticizes the author of a book over claims that technology can harm the young brain, saying what's needed is 'less shock, more substance.'

Headlines: Irritable Bowel Syndrome: Little Evidence for FODMAP Diet
Teaser: A review has found evidence to be lacking for a diet low in fermentable oligosaccharides, disaccharides, monosaccharides and polyols (FODMAPs) for irritable bowel syndrome.

Headlines: Standing, Over Sitting, Improves Metabolic CV Risk Factors
Teaser: In addition to daily and weekly exercise targets, an editorialist says to increase thermogenesis unrelated to exercise, there is a need for "simple and pragmatic" recommendations to decrease sedentary behavior.

Headlines: Proteins in Blood Prognostic in TBI
Teaser: Measuring blood levels of tau or brain-derived neurotrophic factor (BDNF) may provide prognostic information in people with traumatic brain injury, new research hints.

Headlines: Exercise Linked to Less Disease Activity in Kids With MS
Teaser: A new study shows children with multiple sclerosis who participate in strenuous exercise, among the minority in this population, appear to have a lower relapse rate.

Headlines: Antidepressants in Pregnancy: Good News, Bad News
Teaser: SSRIs in pregnant women with depression have been linked to reduced rates of preterm birth and cesarean delivery. However, the drugs are also tied to a higher risk for neonatal complications.

Headlines: NICE Still Has It Wrong on Type 2 Diabetes Guidance, Say Docs
Teaser: UK NICE is wedded to some illogical recommendations with regard to pharmacotherapy of type 2 diabetes in the latest draft of its new guidance on treatment,     says a group of experts.

Headlines: Troponins Point to CVD Risk in Patients With Stable CAD, Diabetes
Teaser: "This is a different kind of heart injury," said an author of the BARI 2D analysis. When troponins were elevated, revascularization neither lowered their concentrations nor improved outcomes.

Headlines: Low DKA Risk Seen With Canagliflozin in Company Trials
Teaser: Janssen's analysis of data for more than 17,000 patients in its type 2 diabetes clinical-trial program for canagliflozin finds the risk for DKA is less     than 1%.

Headlines: Botulinum Toxin Helpful in Painful Cutaneous Leiomyomas
Teaser: Botulinum toxin A may improve skin-related quality of life in patients with cutaneous leiomyomas, according to Maryland-based researchers.

Headlines: Ankylosing Spondylitis Linked to Cardiovascular Mortality
Teaser: Patients with ankylosing spondylitis had a 60% higher risk for cerebrovascular mortality and a 35% higher risk for cardiovascular mortality than non-AS comparators.

Headlines: Corticosteroids Effective in Community-Acquired Pneumonia
Teaser: Corticosteroids can lower mortality, reduce the need for mechanical ventilation, and shorten hospital stay for adults with community-acquired pneumonia, a meta-analysis has shown.

Headlines: Type 1 Diabetes Ups Fracture Risk From Childhood On
Teaser: A large database study finds elevated fracture risk in people with type 1 diabetes of both genders and in all age groups.

Headlines: Inflammation Contributes to Effect of Diabetes on Brain
Teaser: Inflammation may contribute to impaired cerebral vasoregulation in type 2 diabetes, research suggests.

Headlines: Rituximab Safe for Up to 11 Years in Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: An analysis of data for nearly 3000 patients with RA treated with rituximab for up to 11 years showed no increased risk for serious infection cardiac events or malignancy.

Headlines: PsA Remission, Response Cutoffs Identified for DAPSA Tool
Teaser: Criteria for disease activity states and therapeutic response have been developed with the Disease Activity Index for Psoriatic Arthritis, but some question the validity of using only joint activity.

Headlines: Goth Teens at Risk for Depression, Self-harm
Teaser: Youth who identify strongly with the dark goth subculture at age 15 have a higher risk of being clinically depressed and participating in self-harm at age 18.

Headlines: OPTIDUAL: More Debate on Length of Dual Antiplatelet Therapy Post-DES
Teaser: Another trial of extended clopidogrel has done little to settle the confusion about how long dual antiplatelet therapy should be continued following drug     eluting stent placement.

Headlines: IMPROVE-IT: Diabetics Benefit With Ezetimibe, but Is It Enough?
Teaser: Diabetics saw reductions in MI and stroke with ezetimibe in a new analysis of IMPROVE-IT. But one expert said it's still not enough to convince him to use     it; more refined risk assessment is needed.

Headlines: Awareness of Memory Decline Drops Years Before Dementia
Teaser: New study results look at the progression of late-life dementia, finding that insight into memory impairment begins to decline 2 to 3 years in advance.

Headlines: FDA Green-lights Evolocumab (Repatha) for LDL-Cholesterol Lowering
Teaser: There are now two PCSK9 inhibitors available to US physicians, with the FDA approving evolocumab one month after alirocumab. The indications for both drugs are similar, with neither approved for statin-intolerant patients.

Headlines: Daratumumab Activity 'Impressive' in Refractory Myeloma
Teaser: The investigational anti-CD38 monoclonal antibody has demonstrated promising single-agent activity in patients with difficult-to-treat multiple myeloma.

Headlines: Cheaper Generic AIs Boost Treatment Adherence
Teaser: The advent of generic versions of aromatase inhibitors (AIs) boosted adherence among breast cancer survivors on Medicare who previously could not afford the drugs.

Headlines: Outcomes May Be Better in Early RA With Oral Contraceptive Use
Teaser: Both current and past oral contraceptive use seem to improve patient-reported outcomes in the first 2 years of being diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: Discovery of Asthma Subtypes Suggests New Therapies
Teaser: Some patients with severe asthma do not respond to new biologic therapies in development, and now researchers might have discovered the reason, as well as what kinds of therapies might work instead.

Headlines: More Choices for In-Office Cognitive Assessment Tools
Teaser: Whether using mobile devices or computers, new FDA-approved tools allow rapid assessment of cognitive function.

Headlines: Stiffer Matrix in Fat Tissue May Promote Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: Obesity increases the risk for breast and other cancers. New research shows that a stiffer extracellular matrix within the adipose tissue is involved.

Headlines: Many Alzheimer's Patients Have Minimal Amyloid Plaque
Teaser: A new study confirms earlier amyloid PET studies and raises the question of what's causing dementia in these patients.

Headlines: Everolimus-Eluting Stent Best for Treating In-Stent Restenosis
Teaser: The everolimus-eluting stent was significantly better than its competition for reducing percent diameter stenosis among patients who developed in-stent         restenosis after PCI. A drug-coated balloon was the second best option.

Headlines: Beta-blocker Use Linked to Improved Ovarian Cancer Survival
Teaser: In a large, retrospective study of women with ovarian cancer, use of nonselective beta-blockers was associated with longer survival than nonuse.

Headlines: ACOG Warns Against First-Trimester Preeclampsia Screening
Teaser: Available tests for preeclampsia have low positive predictive value and no data demonstrating improved outcomes, according to a committee opinion.

Headlines: Obesity-Cancer Link in Lynch Syndrome Quashed by Aspirin
Teaser: Obese individuals with Lynch syndrome have an increased risk for colorectal cancer that appears to be eliminated by regular aspirin.

Headlines: Bring Back LDL Targets, Says CVS on Advent of PCSK9 Inhibitors
Teaser: Mega-prescription provider CVS Health has worries over costly overuse of PCSK9 inhibitors and wants a return to treatment-based LDL-C targets. Guideline     authors say a return to LDL treatment thresholds isn't happening without better evidence.

Headlines: Ipilimumab Side Effects in Real World, and What to Do
Teaser: Real-world immune-related adverse events with ipilimumab may be higher than clinical trials suggest; experts give advice on how to deal with them.

Headlines: FDA Clears Adalimumab (Humira) for Hidradenitis Suppurativa
Teaser: The TNF blocker becomes the first and only FDA-approved agent for treatment of moderate to severe hidradenitis suppurativa.

Headlines: FDA Strengthens Fracture Warning for Canagliflozin
Teaser: New clinical trial data for canagliflozin confirmed previously noted risk about fractures and reduced bone mineral density in the hip and spine, prompting the FDA to revise the product label.

Headlines: Digoxin Safe in Heart-Failure Patients With AF in Danish Cohort
Teaser: However, "if we cannot get a clinical trial to show any significant effect on both safety and efficacy, then I think it is a drug of the past," says the     lead author.

Headlines: EMPA-REG OUTCOME Results Top EASD Agenda in Stockholm
Teaser: This year's European Association for the Study of Diabetes Meeting will feature the much-anticipated results of the cardiovascular-outcomes study with     empagliflozin, among other exciting topics.

Headlines: Stratospheric Rise of Medical Marijuana in Epilepsy
Teaser: An 'interesting mix of science, politics, and social phenomena' has moved medical marijuana to the forefront of treatment for severe drug-resistant epilepsy, says the author of a new review article on the topic.

Headlines: Absorb Stent Comparable to Xience in Two Trials
Teaser: In two trials, the Absorb stent with a bioabsorbable scaffold fared just as well as the Xience stent. While the data are positive, one expert warns the     jury is still out on their clinical benefit, especially in tougher-to-treat patients.

Headlines: Delays in Cancer Drug Approvals Cost Lives
Teaser: The current regulatory process for new anticancer therapies slows progress by increasing drug developments costs, according to a new study.

Headlines: 'Reassuring' Data on Active Surveillance in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A study from the Johns Hopkins Hospital in Baltimore shows that active surveillance may be appropriate for patients with very-low-risk or low-risk prostate cancer.

Headlines: Test Predicts Drug Response in Depression, Anxiety
Teaser: Pharmacogenomic testing predicts patient response to psychotropic medications and enhances treatment outcomes by identifying the best drug for individual patients, a new study suggests.

Headlines: ACIP Changes Pneumococcal Vaccine Interval in Low-Risk Elderly
Teaser: Guidelines recommend 1 year between two pneumococcal vaccines in healthy older adults.

Headlines: Esophageal Cancer Survival No Better With Lymphadenectomy
Teaser: The extent of lymphadenectomy after patients with esophageal cancer underwent surgery was not associated with outcomes, which challenges the currently accepted standard of care.

Headlines: Are Two European Stroke Conferences Feasible?
Teaser: The creation of a new stroke conference in Europe has meant two European stroke conferences were held within a month of each other this spring -- a situation that is scheduled to be repeated next year.

Headlines: Kidney Recipients, Donors Want Info on Each Other's Health
Teaser: Living kidney donors and their recipients would like to share more health information before the transplant surgery, a new survey indicates.

Headlines: CRAO and Stroke Risk: Is Neurological Evaluation Warranted?
Teaser: Patients with central retinal artery occlusion may be at an increased risk for stroke and may benefit from prompt neurological evaluation, according to a new study.

Headlines: Endovascular Aortic Aneurysm Repair May Have Trade-offs
Teaser: Compared with open repair, mortality rates were lower for patients with endovascular repair through the third year of follow-up, when the pattern shifted.

Headlines: Telomerase Inhibitor Imetelstat Reverses Marrow Fibrosis
Teaser: The investigational agent induced complete and partial remissions in some patients with myeloproliferative disorders, but the mechanism of action is unclear.

Headlines: Diuretic Combo Lowers BP, No Effect on Glucose Metabolism
Teaser: Adding the potassium-sparing diuretic amiloride to HCTZ amplified the blood-pressure reductions of each drug and offset the undesirable changes in blood     glucose and potassium, report the PATHWAY investigators.

Headlines: PLATFORM: FFRCT Reduces Unnecessary Caths in Stable CAD
Teaser: In patients scheduled for diagnostic angiography, obtaining functional data derived from the CT scan can safely filter out patients who are unlikely to     have any obstructive disease evident on the invasive angiogram.

Headlines: Finerenone: Another Tool for Diabetic Nephropathy?
Teaser: The nonsteroidal mineralocorticoid receptor antagonist finerenone lowers the urinary albumin-creatinine ratio with less hyperkalemia than other aldosterone     blockers.

Headlines: CSA Therapy Neutral on Outcomes, Hints at Raised Mortality
Teaser: Experts note that adaptive servo ventilation should not be used outside clinical practice in HF patients with central sleep apnea. "This is a complete     about-turn for the field," said the lead investigator.

Headlines: Number of Health Apps Soars, but Use Does Not Always Follow
Teaser: An IMS Health study counted 165,000 apps in Apple and Android stores; nearly a quarter focus on disease treatment, but wellness and fitness apps still rule.

Headlines: Case Reports of 'Syndrome' Appearing After HPV Vaccination
Teaser: Clinicians are reporting a syndrome of pain, fatigue, and autonomic dysfunction appearing after human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccination.

Headlines: 'Encouraging' Real-life Data on Ranibizumab in Wet AMD
Teaser: Most patients with age-related macular degeneration (AMD) in a 'real-life' study maintained their vision or continued to improve after 5 years of treatment with ranibizumab.

Headlines: Tips for Managing CV Toxicity With TKIs in Leukemia Patients
Teaser: A new review covers cardiovascular (CV) toxicity for patients with chronic myeloid leukemia (CML) on tyrosine kinase inhibitors (TKIs), and provides practical recommendations on management.

Headlines: FDA Okays New Atypical for Schizophrenia, Bipolar Disorder
Teaser: The FDA has approved a new atypical antipsychotic for the treatment of schizophrenia and bipolar disorder in adults.

Headlines: Retract Antidepressant Drug Trial, Experts Say
Teaser: A reanalysis of the now infamous Study 329 of the antidepressant paroxetine shows the drug is ineffective and unsafe for adolescents, prompting experts to call for retraction of the original study.

Headlines: Diabetes Drug Cuts CV Deaths in Landmark EMPA-REG Trial
Teaser: For the first time ever, a type 2 diabetes drug has lowered the risk of cardiovascular death and, indeed, death from any cause, in a population of     diabetics with established heart disease.

Headlines: NSCLC Patients With Brain Mets Often Excluded From Trials
Teaser: Patients with brain metastases are often excluded from clinical trials, especially from those sponsored by industry.

Headlines: XenoPort's Psoriasis Drug Found Effective in Phase 2 Trial
Teaser: Drug developer XenoPort Inc said on Tuesday its experimental drug was effective in treating psoriasis, sending its shares up 19% in premarket trading.

Headlines: Intrascleral Lens Fixation May Increase Higher-Order Aberrations
Teaser: Extending intraocular lenses (IOLs) widely for intrascleral fixation may increase their higher-order aberrations, but not enough to significantly affect postoperative vision, a new study from Japan suggests.

Headlines: FDA Clears Hemophilia A Drug Nuwiq
Teaser: The intravenous antihemophilic factor is for on-demand treatment and routine prophylaxis of bleeding in adults and children with hemophilia A.

Headlines: Men Twice as Likely as Women to Be Full Medical Professors
Teaser: They also get more money from their institutions for research. Women now make up half of medical school graduates, and an editorialist says it is time for academic medicine to move forward.

Headlines: New Directions for Treating NSTE-ACS Patients: ESC
Teaser: The society's 2015 revamped NSTE-ACS guidelines now stress radial-artery vascular access for PCI, allow flexibility in duration of dual-antiplatelet therapy, and make room for 1-hour troponin assays.

Headlines: Mediterranean Diet May Protect Against Breast Cancer Too
Teaser: The diet has been shown to reduce the risk for heart disease, and now it appears to prevent breast cancer.

Headlines: New Tamper-Proof Pain Products in the Pipeline
Teaser: An uncrushable opioid and a morphine product that can't be injected are some of the new abuse-deterrent pain medications being tested.

Headlines: Promising New Opioid Has Novel Mechanism
Teaser: Results of a double-blind, phase 2 study of TRV130 showed that it was superior to placebo in reducing pain, with a rapid onset.

Headlines: Cancer Risk Elevated With Glyburide Over Other Sulfonylureas
Teaser: Overall cancer risk with glyburide was not significantly elevated, but significant dose- and duration-response relationships were seen with glyburide and     breast, prostate, and colorectal cancers.

Headlines: Low Vitamin D Linked to Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Older adults with low vitamin D show accelerated decline in episodic memory and executive function, two cognitive domains strongly associated with Alzheimer's disease dementia.

Headlines: Botulinum Toxin Injection Pain Is Less With Smaller-Gauge Needles
Teaser: Injection of botulinum toxin type A through 32-gauge needles is slightly less painful than injection through 30-gauge needles, according to a randomized trial.

Headlines: Adjuvant Treatment, Peptide Vaccine Do Not Improve Melanoma Survival
Teaser: Adjuvant treatment with granulocyte-macrophage colony-stimulating factor (GM-CSF) and peptide vaccine does not improve survival in patients with high-risk melanoma, researchers report.

Headlines: New Clue as to Why Only Some Breast Cancers Relapse
Teaser: The finding comes from the largest study so far of genetic sequencing of breast cancer tissue samples taken on primary diagnosis and at relapse.

Headlines: Drug Combo Helps Agitation in Alzheimer's
Teaser: The combination may represent a safer alternative to atypical antipsychotics, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Costs Similar for Bariatric Surgery vs Not in New Diabetes
Teaser: This study adds to "accumulating evidence [that] indicates that the benefit of bariatric surgery might be much greater for obese patients with diabetes     than without diabetes," an expert says.

Headlines: FDA's 'Breakthrough' Terminology Is Confusing, Misleading
Teaser: People may have 'unwarranted' confidence in 'breakthrough'-designated drugs, which could prevent them from making a fully informed decision on use, researchers say.

Headlines: After EMPA-REG: Docs Dissect Diabetes Study, Discuss Implications
Teaser: Doctors tried to make sense of the "unique" finding of the EMPA-REG OUTCOME study, which showed a mortality benefit for empagliflozin, but admitted the     trial posed more questions than it answered.

Headlines: Fewer Complications With Subclavian Catheterization
Teaser: Central venous catheterization of the subclavian vein showed the lowest risks for bloodstream infections and symptomatic thrombosis compared with insertions at the jugular or femoral veins.

Headlines: Targeted Drug Neutralizes C difficile Toxins in Animal Model
Teaser: The drug, already in clinical trials for other conditions, does not eradicate a C difficile infection, but may relieve symptoms of infection without disrupting the microbiome.

Headlines: Low Price Suggested for Necitumumab, Even Before Launch
Teaser: A value pricing cost model says that investigational agent necitumumab should be priced far lower than other new agents.

Headlines: SHIVA: Trial of Personalized Cancer Care Disappoints
Teaser: The first randomized trial evaluating therapy based on molecular profiling of tumors has not shown superiority over conventional therapy.

Headlines: ACOG Strengthens Opinion on IUDs and Implants
Teaser: ACOG strengthened its support for long-acting reversible contraception, along with education, to reduce unintended pregnancy.

Headlines: Gilead Experimental Drug Fights All Forms of Hep C: Data
Teaser: Gilead Sciences Inc is edging closer to the approval of the first drug to fight all forms of hepatitis C as the drugmaker's experimental combination showed high rates of effectiveness in four late-stage studies.

Headlines: TEXT ME: Lifestyle-Modification App May Improve CVD Risk Factors
Teaser: "It was surprising that such a simple, low-cost intervention could be so effective in patients with coronary heart disease," say researchers, noting that     it addresses a gap in clinical practice.

Headlines: Independent Review Excludes Many Patients From AED Trial
Teaser: In a first for an epilepsy drug trial, an external review found many patients included were ineligible because of misdiagnosis or insufficient data, raising questions about past trial results.

Headlines: FDA OKs New Oral Drug for Refractory Colorectal Cancer
Teaser: A new oral drug has been approved for use in patients with advanced colorectal cancer who are no longer responding to chemotherapy and biological agents.

Headlines: Lupus Nephritis Affects One Third of Patients With Lupus
Teaser: Patients with lupus who have nephritis had high rates of end-stage renal disease and death and a lower quality of life, a longitudinal study showed.

Headlines: Medicare's Pioneer ACOs See Modest Drop in Low-Value Care
Teaser: The program put spending for all services under a global budget, with incentives to stay under the limit and improve quality. A commentary commended the study, but said it's only part of the solution.

Headlines: Eculizumab Reduces PNH Symptoms in Women During Pregnancy
Teaser: Eculizumab can help reduce symptoms of paroxysmal nocturnal hemoglobinuria during pregnancy, is associated with a higher rate of live births, and leaves little trace in mothers' breast milk.

Headlines: Consensus on Treating Cognitive Impairment in Schizophrenia
Teaser: Cognitive impairment in schizophrenia should be as high a priority to assess and address as functional disability, according to a new consensus report.

Headlines: Blacks, Poor Whites Have Worse Survival After Heart Attack
Teaser: Black patients also had higher rates of comorbidities, were more likely to live in poor areas, and were less likely to receive PCI or CABG after MI, in a     new study.

Headlines: Rheumatoid Arthritis: Depression, Anxiety Predict Disease Outcomes
Teaser: Mental health status of patients with rheumatoid arthritis should be measured before initiating treatment, new results suggest.

Headlines: Ambitious Plan to Improve Childhood Cancer Care in Europe
Teaser: An ambitious plan to tackle disparities in the provision of pediatric oncology care and access to treatment across Europe has been launched by a group of experts.

Headlines: Pulmonary Fibrosis Treatment Trickier Than Drug Trials Imply
Teaser: In real-world patients with idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis, the mortality rate is higher than clinical trials have suggested, and disease is more severe, a German registry reveals.

Headlines: WHO Guidelines: Everyone With HIV Should Receive ART
Teaser: Those infected with HIV should receive antiretroviral therapy as soon as possible; those at substantial risk should be offered preventive treatment, new WHO guidelines say.

Headlines: Cancer Itself May Damage the Heart, Before Any Treatment
Teaser: "This is an important discovery," said one cardio-oncology expert, "in ways that are not yet fully understood." The findings seem to reflect complex interactions between malignancy and heart disease.

Headlines: Everolimus First Drug to Show Effect in Lung NETs
Teaser: Already approved for use in pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors (NETs), the drug now shows efficacy in tumors originating in lung and gastrointestinal tract.

Headlines: Maintenance Treatment Improves Overall Survival in Myeloma
Teaser: Pooled analysis of five major trials should finally settle the debate over the value of maintenance therapy after complete response to induction therapy for myeloma.

Headlines: Childhood Distress May Increase Adult Cardiometabolic Risk
Teaser: "This is the first study to suggest that even if distress appears to remit by adulthood, heightened risk of cardiometabolic disease remains," note     researchers.

Headlines: Double Dipping: Many Leading Academics Serve on Industry Boards
Teaser: Academically affiliated directors were paid nearly $55 million for their services in 2013.

Headlines: Targeted Therapies May Ease Severe Pulmonary Hypertension
Teaser: A new analysis has spotted a mortality reduction in patients with severe pulmonary hypertension caused by lung disease, but doubts remain.

Headlines: Arrowhead's Hep B Data Shows Promise, Shares Jump
Teaser: Arrowhead Research Corp is one step closer to achieving a cure for hepatitis B infection, Chief Executive Christopher Anzalone said.

Headlines: Aldoxorubicin Improves Progression-Free Survival in Advanced Soft-Tissue Sarcoma
Teaser: Aldoxorubicin improves progression-free survival in patients with metastatic or locally advanced unresectable soft-tissue sarcoma, according to results from an early trial.

Headlines: Cancer Treatment Should Not Be Delayed During Pregnancy
Teaser: Women diagnosed with cancer during pregnancy can be safely treated during the second and third trimesters without harming the fetus.

Headlines: Carfilzomib Quadruplet for Myeloma Induction Looks Tolerable
Teaser: Can newer-generation proteasome inhibitors such as carfilzomib provide better-tolerated four-drug combos for induction therapy in newly diagnosed myeloma?

Headlines: Cancer Surgery Crisis -- Urgent Action Needed
Teaser: A huge shortfall in cancer surgery has been revealed: across the world, less than 25% of patients have access to safe, affordable care, say experts.

Headlines: Meta-analysis Supports Ovarian Suppression in Breast Cancer
Teaser: The largest meta-analysis of the data so far supports the use of LHRHa in young breast cancer patients to protect against premature ovarian failure.

Headlines: Consider Frailty, Not Only Age, When Choosing Myeloma Drugs
Teaser: Clinicians have traditionally made treatment decisions for patients with myeloma on the basis of their age. But new research shows the impact of functional status as well as chronologic age on survival.

Headlines: Surgery Boosts Survival Chances for Advanced Throat Cancer
Teaser: Surgery significantly improves survival among patients with advanced oropharyngeal and hypopharyngeal cancers, registry data show.

Headlines: Dietary Change Key to Improving Mental Health, Experts Say
Teaser: Dietary changes and nutraceuticals are a cost-effective and efficacious way to improve mental health, says a consensus statement by a leading group of nutritional medicines experts in psychiatry.

Headlines: FDA Approves Long-Lasting Insulin Drugs Tresiba and Ryzodeg
Teaser: Both drugs for patients with diabetes contain insulin degludec, which possesses a half-life of 25 hours and acts for at least 42 hours.

Headlines: New Taxonomy Can Better Classify Young Women With Acute MI
Teaser: "We believe it is a breakthrough to think that [acute] MI in younger women is, for many people, a different disease," says the senior study author.

Headlines: Bernie Sanders Comes Out Against Califf as FDA Chief
Teaser: US Senator and presidential candidate Sanders says he'll oppose the prominent cardiologist's confirmation, which had been widely expected. But new developments suggest the road may get rockier.

Headlines: Experimental Tardive Dyskinesia Drug Hits Mark in Phase 3
Teaser: Neurocrine Biosciences' drug NBI-98854 eases symptoms of tardive dyskinesia in a phase 3 study.

Headlines: First Data From Ocrelizumab Phase 3 Studies in MS
Teaser: Genentech has released topline data from its three positive phase 3 studies of ocrelizumab in relapsing as well as progressive multiple sclerosis ahead of presentations this week at ECTRIMS 2015.

Headlines: Express Scripts: 'We Will Pay for Alirocumab and Evolocumab'
Teaser: It should improve patient care, an expert says about the company's coverage decision on the novel cholesterol-lowering agents. But another questions it as clinical outcomes trials are lacking. Others weigh in in the New England Journal of Medicine.

Headlines: Compression Device Benefits Lymphedema
Teaser: In this retrospective analysis of both cancer and noncancer patients with lymphedema, use of an advanced pneumatic comprssion device reduced cellulitis and outpatient care.

Headlines: Type 2 Diabetes Risk May Begin at Birth in South Asians
Teaser: A Canadian study has found that South Asian babies have lower birth weight but higher skinfold thickness and greater waist circumference, which could     increase their risk for diabetes later in life.

Headlines: Futuristic Diagnostic Tools Transforming Medicine
Teaser: Technology is altering the doctor–patient relationship and tasking people with increasing responsibility to self-monitor, according to executives from digital start-up companies.

Headlines: What's Hot at ECTRIMS 2015?
Teaser: The biggest congress kicks off, focusing on personalized medicine, biomarkers of multiple sclerosis disease activity, changing prevalence, and phase 3 clinical trial results.

Headlines: Social Media Shaping How Drugs Are Made, Monitored
Teaser: One year of social media postings yield more information on adverse events than the entire US Food and Drug Administration database, say industry insiders.

Headlines: No Benefit From Ischemic Preconditioning at Cardiac Surgery
Teaser: It may fascinate, but two large randomized trials say it doesn't work. In them, remote ischemic preconditioning prior to on-pump cardiac surgery made no     clinical difference compared with a sham procedure.

Headlines: No Coronary Calcium in 50% of Statin-Eligible Patients: MESA
Teaser: A MESA analysis suggests that coronary artery calcium screening can rule out one of every two patients who might otherwise have to start lifelong statin     therapy, say investigators.

Headlines: Precision Medicine Targets Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: Next-generation sequencing may help to identify therapy options for patients with pancreatic adenocarcinoma.

Headlines: New Drug Shows Benefit in NET Carcinoid Syndrome
Teaser: Telotristat etiprate is the first drug developed specifically for carcinoid syndrome, which occurs in patients with metastatic neuroendocrine tumors (NETs).

Headlines: Psoriatic Arthritis: Phase 3 Data Confirm Secukinumab Efficacy
Teaser: The FUTURE 1 trial has confirmed that selective inhibition of IL-17A improves signs and symptoms of psoriatic arthritis for 1 year.

Headlines: FDA Orders Duodenoscope Makers to Conduct Postmarket Studies
Teaser: The studies will provide information about the effectiveness of current reprocessing protocols and real-world practices and identify ways to reduce the risk for infections.

Headlines: TCT 2015: Bioresorbable Stents, TAVR, and More
Teaser: There will be 950 abstracts presented or displayed at TCT 2015. Among late breakers, first reports, live cases, and town halls, even Arnold Schwarzenegger     makes an appearance.

Headlines: Placebo Effect a Major Factor in Antidepressant Response
Teaser: The endogenous mu-opioid system is involved in inducing a placebo response in depressed patients and likely accounts for a significant proportion of the treatment response to antidepressant drugs.

Headlines: FDA Approves DES With Bioabsorbable Polymer (Synergy)
Teaser: The stent polymer is fully absorbed after 3 months, leaving behind a bare platinum-chromium stent. By eliminating the polymer, the hope is the stent will     promote speedier healing and reduce the risk of vascular complications.

Headlines: Brentuximab -- First-Line Option in Elderly Hodgkin's Lymphoma
Teaser: A phase 2 trial has shown that brentuximab vedotin monotherapy is safe and effective as first-line therapy in elderly lymphoma patients who cannot tolerate standard chemotherapy.

Headlines: Metformin Intolerance Increased by Genes, Other Meds
Teaser: In two studies, certain gene variants and medications that inhibit the action of a metformin transporter in the gut increased the likelihood of drug     gastrointestinal side effects.

Headlines: Lesion-Directed Screening Similarly Effective as Full Skin Exam
Teaser: Time-strapped dermatologists can use lesion-directed screening to check for skin cancer because its detection rate mirrored that of total-body examination, but it was 5.6 times less time consuming.

Headlines: Apple ResearchKit Data to Be Used in Three Clinical Studies
Teaser: Academic medical centers will use iPhone apps to study autism, epilepsy, and melanoma; might later build marketable apps and apply for FDA clearance.

Headlines: BRAVO 3: Bivalirudin No Better Than Heparin in TAVR
Teaser: In BRAVO 3, the use of bivalirudin yielded no benefit over unfractionated heparin, which experts say should limit its use to a small segment of patients,     such as those with heparin-induced thrombocytopenia.

Headlines: End Conversion Therapy for LGBTQ Youth, Experts Say
Teaser: A US government report calls for the end of conversion therapy for lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and questioning youth.

Headlines: Does Exercise Improve Survival in Cancer?
Teaser: Evidence suggests that exercise and other lifestyle changes may protect against certain cancer types, but the jury is out as to whether it actually improves outcomes after diagnosis.

Headlines: Sirolimus Stent Differences From Elution Kinetics, Says PANDA
Teaser: "The beauty of this study was that it focused on how the same drug was eluted from almost-identical stents," just with different elution and     polymer-absorption rates over time, said one expert.

Headlines: UK Nurse With Ebola Critically Ill Again
Teaser: Pauline Cafferkey, the Scottish nurse who survived the Ebola virus and was thought to have made a full recovery, is now critically ill, officials say.

Headlines: Polymer-Free Stent Superior to BMS in High-Risk Patients
Teaser: The intention was to show noninferiority, but the BioFreedom stent outperformed a bare-metal stent in high-risk bleeding patients treated with a 30-day     course of DAPT.

Headlines: Vitamin D and Calcium Fail to Reduce Risk for Adenomas
Teaser: A large randomized trial failed to show that vitamin D and calcium supplements reduced the risk for colorectal adenomas in a high-risk population.

Headlines: DAPT Results Confirmed in Trial's Everolimus-Stent Patients
Teaser: The overall trial's primary finding of reduced thrombosis risk for dual antiplatelet therapy continued beyond 1 year in patients receiving a range of stents was confirmed in those who received everolimus-eluting stents.

Headlines: Trial Questions Staged Chronic-Occlusion PCI After Primary PCI
Teaser: It's "feasible and safe" and might even raise LVEF, but only in selected patients, says a small first-of-its-kind randomized trial. But its signals of risk     led some observers to question its safety.

Headlines: Pharmacist Roles to Be Deliberated at ACCP Conference
Teaser: Questions about the training and role of clinical pharmacists will feature prominently at the upcoming American College of Clinical Pharmacy (ACCP) 2015 Global Conference.

Headlines: Carotenoid-Rich Diet May Protect Against Advanced Eye Disease
Teaser: Dietary components lutein and zeaxanthin reduced the risk for advanced age-related macular degeneration in a large prospective cohort.

Headlines: DRAGON: Radial PCI Noninferior to Femoral, With Less Bleeding
Teaser: In response to the Chinese study, several US experts noted that the US is "way behind" the world in offering the radial approach and stressed the     importance of learning both access strategies.

Headlines: CPR Video Improves Decision-Making in Advanced Cancer
Teaser: Sometimes a picture is worth a thousand words when educating patients about end-of-life care.

Headlines: ABSORB III and More: Bioresorbable Stent Noninferior to Xience
Teaser: The real unknown is whether the Absorb stent with its vanishing scaffold prevents late outcomes associated with late healing and inflammation. Data from     ABSORB China and ABSORB II were also presented Monday.

Headlines: Impact of Z0011 Findings on Clinical Practice
Teaser: Variability in implementation from the ACOSOG Z0011 trial is particularly pronounced in patients with more aggressive sentinel lymph node-positive disease.

Headlines: Fluid Management: Buffered Crystalloid No Benefit vs Saline
Teaser: Among patients in the ICU receiving crystalloid fluid therapy, use of a buffered crystalloid compared with saline did not reduce the risk for acute kidney injury in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Psoriasis Severity Tied to Vascular Inflammation
Teaser: Plaque severity increases neutrophil levels and aortic vascular inflammation.

Headlines: FDA Expands Use of Nivolumab in Lung Cancer
Teaser: The new use is in nonsquamous, non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC). The drug was approved for squamous NSCLC earlier in the year.

Headlines: Dual Therapy No Better Than NSAIDs Alone for Low Back Pain
Teaser: In patients with acute nontraumatic lower back pain, adding cyclobenzaprine or oxycodone/acetaminophen to naproxen alone did not improve functional outcomes or pain at 1 week.

Headlines: Insulin Analysis of ACCORD Published: Dose Not Linked to CV Death
Teaser: In a post hoc analysis of the ACCORD trial, insulin dose was higher among those with cardiovascular death, but the association disappeared after adjustment     for multiple confounders.

Headlines: Malaria: New Risks to Pregnant Women in Endemic Regions
