Teaser: Declines in malaria transmission and immunity in the south of Mozambique have adversely affected pregnancy outcomes in infected women.

Headlines: Brain Inflammation Linked to Schizophrenia Risk
Teaser: New findings support a neuroinflammatory component in the development of psychotic disorders and provide a potential new target for treatment and prevention.

Headlines: High Maternal Thyroid Function Affects Offspring Brain Development
Teaser: The study is the first to show a link between high maternal thyroid function, as well as low, and neurodevelopment of offspring in childhood as assessed by     IQ and MRI brain scanning.

Headlines: Concerns Over Sudden Increase in Radiation for Skin Cancer
Teaser: The use of first-line electronic brachytherapy for nonmelanoma skin cancer has risen 20-fold, raising concerns over inappropriate use.

Headlines: FDA Eye Drug Rebuff Adds to Shire's Woes in Baxalta Pursuit
Teaser: Shire Plc said late Friday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) had declined to approve its new eye drug lifitegrast and had requested an additional clinical study.

Headlines: RIVER-PCI: No Benefit of Ranolazine After Incomplete Revascularization
Teaser: Although negative, "this trial has opened up a new avenue of investigation that is necessary in a high-risk group," said one expert, stressing the need for     other treatment possibilities.

Headlines: FDA OKs Topical Drug Combo (Enstilar) for Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: Enstilar combines calcipotriene and betamethasone dipropionate in a foam formulation for topical treatment of plaque psoriasis in adults.

Headlines: Enhanced Recovery After Colorectal Surgery Has Mixed Results
Teaser: Two studies of methods to speed patients' recovery from colorectal surgery include some diminishments.

Headlines: New Glatiramer Acetate Generic 'Equivalent' to Copaxone in MS
Teaser: The GATE study, showing equivalence of the generic to the branded drug, should pave the way for the first generic of a disease-modifying treatment for multiple sclerosis in the European market.

Headlines: ACS Updates Screening Mammography Guidelines
Teaser: In their updated guidelines, the American Cancer Society now recommends that women begin annual screening at age 45 and switch to biennial screening at age 55.

Headlines: FDA Says No to Lifitegrast for Dry Eye, Requests More Data
Teaser: In a complete response letter, the FDA asked for another study on the experimental ophthalmic solution for dry eye and further information related to product quality.

Headlines: Experts Debate Risk of Thrombosis With Bioprosthetic Valves
Teaser: Experts revisit the issue of reduced leaflet function observed in patients who received a bioprosthetic aortic valve. They stress practice should not         change and to wait for studies designed to test anticoagulation strategies post-TAVR.

Headlines: Green Light for Less Therapy for HPV Oropharyngeal Cancer
Teaser: Mounting evidence suggests that deintensification is feasible and that it reduces toxicity without compromising survival.

Headlines: RESPECT at 10 Years Supports Case for PFO Closure for Stroke
Teaser: "The procedure and the device are safe, and treatment with the occluder was superior to medical management," say researchers, adding that they're next     aiming for FDA approval.

Headlines: Scleroderma, Sleep Apnea, Sepsis Highlights of CHEST 2015
Teaser: Scleroderma Lung Study II results will be presented, specialists digesting the SERVE-HF results will hear more about sleep apnea, and a controversial session on sepsis will round out the conference.

Headlines: Brain Scans May Predict Recurrence Risk in Major Depression
Teaser: Hyperconnectivity in brain regions linked to guilt may identify patients in remission with major depression who are at risk for relapse.

Headlines: Online Fatigue Self-Management Program Promising in MS
Teaser: Web-based cognitive-behavioral therapy reduces fatigue and improves activity levels in patients with multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: AstraZeneca Diabetes Drug Combination Faces Delay After FDA Rebuff
Teaser: U.S. health regulators declined to approve a fixed-dose diabetes drug combination from AstraZeneca, delaying its launch and dealing a blow to an important plank of the drugmaker's business.

Headlines: Heart Disease and Diabetes Trials Anticipated at Kidney Week
Teaser: New data will be presented on empagliflozin in patients with diabetes, and results from trials of atorvastatin and kidney injury after cardiac surgery will be released.

Headlines: Women and Drug Users With HIV Receive Inadequate Care
Teaser: In Europe, some groups of people infected with HIV have trouble accessing antiretroviral therapy. Extending coverage to under-represented patients could mean they present for treatment sooner.

Headlines: What is the Most Hyped Drug in Cancer Care?
Teaser: A study looked for and tallied terms such as 'breakthrough' and 'revolutionary' in news stories.

Headlines: Experimental Agent Shows Promise for Alcohol Dependence
Teaser: The compound OSU6162 reduces 'liking' and craving for alcohol in alcohol-dependent adults by normalizing dopamine levels in the brain.

Headlines: Memory Complaints Could Signal Dementia Decades Later
Teaser: A new study finds women with subjective memory complaints were more likely to be diagnosed with dementia almost 20 years later compared with those without such complaints.

Headlines: HCV Guideline Update: Treat All Patients With New Drugs
Teaser: An update has suggested that all patients, with the exception of patients with short life expectancies not related to HCV, should be treated with newer HCV medications.

Headlines: 'Judicious' GP IIb/IIIa Inhibitor Use at PCI Recommended
Teaser: "There may still be a role" for them, says an NCDR analysis based on real-world practice. Expert observers took issue, citing clinical trials and considering more contemporary treatment options.

Headlines: FDA Approves Imlygic, First Oncolytic Viral Therapy in the US
Teaser: The FDA has given the green light to talimogene laherparepvec for the treatment of advanced melanoma, making it the first oncolytic viral therapy to be approved for sale in the United States.

Headlines: Constipation Drug Extends Survival in Palliative Cancer Care
Teaser: A drug approved for opiate-related constipation might improve the survival of patients with advanced cancer.

Headlines: Positive Data With Omecamtiv Mecarbil, but Losmapimod Falters
Teaser: Amgen/Cytokinetics announced positive topline results with omecamtiv mecarbil, an investigational cardiac myosin activator, in HF patients, while     GlaxoSmithKline announced negative results with losmapimod in ACS.

Headlines: FDA Review Finds No Increased CV Risk With Entacapone in PD
Teaser: An FDA review has found no increased cardiovascular risk linked to use of entacapone in the treatment of Parkinson’s disease.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Lesinurad (Zurampic) for Gout
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommended approval of lesinurad for the treatment of gout-associated hyperuricemia, in combination with a xanthine oxidase inhibitor.

Headlines: ACIP Supports Meningitis B Vaccine for Teens, Young Adults
Teaser: Vaccination at ages 16 to 23 years may help protection last into the highest-risk period.

Headlines: Antioxidants May Promote Metastasis in Melanoma
Teaser: An experimental study suggests that oxidative stress limits distant metastasis in melanoma, but administering antioxidants helps the cancer cells to survive and spread.

Headlines: Deferring Stent After Infarct-Artery Opening May Limit MI Size
Teaser: Calling this a "very clever" strategy, one expert noted it did suggest superiority over immediate stenting. "I don't think it's the final answer, but I     congratulate them on the concept."

Headlines: Sleep Apnea May Boost Gout Risk
Teaser: Patients with sleep apnea had a 60% greater risk of developing the painful inflammatory condition in a  population-based study.

Headlines: FDA Approves Relypsa's Drug Veltassa to Treat Hyperkalemia
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration approved Relypsa Inc's drug Veltassa (patiromer for oral suspension) to treat hyperkalemia in patients with chronic kidney disease or heart problems.

Headlines: NHS Boost for Diabetic Nephropathy Trial
Teaser: The NHS is to start producing stem cells for trials of an experimental treatment for diabetic nephropathy.

Headlines: No to Thrombectomy, Yes to Multivessel PCI, Say ACC/AHA/SCAI
Teaser: A new focused update on the use of PCI in STEMI patients downgrades the use of routine aspiration thrombectomy prior to stent implantation, while     multivessel interventions receive an upgrade to a class IIb recommendation.

Headlines: Approved But Not Proven: What's Up With FDA, Cancer Drugs?
Teaser: How many approved cancer drugs actually pan out in terms of a survival benefit?

Headlines: SPRINT: Push BP Target Lower in High-CV-Risk HTN Patients
Teaser: UPDATED // Full results of the much-anticipated trial have been released to a variety of expert opinions. Some are calling for updated hypertension guidelines, but     exclusions and high adverse-event rates raise concern.

Headlines: Prosthesis Beats Repair for 2-Year Durability in Ischemic MR
Teaser: UPDATED // Remodeling was similar with two approaches for severe ischemic mitral regurgitation in a multicenter trial; so was mortality. But MR recurrence and heart failure were more likely with repair.

Headlines: Bariatric Surgery May Aid Very Obese Teens, 3-Year Data Show
Teaser: In the longest-ever prospective study of very obese teens who had gastric bypass or sleeve gastrectomy, the teens maintained a weight loss of 28% at 3     years, with manageable side effects.

Headlines: Varenicline Started in ACS Hospitalization Helps Smokers Quit
Teaser: UPDATED // In a randomized trial, a rare successful showing for a smoking-cessation medication in this particularly sick population, abstinence at 24 weeks was     confirmed by carbon-monoxide breath analysis.

Headlines: Pay, Subspecialties Differ for Female vs Male Cardiologists
Teaser: Realizing there's a problem is critical, says a researcher. "People ask: What are women in cardiology doing about this? But this isn’t about the women. This is a workforce issue for the profession."

Headlines: BEAT-HF: Remote Telemonitoring Fails to Prevent HF Rehospitalizations
Teaser: There was a sliver of benefit among patients most adherent to the telemonitoring protocol, but researchers say the evidence does not support the         routine use of the telemonitoring technology in HF patients.

Headlines: Blood Pressure Targets May Be Independent of Albuminuria
Teaser: In patients with moderate to advanced kidney disease, the association between elevated systolic blood pressure and decline in renal function is independent of albuminuria, new research shows.

Headlines: Transcranial Stimulation May Quell Cravings in Obese Subjects
Teaser: Stimulating the prefrontal cortex may alter food-reward circuits in the brain, diminish cravings, and lead to weight loss, a small proof-of-principle trial     suggests.

Headlines: No Cognitive Benefit of Raloxifene in Women with Alzheimer's
Teaser: The selective estrogen receptor modulator failed to improve cognition in a small study of women with AD, although the possibility of a small cognitive benefit can't be excluded, researchers say.

Headlines: Europe Concludes Syndromes Are Not Caused by HPV Vaccine
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has concluded its safety review of the HPV vaccines, and says the evidence does not support causation of syndromes.

Headlines: High-Fat Diet Linked to Anxiety, Depression
Teaser: Consuming a high-fat diet may cause brain changes that lead to anxiety and depression. Switching to a healthy diet reverses metabolic changes, but mood problems persist, preliminary findings suggest.

Headlines: First Precision Medicine Chemoprevention Trial Disappoints
Teaser: In the first precision-based chemoprevention study, erlotinib failed to significantly prevent the development of oral cancer in patients with oral premalignant lesions.

Headlines: CKD: Elevated Plasma SuPAR Levels May Signal Trouble
Teaser: Researchers have found a link between high plasma suPAR levels and decline in eGFR and incident CKD; other experts say the findings are strong, but more precise measures are needed to prove the link.

Headlines: NEJM Supports Califf for FDA Chief, Others Critical
Teaser: Critics say he has been too closely aligned with industry, but supporters--including US medical groups and influential journals--say his clinical trial leadership and expertise make him an excellent choice.

Headlines: Knee Lesions on MRI Likely to Worsen Into OA
Teaser: Knee lesions likely to develop into symptomatic osteoarthritis were identifiable as MRI changes in nonsymptomatic but high-risk subjects.

Headlines: Researchers Say Path to Better Health Starts With Patients' Input
Teaser: The Patient-Centered Outcomes Research Institute, which has funded 468 studies, is creating research networks that will cover specific diseases involving millions of patients across the country.

Headlines: Orlando Adds Cardiology Theme Park November 7: AHA 2015
Teaser: Orcas and an anthropomorphic mouse aside, the hot tickets in central Florida next week are to the AHA Scientific Sessions; the rides include full SPRINT     results, which could shake up BP management.

Headlines: Biosimilars, Tech Advances, Chikungunya Among ACR Highlights
Teaser: More than 16,000 attendees at the American College of Rheumatology (ACR) meeting will hear about the latest technology and resources to make their practices more efficient.

Headlines: Meds Seldom Deintensified in Elderly Diabetics: VA Study
Teaser: "We found that only one in four of nearly 400,000 older patients who could have been eligible to ease up on their multiple BP or blood sugar medicines     actually had their dosage changed."

Headlines: Cervical Length May Predict Labor Onset
Teaser: Cervical length may help predict when labor will begin for pregnant women at term, according to a meta-analysis.

Headlines: Chronic Symptoms After HPV Vaccination: Danes Start Study
Teaser: Danish specialists are investigating more than 1300 girls with chronic symptoms after HPV vaccination.

Headlines: Candesartan May Cut Cardiotoxicity in Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: Adjuvant candesartan (but not metoprolol) showed "significant but modest" attenuation of LVEF changes after cancer therapy. More research is needed, but     "this study is a key first step," notes one expert.

Headlines: Aerobic Exercise Has Disease-Modifying Effect in MCI
Teaser: Aerobic exercise boosted blood flow in the brain, reduced phosphorylated tau levels, and improved cognitive function in adults with mild cognitive impairment and prediabetes.

Headlines: App Plus Coaching Can Change Four Heart-Health Habits at Once
Teaser: "The implications are that it's far more possible than I would have believed to produce sustained, large . . . improvements in cardiovascular risk     behaviors without using large financial incentives," says the study author.

Headlines: Test Indicates Prostate Cancers Resistant to Abiraterone
Teaser: A blood test identifies men with castration-resistant prostate cancer who are unlikely to respond to abiraterone. But the test still needs to be validated.

Headlines: Radiotherapy Confers No Additional Benefit for Mesothelioma
Teaser: A randomized trial shows no extra benefit from adding radiotherapy after surgery and neoadjuvant chemotherapy for mesothelioma.

Headlines: Even Mild Memory Problems Exact Economic Toll
Teaser: A novel analysis highlights the financial hit individuals and families take when the diagnosis is amnestic mild cognitive impairment.

Headlines: Big Trials Disappoint at Kidney Week
Teaser: The mystifying relation between vascular complications and kidney disorders has investigators stumped after negative results from three highly anticipated trials of statins, steroids, and fish oils.

Headlines: Neurobehavioral Effects of Maternal SSRI Use Linger in Newborns
Teaser: Neurobehavioral effects of prenatal exposure to selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors extend beyond the first 7 to 10 days of life, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Social Media Drives Traffic to AD Education, Recruitment Website
Teaser: Adults were 'easily and fairly cost-effectively recruited' to an online AD education and recruitment website via advertising on social media.

Headlines: Liraglutide No Match for Heart Failure in Early Round of FIGHT
Teaser: In the FIGHT trial of patients with advanced HF, the GLP-1 agonist liraglutide did not improve survival or rates of rehospitalization at 6 months.

Headlines: FDA Approves Cotellic as Part of Melanoma Combination
Teaser: The MEK inhibitor cobimetinib (Cotellic, Roche) works with already-approved vemurafenib for the treatment of advanced melanoma that is BRAF mutation-positive.

Headlines: PROACT-4: Mixed Results With Point-of-Care Troponin Testing
Teaser: The study did not meet the statistical definition of significance, but investigators did observe a reduction in the amount of time needed to discharge a     patient from the emergency department when troponin was measured in the ambulance.

Headlines: Inappropriate PCI Is on the Decline, New US Data Show
Teaser: The number of inappropriate PCIs declined from 2009-2014 after publication of appropriate-use criteria, suggesting these quality-improvement standards had     a significant impact on cardiology practice.

Headlines: Smell Test May Predict Treatment Response in Alzheimer's
Teaser: An olfaction test has the potential to identify patients with mild cognitive impairment who are likely to benefit from a cholinesterase inhibitor.

Headlines: Big Data, Combo Drugs, Implants Will Be Focus of AAO 2015
Teaser: Research from the national IRIS Registry will be presented at the American Academy of Ophthalmology meeting, along with the latest on combination options for macular degeneration and diabetic edema.

Headlines: Insulin Pumps Underused in Kids With Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Insulin pumps are associated with better glycemic control among kids with type 1 diabetes, but are used by less than 50% of those eligible, even in         some of the richest countries, and by just one in seven in the United Kingdom.

Headlines: Baricitinib Tops Methotrexate in Early Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: Baricitinib, alone or in combination with methotrexate, works better than methotrexate alone in patients with early rheumatoid arthritis, according to results from the phase 3 RA-BEGIN trial.

Headlines: Feds (Finally) Say that Researcher Faked Data
Teaser: A former Duke University cancer researcher repeatedly falsified data, the US Office of Research Integrity has finally officially concluded.

Headlines: Statins Linked to Less White Matter Damage
Teaser: In older adults with suboptimal cognition, statins may have a benefit on white matter in the brain, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Califf Breezes Through Nomination Hearing for FDA Chief
Teaser: The nominee for FDA commissioner seemed to dispel concerns that he's too close to industry.

Headlines: Uterus Transplant: First US Clinical Trial Begins
Teaser: The first clinical trial of uterus transplantation in the United States has begun at Cleveland Clinic in Ohio.

Headlines: Diagnosing Stroke in Acute Dizziness
Teaser: A new study shows a combination of readily available clinical information can help risk-stratify stroke patients presenting with dizziness.

Headlines: Dyspnea, Minor Bleeds Led Causes for Stopping Ticagrelor in Trial
Teaser: "As clinicians we shouldn't underestimate the impact on patients of nosebleeds and bruising," said a PEGASUS TIMI 54 researcher, so before treatment patients should hear about even nonmajor risks.

Headlines: Huge Cancer Research Fraud, But Only One Doc Blamed
Teaser: Why has only one researcher has been punished for the false research in cancer genomics at Duke University that led to clinical trials in hundreds of patients?

Headlines: CBT May Trump Light Therapy for SAD in the Long Run
Teaser: Patients with seasonal affective disorder are more likely to be in remission two winters after 6 weeks of cognitive-behavioral therapy than after the same duration of light therapy, research indicates.

Headlines: PrEP Effective in High-risk Group in Three-City Project
Teaser: A demonstration project in three major US cities showed more evidence for the effectiveness of preexposure prophylaxis for HIV in high-risk groups.

Headlines: Jaw Support Helps Relieve OSA Sleepiness
Teaser: Patients with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) who are tired during the day because they can't wear a continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) mask all night may be able to reduce daytime sleepiness by using mandibular advancement devices (MAD) instead, a research review suggests.

Headlines: Three-Minute Test for Lewy Body Dementia
Teaser: A one-page tool includes 10 questions covering motor and nonmotor symptoms that may help differentiate Lewy body dementia -- in the news since the death of Robin Williams -- from other dementias.

Headlines: Epilepsy Risk May Be Higher After Pertussis Infection
Teaser: Young children with hospital-diagnosed pertussis infections had a higher risk for epilepsy later compared with children who did not have pertussis, but the absolute risk was still low.

Headlines: FDA Developing Pathway Toward Maternal Immunization
Teaser: At a hearing, the FDA's vaccine advisory panel discussed steps that will be needed for vaccines to be licensed for use in pregnant women specifically to prevent disease in their infants.

Headlines: Viekira Pak Results Reassuring for Compensated Cirrhosis
Teaser: For patients with genotype 1 hepatitis C infection and cirrhosis, the combination of ombitasvir, paritaprevir, and ritonavir plus dasabuvir, with or without ribavirin, is safe and effective.

Headlines: Empagliflozin's CV Gains Explored in Diabetics With, Without HF
Teaser: Given the specter of associated heart failure with some antidiabetic medications, deeper analysis of the recently reported EMPA-REG OUTCOME trial of the SGLT2 inhibitor may reassure.

Headlines: Micra Leadless Pacemaker Upholds Promise in Prospective Study
Teaser: The Medtronic device may now have an early evidence base sufficient for FDA consideration; like the St Jude Nanostim, the Micra seems to work well within     its limitations, including VVI-only pacing.

Headlines: Clozapine Best Choice for Treatment-Resistant Schizophrenia
Teaser: Treatment-resistant schizophrenia patients have better outcomes with clozapine compared with other standard antipsychotics, but despite its superior efficacy, the drug remains vastly underutilized.

Headlines: PICC Dwell Time Not Tied to Infections in Infants
Teaser: Clinicians need not routinely replace uninfected peripherally inserted central catheters to prevent infection in infants, but should remove tunneled catheters before week 7 if no longer needed.

Headlines: Gene Therapy Restores Some Vision in Congenital Amaurosis
Teaser: A single injection of AAV2-hRPE65v2 (SPK-RPE65, Spark Therapeutics, Inc) improved mobility in different light levels and improved light sensitivity more than 100-fold.

Headlines: Obeticholic Acid Promising for Biliary Cholangitis Long-term
Teaser: A long-term trial showed that obeticholic acid can continue to reduce biomarkers for primary biliary cholangitis after 5 years of treatment.

Headlines: Ranibizumab Deemed Major Advance for Diabetic Retinopathy
Teaser: Ranibizumab was noninferior to panretinal photocoagulation for visual acuity in patients with proliferative diabetic retinopathy, according to 2-year results of the Protocol S Study.

Headlines: FDA OKs Osimertinib for Specific Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancers
Teaser: A new drug is available for patients with non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who progress on epidermal growth-factor receptor inhibitors and who have a specific related mutation.

Headlines: No Ranolazine Benefit Against Angina Seen in Small-Vessel CAD
Teaser: The antianginal agent didn't overall reduce symptoms due to microvascular disease in the small trial, although it may have helped in patients with the poorest coronary flow reserve.

Headlines: Europe Again Says HPV Vax Safe,  but Petition in Spain
Teaser: Europe has again said that HPV vaccination is safe and that it is not causally linked to chronic syndromes, but some doctors remain unconvinced.

Headlines: EMA Recommends Approval of Pitolisant (Wakix) for Narcolepsy
Teaser: Pitolisant is a first-in-class drug that increases histamine release in the brain to enhance wakefulness and alertness.

Headlines: Sildenafil Improves Risk Markers in Prediabetes, Small Study Shows
Teaser: In an admittedly small study, the drug that treats both erectile dysfunction and pulmonary hypertension improved insulin sensitivity and reduced     microalbuminuria in people with prediabetes.

Headlines: Sofosbuvir, Velpatasvir Promising in Several Hep C Genotypes
Teaser: The combination of sofosbuvir plus velpatasvir could treat hepatitis C genotypes 1, 2, 4, 5, and 6, reducing the need for tests and monitoring.

Headlines: Autoimmune Diseases Common in Patients With Vitiligo
Teaser: Patients with vitiligo commonly have other autoimmune diseases, according to a cross-sectional study.

Headlines: Cataract Surgery Has Benefits in Patients With Dementia
Teaser: Cataract surgery improves vision, cognitive function, and neuropsychiatric symptoms in patients with dementia, a new study shows.

Headlines: Daclatasvir, Sofosbuvir, Ribavirin Effective in Hep C Type 3
Teaser: The combination is effective in most patients with hepatitis C genotype 3 infection and cirrhosis, results from the ALLY-3+ trial show.

Headlines: Amphetamine Doesn't Make a Terrorist, but It Contributes
Teaser: Is captagon the terrorist's amphetamine of choice? In any case, the name crops up all too often.

Headlines: FDA Approves Narcan Nasal Spray to Treat Opioid Overdose
Teaser: The FDA approved a nasal spray form of naloxone, a drug that immediately stops or reverses the effects of opioid overdose.

Headlines: Global Drug Spending Forecast: $1.4 Trillion by 2020
Teaser: Greater access to medicines, particularly in low- and middle-income countries, and innovation in medicine are the top drivers of spending growth.

Headlines: Medicaid Denial for Hep C Drugs Nearing 50% in Some States
Teaser: Medicaid programs in four states recently refused nearly half of all claims for new hepatitis C drugs, denying impoverished patients access to life-saving medications, physicians say.

Headlines: How to Improve Access to Compassionate-Use Drugs
Teaser: Patients with life-threatening conditions and poor response to FDA-approved drugs may be able to receive investigational drugs under preapproval access or compassionate use -- but they have to know about them first.

Headlines: Intravitreous Ranibizumab Effective for Diabetic Retinopathy
Teaser: Intravitreous ranibizumab is noninferior to panretinal photocoagulation (PRP) for treating proliferative diabetic retinopathy, according to research from the Diabetic Retinopathy Clinical Research Network (DRCR.net).

Headlines: SPRINT and BP Management: 'Groundbreaking' but Questions Remain
Teaser: "If I had a patient with characteristics of SPRINT and they could tolerate the medication and were willing to go through more steps of titration, I'd want to try to get them to 120," said one expert.

Headlines: tPA for Stroke: Reassuring Results for Patients on Antiplatelets
Teaser: A new study representing the largest clinical experience of thrombolysis for stroke in patients receiving antiplatelet therapy suggests the overall benefits may outweigh the risks in this population.

Headlines: Functional Gains With LV Gel Scaffold Durable at 1 Year
Teaser: It's "very promising" and "addresses an important need," says an observer. Still, says another, "This is invasive, and the mortality data really need to be looked at very closely as we move forward."

Headlines: Asthma: No Clear Winners in Combination Treatment in Blacks
Teaser: A randomized trial showed no benefit to long-acting beta-agonists over tiotropium in combination with inhaled corticosteroid for improving outcomes in black adults with asthma.

Headlines: HbA1c Predicts Loss of Control in Teens With Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Data from the TODAY study identify HbA1c thresholds of 6.3% for girls and 5.6% for boys, less than the recommended ADA treatment cutoff, as a predictor for     early loss of control on metformin therapy.

Headlines: What's Cool at the San Antonio Breast Cancer Symposium
Teaser: Cool is not hot, but it's almost as good.

Headlines: A Biomarker for Concussion?
Teaser: Measures of a cleaved protein, SNTF, may signal axonal damage in patients with concussion, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Maker of Hep C Drugs Put Profit Before Patients, Report Says
Teaser: "Affordability was barely an afterthought," said Sen. Ron Wyden about how Gilead Sciences priced Sovaldi at $84,000 for a 12-week regimen.

Headlines: On-Demand Preexposure Prophylaxis Effective Against HIV
Teaser: IPERGAY results also found risk for gastrointestinal and renal adverse events. We now have better tools for preventing and treating, but the challenge is working them into practice, experts commented.

Headlines: Diabetic Vision Loss Medication May Promote Return to Driving
Teaser: After a year of treatment with the drug ranibizumab (Lucentis), some people with vision loss due to diabetes regain their confidence to drive and have vision good enough to do so, according to a new study.

Headlines: ROCKET AF Reveals Higher GI Bleeding Rates With Rivaroxaban
Teaser: "Patients with GI bleeding didn't have higher HAS-BLED scores compared with those who did not bleed, and they had the same CHA2DS2-VASc scores as well,"     say researchers about another of their findings.

Headlines: Elotuzumab (Empliciti) Approved for Multiple Myeloma in US
Teaser: A second monoclonal antibody for use in the treatment of multiple myeloma has been approved by the FDA within 2 weeks of approval of the first such product.

Headlines: Gene Editing Trials Poised to Expand, but Hurdles Remain
Teaser: Few gene editing applications are in clinical trials, but that may change in 2016, as researchers sharpen the tools and companies tackle new targets.

Headlines: Triple Antithrombotics for PCI Up Bleed Risk in Oldest With AF
Teaser: In such patients, "Maybe the net clinical benefit is similar between dual-antiplatelet therapy and triple therapy," propose researchers based on their admittedly limited cohort subgroup analysis.

Headlines: Jackson Heart: Major Depression Ups Stroke, CHD Risk in Blacks
Teaser: Investigators note the need for greater understanding of these associations "in light of reported racial disparities in disease severity, timely diagnosis,     and use of pharmacotherapy."

Headlines: Response to Anti-VEGF in Macular Edema Evident at 3 Months
Teaser: Response to anti-VEGF injections at 3 months is predictive of response at 1 and 3 years, so nonresponders can be switched to a drug with a different mechanism of action early on, researchers report.

Headlines: Exercise Barriers May Affect Clinical Outcomes in HF Patients
Teaser: Although there may be physical and cardiopulmonary limitations to exercise, "it’s important to recognize that psychosocial factors may also limit a patient's perceived ability to exercise," say researchers.

Headlines: Beta-3 Agonist Mirabegron May Help in Severe HF, BEAT HF Hints
Teaser: "We really think that we have something in our hands here that might be really, really big," says the lead author. One expert is less enthusiastic at this     early stage of research.

Headlines: Upping Dietary Potassium May Have Protective Effect in Diabetes
Teaser: High urinary potassium excretion levels are associated with a slower rate of renal decline and a lower incidence of cardiovascular complications in type 2     diabetes patients with normal renal function.

Headlines: 'Real-World' Melanoma Treatment Patterns Similar to Trials
Teaser: Treatment patterns in the clinic reflect those of clinical trials, but why are some patients are not receiving a full treatment cycle?

Headlines: Mice Gut Microbe Study Gives Clues to 'Browning' of White Fat
Teaser: A mouse study finds depleting gut microorganisms turns white fat into beige fat and improves glucose control; the findings may have implications for     development of new drugs for obesity and diabetes.

Headlines: Panel Rejects Biosimilar Insulin for European Market
Teaser: Melatonin supplements are a safe and effective way to address sleep problems in children with atopic dermatitis, hint results of a clinical trial.

Headlines: Melatonin Aids Sleep, Eases Atopic Dermatitis in Children
Teaser: A carbomer-based lipid-containing artificial tear formulation improved patients' ocular surface staining grades and ocular irritation symptom scores and decreased symptoms in patients with dry eye.

Headlines: New Dry Eye Gel Improves Some, but Not All, Symptoms
Teaser: Core scientific principles must remain sacrosanct, Anthony Fauci, the top HIV/AIDS expert in the United States, said at TEDMED, but there are moments when conventional wisdom needs to be challenged.

Headlines: Cannabidiol Effective and Safe at 3 Months for Epilepsy
Teaser: New open-label data on purified cannabidiol in children and young adults with treatment-resistant epilepsy are 'promising' at 3 months' follow-up, researchers say.

Headlines: AMD: Aflibercept Clinical Practice Efficacy Similar to Trials
Teaser: Bimonthly administration may reduce the treatment burden and improve adherence, but longer-term visual acuity outcomes are still not known.

Headlines: A 'Major, Major Finding' in Managing Residual Breast Cancer
Teaser: The addition of capecitabine to standard care for HER2-negative breast cancer patients with residual invasive disease after neoadjuvant chemo and surgery improved disease-free and overall survival.

Headlines: Stem Cells to Treat Depression?
Teaser: Phase 1B data from 24 patients show potential of a new, stem cell-derived small molecule to become the first nonmonoamine-based agent to treat major depressive disorder.

Headlines: Program Will Boost Enrollment in Alzheimer's Prevention Trials
Teaser: A nationwide program that will allow interested individuals to be genotyped for their degree of risk for Alzheimer's disease has been launched.

Headlines: 'Bad Press' May Make Patients Stop Statins, Raise MI Risk
Teaser: An increased event risk is the "most disturbing" aspect of the analysis, says one expert: "Major media outlets need to be more careful about how they cover stories generated by antistatin zealots."

Headlines: Live Attenuated Vaccine Safe for Children With Egg Allergy
Teaser: A new study has found that live attenuated influenza vaccine is unlikely to trigger systemic anaphylaxis in children with egg allergy and well-controlled asthma.

Headlines: Women at Risk for Breast Cancer Don't Take Preventive Drugs
Teaser: Most women who are at high risk for breast cancer are choosing not to take drugs that could prevent the disease, a meta-analysis reveals.

Headlines: Patients With Kidney Disease a Blind Spot in Most CV Trials
Teaser: They're excluded from most cardiovascular procedure, device, and drug trials, a study finds; yet it's "nearly inevitable" specialists will see     patients with both CV and kidney disease in daily practice.

Headlines: Small, but Detectable, Pancreatitis Risk With DPP-4 Inhibitors
Teaser: A meta-analysis of DPP-4 inhibitor trials for type 2 diabetes finds small but significantly higher risk of acute pancreatitis but is "reassuring" on heart     failure, renal function, and pancreatic cancer.

Headlines: More Evidence Needed for Women's Health Preventive Services
Teaser: The US Preventive Services Task Force and the Endocrine Society are calling on Congress to provide funding to address key evidence gaps in preventive     services for women's health.

Headlines: Missing Doses of Oral Drug in ALL Maintenance Chemo
Teaser: Overreporting is very common during maintenance therapy with 6MP in childhood acute lymphocytic leukemia.

Headlines: PA Catheter Use Is Increasing in HF Inpatients, Says Study
Teaser: Further research is needed to understand why use increased "in a patient population where current clinical-trial evidence and current guidelines do not     suggest benefit," say investigators.

Headlines: Metformin Doesn't Improve HbA1c in Kids with Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Adding metformin to insulin did not improve glycemic control in obese and overweight adolescents with type 1 diabetes but did lead to a reduction in     insulin dose and some weight loss.

Headlines: FDA Clears Relizorb for Use With Enteral Tube Feeding
Teaser: The digestive enzyme cartridge mimics the normal function of pancreatic lipase and is for use in people on enteral tube feeding who have trouble breaking down and absorbing fats.

Headlines: EMA OKs Nucala for Severe Refractory Eosinophilic Asthma
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has approved mepolizumab as an add-on treatment for severe refractory eosinophilic asthma in adults.

Headlines: Alexion's $550,000 Bone Drug Too Expensive for Britain
Teaser: A new drug to treat a rare inherited bone disorder from Alexion Pharmaceuticals that costs more than $550,000 a year for each patient has been deemed too expensive by Britain's health cost watchdog NICE.

Headlines: Treatment Innovations to Headline Bowel Diseases Conference
Teaser: Biosimilar drugs, new approaches to complex patients, and discussions about challenging inflammatory bowel disease will be highlighted at the Crohn's and Colitis Foundation of America meeting.

Headlines: Stand or Walk: Either Way, Breaking Up Sitting is Beneficial
Teaser: A study finds that either standing or walking for 5 minutes every half hour throughout the day improves glycemic parameters among postmenopausal women at     risk for diabetes.

Headlines: Novel Depression Drug Hits Regulatory Roadblock
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee determined that the evidence backing gepirone does not support its approval as a treatment for major depression.

Headlines: EMA Panel Backs Two Octocog Alfa Products for Hemophilia A
Teaser: Iblias and Kovaltry from Bayer Pharma AG are indicated for treatment and prevention of bleeding in patients with hemophilia A.

Headlines: CHMP Recommends Lesinurad (Zurampic) for Gout
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency panel has recommended marketing authorization for lesinurad for the treatment of hyperuricemia in adults with gout.

Headlines: FDA Approves Fecal Incontinence Treatment Device
Teaser: The Fenix Continence Restoration System is indicated for patients in whom other treatments have failed or are not possible.

Headlines: Similar Low Cancer Rates With Two DAPT Strategies in TRILOGY ACS
Teaser: New cancers occurred infrequently in patients with unstable angina or MI, and the rates were comparable in those taking dual antiplatelet therapy with aspirin plus prasugrel or clopidogrel.

Headlines: New Guideline Addresses Microscopic Colitis Management
Teaser: The American Gastroenterological Association Institute has issued a new guideline on the medical management of microscopic colitis, supporting the use of budesonide for induction/maintenance therapy.

Headlines: Is it Time to Embrace Prepublication Study Results?
Teaser: Authors say clinical research lags behind other disciplines and that delays in releasing results keep vital information from the public, but a journal editor says the peer review process is well worth the wait.

Headlines: Fourth PML Case With Tecfidera in MS Calls for Vigilance
Teaser: After a fourth case of PML linked to the MS drug dimethyl fumarate (Tecfidera), it's becoming more widely accepted that even 'safer' immunosuppressants may have dangerous adverse effects, experts say.

Headlines: Pathogenic Gut Flora Tied to Heart-Failure Severity
Teaser: The "leaky-gut" concept isn't new in HF, but research now puts it in a different light by showing it can affect disease severity. In other research: hope for treatments aimed at gut microbiotia.

Headlines: Resuming Antithrombotics for AF Safe After a Halt for GI Bleed
Teaser: More evidence is called for, caution researchers, but after patients recover from the bleed, "restarting or modifying" antithrombotics to a single agent seems safe and improves outcomes, say researchers.

Headlines: Testosterone Levels May Play Part in Uterine Fibroid Risk
Teaser: The "male" hormone has been underestimated in women's health, lead author says. Findings may inspire physicians to look beyond estrogen and progesterone to     find what's causing these benign tumors.

Headlines: Industry-Funded Trials Up 43% as NIH-Funded Trials Drop 24%
Teaser: The trend has researchers concerned about objectivity and vested financial interests in outcomes.

Headlines: Carboplatin for Early TNBC? Depends on Who You Ask
Teaser: The benefits of adding carboplatin to first-line chemotherapy for early-stage triple-negative breast cancer are still unclear, but certain patients are a better fit, according to new data.

Headlines: FDA Advisors: Reject Secondary-Prevention Ezetimibe Indication
Teaser: UPDATED // Noting that the secondary-prevention IMPROVE-IT trial's results weren't "clinically substantial," the panel also voiced concerns with hemorrhagic stroke risk and missing study data.

Headlines: Noninvasive Brain Stimulation Helps Treat Cocaine Addiction
Teaser: A pilot study suggests that repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation to the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex reduces cravings in cocaine addicts and increases the number of drug-free days.

Headlines: Weighing Benefits of Therapies Against Cancer Risks in IBD
Teaser: Some biologic and immunomodulator therapies for IBD can increase cancer risks, evidence suggests. Experts put the findings in perspective and advised counseling patients about risks and benefits.

Headlines: Pembrolizumab Not So Hot (Yet) for Breast Cancer
Teaser: Checkpoint inhibition has been notably successful in melanoma, lung cancer, and other malignancies. The story about its use in breast cancer is developing.

Headlines: Alectinib Approved in US for Refractory ALK-Positive NSCLC
Teaser: Another ALK-targeted therapy has been approved for use in patients who no longer respond to crizotinib, but this one is also active on brain metastases.

Headlines: First Emergency Antidote to 5-FU Chemo in the US
Teaser: This first-of-its-kind product is an emergency antidote for use in cases of unintended overdose or severe adverse reaction to 5-fluorouracil (5-FU).

Headlines: CLL Patients With 'Dismal' Prognosis Respond to Venetoclax
Teaser: Venetoclax shows impressive responses in patients with relapsed/refractory CLL who harbor the 17p deletion and who tend to have worse prognoses.

Headlines: Smaller Insulin Manufacturers Could Improve Access
Teaser: Extensive market research identifies 39 companies that make insulin in addition to the "Big 3," which could potentially offer greater access to the product     in low- and middle-income countries.

Headlines: High-Dose Laquinimod Dropped Due to Cardiac Issues in MS
Teaser: Teva has discontinued development of the 1.2-mg and 1.5-mg doses because of eight cardiovascular events in two clinical trials. Investigation with the 0.6-mg dose continues.

Headlines: 'Liquid Biopsy' May Help Guide Treatment in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Single CTC morphology, protein, and genomic characterization are feasible and can be used to assess tumor heterogeneity and potentially guide treatment decisions.

Headlines: Which Kidney Cancer Drug on Progression? Surprising Answers
Teaser: Although cabozantinib has shown the best progression-free survival ever seen, nivolumab improves overall survival and has fewer adverse events.

Headlines: Aspirin and Reduced Risk of Dying From Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Men who take aspirin regularly might have a lower risk of dying from prostate cancer, but aspirin use did not affect the overall incidence of prostate cancer.

Headlines: FDA Reclassifies Vaginal Mesh as a High-Risk Device
Teaser: Already hounded by numerous lawsuits over adverse events, manufacturers have 30 months to prove the safety and effectiveness of these devices for transvaginal repair of pelvic organ prolapse.

Headlines: Filter Mask Might Lessen Diesel-Fume Cardiotoxicity in HF
Teaser: "This trial is the first to show that a filter can reduce both endothelial dysfunction and BNP increases in patients with heart failure during     diesel-exhaust exposure," according to researchers.

Headlines: Antifreeze Might Protect Islet Cells for Transplantation
Teaser: Studies in mice and in vitro suggest that antiaging glycopeptide (AAGP: ProtoKinetix), an antifreeze protein analogue, may improve islet cell transplantation in patients with type 1 diabetes, according to Canadian researchers.

Headlines: Coronary Calcium Promotes AF in 'Dose-Response' Fashion: MESA
Teaser: 'The risk of AF not only depends on the presence of CAC but also on the rate at which the coronary arteries age,' investigators propose based on a new MESA     analysis.

Headlines: Drug Companies 'Gaming' the Orphan Drug System
Teaser: Drug companies are exploiting gaps in the Orphan Drug Act, generating huge profits at the expense of patients and the US health system, say the authors of a commentary.

Headlines: Majority of Biopsies in Early Cancer Studies Are Unnecessary
Teaser: Many phase 1 studies require tissue biopsies to discover new biomarkers and drug pharmacodynamics, but a recent report questioned whether they are all necessary.

Headlines: Short-term Magnesium Sulfate Use Appropriate, ACOG, SMFM Say
Teaser: A committee opinion from the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists and the Society for Maternal-Fetal Medicine supported appropriate short-term use of magnesium sulfate in obstetric care.

Headlines: IVF: Extending Number of Cycles Increases Efficacy
Teaser: Additional IVF cycles beyond the standard four attempts in women younger than 42 years in the United Kingdom increased the rate of live births.

Headlines: FDA Clears Selexipag for Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
Teaser: The oral IP prostacyclin receptor agonist is indicated to delay disease progression and reduce the risk for hospitalization in adults with PAH.

Headlines: Novel, Fast-Onset Antiplatelet Promising in First-in-Human Study
Teaser: The reversible PZ-128 is envisioned for use during catheter procedures. "We feel that it will be a third drug added onto aspirin and a P2Y12 inhibitor," say researchers.

Headlines: News Quiz: 2015 an Important Year for the Lungs
Teaser: New drugs for COPD, asthma, and cystic fibrosis made headlines this year. Experts debated the apnea treatment vacuum and what to do about tricky pulmonary fibrosis and contaminated bronchoscopes. Test how well you kept up with the news this year

Headlines: Oncology News Quiz 2015: 'Unprecedented Survival' Was How Long?
Teaser: Immunotherapy continues to make its mark on oncology and, overall, cancer patients are living for longer. Take a look back over the biggest oncology news stories of the year, and see if you can remember the details.

Headlines: Sadness-Induced Inflammation May Up Comorbid Disease Risk
Teaser: Sadness increases levels of inflammatory proteins in the blood in healthy and depressed persons, suggesting it may up the risk for medical comorbidities, including diabetes and heart disease.

Headlines: Radial-Access Rare in STEMI Post-Lytic 'Rescue' PCI: NCDR
Teaser: "Transradial rates are still surprisingly low for a population that you would expect to be at high risk for bleeding," say researchers, who attribute the finding to the "risk-treatment" paradox.

Headlines: WHO Sets Priority for Emerging Diseases Research
Teaser: Hemorrhagic fevers lead the list of emerging diseases likely to cause severe outbreaks in the future and are targeted for accelerated research and development.

Headlines: Vaginal Mesh Use for Prolapse Repair Drops After 2011 Warning
Teaser: However, mesh is still used 23% of the time. Experts say findings are further evidence that the 510(k) pathway to device approval that does not require clinical trials is flawed.

Headlines: European Commission Pushes for More Reliable mHealth Apps
Teaser: In the US, the FDA evaluates some apps; an NIH-funded study will look at use of mobile health apps in clinical trials.

Headlines: Medical, Behavioral Intervention Improves Arthritis Care
Teaser: A low-intensity combined osteoarthritis patient and provider intervention modestly improved self-reported functional outcome.

Headlines: Eating Berries 'May Prevent Erectile Dysfunction'
Teaser: Eating berries and citrus fruit may reduce the risk of men developing problems getting and maintaining an erection.

Headlines: High ApoB in Young Adults Seen to Predict Later Subclinical CAD
Teaser: Should apolipoprotein B be added to traditional lipid panels? The biomarker may best LDL and non-HDL cholesterol in predicting coronary calcification in middle age, suggests the CARDIA cohort study.

Headlines: Suicide and Eating Disorders: New Data
Teaser: Suicide risk is elevated in persons with eating disorders, but new data show other factors have a strong influence.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Cautious Thumbs Up to Opioid Delivery System
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee recommends approval of implant that promises to reduce problem of diversion and abuse.

Headlines: Frozen, Thawed Fecal Microbiota Effective for C difficile
Teaser: Frozen and thawed fecal microbiota transplantation successfully treats Clostridium difficile infections.

Headlines: Eating Potatoes Before Pregnancy Linked to Gestational Diabetes
Teaser: A study suggests that eating potatoes before pregnancy may increase the risk of gestational diabetes; substituting vegetables, legumes, or whole grains for     potatoes may reduce this risk.

Headlines: 'Bipolar' Therapy: New Twist in Advanced Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Challenging current notions, exposing prostate cancer cells alternately to very high and very low levels of testosterone may have clinical benefit and improve quality of life.

Headlines: Risk-Based Tops 'Trial-Based' Primary Statin Therapy in Study
Teaser: That question again: Who should get statins for primary prevention? A analysis supports the controversial ACC/AHA risk-based guidelines, rather than an approach taken directly from the clinical trial experience.

Headlines: Lowering Dietary Glycemic Index Reduces Plasma Uric Acid
Teaser: A diet with a low glycemic index was more effective than a low-carbohydrate diet for reducing uric acid concentrations and should be studied for preventing gout or gout flares, researchers said.

Headlines: New Definition of Status Epilepticus
Teaser: The clarified definition, proposed by an International League Against Epilepsy task force, includes direction on when to treat and when injury might occur.

Headlines: Less Bleeding on Rivaroxaban for AF if Fewer Concomitant Meds
Teaser: Taking five or more meds is common in patients with AF, but for those taking fewer than that, the risk of bleeding was lower with rivaroxaban than with warfarin, in  a  new analysis of ROCKET-AF.

Headlines: Scrambler Therapy Benefit in Cancer-Related Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: Noninvasive scrambler therapy is emerging as a potential option for the treatment of cancer-related neuropathic pain, although uptake remains limited in the absence of major clinical trials.

Headlines: Recro Pharma's Lead Painkiller Succeeds in Mid-Stage Trial
Teaser: Recro Pharma Inc said its lead painkiller reduced pain in post-operative orthopedic surgery patients and was safe and well tolerated, in a mid-stage trial.

Headlines: Transdermal Estradiol Suppresses Testosterone While Sparing Bone in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Transdermal estradiol suppresses testosterone levels while reducing bone mineral density (BMD) loss, compared with luteinizing hormone-releasing hormone agonists (LHRHa), in men with advanced prostate cancer, researchers from the U.K. report.

Headlines: Why Are Cancer Patients Not Enrolling in Clinical Trials?
Teaser: A video tailored to individual patients may improve patient knowledge and decision making about entering clinical trials, but  financial worries are a major issue.

Headlines: After Great Pain, a Cold Cap for Chemo Hair Loss Came
Teaser: Refrigeration expertise and anguish from the adverse effects of breast cancer chemotherapy came together in a British family, and gave rise to technologic innovation.

Headlines: Many Women Overtreated With Osteoporosis Medication
Teaser: The majority of women taking medication for osteoporosis did not have it at a main site, and half of these women lacked any risk factors for the disease.

Headlines: Limits of Gene Variants as Biomarkers Aired in Cohort Study
Teaser: Carriers of two rare high-risk ion-channel gene variants in a cohort study didn't have more arrhythmias. But when patients hear they have one of the     variants, "what do people do with that information?"

Headlines: High-Dose Vitamin D Doesn't Improve Glycemic Parameters
Teaser: A small randomized trial finds no glycemic benefit for 8 weeks of high-dose vitamin D treatment in patients with prediabetes or mild type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Prenatal Vitamin D Has a Weak Effect on Wheezing
Teaser: Women did not significantly reduce the risk of wheezing in their children by taking vitamin D during their pregnancies in two new studies, but they did reduce the risk for some other lung problems.

Headlines: TTFields Plus Chemo Shows Benefit in Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: A device that delivers tumor-treating fields (TTFields), recently approved for use in glioblastoma, is now showing benefit in advanced pancreatic cancer.

Headlines: NEJM Editor Backtracks on Data-Sharing 'Parasites' Editorial
Teaser: Jeffrey Drazen. MD, restated that NEJM supports the ICMJE proposals after backlash to his original editorial, which suggested data sharing would draw 'parasites.' Some say wider access still needed.

Headlines: After Dust Settles, Mixed Reaction to New US Dietary Guidelines
Teaser: Response to the new 2015-2020 Dietary Guidelines for Americans ranged from neutral to supportive to harsh critique; now that docs have had time to digest     the impact, Medscape gauged reactions.

Headlines: FDA Panel Considers Allergen Immunotherapy Development
Teaser: An FDA panel met to discuss issues around the clinical development of allergen immunotherapy products.

Headlines: Reporting of Mortality After Breast Cancer Radiotherapy Differs Greatly
Teaser: Mortality rates after breast cancer radiotherapy differ strikingly between clinical trial reports and observational data, researchers report.

Headlines: Big Pharma Pledges to Develop New Antibiotics, With Help
Teaser: Global drug companies call on governments around the world to develop novel economic models to support development of new antibiotics.

Headlines: No Difference by Race in Recurrent Stroke Risk
Teaser: The increased risk for a first stroke seen in the young black population seems to disappear when it comes to second strokes, new REGARDS data suggest.

Headlines: Skip Step 2, Use Low-Dose Morphine for Moderate Cancer Pain
Teaser: The WHO three-step analgesic ladder should be switched to a two-step approach that bypasses weak opioids and goes straight to low-dose morphine for moderate cancer pain, Italian researchers suggest.

Headlines: Opt-Out Screening Can Improve Acceptance of HIV Testing
Teaser: How providers offer patients an HIV test significantly affects the likelihood of them accepting tests, according to a new study.

Headlines: Journal Editors Say Authors Must Share Clinical Trial Data
Teaser: The proposal calls for access to deidentified patient-level data within 6 months. Such access is an "ethical obligation," the editors say, because study participants have put themselves at risk.

Headlines: FDA Fails to Track Postmarket Drug Studies Sufficiently: GAO
Teaser: Drugs that get expedited approval go on market without strong evidence of effectiveness or safety, but the FDA does not keep good track of required studies, the GAO said.

Headlines: CMV Retinitis After Ruxolitinib Treatment: Case Report
Teaser: Patients treated with ruxolitinib should report any symptoms of reduced or disturbed vision and undergo ophthalmologic examination, say the authors of the case report.

Headlines: Possible Statin Link to Sleep Apnea's Greater CV Risk Observed
Teaser: Statins may block one of the mechanisms behind the vascular proinflammatory effect of obstructive sleep apnea, proposed researchers based their in vitro     preliminary study.

Headlines: Cocaine Kills Brain Cells, but New Agents May Reverse Damage
Teaser: Cocaine induces out-of-control autophagy, and an inhibitor shows promise in thwarting the damage.

Headlines: Stem Cell Transplants Promising in ALS
Teaser: Preliminary results of a small open-label trial show 87% of patients with 6 months of follow-up were responders.

Headlines: Cure for Mantle Cell Lymphoma Within Reach, Says Expert
Teaser: A better understanding of the biology of mantle cell lymphoma and improved treatments in the past 2 decades make a cure for this disease a definite possibility, say leaders in the field.

Headlines: FDA Declines Approval for Drisapersen in DMD
Teaser: The agency concluded that substantial evidence for effectiveness of drisapersen has not been shown, BioMarin announced.

Headlines: One Death, Three Serious Brain Injuries in Phase 1 Trial
Teaser: One man is brain dead and three other previously healthy volunteers were seriously injured in a phase 1 drug trial as French authorities investigate what went wrong.

Headlines: Sanofi Launches Hunt for Zika Vaccine as Disease Fears Grow
Teaser: Sanofi has launched a project to develop a vaccine against the Zika virus in the most decisive commitment yet by a major vaccine producer to fight the disease linked to multiple birth defects in Brazil.

Headlines: Califf for Commish? Opposition Rocks Senate Confirmation Process
Teaser: Among the issues: Does Robert Califf's past work involving industry disqualify him for the top FDA post? Depends on who is asked; some say yes, and others say the relationships may be an asset.

Headlines: New Guidance: Bisphosphonate Holidays for Low-Risk Patients
Teaser: High-risk osteoporosis patients, however, are advised to continue therapy; discussion of the risks/benefits is encouraged.

Headlines: Frailty a Risk Factor for 1-Year Postoperative Mortality
Teaser: Frail patients aged 65 years and older undergoing major elective surgery had significantly increased risks for death within 1 year for 10 of 11 noncardiac procedures.

Headlines: COPD Drug Does Not Significantly Reduce Ventilator Time
Teaser: However, acetazolamide cut 16 hours off ventilator time, which is clinically important. It has been used for decades, but randomized controlled trial information has not been available until now.

Headlines: First Chemo 'Antidote' Cuts Deaths From 5-FU Toxicity
Teaser: The first and only approved antidote for severe toxicity related to a chemotherapy overdose dramatically reduces mortality.

Headlines: Meta-Analysis Confirms Benefit of Stent Retrievers in Stroke
Teaser: A new meta-analysis of the five recently published studies of stent retrievers in the acute treatment of ischemic stroke confirms that they are associated with a significant improvement of functional independence at 90 days.

Headlines: President Asks for $1 Billion for Cancer 'Moonshot' Funding
Teaser: Taking the cancer moonshot announcement to the next level, the White House is now requesting $1 billion to fund it.

Headlines: Lupus Raises Mortality by 67%; Young Adults at Highest Risk
Teaser: Patients with systemic lupus erythematosus frequently die of circulatory system disease or cancer, just like patients without lupus, but at younger ages, according to a new analysis.

Headlines: Jan 29 Cardiology News
Teaser: A draft proposal for data sharing, women and AF, an ICD lead recall, vasovagal syncope, and prediabetes are discussed by Dr John Mandrola in this week's podcast.

Headlines: Mixed Rotavirus Vaccine Series Safe and Immunogenic
Teaser: Rotavirus vaccination series using either a single vaccine or a combination of the approved vaccines was equally safe and immunogenic.

Headlines: Questions About Protocol After Death in French Trial
Teaser: New disclosures about the phase 1 protocol show European regulations for first-in-human studies may not have been followed.

Headlines: EU Panel Likes Elotuzumab, New Approach for Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The drug is the first immune-based therapy for patients who progress after initial treatment.

Headlines: FDA OKs Zepatier (Elbasvir/Grazoprevir) for Hepatitis C
Teaser: Patients with HVC genotypes 1 gain another cure that does not require concomitant use of interferon. Zepatier can be prescribed with or without ribavirin.

Headlines: Anti-VEGF Therapy for Persistent Diabetic Macular Edema
Teaser: In patients with persistent diabetic macular edema (DME), there may be long-term benefits to be gained from continuing with anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (anti-VEGF) therapy, according to a post hoc analysis of a Diabetic Retinopathy Clinical Research (DRCR) Network trial.

Headlines: Lessons From Genetic Testing in Pediatric Cancers
Teaser: Two studies of gene testing in children and adolescents with cancer that looked for germline and actionable genes provide important lessons for clinical care.

Headlines: Shooting for the Moon: The New Cancer Space Race
Teaser: A private initiative, overshadowed by President Obama's call for action on cancer, has an ambitious plan to put 20,000 patients into clinical trials by 2020.

Headlines: Top US Cancer Centers Call for Greater Uptake of HPV Vaccine
Teaser: NCI-designated cancer centers in the United States have issued a call to action to improve uptake of the human papillomavirus (HPV) vaccine across the country in both males and females.

Headlines: Brain BDNF Expression May Explain Cognitive Reserve
Teaser: Boosting BDNF gene expression might be a good therapeutic strategy to prevent Alzheimer's disease, researchers speculate.

Headlines: U.S. Senator Markey Places Hold on Obama's Nominee to Lead FDA
Teaser: Democratic U.S. Senator Edward Markey of Massachusetts said on Monday he has placed a hold on President Barack Obama's nominee to head the Food and Drug Administration until the agency agrees to reform its process for approving opioid painkillers.

Headlines: Cigna, Aetna Announce 'Pay-for-Performance' Entresto Contracts
Teaser: The insurers have contracted with Novartis in an agreement that will depend on how well the heart-failure drug improves patient health, including hospitalizations.

Headlines: New EMA Advice for PML Prevention With Tysabri in MS
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency has released new recommendations on PML prevention with natalizumab in multiple sclerosis.

Headlines: A Man With Breast Cancer, Dr Bogler, Entered 'World of Pink'
Teaser: A male professor of neurosurgery is diagnosed with a disease identified with women. Many life changes follow.

Headlines: What's Hot at ISC 2016?
Teaser: After last year's landmark trials making endovascular therapy the standard of care, the stroke community meets in Los Angeles ahead of the Oscars for the International Stroke Conference 2016.

Headlines: Postdischarge Care Worse for MI Patients Sent to PCI Center
Teaser: "This article is showing us something we probably should have realized from the beginning," says an observer: MI patients transferred for PCI "probably have some special considerations when we send them home."

Headlines: Early Data for Combo Immunotherapy in Lung Cancer
Teaser: Phase 1 results showed antitumor activity with a combination of investigational checkpoint inhibitors, but toxicity was 'substantial.'

Headlines: Meniscus Surgery Criteria Called Into Question
Teaser: Catching and locking may not provide reliable indications that arthroscopic partial meniscectomy is warranted.

Headlines: FDA Places Clinical Hold on Pacritinib for Myelofibrosis
Teaser: In a clinical trial of the investigational agent, pacritinib-treated patients have died from intracranial hemorrhage, cardiac failure, and cardiac arrest.

Headlines: Age No Barrier to Gastric Bypass Surgery Survival Benefit
Teaser: A new study finds mortality benefit for adults aged 35 to 74 years who undergo gastric bypass, but not for women younger than 35.

Headlines: Similar Outcomes After VA vs Non-VA Admissions for MI, HF
Teaser: Although mortality and readmission rates were significantly different between the two hospital types, absolute differences were relatively small, say     experts, noting that the findings are "reassuring."

Headlines: Therapy, Antidepressants Similarly Effective for Depression
Teaser: A new ACP guideline recommended that physicians discuss the benefits, potential adverse effects, and costs of both treatments with patients. The guideline also addressed problems with St John's wort.

Headlines: Atrial-Flutter Ablation Complications Linked to Age, Case Volume
Teaser: "These results underscore the importance of having experienced high-volume centers," write the investigators, noting also the need for a multidisciplinary     approach and better training for supporting staff.

Headlines: Defibrotide's Promise in Rare but Fatal Syndrome Post HSCT
Teaser: Phase 3 data from a trial that used historical controls to assess safety and efficacy of defibrotide show that it confers survival benefits in patients with VOD and multiorgan failure after HSCT.

Headlines: FDA Panel Backs Vortioxetine for Cognitive Dysfunction in MDD
Teaser: Company successfully showed that the drug improves concentration and other cognitive deficits in patients with major depression, according to FDA advisory committee.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Impairs Verbal Memory
Teaser: Long-term marijuana use may significantly impair verbal memory by middle age, warn researchers, who found that other aspects of cognitive function were unaffected.

Headlines: Validity of Pivotal ROCKET AF Rivaroxaban Trial Questioned
Teaser: The BMJ alleges a faulty INR test likely made the novel oral anticoagulant's bleed risk seem better than was true in the stroke-prevention trial; researchers say the issue didn't affect the trial's main message.

Headlines: Antidepressants in Kids May Double Suicidality, Aggression Risk
Teaser: Antidepressant use in children and adolescents may double the risk for suicidality and aggression, results of a large, systematic review suggest.

Headlines: Proton Beam in Medulloblastoma: 'New Benchmark'
Teaser: In children with medulloblastoma, proton-beam therapy has survival rates similar to standard radiotherapy, but fewer systemic toxicities.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Is ASCO's Advance of the Year
Teaser: The organization's annual report highlights clinical cancer advances that have been made in the past year, and says immunotherapy 'clearly stands out from the rest.'

Headlines: Rivastigmine Prevents Falls in  Patients With PD
Teaser: The results are 'very encouraging and exciting' but need to be reproduced in larger trials, lead researcher says.

Headlines: Rapid Stroke Improvement Not Always a Ticket Home
Teaser: Nearly half of patients with rapid neurological improvement of stroke symptoms are not discharged, suggesting the need for close evaluation.

Headlines: Expert: Induction Chemo Has 'No Role' in H&N Cancer
Teaser: A large new study adds to the evidence that for patients with advanced head and neck cancer, extensive chemotherapy long before radiation does not improve survival.

Headlines: Saliva Test for Lung Cancer
Teaser: A new saliva-based test is able to detect circulating tumor DNA and is about to move into clinical trials.

Headlines: FDA Clears Brivaracetam (Briviact) for Partial-Onset Seizures
Teaser: The levetiracetam analogue is approved for adjunctive therapy for treatment of partial-onset seizures in patients age 16 and older with epilepsy.

Headlines: Less Is More: ARUBA Confirms Intervention Unwise in AVM
Teaser: Five-year follow-up of ARUBA confirms that despite the elevated stroke risk associated with an unruptured arteriovenous malformation, intervention only raises that risk.

Headlines: INFORMS Published: Fingolimod Fails in Primary Progressive MS
Teaser: Full details of the INFORMS trial have confirmed that the multiple sclerosis drug fingolimod did not slow progression of disability or brain volume loss vs placebo in the primary progressive form of the disease.

Headlines: CT Profile Flags Stroke Patients Who May Have More Time
Teaser: Stroke patients found on CT perfusion imaging to have distinctive brain anatomy show good outcomes with intervention even after the 6-hour window.

Headlines: FDA Likely Underestimated Fetal Deaths From Essure: Analyst
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration may have greatly underestimated the number of fetal deaths among women who became pregnant after using Bayer AG's Essure contraceptive device.

Headlines: Dementia Drugs May Help Smokers Quit
Teaser: Cholinesterase inhibitors, which are traditionally used to treat symptoms of Alzheimer's disease, may be repurposed to help smokers quit, new research suggests.

Headlines: IRIS: Diabetes Drug Reduces Recurrent Stroke, MI
Teaser: A randomized trial shows that in patients with insulin resistance but no diabetes and a history of recent stroke or TIA, pioglitazone reduced recurrent stroke and myocardial infarction vs placebo.

Headlines: Upper-Arm Girth Plus BMI May Sharpen HF Risk Prediction
Teaser: Unlike a more commonly used body measurement, arm circumference at the biceps as a proxy for lean body mass complements body-mass index for risk     stratification, at least in a Japanese cohort study.

Headlines: Eribulin Makes 3: Changing Treatment Landscape for Sarcoma
Teaser: After a 40-year dearth of new treatments, three new drugs have been approved for soft-tissue sarcomas.

Headlines: Repeat Laser Trabeculoplasty for Intraocular Pressure Control
Teaser: In eyes with open-angle glaucoma that have already had successful initial selective laser trabeculoplasty (SLT), repeat SLT can restore intraocular pressure (IOP) control, new research suggests.

Headlines: ESAs Do Not Improve HRQoL in Patients With Anemia and CKD
Teaser: Using erythropoietin-stimulating agents to treat anemia in patients with CKD did not significantly improve health-related quality of life, according to a new study.

Headlines: Interstitial Lung Abnormalities Tied to Increased Mortality
Teaser: Interstitial lung abnormalities were associated with increased risk for all-cause mortality, suggesting they might be mild or early idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis.

Headlines: 'Extraordinary Results' With CAR-T Making Headlines Again
Teaser: 'Unprecedented responses' seen in blood cancer patients who had run out of options are making headlines again, but will this approach ever find a broader use?

Headlines: HCV Relapse Uncommon After Sustained Virological Response
Teaser: Late relapse of hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection is very uncommon after achieving a sustained virological response (SVR), according to a systematic review and meta-analysis including more than 9,000 patients.

Headlines: Cutting Cancer Drug Costs: No Pain, No Gain
Teaser: Public policy changes could help control the escalating cost of cancer drugs, but not without making tradeoffs in the process, say some experts.

Headlines: Proton Pump Inhibitors Linked to Dementia
Teaser: A new study reinforced results of earlier research showing an association between regular use of these drugs to treat gastrointestinal disorders and dementia risk.

Headlines: ACTRIMS Forum 2016: Focus on Progressive MS
Teaser: ACTRIMS Forum 2016, the first stand-alone ACTRIMS meeting, will focus on emerging concepts in MS and the latest data on novel treatment approaches.

Headlines: Angina Often Missed, Undertreated in Stable CAD Outpatients
Teaser: "I think that every cardiologist would think they are doing a perfect job, and what we found is that the underrecognition rate of angina was incredibly     high," said a coauthor.

Headlines: An Evolutionary Approach: Learning to Live With Cancer
Teaser: Instead of high-dose chemotherapy to shrink the tumor, a new approach suggests using adaptive therapy with low-dose chemotherapy.

Headlines: Aflibercept Best in Diabetics With Bad Baseline Vision?
Teaser: Final results from a trial comparing aflibercept, bevacizumab, and ranibizumab in diabetic macular edema confirm all three drugs are similar, but     aflibercept is best in those with worse baseline vision, says lead researcher.

Headlines: Physicians Greet New HCV Drug Zepatier Cautiously
Teaser: Lack of familiarity with the drug and its cost, as well as the availability of rival therapies, may help explain the quiet reception of elbasvir/grazoprevir.

Headlines: Surgical Oncologists Descend Upon Boston
Teaser: One of the debates at this year's annual meeting will be of when surgeons should try to discourage women from undergoing contralateral prophylactic mastectomies.

Headlines: First Human Data Show Verapamil Lowers Glucose in Diabetes
Teaser: Early research hints that this old antihypertensive drug may also lower serum glucose, especially in patients with type 1 or late-stage type 2 diabetes who     are on insulin.

Headlines: Another Option for Opioid-Induced Constipation?
Teaser: A new drug in development is superior to placebo in treating opioid-induced constipation and doesn't interfere with analgesic effect.

Headlines: Stem Cell Transplant in Multiple Sclerosis: Next Steps
Teaser: Hematopoietic stem cell transplant looks promising in relapsing MS, while more biologically cell-based approaches may be needed for progressive forms. Two important studies are in development.

Headlines: Feb 26 Cardiology News
Teaser: Unpublished trials, new CMS rules, statins after cardiac surgery, sudden death in the young, macrolide antibiotics, and FDA Commissioner Dr Robert Califf are discussed this week.

Headlines: Vedolizumab Safe for Inflammatory Bowel Disease
Teaser: Vedolizumab safely treats ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease, researchers report in a study that integrates safety data from six clinical trials.

Headlines: Hidradenitis Suppurativa Tied to Higher Mortality
Teaser: Hidradenitis suppurativa (HS) is associated with a significantly increased risk of adverse cardiovascular (CV) outcomes and all-cause mortality, according to Danish researchers.

Headlines: FDA Clears Extended-Release Tofacitinib (Xeljanz XR) for RA
Teaser: Xeljanz XR provides a once-daily oral option for patients with moderate to severe rheumatoid arthritis.

Headlines: New Staging System for HPV-Positive Oropharyngeal Cancer
Teaser: Researchers propose a new staging system for HPV-positive oropharyngeal cancer that could help improve prediction of survival, treatment selection, and recruitment into clinical trials.

Headlines: Pancreatic Cancer: Adjuvant Chemotherapy, but Not Radiation
Teaser: In the treatment of resectable pancreatic cancer, addition of adjuvant chemotherapy, but not radiation, reduces the risk for distant recurrences, according to a retrospective analysis.

Headlines: US Senate Clears Way for Vote on Califf FDA Nomination
Teaser: Today's cloture vote on the confirmation process for Dr Robert Califf as FDA chief clears holds and a threatened filibuster, making way for a final vote scheduled for later this week.

Headlines: Two Thirds of Clinical Trials Unpublished 2 Years Later
Teaser: Leading academic research centers have done a poor and variable job of disseminating clinical trial results, according to a cross-sectional analysis.

Headlines: Monthly Vaginal Ring Moderately Reduces HIV Risk
Teaser: A vaginal ring inserted monthly helps prevent HIV transmission, two phase 3 sister studies of African women have shown.

Headlines: Hyperthyroidism Raises Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: Women with hyperthyroidism have an increased risk of developing breast cancer, but hypothyroidism appears to protect against the         disease, new Danish registry data indicate.

Headlines: ASCO on Ovarian Suppression in Young Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: The latest results on ovarian suppression in premenopausal women with breast cancer,  hailed as practice changing, have now been incorporated into clinical guidelines.

Headlines: Typical Therapies Not Tough Enough to Curb Digital Ulcers
Teaser: Physicians should use more aggressive therapy for patients with systemic sclerosis who are at high risk for digital ulcers, according to researchers who identified a predictor for this complication.

Headlines: Traumatic ICH Surprisingly Common With AF Anticoagulation
Teaser: All intracranial hemorrhage "is a real risk” in older vets, although so is risk of ischemic stroke, say experts. The findings “underscore that decisions around anticoagulation need to be patient-centered."

Headlines: Safety Data Accumulating for Combination Asthma Drugs
Teaser: The first of a series of safety studies mandated by the FDA suggests that the black-box warning on inhalers might not be warranted; however, patients with the most severe disease were excluded.

Headlines: Common Test May Aid Personalized Depression Treatment
Teaser: Preserved set-shifting capacity may mark a subgroup of older patients with resistant depression who may benefit from aripiprazole augmentation.

Headlines: Topical Anticholinergic Reduces Underarm Hyperhidrosis
Teaser: An investigational anticholinergic gel noninvasively reduces excess sweating with minimal adverse effects, a phase 2b study suggests.

Headlines: One in Four People Worldwide Have Nonalcoholic Fatty Liver Disease
Teaser: As the global obesity epidemic continues to fuel development of metabolic disorders, the clinical and economic burden of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) and its more severe form, nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), will become "enormous," researchers warn in a new paper.

Headlines: Metastasis Site Affects Prostate Cancer Survival
Teaser: Results from a multistudy analysis confirm that the site of prostate cancer metastases affects survival, with liver metastases associated with significantly shorter survival times than other sites.

Headlines: Respirators Not More Effective Than Masks in the Workplace
Teaser: Respirators did not prevent acute respiratory infections more effectively than surgical masks, at least as used by healthcare personnel under normal working conditions.

Headlines: Keys to Unlocking Precision Medicine's Potential: IOM Report
Teaser: The IOM calls for creation of a "rapid learning" system that would integrate research on biomarker tests and associated treatments with clinical practice.

Headlines: Neurofibromatosis — Best Data Yet on Risks for Cancer
Teaser: Patients with neurofibromatosis 1 have been reported to be at an increased risk for several malignancies. A Finnish study refines this risk and reports the risk for breast cancer. Survival is also worse for these patients.

Headlines: Benefit Persists After Prostaglandin Stopped in Glaucoma
Teaser: For patients with primary open-angle glaucoma, the drop in intraocular pressure seen with prostaglandin analog therapy can last for weeks after treatment has been discontinued, new research shows.

Headlines: Biologics Maintain Benefits Long-term in Plaque Psoriasis
