Teaser: The newer biologics ixekizumab and secukinumab showed duration of benefit for treating moderate to severe plaque psoriasis over the long term, but cost and number of injections needed are an issue.

Headlines: Investigational Therapeutic Genital Herpes Vaccine Promising
Teaser: Phase 2 data for a novel immunotherapy for genital herpes showed a significant reduction in viral shedding and lesions, although the reduction in lesions was also seen with placebo.

Headlines: Hope and Hype Push Liquid Biopsies in Oncology
Teaser: Detecting cancer through tumor DNA circulating in the blood has both possibilities and limitations. Realizing its full potential depends in part on resolving cost and sensitivity issues.

Headlines: Top-Line Data Show CV Benefit for Liraglutide in Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: Liraglutide is the third diabetes drug to show CV benefit and the first for the GLP-1 class.

Headlines: Novel 'Gene Silencer' Shows Promise in Huntington's
Teaser: The first clinical trial of a second-generation antisense oligonucleotide that targets the cause of Huntington's disease is underway after promising results in animal testing.

Headlines: Women at Risk of Missing Out on Oral Anticoagulation for AF
Teaser: One possible reason: being female may be underappreciated as a thromboembolic risk factor, "despite having similar weight within the risk-stratification tool," say researchers based on NCDR data.

Headlines: Could a 'Default Option' Improve Cancer Care?
Teaser: Introducing a 'smart default' into electronic health record systems would steer physicians to evidence-based choices, but would also allow other choices.

Headlines: With Diabetes, BP Treatment Goal May Depend on Starting Line
Teaser: A meta-analysis of published and unpublished data may give pause about aiming too low in blood-pressure treatment for diabetes patients.

Headlines: Unilateral ECT Equal to Bilateral Approach for Major Depression
Teaser: Twice-weekly high-dose unilateral ECT for severe depression is as effective as bilateral ECT, with fewer cognitive side effects, new research shows.

Headlines: New Training Guidelines for Endovascular Stroke Therapy
Teaser: New international guidelines have been drafted setting out minimum training requirements for physicians performing endovascular thrombectomy procedures for acute stroke patients.

Headlines: Prescription Drug Costs Increasing; So Are TV Ads Promoting Them
Teaser: Spending on consumer advertising by drugmakers has increased 62 percent since 2012.

Headlines: Oral Anticoagulants Remain Underused in US for AF
Teaser: "Even cardiologists need to heed this wake-up call," said a researcher based on PINNACLE registry findings that, regardless of stroke risk, only about half     of eligible AF patients get such treatment.

Headlines: Lack of Psychiatric Drug Research Creates Clinical 'Crisis'
Teaser: A lack of investment into researching new psychiatric medications is driving at least one clinician to turn to nonpsychiatric medications to treat various mental disorders.

Headlines: Artificial Pancreas Success in Type 1 Diabetes in Pregnancy
Teaser: Use of an "artificial pancreas" overnight in a home setting in pregnant women with type 1 diabetes resulted in 2 extra hours a day in target blood glucose     range, compared with insulin-pump use alone.

Headlines: Shortened Hep C Combo Passes Real-World Test
Teaser: An 8-week regimen of combination ledipasvir and sofosbuvir appears to clear the hepatitis C virus as well as a 12-week schedule, even in patients with very high viral loads, new research shows.

Headlines: Antibodies in Infliximab-Treated Patients Bind CT-P13
Teaser: Antibodies that develop in infliximab-treated patients bind to the biosimilar CT-P13, indicating that switching patients to the biosimilar will be ineffective.

Headlines: For Arthritis Pain: Diclofenac Best, Acetaminophen Worst
Teaser: Diclofenac was most effective and acetaminophen least effective for relieving pain in knee or hip osteoarthritis.

Headlines: FDA Clears Factor VIII Product Kovaltry for Hemophilia A
Teaser: Studies show routine prophylaxis with Kovaltry helps controls bleeds and reduces frequency of bleeding episodes in children and adults with hemophilia A.

Headlines: Death in French Drug Trial: Family Demands Answers
Teaser: New developments in the investigation into the phase 1 trial that went terribly wrong for five participants includes a formal complaint from the family of the man who died during the trial.

Headlines: Marijuana for Cancer: No Benefit, but Don't Tell Patients
Teaser: As more states approve medical marijuana, oncologists should be prepared to field questions from patients, but the available scientific data are limited.

Headlines: New Scan for Diabetic Eye Disease Is Better, but at a Cost
Teaser: Telescreening trial in remote areas of the Indian Health Service finds that new ultrawide field imaging may cut the number of people referred unnecessarily     for diabetic retinopathy follow-up, but at a price.

Headlines: Online Tools Aid Mental Health Wellness, Treatment
Teaser: Internet-based wellness trackers and online tools to monitor patient progress and provide therapeutic interventions may aid development of tailored therapies and improve symptoms.

Headlines: Trial Surprise: Rigosertib May Benefit Some MDS Patients
Teaser: There was no significant improvement in overall survival with rigosertib vs usual care in patients with high-risk MDS, but the drug did show promise in a subset of patients.

Headlines: FDA Proposes Tighter Rules for Fecal Transplants
Teaser: The agency would allow the use of fecal transplants for curing C difficile as long as they're made in hospitals with clinician oversight, or by factory-style stool banks meeting IND requirements.

Headlines: Improved Varicella Vaccine Effectiveness With 2-Dose Regimen
Teaser: A two-dose varicella vaccine regimen is more effective than a one-dose regimen in preventing community transmission, researchers report.

Headlines: Gilead Stops Six Trials Adding Idelalisib to Other Drugs
Teaser: The FDA said it would review the findings of the six trials, which saw an increased rate of adverse events, including death.

Headlines: Low-Dose Steroids Generally Safe in Rheumatic Diseases
Teaser: A EULAR task force has concluded that long-term use of glucocorticoid doses of 5 mg/day or less is generally safe in treating rheumatic diseases.

Headlines: Smartphone Responses on Health and Safety Need Major Upgrade
Teaser: Some computerized conversational agents failed to recognize 'I was raped' or 'I am having a heart attack,' a study found.

Headlines: Role for Twitter in Cancer Clinical Trial Recruitment?
Teaser: A pilot study using a sample of tweets about lung cancer found that a surprising amount of these were about clinical trials, suggesting Twitter could be a resource for recruitment.

Headlines: EMA Starts Review of Cancer Drug Idelalisib (Zydelig)
Teaser: The review was prompted by an increased rate of serious adverse events including deaths, mostly due to infections, seen in ongoing clinical trials.

Headlines: FDA Panel Gives Thumbs Up to Parkinson's Psychosis Drug
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee concludes that pimavanserin is safe and effective and that its benefits outweigh its risks.

Headlines: Defibrotide Approved for Serious Disorder After HSCT
Teaser: This is the first treatment approved for a rare but often fatal complication that can occur in cancer patients who receive hematopoietic stem cell transplants.

Headlines: Antipsychotics Linked to Mortality in Parkinson's
Teaser: Comorbidities should be checked, PD drugs adjusted, and perhaps behavioral approaches tried before an antipsychotic is introduced, researchers say.

Headlines: Possible Drug Risks Buried in Delayed FDA 'Watch Lists'
Teaser: The agency has finally posted quarterly reports for 2015 that list drugs with potential signals of serious risk, such as stroke for SGLT-2 inhibitors. FDA critics say its early warning system needs fixing.

Headlines: Obesity Survey Uncovers Striking Clinician 'Knowledge Gap'
Teaser: "The most striking observation...is that it demonstrates a considerable knowledge gap in the indications, efficacy, and safety of currently FDA-approved     drugs for obesity," says one expert.

Headlines: PPIs May Lower GI Events After DAPT With Low-Dose Aspirin
Teaser: Based on new analysis from COGENT, "one could make an argument to consider routine PPIs" in these CAD patients, said the senior author. "But that does go     beyond current guidelines."

Headlines: ACP Issues Policy Statement to Stem Rising Cost of Drugs
Teaser: The American College of Physicians (ACP) is calling for stakeholders to work together to rein in rising drug costs and improve patient access.

Headlines: Very Low-Calorie Diet May Trigger Type 2 Diabetes Remission
Teaser: A study finds that an 8-week very low-calorie diet followed by intensive support in weight maintenance can put type 2 diabetes into remission for 6 months.

Headlines: Defining Efficacy of Cancer Immunotherapy Is a Challenge
Teaser: Determining the clinical efficacy of immunotherapeutic agents can be a challenge because of pseudoprogression and other distinct immune-related patterns of response.

Headlines: Tocilizumab Ups Giant Cell Arteritis Remissions in Early Trial
Teaser: Patients with giant cell arteritis treated with tocilizumab were more likely to reach and maintain complete remission and were able to taper off steroids more quickly in a randomized trial.

Headlines: Dual-Drug Strategy Reduces Carpet of Polyps in FAP Patients
Teaser: Colon carpeted with polyps in FAP patients can be favorably affected with a novel dual-drug strategy that offers the first really tenable treatment for this condition.

Headlines: Registry Study Supports TAVR in Select Nonagenarians
Teaser: "The published data show the procedure can be done, albeit with upfront mortality and stroke risk, and for many patients will provide improvement in     length and quality of life," an expert says.

Headlines: Early-Career Docs No Less Likely to Prescribe Antibiotics
Teaser: Contrary to guidelines, Australian trainees prescribed antibiotics for 71.5% of sore throat diagnoses, and they got worse with time: the most experienced trainees wrote the most prescriptions.

Headlines: Skip Neoadjuvant Tx in Node-Negative Esophageal Cancer?
Teaser: Patients with clinically staged node-negative esophageal adenocarcinoma derive no overall survival benefit from neoadjuvant chemoradiation, new research hints.

Headlines: Reslizumab (Cinqair) Approved to Treat Severe Asthma
Teaser: Patients receive this add-on treatment by infusion every 4 weeks to stave off severe asthma attacks. The most common adverse events seen in clinical trials include anaphylaxis and cancer.

Headlines: WHO: Zika May Cause 'Severe Public Health Crisis'
Teaser: Zika virus poses severe public health crisis, says the head of the World Health Organization.

Headlines: Botox Alleviates Neuropathic Pain
Teaser: A series of two doses of botulinum toxin A relieved neuropathic pain better than did placebo, new randomized findings show.

Headlines: ENDO 2016: Centennial Celebration Will Mix Old With New
Teaser: The program of the Endocrine Society's meeting will feature odes to past endocrine achievements and the many advances for which they paved the way.

Headlines: Real-World Results With Bevacizumab for DME Doesn't Match Trial Results
Teaser: In the real world, intravitreal bevacizumab (IVB) for diabetic macular edema (DME) doesn't work as well as it does in clinical trials, according to new research.

Headlines: Colitis Improves in Multidonor Fecal Transplant Trial
Teaser: Fecal microbiota transplantation can induce remission in patients with treatment-resistant ulcerative colitis, but there are still some concerns about safety, according to experts.

Headlines: Novel Drug May Offer Hope in Prader-Willi Syndrome, Obesity
Teaser: Beloranib reduces weight and hyperphagia in Prader-Willi syndrome and may also hold promise for other severe obesity conditions, but first the company must     prove that it doesn't raise thrombotic risk.

Headlines: Primary Care Reaching Saturation Point in England
Teaser: Workloads increased 16% in 7 years, which may explain, in part, why burnout rates are so high among primary care physicians in the United Kingdom and the United States, experts said.

Headlines: FDA Okays Third, Gentler Form of Tenofovir for HIV (Descovy)
Teaser: The new drug is identical to Truvada except that tenofovir alafenamide replaces tenofovir disoproxil fumarate.

Headlines: Physician Aid in Dying: Oncologists Grapple With New Law
Teaser: California's new law allowing physician aid in dying opens access to one in 10 Americans to this end-of-life option, and oncologists are testing the waters.

Headlines: TAVR Superior to Surgery in Intermediate-Risk Patients: SAPIEN 3
Teaser: The results "are clinically meaningful and some of the best observed outcomes we've ever witnessed," said an expert. Another predicted that surgery "won't     be done much" in this population in the future.

Headlines: Bladder Preservation High With 'Trimodal' Cancer Therapy
Teaser: A trimodal treatment approach to localized bladder cancer using adaptive radiotherapy had high rates of bladder preservation and survival.

Headlines: Eating Pulses 'Could Help With Weight Loss'
Teaser: Eating one serving of pulses each day could contribute to modest weight loss, according to a new study.

Headlines: STICHES: CABG Boosts 10-Year Survival in Severe LV Dysfunction
Teaser: "It's a very clear indication that if you have low ejection fraction that you should seriously consider whether revascularization is feasible," says an expert observer.

Headlines: New FDA Chief Tops Most Influential Physicians List
Teaser: Robert Califf, MD, could 'redefine how drugs, medical devices, tobacco, food safety and controlled substances are regulated in the 21st century.' He is a newcomer to the Modern Healthcare list.

Headlines: Technology Rekindling the Doctor-Patient Relationship
Teaser: Note bloat and the antisocial manner of some electronic health record keepers has given digital tools a bad rap, according to experts who say social media is powering a revolution in healthcare.

Headlines: EU Regulators Favor 'Bubble Boy' Gene Therapy (Strimvelis)
Teaser: The treatment corrects a genetic defect in patient's' blood-forming stem cells that causes a form of severe combined immunodeficiency.

Headlines: Morphine at Acute MI May Blunt Short-Term Antiplatelet Response
Teaser: "Once morphine is given, we may consider giving other IV agents that bypass the gastric emptying, such as GP IIb/IIIa inhibitors or bivalirudin," propose investigators after their prospective study.

Headlines: GAUSS-3: Evolocumab Cuts LDL-C in Statin-Intolerant Patients
Teaser: UPDATED // "We have established that you can use PCSK9 inhibitors successfully" in this patient population, said the lead author. "And that has regulatory and     practice implications."

Headlines: HOPE-3: Statins Lower CV Events in Intermediate-CHD-Risk Patients
Teaser: UPDATED // Alone or with blood-pressure-lowering therapy, at least in those with elevated baseline BP, rosuvastatin lowered composite end points by 24% to 29% vs     placebo.

Headlines: Genfit Plans to Test Its Drug in Second Liver Disease
Teaser: French drugmaker Genfit SA on Thursday said it would begin a midstage trial this year of its experimental drug elafibranor to treat primary biliary cholangitis, a chronic disease in which bile ducts in the liver are gradually destroyed.

Headlines: EMA Panel Likes Daratumumab for Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) has recommended granting conditional marketing authorization for daratumumab for the treatment of adults with relapsed and refractory multiple myeloma.

Headlines: Invasive Lobular Carcinoma -- A Distinct Breast Cancer Subtype
Teaser: Genomic studies have highlighted invasive lobular cancer as a distinct subset of breast cancer, which may lead to new treatment approaches in the future.

Headlines: Nonoperative Management of Rectal Cancer Increasing in US

Headlines: Post-Lyme-Disease Syndrome: Longer Antibiotics May Not Help

Headlines: Delayed Visual Improvements in AMD Continue With Ranibizumab Treatment

Headlines: Studies Suggest Ways to Improve Gestational Diabetes Outcomes
Teaser: Screening women earlier for gestational diabetes and treating those who meet lower diagnostic criteria may reduce adverse maternal and neonatal outcomes, according to two new studies.

Headlines: World's Largest Imaging Project Aims to Shed New Light on Disease

Headlines: Surgery Tops Drugs for Glycemic Control at 5 Years: STAMPEDE

Headlines: What's Hot at AAN 2016?
Teaser: A rundown of changes to the program and expected highlights of the American Academy of Neurology 2016 Annual Meeting in Vancouver, Canada.

Teaser: The entire family of Impella left side heart pumps has been approved for cardiogenic shock.

Headlines: Empowered Pharmacists Lower Patients' Cardiac Risk in RxEACH
Teaser: "Engaging pharmacists could bring another 450,000 helping hands in the United States and Canada to help reduce the burden of cardiovascular disease,"     researchers say.

Teaser: Interim analysis of a phase 3 randomized controlled trial shows positive outcomes with masitinib on all primary and secondary endpoints, the company reports.

Teaser: The approval comes almost 2 months after an advisory panel met to work out the technology's practice implications. Both the Micra and Nanostim devices are already available in Europe.

Headlines: Marijuana Use Before Acute MI May Give Survival Edge in Hospital

Headlines: Behavior After Bariatric Surgery Key, Study Finds

Headlines: Everolimus Data for Seizures in Tuberous Sclerosis 'Exciting'

Teaser: Sorafenib might be a suitable option for treating advanced MTC, when the standard drugs are not available.

Headlines: In-Hospital TAVR Outcomes Improve as Case Volume Goes Up

Teaser: A 2-day FDA advisory panel meeting this week focused on ways to modify the opioid analgesic Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategies.

Headlines: Blockbuster Hopes Grow for Ablynx Arthritis Drug Backed by Abbvie
Teaser: Ablynx's hopes for a potential multibillion-dollar drug were boosted on Thursday by strong clinical trial results in rheumatoid arthritis, vindicating a $175 million bet placed on the product by U.S. pharma group AbbVie in 2013.

Headlines: CAR T-Cell Leukemia Trial Put on Hold After Two Deaths
Teaser: The deaths in Juno Therapeutics' ROCKET trial are blamed on neurotoxicity stemming from the addition of fludarabine to the preconditioning regimen.

Headlines: Expensive Eye Meds Cost Medicare ‘Billions’
Teaser: Many U.S. ophthalmologists are prescribing expensive eye medications for Medicare patients despite evidence that a lower cost drug may be just as effective, researchers report.

Headlines: Two Drugs 'Graduate' From Novel I-SPY 2 Breast Cancer Trial
Teaser: A novel trial design, the I-SPY 2 collaboration, predicts that neratinib and veliparib-carboplatin will be successful in phase 3, but questions remain about endpoints.

Headlines: Regulatory Endpoints for Approval: ORR, OS, or PFS?
Teaser: Has the recent move toward accepting objective response rates as an  endpoint in oncology trials been a success?

Headlines: Does Too Much Sleep Increase Diabetes Risk?
Teaser: For the last 30 years scientists have been telling us that not getting enough sleep may be a cause of type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: NYU Studies Stopped After 'Violations' Exposed, PI Resigns
Teaser: The New York University School of Medicine has shuttered eight studies of an experimental marijuana-like drug, resulting in the resignation of the principal investigator, the New York Times reports.

Headlines: Cancer Moonshot Effort Unveils Dozens of Initiatives
Teaser: Federal officials outlined plans to collaborate more with the private sector in an acknowledgment that government funding would not be enough.

Headlines: Midostaurin Works in Advanced Systemic Mastocytosis
Teaser: Desperately needed treatment for advanced systemic mastocytosis seems to have been found in the investigational multikinase inhibitor, midostaurin.

Headlines: Zika Vaccine Clinical Trials to Start in Humans This Month
Teaser: A Zika virus DNA vaccine has entered phase 1 testing in humans, and two other Zika vaccines that protected mice from infection after a single dose are heading for human studies this year.

Headlines: How Is Empagliflozin Working in Type 2 Diabetes in EMPA-REG?
Teaser: Theories abound as to the mechanisms by which empagliflozin is reducing cardiovascular death and renal events in the EMPA-REG OUTCOME study; some of these     were outlined at the recent ADA conference.

Headlines: Identifying Migraine 'Protectors'
Teaser: A new data platform creates individual profiles aiming to identify which factors trigger migraine headaches, and which may protect against them.

Headlines: All Eyes at Optometry's Meeting Will Be On Buzz Aldrin
Teaser: Moon-walking astronaut Buzz Aldrin will kick off the 5-day event celebrating the best of science, education, and the practice of optometry.

Headlines: As Little as a Free Meal Influences Prescribing, Data Suggest
Teaser: Physicians who accept a free meal from a drug company appeared more likely to prescribe the promoted, brand-name drug instead of a less expensive, generic drug, new data showed.

Headlines: Can Patients Discontinue Immunotherapy and Still Benefit?
Teaser: Overall, there are few data on whether to and when to discontinue immunotherapy, but clues from trials show continued benefit.

Headlines: Insulin-Statin-PCSK9 Links Point to New Treatment Horizons
Teaser: An intricate dance with the PCSK9 molecule played out by statins, diabetes, and risk markers may explain the prowess of evolocumab and alirocumab on LDL-C     and points to a hypothetical use for the agents.

Headlines: Single Rituximab Injection Delays RA in High-Risk Patients
Teaser: A single infusion of the anti-CD20 antibody rituximab, intended to deplete the B-cell population, delays the onset of rheumatoid arthritis in high-risk patients, results from the PRAIRI study suggest.

Headlines: New Tool Predicts Cancer Patient Survival Time
Teaser: A new statistical method provides useful information for estimating how long a cancer patient may survive.

Headlines: Empagliflozin Slows Progression of Renal Disease in Diabetes
Teaser: The long-awaited renal outcomes from the EMPA-REG trial with the SGLT-2 inhibitor for type 2 diabetes, empagliflozin indicate that the drug slows     progression to kidney disease.

Headlines: Unprecedented, But Puzzling, Results in Advanced Sarcoma
Teaser: In soft tissue sarcoma, the investigational antibody olaratumab improved overall survival by a large margin and progression-free survival by a considerably smaller margin, which is unusual.

Headlines: Vemurafenib Shows Activity in Refractory Thyroid Cancer
Teaser: The  BRAF inhibitor has shown activity in patients with papillary thyroid cancer with BRAF mutations refractory to radioactive iodine.

Headlines: GLP-1 Agonist Lixisenatide (Adlyxin)    Okayed for T2DM in US
Teaser: The latest GLP-1 agonist for the treatment of type 2 diabetes to gain approval in the US is lixisenatide; it's already approved under the brand name     Lyxumia in more than 60 countries.

Headlines: No Confusion: Alcohol Causes Seven Cancers
Teaser: A new literature review reaffirms alcohol as a cause of cancer and discusses why there is 'confusion' about this relationship.

Headlines: Costs of Treating Blood Disorders Explored
Teaser: The costs of treating hematologic malignancies and nonmalignant blood disorders are similar, but there is substantial variation in direct healthcare costs between countries.

Headlines: Robot vs Human Prostatectomy: It's a Tie, at Least So Far
Teaser: Early results showed no significant oncologic or functional differences at 12 weeks, including return of early urinary and sexual function.

Headlines: New Checklist Tests Behavior Change as First Sign of Dementia
Teaser: Mild behavioral changes, not memory problems, may be a harbinger of cognitive decline, new research shows.

Headlines: CCTA Can Track Noncalcified Plaque Regression by Statin Therapy
Teaser: CT angiography can potentially be used to identify any coronary calcifications in higher-risk patients for deciding whether to consider intensification of statin therapy, according to researchers.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Clinical Trials Must Include Older Patients
Teaser: Older adults continue to be underrepresented in clinical trials investigating new cancer therapies, despite the fact that they make up a large proportion of cancer patients.

Headlines: Serial BMD Tests Show Osteoporosis-Drug Effects, Fracture Risk
Teaser: "The important thing is there is value in doing some repeat testing [of bone-mineral density] in women receiving treatment" for osteoporosis, according to     the lead researcher.

Headlines: Variable LDL-C Tied to Worse Memory-Test Scores, MRI Findings
Teaser: The study adds to "emerging evidence that vascular factors are of importance to brain health and underscores that LDL-C variability might be a useful risk marker,"   the lead author says.

Headlines: Risk Calculator Predicts Conversion to Psychosis
Teaser: A new risk calculator predicts the probability of high-risk patients converting to full psychosis within 2 years, new research shows.

Headlines: Valeant Psoriasis Drug's Suicide Risk Hard to Assess -FDA Staff
Teaser: Valeant Pharmaceuticals International Inc's experimental drug to treat psoriasis carries a potential risk of suicide that is challenging to assess due to limited data, a preliminary review by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Friday.

Headlines: Apixaban Effective, Safe in AF with Declining Renal Function
Teaser: Renal function declined in 13.6% of atrial-fibrillation patients over time, prompting one expert to call for experts to serve as a "hovering cloud" to address inpatient direct oral anticoagulant concerns.

Headlines: HF With 'Recovered' LVEF: Distinct, Deserves More Scrutiny
Teaser: "A new phenotype of heart failure has emerged," say expert observers of an analysis pointing to unique outomes in treated outpatients with ejection fractions that had risen from 40% or lower to >40%.

Headlines: Juno's CAR T-Cell Study Restarts, Without Fludarabine
Teaser: The clinical trial was halted after two patients died, but the deaths were related to the use of fludarabine in the preconditioning regimen.

Headlines: Ipilimumab Shows Impressive Activity After HSCT Failure
Teaser: In patients with hematologic malignancies, ipilimumab, the CTLA4 inhibitor, showed impressive responses after disease relapse following allogeneic transplant.

Headlines: D-Cycloserine Augmentation Ineffective in Pediatric OCD
Teaser: Contrary to earlier findings, D-cycloserine administered before CBT sessions does not boost the efficacy of CBT in children and adolescents with OCD, a large randomized controlled trial shows.

Headlines: Biosimilar to Humira Recommended by FDA Panel
Teaser: The FDA's Arthritis Advisory Committee voted unanimously to recommend licensure of ABP 501 as a biosimilar product to US-licensed Humira (adalimumab).

Headlines: NIH's Fauci on Combating Zika
Teaser: The number of travel-related cases is growing, and public health officials -- especially in states such as Florida -- predict it is only a matter of time until the first locally transmitted case is confirmed.

Headlines: Titanic Shift in Attitude Anticipated at AIDS 2016
Teaser: Since the International AIDS Conference was last held in South Africa, politics have caught up to science, and access to treatment and prevention will now be on the agenda.

Headlines: Sanofi's GLP-1/Insulin Combo LixiLan Faces 3-Month Delay in US
Teaser: US approval of the GLP-1 receptor agonist lixisenatide and insulin glargine combination LixiLan is delayed over concerns about the delivery device; a     decision is now due by November.

Headlines: Prescription Drug Costs: Why Do They Keep Going Up?
Teaser: A new paper examines the reasons for the continuing rise of drug costs in the US and offers several strategies to control pricing.

Headlines: Donor Fecal Transplant More Effective Than From Self
Teaser: Fecal microbiota transplant was found to be effective in a randomized controlled clinical trial, but efficacy of control self-transplant differed in the two study locations.

Headlines: Topical Antibiotics Unnecessary for Intravitreous Injections
Teaser: Topical antibiotics are unnecessary in patients receiving intravitreous injections, but povidone-iodine is important for preventing endophthalmitis, according to results from the Diabetic Retinopathy Clinical Research Network.

Headlines: Oral Contraceptives Don't Impair Sexual Function, at Least Overall
Teaser: Still, use of a levonorgestrel-based contraceptive in a trial had modest but significant adverse effects on measures of arousal and pleasure, and "for     individual women, we believe it could be of clinical importance."

Headlines: A Morphine Alternative With Less Overdose Risk?
Teaser: Scientists are testing an experimental drug that's designed to have the painkilling power of morphine without some of the side effects that can lead to overdose deaths.

Headlines: Alzheimer’s Association Announces Clinical Trial Competition
Teaser: Four projects related to brain inflammation receive $1 million each but compete for additional $3 million.

Headlines: FDA Delays Approval Decision for Factor Xa Inhibitor Antidote
Teaser: The agency is seeking further manufacturing information and data from ongoing clinical trials prior to potential approval of Portola's andexanet alfa.

Headlines: Surge in Bare Metal Stent Use Not Tied to Higher Risk of Revascularization
Teaser: The surge in bare metal stent use that occurred after regulators expressed concerns about drug-eluting stents was not associated with a higher risk of revascularization or other adverse outcomes in adults over age 75, researchers have found.

Headlines: Real-World Anti-VEGF Data Disappointing
Teaser: Administered under real-life circumstances, anti-VEGF treatments produce much worse results than they do in clinical trials, according to an analysis of 750,000 patients in the US.

Headlines: Infection Linked to Large Increased Risk for Death by Suicide
Teaser: Infection requiring hospitalization has been linked to a 43% increased risk for death by suicide, a large population-based Danish cohort study shows.

Headlines: Independent Pathways Connect Brain and Gut in Irritable Bowel Syndrome
Teaser: There might be independent gut-to-brain and brain-to-gut pathways in patients with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), researchers from Australia report.

Headlines: Half of Pediatric Trials Go Unfinished or Unpublished
Teaser: Recruiting enough children was the top reason for the waste of financial and human resources. Industry-sponsored trials were less likely to be halted, but more likely to result in nonpublication.

Headlines: Do Elevated Lipids Protect Against Diabetes? Clues in Gene Study
Teaser: The study findings "will no doubt fuel the controversy on the causal association of major plasma lipids with type 2 diabetes," experts assert.

Headlines: Acupuncture May Improve Memory in Mild Cognitive Impairment
Teaser: Although a new meta-analysis suggests acupuncture alone or as an adjunctive therapy to nimodipine can increase cognitive and memory scores in patients with MCI, investigators urge caution.

Headlines: Mission: Lifeline Extends Guideline STEMI Care to More Patients
Teaser: Greater regional coordination of leadership, protocols, and feedback can help to bring more STEMI treatment times within national guidelines, suggests a new analysis.

Headlines: Models for Sharing Trial Data Abound, but With Little Consensus
Teaser: Authors of perspectives published in the NEJM differ on time frames for releasing data and who should make sharing decisions. An outside expert said none of the models goes far enough.

Headlines: Zika DNA Vaccine Enters Phase 1 Trial
Teaser: The National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases, which developed the novel vaccine, is also developing other candidates to immunize people against the Zika virus.

Headlines: Diabetes Drug Liraglutide Falls Short in Advanced Heart Failure
Teaser: The agent may have helped with clinical stability in mild heart failure, but there was a worrisome trend in those already with advanced heart failure, according to researchers.

Headlines: 'Visionary' Psychiatrist New NIMH Director
Teaser: Joshua Gordon, MD, PhD, is a 'visionary psychiatrist and neuroscientist with deep experience in mental health research and practice,' the NIH says.

Headlines: Pathophysiological Differences in Early AMD May Point to New Therapeutic Targets
Teaser: In early age-related macular degeneration (AMD), differences in pathophysiology may help identify new targets for treatment, a new pilot study from France suggests.

Headlines: Could Identifying Cardiac Arrest Patients With No Chance of Survival Help Reduce Organ Shortage?
Teaser: Three objective criteria can identify patients with out-of-hospital cardiac arrest (OHCA) who have no chance of survival but might still provide organs for donation, according to a retrospective study.

Headlines: 'Mystery Shoppers' Call About Palliative Care, Get Mixed Bag
Teaser: Researchers found that patients may not always get the answers they need on first contact with even the biggest cancer centers.

Headlines: Top Medical Leaders Debate Nation's Public Health Progress
Teaser: The speakers shared views on Zika, disease prevention, funding for emergency outbreaks, social determinants of health, and FDA priorities.

Headlines: FDA Warns Over Promotion of Investigational Drug at ASCO
Teaser: Material displayed in a panel at an exhibition booth did not state that the drug was investigational and not yet approved, and so was in violation of a federal act.

Headlines: Brexit Causing Uncertainty in UK Neurology Community
Teaser: Possible negative effects on the neurology community of the recent vote for the UK to leave the European Union are outlined in an editorial in The Lancet Neurology.

Headlines: Cannabis-Derived Agent May Offer Type 2 Diabetes Benefit
Teaser: The first clinical trial of two phytocannabinoids finds one that reduces blood glucose without the psychotropic side effects.

Headlines: Cancer Moonshot Plans Crystalize With 10 Recommendations
Teaser: Plans for the Cancer Moonshot, which aims to compress a decade of cancer research into the next 5 years, have now been outlined by an expert panel.

Headlines: Better Outcomes With Bone Marrow vs Peripheral Blood
Teaser: For hematopoietic stem cell transplants from unrelated donors, bone marrow may be a better source than peripheral blood, new results suggest.

Headlines: Sudden Death in HCM Usually Not at Exertion: Autopsy Registry
Teaser: It is known that some of these patients die suddenly without known risk factors, said a researcher, adding the study "is in some way a snapshot of the current failure of risk stratification."

Headlines: Merck Scraps Development of Osteoporosis Drug Due to Stroke Risk
Teaser: Merck & Co Inc said it would stop developing its experimental osteoporosis drug after an independent analysis confirmed the treatment raises the risk of stroke.

Headlines: SUSTAIN-6 Will Headline EASD 2016 in Munich
Teaser: New data on key trials, as well as the first details of the SUSTAIN-6 study with semaglutide, plus a focus on the complications of diabetes, promise to     make this year's EASD one to remember.

Headlines: Major Trial: Forgo Whole-Brain RT in Lung Cancer
Teaser: Whole-brain radiotherapy is routinely used in lung cancer patients with multiple brain metastases, but a major trial shows no significant survival or QoL benefit.

Headlines: Artificial Vision, Anti-VEGFs Focus of EURETINA Congress
Teaser: Artificial vision, anti-VEGF therapies, and interactive sessions with thought leaders discussing the latest studies are planned for the European Society of Retina Specialists 16th EURETINA Congress.

Headlines: Empagliflozin CV Benefit Unaffected by HF Burden: EMPA-REG
Teaser: In a clinical-trial update, researchers look into empagliflozin effects on type 2 diabetes patients who have heart failure at study baseline, incident heart failure during the trial, or not at all.

Headlines: Speeding the Pace of Influenza Vaccine Development
Teaser: Investigators are debating cost-effective new methods to assess the efficacy of novel influenza vaccines in advance of conducting large, expensive clinical trials.

Headlines: Intravenous Zanamivir for Hospitalized Patients With Flu
Teaser: An intravenous formulation of a neuraminidase inhibitor is a good option for the treatment of influenza, especially for patients who cannot tolerate oral or inhaled treatments, new research shows.

Headlines: Optical Coherence Tomography: Modest Benefit in PCI
Teaser: The imaging technology was not associated with adverse effects, despite increasing PCI procedural time and contrast-media exposure in the DOCTORS study.

Headlines: Wide Support for NIH Study for Precision Medicine Initiative
Teaser: A nationally representative survey revealed high levels of support and interest in participation among Americans for the centerpiece of the White House's Precision Medicine Initiative.

Headlines: Conflicts of Interest Frequent Among NCCN Guideline Authors
Teaser: Financial conflicts of interest are frequent among panel members authoring the National Comprehensive Cancer Network guidelines, raising concerns about the integrity of the scientific process.

Headlines: NIH Panel Unveils New Plan to Stop Youth Suicide
Teaser: Greater collaboration and linked data systems are needed to advance youth suicide prevention efforts in the next decade, an NIH panel concludes.

Headlines: HHS Officials: Important Progress on Zika, but Much Work Ahead
Teaser: With $1.1 billion in supplemental funding for Zika now in hand, federal health officials provide an update on Zika virus response.

Headlines: Autophagy Researcher Wins Nobel Prize for Medicine
Teaser: Yoshinori Ohsumi, PhD, mapped out how cells break down and recycle their contents, a metabolic process involved in diseases ranging from cancer to type 2 diabetes.

Headlines: Practice-Changing Data to Feature at ESMO 2016
Teaser: The latest clinical trial data and public health issues regarding access to novel therapies across Europe will form the backbone of the largest oncology meeting in Europe, taking place in Copenhagen.

Headlines: Data Gathering Transforming Medical Research
Teaser: Researchers are digging deep -- using wearables, electronic hospital records, open-source data collections, and whole-genome sequencing -- to extract precise information on patients.

Headlines: BMJ: More Questions on Faulty INR Device Used in ROCKET AF
Teaser: The BMJ charges that Janssen had early concerns about the testing device and even created a recheck program -- but didn't share these data with the FDA or the trial's safety monitoring board.

Headlines: New Standard of Care Emerging for Merkel Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: For patients with advanced Merkel cell carcinoma, immunotherapies targeting the PD-1/PD-L1 axis are emerging as what will likely be the new standard of care.

Headlines: Questions Over Promise of Personalized Cancer Medicine
Teaser: The promise of personalized cancer medicine is questioned, as few patients to date have benefited to any real extent from any agent targeted to tumor mutations.

Headlines: Patient Expectations Unrealistic for Phase 1 Cancer Trials
Teaser: Patient expectations appear to be at odds with reality when it comes to participation in phase 1 clinical trials.

Headlines: Ketamine's Antidepressant Effects: New Insight
Teaser: In contrast to other NMDA antagonists, ketamine appears to have the opposite effect on the brain's thalamocortical networks, a finding that may provide insight into the drug's antidepressant effects.

Headlines: FDA Clears Ustekinumab (Stelara) for Crohn's Disease
Teaser: In clinical trials, most patients who responded to induction therapy with ustekinumab and continued treatment achieved remission of symptoms.

Headlines: Statin Safety Claims in Lancet Reignite Acrimony
Teaser: The statin review is being cast as more than yearlong effort to set the record straight regarding the safety and efficacy of statin therapy and at the same time "a total whitewash."

Headlines: Data: May Be OK to Give 'T' to Men With Prostate Cancer
Teaser: The idea of prescribing testosterone to men with prostate cancer was once an anathema. But new data from a small patient cohort suggest that it may be okay.

Headlines: Allergan to Buy Tobira in Push for NASH Treatments
Teaser: Allergan Plc said it would buy Tobira Therapeutics Inc in a deal worth up to $1.7 billion, about 19 times the company's current value, to get a leg up in the race to develop therapies for nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).

Headlines: Adverse Effects Underreported in Clinical Trials
Teaser: Adverse effects of medical treatments appear to be underreported in peer-reviewed journal articles that describe clinical trial results, a new systematic review has found.

Headlines: Libre 'Flash' Glucose Monitoring System Cuts Hypoglycemia
Teaser: Experts weigh the relative pros and cons of the new Freestyle Libre "Flash" Glucose Monitoring System, which seems to be gaining in popularity among     diabetes patients in Europe.

Headlines: Time to Abandon the Digital Rectal Exam?
Teaser: Data from the PLCO trial show that routine DRE screening for prostate cancer yields minimal gain at maximal discomfort, suggesting the DRE should be abandoned. Some experts disagree.

Headlines: Aspirin Overuse May Exceed Underuse in Diabetes
Teaser: A study suggests that decision-support tools are needed to help clinicians determine which patients are most appropriate for aspirin prescribing.

Headlines: Ten Biomarkers Predict CV Outcomes in Diabetes Patients
Teaser: Ten biomarkers identified in ORIGIN for predicting cardiovascular outcomes have shown similar predictive ability when used, in addition to clinical risk     factors, in diabetes patients from the HOPE study.

Headlines: New Wheelchair Lets You Cruise Through Town Standing
Teaser: Israeli technology start-up UPnRIDE Robotics is launching an innovative upright, self-stabilizing wheelchair at a medical conference in Germany next month and the company hopes the device will hit the market next year.

Headlines: FDA Approves US Trial of Cuban Lung Cancer Vaccine
Teaser: The approval of a clinical trial for the therapeutic vaccine follows some media hype earlier this year.

Headlines: Corneal Inlays Better Than Monovision, Researchers Say
Teaser: The two corneal implants approved for the treatment of presbyopia do not result in monovision, experts explain, and each has a place among treatment options.

Headlines: New CRISPR Tools More Precise, but Targeting Mishaps a Worry
Teaser: A new cutting tool in the CRISPR toolbox provides a greater range of precision and efficiency, but it can also result in off-target gene mutations with unknown and unintended consequences.

Headlines: TCT-16: Halloween 'Magic,' Some Tricks, and a Lot of Treats
Teaser: One "trick" planned is a real disappearing act: bioresorbable vascular scaffolds vying with standard DES. A treat? The potentially definitive face-off     between PCI and CABG in left-main disease.

Headlines: FDA Drowning in Orphan Drug Applications
Teaser: Officials said that staffing issues were beginning to affect review times, but that 2016 was expected to be another banner year for rare diseases.

Headlines: Biohackers Create Generics to Battle Rising Drug Prices
Teaser: Developers said they will keep pushing boundaries to meet patient needs.

Headlines: PrEP Success Breeds Complexity in HIV Prevention Trials
Teaser: As researchers explore new approaches to the prevention and cure of HIV in the era of pre-exposure prophylaxis, success is changing clinical trial design and raising ethics questions.

Headlines: New Antipsychotic Effective With Placebo-like Side Effects
Teaser: Several positive studies support pursuit of approval for a first-in-class antipsychotic with efficacy comparable to that of current medications but with a placebo-like side effect profile.

Headlines: Final Moonshot Report: US Is 'Positioned to End Cancer'
Teaser: Vice President Joe Biden delivered the Cancer Moonshot report to President Barack Obama and the US public.

Headlines: Final Word? Placebo Response in Depression Trials Not Rising
Teaser: Contrary to popular belief, placebo response rates in antidepressant treatment trials are not rising and have held steady for more than 2 decades, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Chromoendoscopy May Improve Neoplasia Detection in Long-Standing IBD
Teaser: Chromoendoscopy may improve the detection of neoplasia in patients with long-standing inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) in a non-trial clinical setting, researchers from Spain report.

Headlines: Editing Human Germline DNA the Focus at Sold-out Conference
Teaser: Ethical concerns related to gene-editing research will be addressed at the European Society of Gene and Cell Therapy Annual Congress, as will advances in technologies and stem cell research.

Headlines: Phytoestrogens May Benefit Health but Also Prompt Concern
Teaser: A literature review finds evidence for a variety of health benefits for women using soy and other phytoestrogens, but there is also concern about     endocrine-disrupting potential.

Headlines: Breast Cancer Overdiagnosis: A New Estimate in NEJM
Teaser: The overdiagnosis of breast cancer via mammography screening is "larger than is generally recognized," concludes a new study of SEER data from 1975 to 2012.

Headlines: Novel Compound May Help Stress-Related Alcohol Abuse
Teaser: ABT-436, a V1b receptor antagonist that targets vasopressin receptors, shows promise in individuals with alcohol use disorder, especially those with high anxiety and stress.

Headlines: Novel Initiative Ups Cognitive Screening in Geriatric Patients
Teaser: A quality improvement project dramatically increased cognitive screening in geriatric patients, opening the door toward timely intervention and better outcomes for those at risk.

Headlines: Twitter Seen as Fertile Ground for Cardiovascular Research
Teaser: Though still in its infancy as a clinical and research tool, "The unique part of Twitter is that it's not just the one-sided posting, but rather there's this bidirectional opportunity to communicate back with people," the author said.

Headlines: Suboptimal Reporting of Adverse Events in Pivotal Cancer CTs
Teaser: Many FDA-approved trials for treatment of advanced cancers had suboptimal reporting for recurrent and late toxicities and duration of AEs.

Headlines: A Golden Ticket That Fast-Tracks a Drug Through the FDA
Teaser: A voucher awarded to companies that find treatments for rare childhood diseases can be sold to the highest bidder — and then used to speed up approvals for much more common drugs.

Headlines: Pricey New Treatment Roils Issues of How to Treat Prostate Cancer
Teaser: High-intensity focused ultrasound, often not covered by insurance, leads to discussions about which patients benefit in the real world.

Headlines: 'Probable Misconduct' in Fracture Risk Trials in Stroke, PD
Teaser: A systematic review of 33 trials from one research group found inconsistencies, errors, and misleading text regarding incidence of hip fractures in patients with stroke, Alzheimer’s, or Parkinson's.

Headlines: Novel Treatment Could Lead to Functional Control of Hep B
Teaser: Nucleic acid polymers block the release of the hepatitis B surface antigen from hepatocytes, boosting the efficacy of standard antiviral therapy, according to an early clinical trial.

Headlines: Aggressive BP Therapy Won't Stop AF Recurrences After Ablation
Teaser: The study "raises a lot of questions for us with respect to patients who already have atrial arrhythmia," said an author.

Headlines: Gut Microbiome May Determine Immunotherapy Response
Teaser: Patients with advanced melanoma may respond better to immunotherapy if they have certain bacterial species in their gut microbiome, say US researchers.

Headlines: GLAGOV: Evolocumab Shows Atheroma Reduction on Top of Statins
Teaser: The study achieved the lowest ever LDL levels seen in any IVUS study and suggests that the benefit in atheroma regression is continuous to         values as low as 20 mg/dL.

Headlines: Financial Gains Taint Debate About Nutritional Supplements
Teaser: Charges of conflicts of interest have encumbered clinical decision-making after the Age-Related Eye Disease Study (AREDS) suggested nutritional supplements are beneficial in macular degeneration.

Headlines: FDA Clears Tenofovir Alafenamide (Vemlidy) for Chronic HBV
Teaser: Once-daily Vemlidy has similar efficacy to tenofovir disoproxil (Viread) with fewer bone and renal side effects, the company says.

Headlines: Safety Netting: Monitoring Vague Symptoms That Could Be Cancer
Teaser: Although safety netting is performed by primary care physicians to monitor patients with vague, low-risk cancer symptoms, no study has examined whether it improves diagnosis, say British researchers.

Headlines: New Online Tool Helps Track Unpublished Clinical Trial Data
Teaser: A new online clinical trials tracker shows around half of all trials have not published results.

Headlines: Preserved Hippocampal Volume a Marker for DLB?
Teaser: The hippocampus does not shrink but is preserved in people with mild cognitive impairment who develop dementia with Lewy bodies, a finding that could distinguish that condition from Alzheimer's.

Headlines: U.S. FDA Panel Narrowly Backs Cempra's Antibiotic Solithromycin
Teaser: The effectiveness of Cempra Inc's antibiotic to treat community-acquired pneumonia outweighs the risk of liver injury, an advisory panel to the U.S. Food and Drug Administration narrowly concluded on Friday.

Headlines: Judging Cancer Drugs by Clinical, Not Statistical, Measures
Teaser: A new study of 277 cancer drug clinical trials found that even when drugs provide a statistically significant benefit, they usually don't provide a clinically significant benefit; time for a new approach to approvals?

Headlines: Plastic Surgeons Establish Humanitarian Missions Database for Research And Education
Teaser: The American Academy of Facial Plastic and Reconstructive Surgery (AAFPRS) recently launched its FACE TO FACE international humanitarian missions database to help with monitoring and analyzing clinical outcomes and epidemiological trends, developing evidence-based practice guidelines, and supporting clinical research and education.

Headlines: Tests ID Breast Cancer Patients at Risk for Blood Clots
Teaser: Genetic tests could identify breast cancer patients at high risk for blood clots, a new study shows. Older patients on chemotherapy were at highest risk.

Headlines: Duchenne Drug Approval Still Leaves Bad Taste for Many
Teaser: Approval of eteplirsen for Duchenne muscular dystrophy, controversial even within the FDA, may have implications for the role of patient advocacy in drug regulation.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer Risk Factor Evidence May Be Biased
Teaser: US prostate cancer prevention trials revealed that younger married men with a family history were more likely to undergo biopsy regardless of PSA , which in turn creates detection bias in risk factors.

Headlines: More Information on Adverse Effects in Tragic French Trial
Teaser: Clinical details on four of the volunteers who received the drug that caused severe neurologic reactions -- including death in one case -- have now been published in NEJM.

Headlines: Endovascular Repair May Be Effective for Ascending Aortic Dissection
Teaser: Endovascular repair appears to be effective for ascending aortic dissection in patients ineligible for open repair, researchers from China report.

Headlines: Clear Bias Seen in Studies Funded by Soft-Drink Industry
Teaser: The new findings are striking even compared with research funded by other industries and call into question methods of designing, interpreting, and assessing     studies, investigators said.

Headlines: Despite Challenges, Hope Remains for Zika Vaccine
Teaser: A number of vaccine candidates are in the pipeline, but the real test will be whether a Zika vaccine will prevent viremia, experts say.

Headlines: CPX-351: Better Outcomes in Older High-Risk AML Patients
Teaser: CPX-351 -- a liposomal formulation of cytarabine and daunorubicin -- achieves better results than the standard formulation in acute myeloid leukemia (AML).

Headlines: Watson vs Oncologists: 90% Agreed on Treatment (Eventually)
Teaser: A double-blinded validation study found a high level of concordance between an artificial intelligence system and members of a cancer center tumor board, after some extrahuman effort.

Headlines: Major Increase in Cancer Funding 'a Global Priority'
Teaser: Two leading cancer organizations from Europe and the United States have called on governments and policy makers to fund cancer research in order to capitalize on recent discoveries.

Headlines: Next Big Thing in ER+ Breast Cancer: For Early-Stage Too?
Teaser: Inhibition of cyclin-dependent kinases 4 and 6 is now an option for the treatment of estrogen receptor-positive metastatic breast cancer. Is this approach going to work in earlier-stage disease?

Headlines: Pembrolizumab 1st-Line in NSCLC Also Boosts Quality of Life
Teaser: Along with its groundbreaking improvement in survival, pembrolizumab also improves quality of life when used first line in non-small cell lung cancer.

Headlines: Congress Passes 21st Century Cures Bill
Teaser: The Senate joined the House in approving the omnibus healthcare bill that speeds up drug approvals, funds research, strengthens mental healthcare, and combats opioid abuse.

Headlines: Grab Bag of Goodies in 21st Century Cures Act
Teaser: A breakdown of winners — and a few losers — in the sprawling Cures Act approved by the House.

Headlines: CAR T Cells Motoring to  Market -- by Next Year?
Teaser: Pivotal registration trials for CAR T cell therapies have now been completed, and two products could be approved by the end of 2017.

Headlines: Tofacitinib Shows Promise for Treating Severe Alopecia Areata
Teaser: The Janus kinase (JAK) inhibitor tofacitinib shows promise for treating severe alopecia areata and its variants in adults and adolescents, according to two retrospective studies.

Headlines: New Cancer Drugs With No Benefit 'Should Be Withdrawn'
Teaser: Many new cancer drugs were approved by the FDA on the basis of preliminary surrogate endpoints, and postmarketing studies do not support any real benefit.

Headlines: Psilocybin May Be a Psychiatry Game Changer
Teaser: Findings from landmark research in late-stage cancer patients suggest that a single, high dose of the psychedelic drug psilocybin has rapid, lasting effects on mood and anxiety.

Headlines: Bipartisan 'Cures' Bill Easily Passes in House
Teaser: Besides speeding up FDA approval of drugs and medical devices, the 21st Century Cures Act would pour billions of dollars into research, mental health, and prevention and treatment of opioid abuse.

Headlines: GOP Begins New Scrutiny of US Preventive Services Task Force
Teaser: Republican members of the House said they'd look to advance a bill to require the task force to add specialty members.

Headlines: Don't Rush to Ban or Use Kratom, Expert Says
Teaser: A new review contends the herbal remedy kratom has some beneficial properties, suggesting a Drug Enforcement Administration proposal to make it illegal could bring legitimate research to a standstill.

Headlines: One-on-One Cognitive Therapy Bests Group Approach in PTSD
Teaser: Individual cognitive processing therapy works better and faster than group therapy in active-duty military personnel with PTSD, new research shows.

Headlines: Cannabis Helpful for Drug Addiction, Mental Health Disorders?
Teaser: A new review suggests cannabis may be useful in the treatment of substance use disorders and anxiety disorders, particularly PTSD. However, more research is needed.

Headlines: As Lung Cancer Survival Evolves, So Does a Prognostic Tool
Teaser: Patients with non-small cell lung cancer and brain metastases are a more heterogeneous group than has been appreciated in the past. A prognostic tool is keeping up with changes in diagnoses.

Headlines: NIH's Collins Optimistic About 2017 If No Budget Delay
Teaser: The NIH director said he has not yet decided whether he'd stay on in a Trump administration, if asked.

Headlines: Cenicriviroc Improves Fibrosis in Patients With Fatty Liver
Teaser: The investigational drug is designed to interrupt the inflammatory cascade that leads to fibrosis and cirrhosis in patients with severe nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH).

Headlines: Iron Supplementation in HF: Trials Support IV but Not Oral
Teaser: "If iron can't get into the body, you cannot expect it to work," an expert remarked about the lack of benefit with oral iron.

Headlines: A Spoonful of AI Helps the Medicine Go Down
Teaser: A new app that uses artificial intelligence (AI) to monitor adherence to medication can lead to higher-quality data from clinical trials and can help high-risk patients in real time.

Headlines: Metabolic Disorders Linked to Severe, Refractory Depression
Teaser: A large proportion of patients with severe, refractory depression have neurometabolic disorders that, once treated, appear to cause depressive symptoms to remit over the long term.

Headlines: Post-Marketing Study Supports Efficacy of Upper Airway Stimulation for OSA
Teaser: Upper airway stimulation using an implanted device appears safe and effective for obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) in routine clinical practice, researchers from Germany report.

Headlines: Drug Costs -- The No. 1 Challenge in Cancer Care
Teaser: The number one challenge for cancer care practices is the cost of drugs, according to the latest survey from the Association of Community Cancer Centers.

Headlines: Sorafenib Survival Effect in Liver Cancer May Depend on HCV-Status
Teaser: Treatment with sorafenib is associated with improved overall survival in hepatitis C virus (HCV)-positive patients with hepatocellular cancer (HCC), according to a meta-analysis of clinical trials in which sorafenib was the control arm.

Headlines: Is Radical Surgery Needed in Rectal Cancer for All Patients?
Teaser: For patients who have a complete response to chemoradiation, a debate is ongoing whether or not radical surgery is needed in all cases.

Headlines: Elevated Natalizumab Levels in MS May Not Be Linked With PML Risk
Teaser: In multiple sclerosis (MS) patients treated with natalizumab, the risk of developing progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) does not appear to be associated with high blood levels of the drug, preliminary research from the Netherlands suggests.

Headlines: Obstetricians Balk at FDA Warning on Anesthesia in Pregnant Women
Teaser: Repeated or lengthy use of general anesthetic and sedation drugs in infants, toddlers and pregnant women in their third trimester might damage children's developing brains, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration warned this month.

Headlines: CAR T Cells Produce Dramatic Remission in Glioblastoma
Teaser: A patient with recurrent and rapidly progressing glioblastoma experienced a complete regression of his cancer for more than 7 months with CAR T-cell therapy.

Headlines: Most Psychiatric Drug Use Is Long-term With Few Safety Data
Teaser: One in six adults report psychiatric drug use. Rates are significantly higher in older adults, and long-term use is reported in the majority of cases, despite a lack of evidence of long-term safety.

Headlines: Improving Long-term Outcomes of Crohn's Disease
Teaser: Changes in the medical management of Crohn's disease over the past two decades have been paralleled by improvements in long-term outcomes, researchers from the Netherlands report.

Headlines: Liquid Biopsy Monitors Response in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: New data suggest that circulating tumor DNA can be used to monitor treatment response in ovarian cancer.

Headlines: Icotinib Doubles PFS in NSCLC Patients With Brain Metastases
Teaser: Non-small cell lung cancer patients with brain metastases have major improvements in progression-free survival with the EGFR TKI icotinib compared with whole-brain radiotherapy, shows a phase 3 trial.

Headlines: Medical News Stories Lack Qualified Independent Commentators
Teaser: Only one in six media stories on medical research findings included commentary from independent sources; lack of appropriate expertise and academic and financial conflicts of interest were common.

Headlines: Bendamustine Toxicity in FL Raises Eyebrows -- and Questions
Teaser: Results from the GALLIUM study in follicular lymphoma (FL) showed that fatal toxicity was higher with bendamustine compared with other regimens. What does this mean for clinical practice?

Headlines: Stronger 'Superbugs,' and No New Drugs to Fight Them
Teaser: For nearly two years, a killer stalked the patients of Providence Alaska Medical Center.  It was a bacteria called Acinetobacter baumannii, a common cause of infections in hospitals. This one was different.

Headlines: New Guidelines to Define Schizophrenia Response, Resistance
Teaser: Consensus guidelines that operationalize criteria for determining treatment resistance and response in schizophrenia patients should guide the next generation of clinical trials, researchers say.

Headlines: Urgent Need for More, Better Medical Marijuana Research
Teaser: Support for legalization of marijuana, also known as cannabis, for both medical indications and recreational use, is increasing in the US, but there is scant evidence from RCTs that it actually works.

Headlines: 21st Century Cures Bill: A Win or Loss for Healthcare?
Teaser: The sweeping healthcare legislation will increase funding for disease research, improve mental healthcare, and streamline the regulatory system for drugs and medical devices.

Headlines: 'Meaningful' Responses With Ibrutinib in Chronic GVHD
Teaser: A very high response rate was observed in patients treated with ibrutinib, including those with multiple organ involvement.

Headlines: Genomic Study IDs New Drug Targets for Cervical Cancer
Teaser: The largest genomic study so far of cervical cancer has identified new mutations and a small HPV-negative subgroup of endometrial-like tumors.

Headlines: U.S. House Panel to Take Up Bill to Spur Generic Drug Development
Teaser: A U.S. House of Representatives subcommittee will take up bipartisan legislation next week to foster generic drug development, the committee's chairman, Representative Greg Walden, said on Thursday.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Is 'Advance of the Year' for Second Year
Teaser: For the second time, the American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) has chosen immunotherapy as its clinical cancer advance of the year, but it also highlights other progress.

Headlines: Music and Meditation May Slow Cognitive Decline
Teaser: In a small pilot study, adults with subjective cognitive decline who were trained to meditate or who listened to classical music showed improvements in memory and cognitive performance after 6 months.

Headlines: Better Survival After Breast Conservation Than Mastectomy
Teaser: Performing breast-conserving therapy may offer survival benefits over mastectomy, particularly in older women who have earlier-stage disease and other conditions, suggests a large observational study.

Headlines: Breath Test for Early Diagnosis of Upper GI Cancer
Teaser: An exhaled breath test that measures just five chemicals could offer an inexpensive alternative to endoscopy in the diagnosis of esophageal and gastric cancers.

Headlines: Two-Year Disease-Free Survival Bodes Well in Lymphoma
Teaser: Two years after first-line treatment, patients with diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) in remission have a generally favorable outlook, according to Danish researchers.

Headlines: Drug Lobby, Under Criticism, Starts Media Campaign
Teaser: The largest lobbying organization for pharmaceutical companies began running TV ads on Monday morning to improve the industry's image as criticism from U.S. President Donald Trump increases.

Headlines: Venetoclax Plus Rituximab: 'Unprecedented' Efficacy in CLL
Teaser: A new chemo-free combination, venetoclax and rituximab, has shown  complete response rates in half of patients with refractory or relapsed chronic  lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

Headlines: Esophageal Cancer -- Two Separate Diseases
Teaser: Genomic study suggests esophageal squamous cell carcinoma and adenocarcinoma are separate diseases, which could lead to the development of new targeted therapies.

Headlines: Delirium Speeds Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Delirium has been identified as a risk factor for accelerated cognitive decline and has a synergistic effect in the presence of  neuropathologic findings associated with classic dementia.

Headlines: Phase 2 Trials in Pancreatic Cancer: Missing the Mark
Teaser: Across all oncology, the probability of a phase 2 trial leading to drug licensure is 16% or 1 in 6, but for pancreatic cancer, that rate is 5 times lower, at about 3% or 1 in 30. Why?

Headlines: Improving Drug Adherence in the Latino Patient With Diabetes
Teaser: Undefined socioeconomic barriers are suspected in high rates of     noncompliance in Latino patients, including those with Spanish-speaking     physicians.

Headlines: Francis Collins, MD, to Stay On as NIH Director Under Trump
Teaser: At first noncommittal, Dr Collins has accepted the offer to stay at his post, at least temporarily.

Headlines: Alzheimer's Disease and Amyloid: Time to Move On?
Teaser: 2016 ended with the failure of yet another antiamyloid agent, but ongoing late-phase trials continue to target amyloid despite increasing pressure to look at other therapeutic targets.

Headlines: Drug Trials by Authors With Pharma Ties More Often Positive
Teaser: Authors and editorialists call for more transparency, including turning over data sets, bringing back independent reviews of major randomized controlled trials, and better vetting by journal editors.

Headlines: Alarm Bell as Chinese With Diabetes 'Losing 9 Years of Life'
Teaser: Chinese adults with diabetes lose an average of 9 years of life due to the     disease, often from complications and associated conditions that point to     poor clinical management, suggests a large survey.

Headlines: Marker for Prostate Cancer That Needs Aggressive Therapy
Teaser: Surrogate marker identifies men undergoing treatment for prostate cancer who are at high risk for all-cause mortality despite lack of overt PSA failure.

Headlines: Schizophrenia Directly Linked to Diabetes
Teaser: Patients with first-episode schizophrenia have impaired glucose homeostasis, highlighting the need to consider diabetes prevention from the onset of illness, new research suggests.

Headlines: Europe Clears Tenofovir Alafenamide (Vemlidy) for Chronic HBV
Teaser: The efficacy of once-daily Vemlidy is similar to that of tenofovir disoproxil (Viread) with fewer bone and renal side effects, the company says.

Headlines: Sodium Zirconium Cyclosilicate Gets Positive EU Recommendation
Teaser: The Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use recommendation was based     on results of three clinical trials and one ongoing open-label trial.

Headlines: Active Surveillance for Metastatic Cancer? Just This One
Teaser: Active surveillance is almost exclusively used in the management of low-risk cancers. But it's also being used in one -- and only one -- metastatic cancer.

Headlines: Iluvien Implants Yield 12-month Benefit for Diabetic Macular Edema
Teaser: The anatomical and visual benefits of intravitreal fluocinolone acetonide implants in patients with chronic diabetic macular edema (DME) persist up to 12 months, a small study suggests.

Headlines: Killed Oral Cholera Vaccine Appears Safe in Pregnant Women
Teaser: As with so many newer cancer drugs, abiraterone, for advanced castration-resistant prostate cancer, is very expensive. Here's a tip that may reduce cost greatly and does not appear to hurt efficacy.

Headlines: Take With Food, Cut $9000 Prostate Cancer Pill Cost by 75%
Teaser: Women with schizophrenia have a nearly twofold increased risk for breast cancer compared to women without schizophrenia, a finding that underscores the need for improved screening in this population.

Headlines: Schizophrenia Linked to Increased Breast Cancer Risk
Teaser: The largest study to date showed that sentinel lymph node biopsy is as accurate as full lymph node dissection in early endometrial cancer.

Headlines: Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy 'Sufficient' in Endometrial Cancer
Teaser: U.S. President Donald Trump's vow to roll back government regulations at least 75 percent is causing anxiety for some pharmaceutical executives that a less robust Food and Drug Administration would make it harder to secure insurance coverage for pricey new medicines.

Headlines: Pharma Industry Shuns Trump Push for Radical Shift at FDA
Teaser: Cancer care delivery has been mostly unchanged for the past 50 years but now needs a new model, a centaur, say Stanford University academics.

Headlines: Introducing the Human-Machine 'Centaur' for Cancer Care
Teaser: Several biomarkers are useful for making treatment decisions and assessing prognosis in colorectal cancer (CRC), but others lack evidence-based support for their use outside of clinical trials, according to a new guideline.

Headlines: Several Molecular Biomarkers Useful in Colorectal Cancer Evaluation: Guideline
Teaser: Drug developer Immunomedics Inc said it entered into a development and licensing deal for its experimental cancer drug with Seattle Genetics Inc for a potential payment of up to $2 billion.

Headlines: Immunomedics in Up to $2 Billion Licensing Deal With Seattle Genetics
Teaser: Antibiotic use in the month before a metastatic kidney cancer patient starts immunotherapy may reduce efficacy, but new results need prospective confirmation.

Headlines: Antibiotics May Impair Cancer Immunotherapy
Teaser: Following September's announcement of failure in its first phase 3 trial of the drug, two more trials didn't reach significant efficacy and don't support 'regulatory submission,' reports Lundbeck.

Headlines: Two More Phase 3 Trials of Alzheimer's Drug Idalopirdine Fail
Teaser: Organizers of upcoming medical conferences say the restrictions threaten the exchange of scientific ideas, which could hurt people, rather than protect them. Some scientists are boycotting US meetings.

Headlines: Medical Conference Leaders Address Travel Ban Consequences
Teaser: Cognitive Behavioral Analysis System of Psychotherapy (CBASP), a disorder-specific psychotherapy, bested nonspecific psychotherapy in a randomized trial and is a 'viable option' for chronic depression.

Headlines: Disorder-Specific Psychotherapy Effective for Chronic Depression
Teaser: The issue of slow recruitment into randomized trials in the stroke field, which has long been a problem, has not improved over the past 25 years and if anything is getting worse, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Stroke Clinical Trial Recruitment Still a Challenge
Teaser: Cellectis has won U.S. regulatory approval to run an early clinical trial using its gene edited cell therapy product UCART123 for blood cancers, boosting the French biotech firm's ambitions in the hot area of cancer research.

Headlines: Cellectis Gets U.S. Go-ahead to Test 'Off-the-Shelf' Cell Therapy
Teaser: Founders and CEOs from 166 biotech companies signed a letter saying Trump's order is causing uncertainty and fear among foreign-born employees and disrupting a sector that drives economic growth.

Headlines: Biotech Leaders Rail Against Trump Immigration Order
Teaser: There is increased use of mental health services after mild traumatic brain injury (mTBI) in children, but mostly by children with a preexisting mental health diagnosis, a new study shows.

Headlines: Mild TBI May Exacerbate Existing Mental Health Problems in Kids
Teaser: With the widespread loosening of marijuana laws, researchers should step up efforts to consider the potential for cannabinoids in the treatment of addiction, experts say.

Headlines: Anxiety Therapy Better for Depression Than CBT?
Teaser: Metacognitive therapy, a psychotherapeutic approach targeting rumination and negative thought processes, has a large effect size when used to treat depression and may offer an alternative to CBT.

Headlines: Turbulent Reign Over: Top Exec at Top Cancer Center Resigns
Teaser: MD Anderson's embattled president, Ronald DePinho, is leaving the top job, leaving behind a controversial legacy.

Headlines: Ketamine for Depression: Key Efficacy, Safety Questions Remain
Teaser: Ketamine and other glutamate-modulating agents may be the first major advance in treating major depression in years, but fundamental questions remain unanswered.

Headlines: Calls to Boycott US Meetings Over Travel Ban May Hurt, Not Help
Teaser: Stronger international ties, not boycotts of US meetings or journals are needed in the face of travel ban, argues editorial.

Headlines: Clinical Outcomes Trials Put iFR in Same League With FFR
Teaser: Less patient discomfort, shorter procedures, and potential cost savings         favor iFR, but will that be enough to increase physiological-guided         revascularization or simply shift those already sold on FFR?

Headlines: Genes May Boost Infants’ Risk of Heart Defects Linked to Maternal SSRI Use
Teaser: Common variants in certain maternal and infant genes can heighten the risk of congenital heart defects in the offspring of women who use selective serotonin receptor inhibitors (SSRIs) in early pregnancy, when the fetal heart is developing, new research suggests.

Headlines: SPIRE Trials: Immune Response Thwarts PCSK9 Inhibitor Bococizumab
Teaser: In the trials, which were halted early, a immune response in many patients     diminished the drug's potent LDL-lowering effects. In another analysis,     immunogenicity was much less of an issue for alirocumab.

Headlines: Trump Proposes Huge Budget Cuts for NIH, Other HHS Agencies
Teaser: The White House said the cuts were needed to offset a $54 billion increase in military spending. Medical leaders warned that they would cripple biomedical research.

Headlines: Metastases, Not Death, New Benchmark in Prostate Cancer?
Teaser: Prostate cancer experts argue in favor of changing the primary endpoint of active surveillance trials to metastatic disease to reflect what is clinically meaningful to men.

Headlines: Mobile Phone Research Feasible in Patient Study
Teaser: A Mount Sinai study based on ResearchKit used a free app to recruit, enroll, and study a large cohort of patients with asthma; results support quality of patient-reported data.

Headlines: Probiotic in Yogurt May Improve Depressive Symptoms
Teaser: Lactobacillus, a probiotic bacteria found in live-culture yogurt, appears to reverse symptoms of depression in mice, and investigators believe these findings should hold true in people.

Headlines: TG Therapeutics' Leukemia Drug Clears Key Study, Shares Soar
Teaser: TG Therapeutics Inc said a combination of its experimental cancer drug ublituximab and AbbVie Inc's ibrutinib (Imbruvica) outperformed Imbruvica alone in high-risk leukemia patients, sending its shares up 63.5 percent in premarket trade.

Headlines: Seattle Genetics to Resume Trials as FDA Lifts Clinical Hold
Teaser: Seattle Genetics Inc said on Monday the U.S. Food and Drug Administration lifted a clinical hold on several early stage studies testing its experimental cancer drug.

Headlines: New Biologic is 'Potential Blockbuster' for Eczema Treatment
Teaser: Dupilumab safely and effectively controls the symptoms of moderate to severe eczema over the long-term, 1-year data show. FDA approval of the biologic is expected soon, the lead investigator reports.

Headlines: Juno Permanently Halts CAR T-Cell Study
Teaser: After five patient deaths and other issues cited by the company, Juno has given up development of the chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) product JCAR015.

Headlines: Universal Cancer Vaccine -- Still a Pipe Dream?
Teaser: A broad vaccine targeting many different tumors has been a 'holy grail' of cancer therapy, but the seemingly limitless genetic diversity of cancer means it is unlikely, say researchers.

Headlines: Cempra's Bacterial Skin Infection Drug Succeeds in Key Study
Teaser: Cempra Inc said on Friday that its oral experimental drug to treat acute bacterial skin infections met the main goal of a late-stage study, sending the company's shares surging about 40 percent in premarket trading.

Headlines: Academia and Generics: Can They Reduce Cancer Drug Costs?
Teaser: A new approach is needed to curtail the cost of cancer drugs, and a group of experts suggest a partnership between academia and generic drug companies.

Headlines: Hormone Therapy Prolongs PFS in Low-grade Serous Cancer
Teaser: Hormone maintenance therapy prolongs progression-free survival, if not overall survival, in low-grade serous carcinoma following surgery and chemotherapy compared with routine observation alone.

Headlines: Cancer Patients and Research Could Suffer After Brexit
Teaser: Six leading British academics warn that cancer treatment and research could suffer if plans are not made to safeguard access to Europe following the country's Brexit vote.

Headlines: Increase in Childhood Cancer, but Survival Rates High
Teaser: The incidence of childhood cancers has increased in recent decades.

Headlines: New US Report Calls for Scientific Integrity Panel
Teaser: Proposals by a National Academies of Science, Engineering, and Medicine committee include establishing an independent, nonprofit research integrity advisory board with dues-paying members.

Headlines: Common Antibiotic May Treat, Prevent PTSD
Teaser: The antibiotic doxycycline appears to block the formation of negative thoughts and fear memories, suggesting a potential use in the treatment and prevention of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

Headlines: Drugmakers Help Turn Patients With Rare Diseases Into Lobbyists
Teaser: The pharmaceutical industry is teaming up with advocacy groups that are training and even paying for patients who need their medicines to promote their causes in Washington.

Headlines: Delirium in Critically Ill Children Common, May Go Undetected
Teaser: About a quarter of children admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU) will develop delirium, according to the first large international study to assess delirium prevalence in critically ill children.

Headlines: ASCO Does Not Support 'Right-to-Try' Laws
Teaser: ASCO's all in favor of helping cancer patients gain better access to experimental drugs in their time of need, but not through 'right-to-try' legislation, which they feel could be harmful.

Headlines: Trump's FDA Pick Vows Scientific Integrity at Hearing
Teaser: Scott Gottlieb, MD, also said the nation needed to "accept no for an answer" regarding the discredited link between childhood vaccines and autism.

Headlines: Transplantation for Myeloma Patients -- Can It Wait?
