Teaser: Following induction, PFS and response rates are higher for myeloma patients when transplant is part of consolidation therapy. Survival is similar to that in patients receiving transplant after relapse.

Headlines: Home-based Macular Degeneration Monitoring Appears Cost Effective
Teaser: Home telemonitoring of people at risk for age-related macular degeneration (AMD) is potentially cost-effective, according to an economic analysis using a simulation model.

Headlines: And They're Off! CAR T Cells Race Toward Market
Teaser: CAR T cell therapies were once thought to be destined for use only at academic centers, but two companies have now filed for US approval.

Headlines: Absence of Amyloid in MCI Still Means Functional Decline
Teaser: A longitudinal analysis underscores differences in progression to dementia when amyloid is, or is not, present.

Headlines: Full FDA Approval for Osimertinib for PFS Benefit in NSCLC
Teaser: The targeted drug has now shown an improvement in progression-free survival when compared to chemotherapy in certain NSCLC patients.

Headlines: Schizophrenia, ALS Share Genetic Roots
Teaser: A genome-wide association study shows significant overlap in genetic susceptibility between schizophrenia and amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

Headlines: EU Rapid Drug Approval Plan Worries Some National Agencies
Teaser: A push by the European Medicines Agency to speed up the approval of new drugs that show promise is running into resistance from some of the national agencies that will ultimately decide whether the medicines are worth buying.

Headlines: New Insomnia Med a Safer Option for Older Adults?
Teaser: The insomnia drug suvorexant appears to be safe and effective in older adults, without some of the risks and side effects commonly associated with of other pharmaceutical agents, new research suggests.

Headlines: Cancer Researcher, Under 'Review' in Ohio, Wins AACR Award
Teaser: At its annual meeting, the American Association of Cancer Research will honor Carlo Croce, MD, with a leadership award. Dr Croce is being investigated by his own university after a news article raised questions about plagiarism and research fraud.

Headlines: New Drug Target for Opiate Use Disorder Discovered
Teaser: A new study provides the first direct evidence of opiate-related epigenetic alterations in the brain and points to a potential new drug target for opiate use disorder.

Headlines: EU Recommends Suspending Hundreds of Drugs Tested by Indian Firm
Teaser: A large number of poor-quality, industry-funded studies overwhelm the few high-quality positive studies that demonstrate the efficacy of antidepressants for teen depression, an expert says.

Headlines: Antidepressant Efficacy in Teens Clouded by Industry Trials?
Teaser: The diuretic bumetanide improved the core symptoms of autism spectrum disorder in a phase 2b study and will be tested in an upcoming phase 3 study in Europe.

Headlines: Very Low Seroconversion Rates After Occupational Exposure to HCV or HIV in Body Fluids
Teaser: Healthcare workers exposed to body fluids contaminated with hepatitis C virus (HCV) or the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) face very low rates of seroconversion, researchers report.

Headlines: Safety Events Common in Newly Approved Drugs
Teaser: More than 30% of new drugs approved by the FDA during a 10-year period are affected by a postmarket safety event.

Headlines: Prostate Cancer Patients Satisfied With HDR Brachytherapy
Teaser: A single outpatient treatment with high-dose-rate (HDR) brachytherapy for prostate cancer was associated with low toxicity and high quality of life.

Headlines: Antipsychotics: No Evidence of Long-term Harm
Teaser: An expert panel finds strong support for the benefits of initial and maintenance antipsychotic therapy and little evidence of long-term harm for patients with schizophrenia.

Headlines: BMI, Other Patient Factors Help Pinpoint Best Antidepressant
Teaser: Current antidepressant prescribing is imprecise, with low remission rates, but individual patient factors, including BMI and individuals' sex, can inform decision-making and improve outcomes.

Headlines: Anti-VEGF Therapy May Reduce Diabetic Retinopathy Severity for Up to Two Years
Teaser: Treating diabetic macular edema with anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (anti-VEGF) may lead to improvements in diabetic retinopathy severity for up to two years, particularly in patients with nonproliferative disease, researchers say.

Headlines: New Biomarker Signals Poor Response in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: A new test identifies men with castration-resistant prostate cancer who have a poorer response to abiraterone and enzalutamide.

Headlines: NIH and War on Opioid Abuse Fare Well in Spending Bill
Teaser: The NIH would get a $2 billion raise in a spending bill that funds the government through September. Lawmakers also put their money where their mouth is on battling the opioid epidemic.

Headlines: British Cancer Drugs Fund: No Value to Patients
Teaser: The Cancer Drug Fund was established to provide access to drugs not available through the UK's National Health Service, but a new study finds that its value is questionable.

Headlines: Opioid Addiction: 'Alarming' Death Rate in Primary Care
Teaser: Opioid-related deaths have been attributed largely to overdoses. This study shows surprisingly high rates of mortality from medical causes that affect opioid addicts in primary care settings.

Headlines: Scientists Develop Fluid-filled Artificial Womb to Help Premature Babies
Teaser: Scientists in the United States have developed a fluid-filled womb-like bag known as an extra-uterine support device that could transform care for extremely premature babies, significantly improving chances of survival.

Headlines: Troubles of the Billionaire 'Moonshot' Doctor
Teaser: Only months after being in the spotlight as a potential player in the Trump administration, a wealthy doctor is beset by a rash of controversies

Headlines: NASH: The Next Untapped Pharma Market Gives Investors Many Options
Teaser: Large drugmakers with piles of cash are on the hunt for promising medicines being developed by small companies to treat non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH), a progressive fatty liver disease poised to become the leading cause of liver transplants by 2020.

Headlines: Physicians Make Themselves Heard at the March for Science
Teaser: As both march speakers and participants, physicians expressed concern for public health and research funding but also voiced hope for the beginning of a movement to elevate the role of science in society.

Headlines: What Will the March for Science Mean for Medicine?
Teaser: Participating physicians list support for evidence-based medicine, funding for the National Institutes of Health, and public health vigilance among the issues at stake.

Headlines: Cloud Over Pediatric Oncologist and Brain Cancer Vaccine
Teaser: While the details are still unclear, Stefaan Van Gool is being investigated for ethical violations revolving around the use of an experimental cancer vaccine.

Headlines: Costs for Neurologic Diseases Soar
Teaser: Dementia, stroke, and other neurologic diseases collectively cost some $800 billion annually, and experts warn that the economic impact will worsen without increased research funding.

Headlines: HIV Pioneer Mark Wainberg, PhD, Dies Unexpectedly
Teaser: The HIV researcher and social activist drowned while swimming in Bal Harbour, Florida.

Headlines: Cancer Therapy Shortages -- Switch Can Harm Patients
Teaser: Shortages of generic injectable drugs, and the resultant switching to alternative chemotherapy, are jeopardizing patients' physical and financial health, say experts.

Headlines: Cardiovascular Safety of Ranibizumab for Diabetic Macular Edema Still Unclear
Teaser: Uncertainty lingers about the cardiovascular safety of intravitreal ranibizumab injections for diabetic macular edema, a pooled analysis of clinical trials shows.

Headlines: Yes, a Pregnancy After Breast Cancer Is Safe
Teaser: Young women treated for breast cancer often wish to have a child, but fear increasing the risk of disease recurrence. New data indicate their fears are unfounded.

Headlines: As Federally Funded Cancer Research Sags, Is US 'Losing Its Edge'?
Teaser: The US does not dominate oncology research as it once did, a fact reflected in the number of studies from US researchers presented at oncology conferences.

Headlines: Low, Almost SPRINT-like BP Targets Best in Huge Meta-Analysis
Teaser: This network meta-analysis of 42 trials, added to HOPE-3 and SPRINT, suggests that for systolic blood pressure, "lower, preferably less than 130 mm Hg if safely attainable, is better," say two editorialists.

Headlines: Best Practice Unclear for Fecal Transplantation
Teaser: Methodological details of fecal microbiota transplantation were absent from most published studies, leaving questions about best practice and implementation.

Headlines: Novel Drug Shows Promise for Binge Eating Disorder
Teaser: Novel agent significantly reduced episodes of binge eating compared to placebo, new research shows.

Headlines: Gilead's HIV Drug Meets Goal in Four Late-Stage Studies
Teaser: Gilead Sciences Inc said on Tuesday a combination of its experimental HIV drug with existing therapies met the main goal in four late-stage studies.

Headlines: 'Unacceptable' -- Proposed Cuts to Cancer Research
Teaser: Major cancer organizations unanimously oppose the proposed cuts to federal agencies, which they believe will dramatically impair research and affect patients.

Headlines: Radiation Boosts Immunotherapy Benefit in NSCLC
Teaser: Patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who underwent radiotherapy before receiving pembrolizumab had significantly better clinical outcomes compared with those who did not.

Headlines: Evidence Accumulates Outside of Randomized Controlled Trials
Teaser: Investigators are making the case that observational studies and large datasets are a better way to advance some research questions than conventional randomized controlled trials.

Headlines: Zuckerberg Biohub Mapping All Human Cells to Fight Disease
Teaser: Facebook founder Mark Zuckerberg and his wife, Priscilla Chan, MD, a pediatrician, are investing $3 billion to help cure, prevent, or manage all disease.

Headlines: NIH Precision Medicine Initiative Set to Launch Amid Turmoil
Teaser: The National Institutes of Health Precision Medicine Initiative, first announced by President Obama, will roll out in a political climate that is drawing attention to medical biases.

Headlines: Trump Budget Revives Malpractice Damage Caps
Teaser: The White House said tough tort reform measures would save the federal government $55 billion over 10 years, part of the $3.6 trillion it's trying to cut.

Headlines: FDA Approves Sarilumab for Adults With Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: The drug will be marketed in self-injectible prefilled syringes and pens to be used once every 2 weeks. It offers an alternative to drugs such as methotrexate.

Headlines: High Rates of Anxiety in Syrian Kids, Moms Resettled in US
Teaser: Overall, just 30% of adult refugees at a Michigan clinic had full-blown PTSD. But the disorder disproportionately affected mothers and children, said researchers.

Headlines: Large Study Shows Reduced Oral HPV Infections With Vaccine
Teaser: Rates of oral HPV infection were reduced in young adults who had been vaccinated, suggesting protection from oropharyngeal cancer.

Headlines: Ads, Not Research, Create Some Pharma Best-Sellers
Teaser: A look at how and why strategic, star-studded advertising brought a drug for a little-known neurological condition into your home.

Headlines: AEIOU Advances Uninterrupted NOAC Strategy in AF Ablation
Teaser: The preliminary data don't prove fully uninterrupted apixaban is equivalent or better than holding a single dose of the factor Xa inhibitor but offers reassurance both strategies are reasonable.

Headlines: Upadacitinib Showing Promise in Refractory Crohn's Disease
Teaser: Rates of clinical and endoscopic remission were better with an experimental oral JAK1 inhibitor than with placebo in the 'most refractory' Crohn's disease population ever studied.

Headlines: Valbenazine Approval Highlights Lessons for Researchers
Teaser: A New England Journal of Medicine editorial notes that the recent FDA approval of valbenazine for tardive dyskinesia shows how to effectively and quickly develop a much-needed treatment.

Headlines: Cannabis May Combat Age-Related Cognitive Decline
Teaser: Long-term administration of low-dose THC, the main ingredient in marijuana, rejuvenates the aging brain in mice, and a clinical trial in elderly adults is planned.

Headlines: Jury Still Out on Cannabidiol for Psychiatric Disorders
Teaser: There is currently no reliable evidence to support the use of cannabidiol for the treatment of psychiatric disorders, a new review suggests.

Headlines: To What End? Decipher Tells Prostate Cancer Metastasis Risk
Teaser: The genomic test appears to add prognostic value in comparison with widely used clinicopathologic features, according to a new meta-analysis. But how should it be used?

Headlines: Novartis Eye Drug Works With Fewer Injections Than Rivals
Teaser: A drug developed by Novartis to treat vision loss in people over 65 does not need to be injected as frequently as a rival medicine from Regeneron to be effective, clinical trials showed on Tuesday.

Headlines: Probiotics Promising for Mild to Moderate Depression
Teaser: Probiotics have been shown to significantly reduce symptoms in patients with mild to moderate depression, offering hope of a safe and highly tolerable treatment for the disorder.

Headlines: Ophthalmology Surgical Pioneer Roger F. Steinert, MD, Dies
Teaser: A medical adviser at Medscape for many years, not only did he leave a long legacy of accomplishment, he was also 'a leader, teacher, mentor, friend,' said one of many colleagues.

Headlines: Norman Sharpless, MD, to Head National Cancer Institute
Teaser: Trump's choice for the NCI is the director of a high-profile cancer center and eminent researcher in the field of oncology and genetics.

Headlines: Practice-Changing Study for Melanoma Surgery
Teaser: A major clinical trial settles the matter of whether or not to remove all of a melanoma patient's regional lymph nodes when some 'sentinel' nodes have cancer.

Headlines: High PCSK9 Levels in Youth, Notably Girls, With Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: A study suggests that "the efficacy of PCSK9 inhibitors in patients with type 1 diabetes should be further investigated, but optimizing insulin therapy should still be first line," says a researcher.

Headlines: Modified Vancomycin Knocks Out Resistance
Teaser: Researchers anticipate the structurally modified molecule, which attacks bacteria in three separate ways and produces a 1000-fold increase in activity, to be clinic-ready in 5 years.

Headlines: Experimental ADHD Drugs Aimed at Aggression, Genetic Targets
Teaser: Medications in development for the treatment of ADHD target specific behaviors, such as impulsive aggression, and symptoms associated with genetic mutations that involve the glutamatergic network.

Headlines: Veracity of Clinical-Trial Publications Comes Under Fire
Teaser: A disturbing new report suggests data may be inaccurate in more than 80 clinical trial papers published in eight medical journals including the American heavyweights NEJM and JAMA.

Headlines: Trastuzumab Biosimilar Effective Against HER2-positive Breast Cancer
Teaser: CT-P6, a trastuzumab biosimilar, is effective and well tolerated in women with HER2-positive breast cancer, according to results from a phase 3 equivalence trial.

Headlines: Genetic Risk Score Predicts Schizophrenia Treatment Response
Teaser: A risk score based on genetic factors associated with an increased risk for schizophrenia can be an effective predictor of response to antipsychotic treatment following a first episode of psychosis.

Headlines: NIH Launches Personalized Medicine Initiative Beta Phase
Teaser: Only select users can sign on now. The goal is to recruit at least 1 million volunteers who will contribute information on their biology, background, and environment to accelerate research.

Headlines: Up-front Abiraterone in Prostate Cancer: Which Patients?
Teaser: Results from two pivotal studies support the use of abiraterone up front with, instead of after, androgen deprivation therapy, but in which patients?

Headlines: New Insight Into Off-Label Ketamine Use for Depression
Teaser: As the off-label use of ketamine for the treatment of severe depression soars, new research provides insight into the way clinicians are using it in the field, away from the research setting.

Headlines: NCI-Funded Trials Have Extended Lives of US Patients With Cancer
Teaser: Results from SWOG treatment trials significantly extend the lives of patients with cancer in the United States at a reasonable cost for that care.

Headlines: 'Crisis' in PTSD Drug Development Shifts Treatment Guidance
Teaser: The lack of progress in development of drugs to effectively treat PTSD has become a 'crisis' and has created a significant shift in the Veterans Administration's clinical practice treatment guideline.

Headlines: Finding Patients for Targeted Therapies in Routine Practice
Teaser: Comprehensive genomic profiling is feasible and can be performed in routine practice to select cancer patients for treatment with targeted therapies.

Headlines: New Drug Shows Rapid, Robust Effect in Postpartum Depression
Teaser: An investigational drug showed swift, significant improvement in postpartum depression in an open-label phase 2 study.

Headlines: Human Blood May Offer Fresh Approach for Dementia Treatment
Teaser: In clinical trials, antiamyloid agents have fallen short as a treatment for Alzheimer's disease. A group of researchers is taking an alternative approach -- human plasma.

Headlines: Leading Cancer Groups Issue Joint Statement on Disparities
Teaser: Four major cancer organizations have issued a joint statement on disparities in cancer care, the needs and priorities for research, and recommendations for implementation.

Headlines: Aldosterone Hormone Linked to Alcohol Use, Cravings
Teaser: Novel findings show a link between the steroid hormone aldosterone and a risk for alcohol use disorder, underscoring the role of neuroendocrine mechanisms in alcohol cravings and potential treatments.

Headlines: Follow the Money: Drugmakers Deploy Political Cash as Prices, Anger Mount
Teaser: Embattled opioid seller Mallinckrodt is one of many pharmaceutical companies boosting political contributions and lobbying on Capitol Hill.

Headlines: Antipsychotics May Boost Outcomes in Refractory Depression
Teaser: Adding an antipsychotic to current antidepressant therapy may lead to better outcomes in treatment-refractory major depressive disorder, new research suggests.

Headlines: ClinicalTrials.gov Registration May Be Misleading, Experts Say
Teaser: Stem cell companies have registered unregulated clinical trials at the government website ClinicalTrials.gov to deceptively recruit paying customers for their treatments, experts charge.

Headlines: Hybrid MIND Diet May Preserve Cognition, Cut Dementia Risk
Teaser: A hybrid diet aimed at maintaining brain health may be key in preserving cognition and reducing dementia risk, new research suggests.

Headlines: 'Incredibly Exciting': CAR T Cells as 'Living Drugs'
Teaser: Unlike drugs that gradually disappear from the body, CAR T cells are 'living drugs' that persist in the body for years.

Headlines: Biosimilars to Avastin and Herceptin Head for US Market
Teaser: Two new biosimilars, bevacizumab and trastuzumab, were unanimously recommended for approval by an FDA oncologic advisory committee.

Headlines: House Bill Would Boost Funds for NIH by $1.1B; Cuts for CDC
Teaser: President Trump's proposal would have cut NIH by $7.5 billion. The 21st Century Cures Act would get $496 million, most of it ($300 million) going to the Cancer Moonshot. CDC, ONC take cuts.

Headlines: FDA Advisory Board Gives Thumbs Up to Gemtuzumab for AML
Teaser: After being withdrawn from the market in 2010, gemtuzumab may once again be available as a frontline therapy for acute myeloid leukemia.

Headlines: Oncologists See Promise in Neratinib, New Oral HER2-Positive Drug
Teaser: Half of those asked in a Medscape survey rated neratinib, which is pending approval by the FDA later this month, as an important or very important alternative in treating HER2-positive breast cancer.

Headlines: Continuing Nivolumab After Melanoma Progression Benefits Some Patients
Teaser: Some clinically stable patients with advanced melanoma benefit from continued nivolumab treatment after disease progression, researchers say.

Headlines: RCT: Menopause Symptoms Mistaken for Tamoxifen Side Effects
Teaser: Many women who use tamoxifen as a chemopreventive agent experience symptoms that are assumed to be drug related, but they may just be naturally occurring symptoms related to menopause.

Headlines: 'Ultralow-Risk' Breast Cancers Can Skip Endocrine Therapy
Teaser: 'Ultralow-risk breast cancer' is a not commonly used term, but a new study suggests that patients with such cancers could receive less treatment.

Headlines: No Support for Routine Use of Direct Brain Stimulation for MDD
Teaser: Transcranial direct-current stimulation does not work as well as an SSRI for major depression, results of a noninferiority trial show.

Headlines: Lack of Sleep Plus Marital Strife Ups Inflammation
Teaser: It is known that insufficient sleep impedes the ability to handle marital discord. A new study suggests elevated inflammation may be the link.

Headlines: AHA: Financial Constraints Jeopardize Cardiovascular Research
Teaser: A new statement from the American Heart Association urges the biomedical community to define and articulate the return on investment society can expect from supporting basic cardiovascular research.

Headlines: 'Ending Cancer as We Know It': Bidens Launch New Initiative
Teaser: The Biden Cancer Initiative, just launched by former vice president Joe Biden and his wife, has the lofty goal of 'ending cancer as we know it.'

Headlines: Microneedle Patch: Safe, Effective Flu Vaccination
Teaser: Participants in the first phase 1 human clinical trial of inactivated influenza delivered by dissolvable microneedle patch preferred vaccine administration via the microneedle patch over intramuscular or intranasal administration.

Headlines: Smartphone 'Selfies' May Help Diagnose Pancreatic Cancer
Teaser: A new smartphone app may improve screening for pancreatic cancer and other diseases, simply by taking 'selfie.'

Headlines: First CAR T-Cell 'Living Drug' Approved by FDA
Teaser: The first chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cell therapy has been approved by the FDA for use in relapsed/refractory leukemia, for which it offers a 'paradigm shift.'

Headlines: What's Hot at ECNP 2017 Congress?
Teaser: Epigenetics, resilience and stress, and the role of modern technologies in neurology and psychiatry will form three main themes at a leading congress for psychiatrists, neurologists, and psychologists.

Headlines: Anti-Inflammatory Interleukin Inhibitor Reduces Lung Cancer
Teaser: The CANTOS trial in patients with atherosclerosis also found a reduction in lung cancer incidence, as well as lung cancer and total cancer mortality.

Headlines: Extended AI Use Linked to CV Events and Bone Fractures
Teaser: There is growing interest in extending the use of adjuvant endocrine therapy in breast cancer, but the benefit vs risk for toxicity is not yet defined.

Headlines: FDA, EMA Strengthen Drug Inspection Cooperation
Teaser: A new confidentiality agreement allows the FDA to share full drug inspection reports with the European Commission and the European Medicines Agency.

Headlines: Case Closed on <1 Year of Trastuzumab for Breast Cancer
Teaser: For early-stage breast cancer, the treatment duration of 1 year for trastuzumab was a guess. New research indicates it was a good guess.

Headlines: Shorter Anti-HCV Regimen Effective in Patients With or Without Cirrhosis
Teaser: An eight-week regimen containing grazoprevir-ruzasvir-uprifosbuvir appears to be effective for treating hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection in patients with or without cirrhosis, according to findings from a pair of randomized phase 2 open-label trials.

Headlines: Early, Late Outcomes of Therapy for Diabetic Macular Edema Correlate
Teaser: Early vision gains correlate with long-term visual outcomes in patients with diabetic macular edema (DME) treated with bevacizumab or dexamethasone implants, according to results from the BEVORDEX clinical trial.

Headlines: Evidence on Second-line HIV ART Regimens Not Yet Definitive
Teaser: Studies behind approvals for high-risk device modifications and accelerated drug approvals are found wanting in two reports. Former FDA chief agrees there are problems but explains some difficulties.

Headlines: FDA Too Quick to OK Device Changes, Fast-Track Drugs
Teaser: Immunotherapy in cancer care has taken off, but recent negative trials and limited success have raised some criticism and concern.

Headlines: Immunotherapy in Cancer: Hits and Misses, but Charging Ahead
Teaser: The vitamin B3 derivative nicotinamide was previously shown to reduce nonmelanoma skin cancers in a phase 3 trial.

Headlines: Proposed: Trial of Vitamin Derivative to Prevent Melanoma
Teaser: T cells from healthy donors can be educated, expanded, and taken 'off the shelf' to fight viral infections that commonly occur after hematopoietic stem cell transplant (HSCT).

Headlines: Off-the-Shelf T Cells Ward Off Viral Infections After HSCT
Teaser: Oral steroids were associated with a threefold reduced risk for kidney failure in patients with IgA nephropathy, but a fivefold risk for serious adverse events, resulting in early study termination.

Headlines: Steroids for IgA Nephropathy: Risks Outweigh Benefits in Some
Teaser: The APOE gene, which has been implicated in risk for Alzheimer's disease, also increases risk for late-life depression, new research suggests.

Headlines: Alzheimer's Gene Linked to Late-Life Depression
Teaser: Of all lifestyle interventions that may aid in preventing dementia, a growing body of research suggests exercise may be king.

Headlines: Exercise Top Lifestyle Factor for Alzheimer's Prevention?
Teaser: A retrospective analysis of patients enrolled in clinical trials found that bone biopsies at baseline and during follow-up were unnecessary.

Headlines: Skip the Bone Marrow Biopsy in Follicular Lymphoma?
Teaser: An analysis of the SEER-Medicare database shows that outcomes and healthcare costs for the two chemotherapy regimens are similar, with one difference.

Headlines: ACTH vs TCH for Breast Cancer in Real-World Setting
Teaser: Two randomized trials confirm that two new biosimilars that have recently been introduced in Europe are efficacious and comparable to the reference product. Other biosimilars are on the way.

Headlines: Futile: Prostate Cancer Vaccine Phase 3 Trial Ends
Teaser: Prostvac is an immunotherapy designed to induce T-cell responses and thus kill prostate cancer cells. As a monotherapy, it is not effective.

Headlines: Severe Health Problems Plague Survivors of Childhood CA
Teaser: Specialized healthcare delivery is needed for diverse subgroups of adult cancer survivors with complex medical needs, say researchers.

Headlines: FDA Panel Mulls New Data for Pain Patch in Kids
Teaser: An FDA advisory committee weighed results of new study of Butrans transdermal opioid in pediatric patients and whether label changes should be made.

Headlines: Targeting Hypoglycemia and Glycemic Variability in T2D? More From DEVOTE
Teaser: Secondary analyses from the DEVOTE trial comparing the ultralong-acting insulin degludec with insulin glargine examine associations between glycemic variability and severe hypoglycemia and outcomes.

Headlines: Preventing Anxiety: It Can Be Done
Teaser: Psychological and educational interventions are effective in preventing anxiety not only in childhood but throughout the life span.

Headlines: Neurologic AEs on Rise as Checkpoint Inhibitors Evolve
Teaser: Potentially lethal immune-related adverse events (AEs) are expected to increase as anti-PD-1 therapies for solid tumors expand to include other cancers.

Headlines: R&D Investment Does Not Justify High Cost of Cancer Drugs
Teaser: A new analysis found that the revenue from cancer drugs greatly exceeds the investment to develop them.

Headlines: Cancer Patients Struggle to Understand Clinical Trials
Teaser: A nationwide study of cancer patients in Ireland found that many did not understand concepts of randomization or clinical equipoise, even when they had participated.

Headlines: New Study IDs Genes Linking Type 2 Diabetes and Heart Disease
Teaser: A study has identified 16 new genes linked to type 2 diabetes, one new gene linked to heart disease, and seven genes linking both diseases; findings could affect drug development for both.

Headlines: Chemoradiotherapy Remains Standard of Care in Cervical Cancer
Teaser: Chemoradiotherapy remains the standard of care for cervical cancer patients with locally advanced disease, concludes an Indian trial that compared it to neoadjuvant chemotherapy.

Headlines: chemoWave: Patients Data-Sharing With Clinicians
Teaser: A lot can go wrong when cancer patients undergo weeks of chemotherapy. A new app allows for symptom reporting and other vital communication.

Headlines: Intranasal Oxytocin May Prevent PTSD
Teaser: Administering oxytocin via a simple nasal spray could help prevent posttraumatic stress disorder in patients severely affected by a trauma and reduce symptoms in those who already have the condition.

Headlines: No Evidence to Support Neurofeedback Over CBT for ADHD
Teaser: There is no evidence to support neurofeedback over CBT for ADHD in adults, a new triple-blind study suggests.

Headlines: PSA Screening Does Reduce Deaths, New Analysis Shows
Teaser: A new analysis of data from the PLCO and the ERSPC screening trials found that both studies show that PSA screening reduces death from prostate cancer.

Headlines: Mylotarg Approved for AML: Drug Returns to Market
Teaser: After being voluntarily withdrawn 7 years ago, gemtuzumab ozogamicin (Mylotarg) is now returning to the market for the treatment of acute myeloid leukemia.

Headlines: Neuropathy After Breast Cancer Chemo Can Last for Years
Teaser: Breast cancer patients can have a significantly increased risk for peripheral neuropathy and consequent reduction in quality of life depending on the adjuvant chemotherapy used, warn US researchers.

Headlines: FDA Alert Over Multiple Myeloma Trials With Pembrolizumab
Teaser: The FDA has issued a statement about the increased risk for death that was observed when pembrolizumab was added to multiple myeloma regimens in clinical trials.

Headlines: ACT IV: Rindopepimut Not Effective for Glioblastoma
Teaser: The investigational vaccine rindopepimut was not effective in patients with EGFRvIII-expressing glioblastoma, but what can be gleaned from the negative trial?

Headlines: FDA Okays Clinical Trial Testing of Psychedelic Drug for PTSD
Teaser: With input from the FDA and a new breakthrough therapy designation, phase 3 trials are set to begin for the psychedelic MDMA, also known as ecstasy, for assisted treatment of PTSD.

Headlines: Retinal Imaging Device May Offer Insight Into Alzheimer's
Teaser: A noninvasive retinal imaging device that detects changes in the eye that are indicative of brain amyloid may provide new insight into Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: Combination Therapy Best Option for Severe Pediatric Anxiety
Teaser: A combination of medication and behavioral therapy nearly triples remission rates in children and adolescents with severe anxiety and should be offered as a matter of course, say US researchers.

Headlines: Should Medical Research Stick to More 'Serious' Topics?
Teaser: Lighter study subjects may be distracting us from more important matters.

Headlines: Insulinomas, Benign Tumors, Key to Novel Diabetes Drug Targets
Teaser: A series of molecular pathways and genetic alterations in insulinomas may help identify routes for novel drug development to increase proliferation of beta cells and thus help treat diabetes.

Headlines: Zika Vaccine Looks Safe, Promising in First Human Trial
Teaser: Data from the Zika-001 GLS-5700 phase 1 trial showed no serious adverse events and substantial production of anti-Zika binding and neutralizing antibodies.

Headlines: Most New Cancer Drugs Don't Improve Survival or QoL
Teaser: For the majority of cancer drugs that entered the European market between 2009 and 2013, there was no clear evidence that they improved survival or quality of life (QoL).

Headlines: Millions of Life Years Saved if Smokers Switch to Vaping
Teaser: Use of e-cigarettes as a smoking cessation method could save lives for smokers who have tried to quit and failed, says a new report. But experts say there is no solid evidence.

Headlines: Right-to-Try Gains Steam as FDA Eases Compassionate Use
Teaser: A House subcommittee considered two bills that would do an end run around an FDA program that makes experimental drugs available to the seriously ill.

Headlines: Stimulant Cuts Apathy, Improves Cognition in Mild Alzheimer's
Teaser: Improved cognition among older veterans with mild Alzheimer's disease taking methylphenidate was somewhat unexpected.

Headlines: Brief Intervention Dramatically Ups Antidepressant Adherence
Teaser: Patients randomly assigned to a program targeting barriers to medication use were five times more likely to adhere to newly prescribed antidepressants compared to those receiving usual care.

Headlines: Positive Topline Results for Cannabinoid Gel in Fragile X
Teaser: An investigational transdermal cannabinoid gel led to significant and clinically meaningful improvement in anxiety and difficult behaviors in a phase 2 study of children with fragile X syndrome.

Headlines: Brain Inflammation Tied to Depression, Suicidal Thoughts
Teaser: Animal and postmortem studies point to a link between neuroinflammation and depression and suicidality. This study used PET scans to corroborate these findings in living human beings.

Headlines: First-line Doxorubicin for Advanced Sarcoma, Not Combo?
Teaser: Doxorubicin should remain first-line therapy for patients with soft-tissue sarcoma, conclude trialists who compared it with a gemcitabine and docetaxel combination.

Headlines: Treatment That's Easy to Swallow in HPV+ Throat Cancer
Teaser: The radiation therapy dose for throat cancer was cut 50%, but the 2-year outcomes are still excellent, including no injury to patient swallowing.

Headlines: Higher-Dose RT Ups Local Control in Cervical Cancer
Teaser: High-dose brachytherapy was more effective for managing locally advanced  cervical cancer, but did not improve overall survival compared to lower-dose therapy.

Headlines: New Antibiotics Debut at IDWeek After Development Drought
Teaser: The many phase 3 trials that will be presented show that the long dearth in antibiotic development could soon be over, report conference organizers.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Plus RT for Metastatic Cancer: 'Step Forward'
Teaser: Cancer treatment with radiation therapy typically attempts to achieve local control of tumors with direct hits of radiation therapy. Not this trial.

Headlines: New Guidelines for Managing CAR T-Cell Acute Toxicities
Teaser: Researchers at MD Anderson have developed a framework to help recognize and manage unique acute toxicities associated with CAR T-cell therapy.

Headlines: Mobile Apps Could Be Used in Research Someday, Experts Say
Teaser: However, there are many barriers to overcome before 'real-world evidence' from mhealth apps can be applied to clinical trials.

Headlines: Football in Childhood Tied to Cognitive Disorders in Adults
Teaser: Playing organized football before age 12 may increase the risks for depression, apathy, and impaired behavioral regulation in adulthood.

Headlines: IL-23 Blocker for Psoriasis Successful in Extension Trials
Teaser: For those with chronic plaque psoriasis, responses to tildrakizumab, an experimental interleukin-23 inhibitor, were upheld in two long-term extension studies, and FDA approval could be in the offing.

Headlines: Second Cancers Common in Survivors, Especially Older Adults
Teaser: Second cancers affect about 25% of survivors 65 years and older, but patients with cancer who have had a prior malignancy are regularly excluded from clinical trials.

Headlines: Herpes Researcher Experimented on People in US
Teaser: Three years before launching an offshore herpes vaccine trial, an American researcher vaccinated patients in U.S. hotel rooms in brazen violation of U.S. law, a Kaiser Health News investigation has found.

Headlines: Long- and Short-Acting Opioid Addiction Meds Equally Effective
Teaser: Extended-release naltrexone and buprenorphine/naloxone are similarly efficacious in preventing relapse for patients with opioid use disorder, although naltrexone was more difficult to initiate.

Headlines: Heterogeneous Hispanics: Tailor Care for Latino Diabetes
Teaser: The terms 'Hispanic' and 'Latino' cover so many cultures and countries that preventing and treating type 2 diabetes in these populations will require a more customized approach, experts say.

Headlines: Encouraging Results With MS Blood Test to Monitor Drug Therapy
Teaser: Latest data show that measuring blood levels of neurofilament light chains correlates well with MS lesions, number of relapses, brain volume loss, and disability progression.

Headlines: HIV Cure Work Narrowing in on Antiretroviral-Free Remission
Teaser: Clearing HIV reservoirs has been the Holy Grail of much of the cure research to date, but after disappointing results, investigators are looking elsewhere.

Headlines: 'Unrelenting': 20-Year Recurrence Risks in Breast Cancer
Teaser: Clinicians have new long-term data to use in discussions with patients with estrogen receptor-positive breast cancer who have been treated with 5 years of endocrine therapy.

Headlines: Disease Control Prolongs QoL in Advanced Breast Cancer
Teaser: A new analysis of data from the PALOMA-2 trial in advanced breast cancer shows that quality of life (QoL) was better for a longer period in patients who had increased progression-free survival.

Headlines: U.S. Experts Set Research Agenda to Meet 'Cancer Moonshot' Goals
Teaser: For decades there were few options for people with atopic dermatitis, but new choices, with more in the pipeline, have meant a substantial shift in treatment.

Headlines: New Drugs for Atopic Dermatitis Boost Treatment Options
Teaser: Online CBT for insomnia effectively treats the sleep disorder and also dramatically reduces the subsequent occurrence of psychotic symptoms, including paranoia and hallucinations.

Headlines: Online CBT for Insomnia Also Cuts Paranoia, Hallucinations
Teaser: Psilocybin, the active compound in 'magic mushrooms,' has been shown to improve a variety of psychiatric conditions, including depression. A study focuses on the neurobiology underlying its effect.

Headlines: 'Magic Mushrooms' Effective for Severe Depression
Teaser: Updated guidance on caring for infants born to possibly Zika-infected mothers is stratified by the infant's clinical status and includes new clinical, laboratory, and monitoring recommendations.

Headlines: New CDC Guidance on Caring for Infants With Congenital Zika
Teaser: Patients flocked to researcher who ignored usual patient protections, as university claimed ignorance.

Headlines: Desperate Quest for Herpes Cure Launched ‘Rogue’ Trial
Teaser: Having no insurance or inadequate insurance accounts for more than a third of the excess mortality risk between black and white women with early-stage breast cancer in the United States.

Headlines: A Black, White Mortality Gap Much Explained by Insurance
Teaser: Findings of a new study suggest there's an urgent need to identify the causes of this phenomenon.

Headlines: Sharp Rise in Self-harm Among Young Teen Girls
Teaser: Adolescent offspring of moms who ate lower amounts of meat while pregnant were at greater risk for problematic substance use than those of moms who consumed higher amounts of meat.

Headlines: Low Prenatal Red Meat Intake Tied to Kids' Substance Misuse
Teaser: The cost of oncology drugs, with few exceptions, continues to increase after they enter the market, and in the absence of any tangible reasons for the increase.

Headlines: Price of Cancer Drugs Rises After Launch, Unfazed by Market
Teaser: Nearly a third of the initial volunteers declined to provide access to their electronic health records; also, sign-up rate is slower than predicted.

Headlines: NIH Precision Medicine Initiative Runs Into a Snag
Teaser: There is a fundamental lack of value in cancer care in which the cost of drugs is unrelated to their impact on clinical outcomes, says an expert who calls for changes in how treatments are assessed.

Headlines: New CAR T Cell for Adult ALL, 'Game Changer' in Pediatric ALL
Teaser: A new CAR T cell has shown efficacy in adults with acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL), as the first of these products is hailed as a 'game changer' in pediatric ALL.

Headlines: Medical Community Has Sparse Reaction to State of the Union
Teaser: Despite comments from some corners about the opioid epidemic, drug prices, and right-to-try laws, many medical organizations have stayed out of the fray.

Headlines: Clinical Cancer Advance of the Year Is CAR T Cells
Teaser: In its annual review of clinical cancer advances, the American Society of Clinical Oncology highlights CAR T cells as having 'historical significance.'

Headlines: Varenicline Decreases Heavy Drinking in Male Smokers
Teaser: Varenicline is FDA-approved as an agent to assist with smoking cessation. A new study suggests it may be useful in reducing heavy drinking in male smokers with comorbid alcohol use disorder.

Headlines: This Gene Test Might Guide PSA Screening: Two Views
Teaser: A new gene test may offer a way to identify men who would benefit from prostate-specific antigen (PSA) screening for prostate cancer, say investigators. But an expert is not convinced at this time.

Headlines: FDA Adds Study Data to Schizophrenia Drug Labeling
Teaser: The FDA has approved inclusion of 'real-world' data from the phase 3 PRIDE trial in product labeling for the once-monthly antipsychotic paliperidone palmitate in schizophrenia.

Headlines: Important CV Risk Seen With Carfilzomib in Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: Carfilzomib, approved for previously treated multiple myeloma, is associated with a significantly greater risk for all-grade and high-grade cardiovascular events and requires vigilance when used.

Headlines: History of Suicide Attempt Linked to Shorter Life Expectancy
Teaser: Mental illnesses are known to place people at risk for shortened life, but this is the first study to show suicide attempt is itself a risk factor for reduced life expectancy.

Headlines: Low Folate, Vitamin D Implicated in First-Episode Psychosis
Teaser: Previous research has found an association between nutrient deficiencies and psychosis in patients with long-term psychotic illness. This is the first study to show this in first-episode psychosis.

Headlines: Tumor-Treating Fields: Significant Survival in Glioblastoma
Teaser: For patients with glioblastoma, survival was significantly improved through use of a device that delivers tumor-treating fields to the brain. Patients also received standard chemotherapy.

Headlines: HHS Says It Gave No 'Directive' to Ban Seven Words at CDC
Teaser: However, healthcare leaders and biomedical ethicists decry what they see as the 'chilling effect' of political interference on science.

Headlines: Buprenorphine Use, Methadone Dose Affect Neonatal Outcomes
Teaser: Infants of mothers treated for opioid use disorder with buprenorphine show lower rates of neonatal abstinence syndrome compared to infants whose mothers are treated with methadone, new research shows.

Headlines: Alzheimer's Set to Skyrocket
Teaser: By 2060, an estimated 15 million Americans will have either Alzheimer’s disease or mild cognitive impairment, a dramatic increase over the 6.08 million currently affected, new research shows.

Headlines: New Drug a 'Ground-Breaking' Advance in Huntington's Disease
Teaser: An experimental antisense drug led to significant dose-dependent reductions in mutant Huntingtin protein in patients with Huntington's disease, a finding being characterized as 'ground-breaking' and 'historic.

Headlines: First Data on Older Breast Cancer Pts on CDK4/6 Inhibitors
Teaser: Giving CDK4/6 inhibitors to breast cancer patients aged ≥70 years yields a similar progression-free survival to that seen in younger women, although the toxicity is more severe, say FDA researchers.

Headlines: Progress Being Made on 21st Century Cures, Officials Say
Teaser: NIH and FDA Chiefs  testify at Senate HELP Committee hearing, where Democrats again raise concerns about funding for the year-old law.

Headlines: No Trastuzumab Benefit in HER2-Low Breast Cancer After All
Teaser: Despite previous analyses suggesting that adding trastuzumab to adjuvant chemotherapy may benefit patients with low HER2 expression, a new large trial shows no impact on outcomes.

Headlines: Concern Over Adverse Events in Prostate Cancer Trial
Teaser: A phase 3 trial investigating the addition of radium-223 to abiraterone acetate plus steroid has been stopped after reports of fractures and deaths.

Headlines: FDA Aims to Approve More Drugs Based on Early Clinical Data
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration is aiming to approve drugs based on very early data if the drug shows a possible benefit in terms of survival, the head of the agency told lawmakers at a hearing on Thursday.

Headlines: Database Studies May Support Supplemental Drug Applications
Teaser: A database cohort study of insurance claims data replicated results of a pivotal RCT showing similar efficacy, suggesting database studies could support supplemental drug applications.

Headlines: ECT for Depression: No Long-term Dementia Risk
Teaser: Patients with severe depression who undergo electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) have no greater risk than the general population of developing dementia over the long-term, new research suggests.

Headlines: Idebenone (Raxone) Fails in Exploratory MS Trial
Teaser: A phase 1/2 trial of idebenone in primary progressive multiple sclerosis  fails to show any benefit over placebo on disease progression.

Headlines: Economic Discrimination of Cancer Survivors Hampers Recovery
Teaser: Cancer survivors experience difficulties in returning to work and accessing loans, insurance, and mortgages because of outdated assumptions, say European experts.

Headlines: Liquid Biopsies Not Yet Ready for Prime Time, Says Expert Review
Teaser: A panel of expert oncologists and pathologists has decreed that liquid biopsy tests are not yet ready for prime time in the management of either early- or late-stage cancer.

Headlines: Add-on Antipsychotic Promising for PTSD, Anxiety
Teaser: Patients with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) who are being treated with antidepressants may experience additional symptom improvement with adjunctive risperidone, a new meta-analysis suggests.

Headlines: Nuts, Especially Tree Nuts, and Improved CRC Survival
Teaser: Eating two small servings of nuts a week, especially tree nuts, was associated with significantly improved overall survival in patients with stage III colon cancer treated with adjuvant chemotherapy.

Headlines: Fewer Kidney Problems With IV Balanced Crystalloids vs Saline
Teaser: A study found lower incidence of major adverse kidney events with IV balanced crystalloids vs normal saline; expert warns results do not clear up the debate about which resuscitation fluid is better.

Headlines: Shine a Healing Light: Circadian-Based Lighting in Hospitals
Teaser: In a hospital setting, special circadian lighting helps patients get a good night's sleep, and it reduces insomnia, fatigue, and daytime sleepiness. It may also speed healing and recovery, say experts.

Headlines: Trump's Perfect Score on Brain Test Spawns DIY Cognitive Exam
Teaser: The makers of the Montreal Cognitive Assessment, or MoCA, say the test wasn’t meant for the masses. Now they’re working on a “mini-MoCA” that people who are worried about possible dementia can take online.

Headlines: Europe Says No to Neratinib for Breast Cancer
Teaser: The European committee recommended against approval of neratinib (Nerlynx) for breast cancer, even though the drug has been approved in the United States.

Headlines: Oncologist Awarded $13 Million in Gender Discrimination Lawsuit
Teaser: After working at UCLA for 25 years and heading up the lymphoma program, Lauren Pinter-Brown, MD, claimed she experienced gender discrimination and then retaliation for complaining about it.

Headlines: Novel Tumor-Agnostic Agent: 80% RR, but Target Is Rare
Teaser: Oral larotrectinib is highly effective in up to 80% of metastatic solid tumors with a TRK fusion, regardless of patient age or tumor type, but these TRK fusions are rare.

Headlines: Dementia Drug for Alcohol-Related Brain Damage?
Teaser: Heavy alcohol use in teens leads to long-lasting structural and genetic changes in the brain that may be reversed with a short course of donepezil, early research suggests.

Headlines: 'Really Durable Benefit' Emerging With Bladder Cancer ImmunoTx
Teaser: Overall survival curves in cancer treatment trials typically go down with time. It's a big deal when survival stabilizes and a flat 'tail' emerges as patients remain alive much longer.

Headlines: Do Right-to-Try Laws Offer Compassion or 'False Hope'?
Teaser: Opponents warn against removing the FDA from the process of making experimental therapies available to dying patients.

Headlines: Lower ICH Mortality Rate With NOACs Than Warfarin
Teaser: A large real-world study provides some reassurance about the consequences of suffering an intracerebral hemorrhage when taking one of the new oral anticoagulants.

Headlines: Imaging Agent Can Change Plans for Recurrent Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Clinicians viewing scans using the imaging agent 18F-fluciclovine changed their management plans in 61% of cases of biochemical recurrence of prostate cancer.

Headlines: Cataract Risk Highest in Younger Diabetes Patients
Teaser: Diabetes patients face a twofold increased risk of developing cataracts compared with other patients. The risk rises to more than fivefold among those aged 45 to 54 years, new UK registry data suggest.

Headlines: Deep Dive Into Mixed Depression Guideline Raises Red Flags
Teaser: A recently published guideline on the recognition and treatment of mixed depression fails to meet standards for trustworthiness and raises questions about the potential for bias, researchers say.

Headlines: 'New Tool' in Arsenal for Second-Line Treatment of GEP-NETs
Teaser: A new first-in-class radionuclide therapy offers an option for patients with gastroenteropancreatic neuroendocrine tumors (GEP-NETs).

Headlines: Women With DCIS Who Are at Low Risk for Recurrence Identified
Teaser: Women with ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) who are at low risk for disease recurrence after conservative breast surgery and radiotherapy, and whose treatment could be reduced, have been identified.

Headlines: House Passes Right-to-Try Bill Over Many Groups' Objections
Teaser: Opponents of the bill say it will put people at risk for harmful, unproven therapies. Backers say it offers hope to those who can't obtain medicines through the FDA's expanded access program.

Headlines: Palliative Care for Every Pediatric Cancer Patient in Phase 1
Teaser: New standard of care should be a palliative care consultation for every pediatric cancer patient who enrolls in a phase 1 clinical trial, say Canadian researchers.

Headlines: DPP-4 Inhibitors May Increase Risk for IBD in Diabetes Patients
Teaser: The oral, incretin-based hypoglycemic agent was associated with a 75% increased risk for inflammatory bowel disease in adults with type 2 diabetes in a population-based study.

Headlines: Macular Degeneration: Stem Cells Restore Sight in Small Study
Teaser: Doctors in the UK say they have taken an important step towards treating a common form of blindness – wet age-related macular degeneration (AMD).

Headlines: Reviews Reveal Benefits of LAMAs, LABAs, and SMART in Asthma
Teaser: Two systematic reviews found LAMAs effective but not superior to LABAs as adjunct to inhaled corticosteroids, and single maintenance and reliever therapy had greater benefit within limits.

Headlines: Improving Diversification of Cancer Patients in Clinical Trials
Teaser: Underserved populations experiencing cancer health disparities are underrepresented in clinical trials (CTs). AACR is taking the lead on fixing this disparity with its '2020 by 2020' initiative.

Headlines: For Cancer, Cannabis Has Many Virtues, Says Large Study
Teaser: It's an observational study and cannot demonstrate causality, but new data from Israel indicate that cannabis may improve a range of common symptoms among cancer patients.

Headlines: Failed Arthritis Drug May Help Treat Opioid Addiction
Teaser: A cannabinoid type 2 receptor agonist may help prevent opioid tolerance and dependence when used in combination with opioid-based pain medications.

Headlines: How Much Attention Do You Pay to Animal Studies?
Teaser: There are pros and cons to using animals in medical testing.

Headlines: President's Cancer Panel -- Urgent Action on Drug Prices
Teaser: The new report from the President's Cancer Panel calls for urgent action in addressing drug costs and offers six key recommendations for doing so.

Headlines: Democrats Defeat GOP Bid to Quickly Pass 'Right-to-Try' Bill
Teaser: While President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence champion expanding access to experimental drugs, advocacy groups say the GOP approach could harm both patients and medical research.

Headlines: Clinical Trial: PET-CT Not Better for Monitoring CRC Patients
Teaser: The addition of PET/CT to standard monitoring of colorectal cancer (CRC) patients after curative-intent surgery did not improve treatment failure rates at 3 years.

Headlines: Placebo -- As a Treatment -- Improves Cancer Fatigue
Teaser: A first-of-its-kind clinical trial reports that 'open-label' placebo significantly improves cancer fatigue, compared to treatment as usual.

Headlines: High-Fiber Generates Gut Bacteria Good for Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A high-fiber diet seems to rebalance the gut microbiota in a way that is beneficial for patients with type 2 diabetes, resulting in improved HbA1c and weight loss.

Headlines: mSTOPS: Wearable Patch ECG Detects More AF Than Routine Care
Teaser: Use of the patch resulted in more diagnosis and treatment of atrial fibrillation, but at least at 1 year, there were no differences in clinical outcomes.

Headlines: ODYSSEY: Alirocumab Cuts CV Events, All-Cause Death Post-ACS
Teaser: First evidence of survival benefit with PCSK9 inhibitor alirocumab reignites the call for greater access to these expensive drugs for patients not just with ACS but also with stable atherosclerotic CVD.

Headlines: Mystery Surrounds Abrupt Termination of Columbia Neuroscientist
Teaser: Thomas Jessell, PhD, a prominent neuroscience researcher at Columbia University in New York City, was terminated from his post without explanation.

Headlines: Acetaminophen Overdosing Common, Especially in Cold/Flu Season
Teaser: Even in noninfluenza months, a significant number of users are surpassing the maximum daily adult dose of 4 g. Study authors suggest more guidance may be necessary.

Headlines: Gender Gap in Senior Research Authorships 'Large and Stable'
Teaser: Women have been making gains in being named first author on research studies, yet decades later, the expected corresponding increase in female senior authors is nowhere to be seen.

Headlines: Limits on Medical Marijuana Research Hinder Patients' Relief
Teaser: Because the federal government classifies marijuana a Schedule 1 drug, research on marijuana or its active ingredients is highly restricted and even discouraged in some cases.

Headlines: FDA Launches Criminal Investigation Into Unauthorized Herpes Vaccine Research
Teaser: The Food and Drug Administration rarely prosecutes research violations, but its criminal division is looking into the experimental herpes vaccine research by Southern Illinois University professor William Halford.

Headlines: FDA Chief Highlights Cost as Obstacle to Cancer Treatment
Teaser: Gottlieb argued that technology can speed development of drugs and also make them more affordable.

Headlines: Ketamine: Key Predictor of Treatment Response for MDD Identified
Teaser: More intense dissociative symptoms during ketamine infusion for severe depression, particularly depersonalization, may be a key predictor of treatment response.

Headlines: Radical New Definition of Alzheimer's Relies on Biomarkers
Teaser: Alzheimer's is characterized by pathologic changes that precede symptom onset by decades, yet the disease is diagnosed by clinical symptoms. A bold new approach suggests biomarkers alone should define it.

Headlines: How the Abortion Pill Turned Into a Rare-Disease Profit Machine
Teaser: An abortion drug invented decades ago is being used to treat Cushing’s syndrome — and it’s bringing in tens of millions of dollars a year.

Headlines: FDA OKs Exparel for Pain Relief After Shoulder Surgery
Teaser: Clinical trial data do not support the general use of Exparel for regional nerve blocks for analgesia after procedures other than shoulder surgery, the FDA said.

Headlines: First Trial of Three Aromatase Inhibitors
Teaser: Clinicians should use factors such as patient preference, tolerability, and cost to determine best adjuvant therapy for postmenopausal patients with early breast cancer.

Headlines: Men Continue to Outnumber Women in Academic Neurology
Teaser: Men hold approximately 7 in 10 of all academic neurology positions at top-ranked programs overall, and the discrepancy increases with advancing rank, results of a cross-sectional study reveal.

Headlines: CABG Improves Survival, Stroke vs PCI in Low-LVEF Diabetes
Teaser: CABG ruled for CV events, stroke, and survival in a propensity-matched observational study. Randomized trial data are thin for patients with both diabetes and poor left ventricular function.

Headlines: Shrink the P Value for Significance, Raise the Bar for Research
Teaser: 'Most claims supported with P values slightly below .05 are probably false,' says a published viewpoint. 'Even among those claims that are true, few are worth acting on in medicine and health care.'

Headlines: FDA Panel Supports Novel Implantable Glucose Sensor
Teaser: If approved, the Eversense would be the first-ever implanted continuous glucose monitor in the United States.

Headlines: US News Ranks Top Medical School Programs by Specialty
Teaser: Harvard University is the best medical school for research, surgery, psychiatry, and obstetrics & gynecology, according to US News & World Report 2019 rankings of top medical school programs.

Headlines: Dermal Fillers: The Risks to Eliminating Wrinkles
Teaser: In 2016, more than 2.4 million filler procedures were done with one type alone, hyaluronic acid (Juvederm, Restylane), in the U.S. That’s a 56% increase over the last decade.

Headlines: Prenatal Micronutrients May Cut Mental Illness Risk in Children
Teaser: Prenatal supplementation with micronutrients should be further considered as a first step in decreasing risk for future psychiatric illnesses in newborns, the authors of a systematic review conclude.

Headlines: Eating Disorders Overlooked in Men, Minorities
Teaser: Only one third of people with eating disorders in the US receive treatment. New research points to disparities in care and shows that certain individuals are less likely to be diagnosed and treated.

Headlines: More High-Risk Prostate Cancer Now in the US Than Before
Teaser: More men are presenting with higher-grade, more invasive prostate cancer in the wake of 2012 recommendations not to use the prostatic-specific antigen test for routine screening.

Headlines: Stress Reduction Techniques Cut Seizure Rate in Severe Epilepsy
Teaser: Stress is known to be a precipitant of seizures in epilepsy. This study investigated two stress reduction techniques and found them effective in reducing seizure frequency in medication-resistant epilepsy.

Headlines: Senate Rejects  Bid for Quick Action on Right-to-Try Bill
Teaser: Sen. Ron Johnson (R-WI) and allies will continue to work to get a version of a right-to-try bill to President Donald J. Trump's desk over the objections of many of their Democratic colleagues.

Headlines: Adalimumab Cuts Steroid Use in Real-world Noninfectious Uveitis
Teaser: Real-world findings confirm that adalimumab reduces the need for corticosteroids in active and inactive noninfectious uveitis.

Headlines: Spinal Cord Injury Improves With New Scaffold Device
Teaser: For patients with complete paraplegia, implantation of an investigational scaffold device improved the odds of converting to incomplete injury, a new trial shows.

Headlines: 'Financial Toxicity' of CVD Catastrophic for Low-Income Families
Teaser: Out-of-pocket costs for patients with atherosclerotic CVD seem to be driven by high insurance premiums, followed by drug costs, and can be a 'catastrophic' burden in some low-income families.

Headlines: Genetic Test Identifies Best Antidepressant
Teaser: Patients with treatment-resistant depression were more likely to achieve remission when their medication selection was guided by a novel psychotropic genetic test.

Headlines: FDA Panel Urges Rejection of Jaundice Drug for Newborns
Teaser: An FDA panel suggests further study of stannsoporfin as a hyperbilirubinemia treatment for newborns. The experimental drug has passed through several organizations since the late 1980s.

Headlines: APA 'Shark Tank' Dives Into Mental Health Care Solutions
Teaser: In a 'shark tank' format, this year's Innovation Lab at the APA's annual meeting will feature novel and creative pitches designed to improve mental health care.

Headlines: Failed Trial Results of Verubecestat in Alzheimer's Published
Teaser: Treatment with the BACE inhibitor verubecestat was not effective in slowing the clinical progression of mild to moderate Alzheimer's disease in a phase 3 trial.

Headlines: 'Genome-Driven' Cancer Drugs Treat Small Minority of Patients
Teaser: Less than 10% of patients with advanced or metastatic cancer are candidates for genome-driven oncology care, and even fewer derive real benefit from it.

Headlines: JIA: Not All Criteria Equal for Predicting Long-Term Outcomes
Teaser: Long-term outcome in juvenile idiopathic arthritis was best predicted by clinically inactive disease as defined by the cJADAS10, rather than by the Wallace preliminary criteria.

Headlines: Lab-Generated 'Minibrains' Shed New Light on Schizophrenia
Teaser: Cerebral organoids that model schizophrenia may lead to a better understanding of the disease processes in the human brain, as well as new targets for drug development.

Headlines: FDA Clears Deep-Brain Stimulation Device for Resistant Epilepsy
Teaser: The FDA has granted premarket approval for Medtronic's deep-brain stimulation therapy as adjunctive treatment for seizure reduction in adults with refractory epilepsy, the company announced.

Headlines: Midlife Anxiety Tied to Late-Life Dementia
Teaser: Midlife anxiety appears to be an independent risk factor for late-life dementia, but more research is needed to determine whether it is prodromal.

Headlines: More Positive Results Released for Novel Huntington's Drug
Teaser: The novel antisense oligonucleotide known as IONIS-HTTRx is safe and well tolerated and 'has the potential to provide disease-modifying benefits' in Huntington's disease, say researchers.

Headlines: Experimental Drug Takes on Injury From Fatty Liver
Teaser: An investigative human fibroblast growth factor 19 analog is in development to reduce markers of liver damage in patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis.

Headlines: Glasgow Coma Scale Gets an Eye-Opening Update
Teaser: Researchers have found that adding pupil response to the scale more accurately predicts prognosis after TBI, including the likelihood of death, than either measure alone.

Headlines: Erenumab Prevents Episodic Migraine in Refractory Patients
Teaser: The new phase 3b LIBERTY trial shows erenumab was safe and effective in patients with episodic migraine refractory to at least two previous preventive treatments.

Headlines: Low-Dose Prostate Drug Can Match Standard Dose, Cut Costs
Teaser: Patients who cannot afford to take abiraterone acetate for metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer could benefit just as much from taking just a quarter dose with food, say US researchers.

Headlines: TMB as New Biomarker in NSCLC -- Ready for Clinic?
Teaser: A new biomarker -- high tumor mutational burden (TMB) -- identifies lung cancer patients who do better on immunotherapy than on chemotherapy.

Headlines: Are Clinical Trials Being Oversold to Cancer Patients?
Teaser: Advertisements encouraging cancer patients to enroll in clinical trials could be fueling misconceptions, according to a new article.

Headlines: BLU-667: New Hope for NSCLC and Medullary Thyroid Cancer
Teaser: RET mutations and rearrangements have been identified across several solid tumors, including non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), and for the first time, a new potent inhibitor shows activity in humans.

Headlines: Adjuvant Pembrolizumab for Melanoma -- Approval Imminent?
Teaser: Pembrolizumab is poised to join the ranks of ipilimumab and nivolumab as adjuvant therapy for patients with stage III melanoma, after showing a 43% reduction in risk for recurrence.

Headlines: 'Best Survival Data Ever' in Young T-Cell Leukemia Patients
Teaser: Moving nelarabine to the front line and combining it with methotrexate improved 4-year disease-free survival in young patients with T-cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia.

Headlines: Resynchronization Pacing May Work Well in Non-LBBB: ENHANCE CRT
Teaser: Time to broaden CRT use? Cardiac resynchronization worked in patients with heart failure without left bundle-branch block. But mapping-guided lead placement, the study's real focus, didn't seem to help.

Headlines: Chiropractic Care Improves Usual Management for Low Back Pain
Teaser: Adding chiropractic care to usual management for low back pain provided more relief than usual care alone in a multisite trial among active-duty US service members.

Headlines: New Enzyme Inhibitor May Stop Common Cold
Teaser: Rhinoviruses and other picornaviruses need a human enzyme to manufacture their protein coat; a new small-molecule inhibitor blocks the enzyme and could be used one day to treat the common cold.

Headlines: Nurse Input Needed So Big Data Answers the Right Questions
Teaser: Nurses have a role to play in the expansion of data-powered health, and should step up and make their voices heard, experts say.

Headlines: PADIT: Aggressive Antibiotics Didn't Cut CIED Infection Risk
Teaser: A trial assigned 28 centers to use standard prophylaxis or a longer-acting multidrug strategy at device implantations. Infections were strikingly low either way. Would that be seen outside of a trial?

Headlines: FDA Publicly Lists Drugmakers It Says May Be Delaying Generics
Teaser: The list includes both brand name and generic companies that the agency said were potentially illegally preventing generic competition.

Headlines: Most Efficient, Less Costly Gene Testing Method for NSCLC
Teaser: For genetic testing of patients with non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC), next-generation sequencing is less costly than other methods, and results are available much sooner.

Headlines: Better Responses to Immunotherapy in Men
Teaser: When patients with advanced solid tumors are treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors, only men get double the survival benefits seen with standard cancer therapies.

Headlines: First Postpartum Depression Therapy Promising in Phase 3 Trials
Teaser: The first treatment specifically for postpartum depression quickly decreases both moderate and severe symptoms of the condition, say two new phase 3 trials.

Headlines: Early ECT Efficacious, Cost-effective for Resistant Depression
Teaser: A study suggests that initiating electroconvulsive therapy (ECT) early in the treatment resistant depression is both cost-effective and efficacious. after multiple other treatments have failed.

Headlines: Resistance Exercise Cuts Depressive Symptoms
Teaser: Aerobic exercise has been shown to be helpful in reducing depressive symptoms in individuals with depression. New research suggests the same is true for strength-based training.

Headlines: Male Cancer Researchers Get 3.6 Times More Funding Than Women
Teaser: Male principal investigators receive 3.6 times more money overall than their female counterparts, regardless of cancer type, disease theme, or source of funding.

Headlines: Which Smokers Should Be Screened for Lung Cancer?
Teaser: Lung cancer screening guidelines recommend using individualized risk models to refer ever-smokers for screening, but the accuracy of current risk prediction models varies widely.

Headlines: Did AF Ablation 'Debulking' Explain Clinical Gains in CASTLE-AF?
Teaser: Catheter ablation's prowess at cutting atrial fibrillation burden vs rhythm- or rate-control meds in patients with HF may have caused the observed effect on death or HF hospitalization.

Headlines: The $3 Million Research Breakdown
Teaser: How a star psychiatrist at the University of Illinois at Chicago violated protocols and put children at risk.

Headlines: Biologic Therapies for Psoriasis May Benefit Coronary Arteries
Teaser: Three high-risk coronary plaque features improved after 1 year of treatment, independent of statins, other cardiovascular medications, and improvements in risk factors.

Headlines: Sudden Death Can Still Loom Over the ICD-Ineligible With CHD
Teaser: In the future, will primary-prevention defibrillators go into patients with coronary heart disease but mid-range ejection fractions? Potentially, if they meet certain criteria.

Headlines: 10 New Genetic Tests Reach the Market Each Day
Teaser: Genetic test availability and spending are escalating rapidly, with prenatal tests and cancer risk tests leading the way.

Headlines: Primary Care Providers Wary, Optimistic About Genetic Testing
Teaser: A survey of primary care providers found that many doubt their readiness to aid patients with genetic testing, but also express optimism about the prospects for these diagnostics.

Headlines: NIH Outlines New Game Plan to Combat Opioid Crisis
Teaser: The HEAL initiative will focus on improving treatments for patients who misuse or are addicted to opioids and enhancing strategies for effective pain management.

Headlines: Helping Cancer Patients to Understand New 'Right-to-Try' Law
Teaser: The new measure should have been called the 'right-to-ask' law, as the decision about whether to provide experimental drugs still rests with pharma companies, says one expert.

Headlines: Nutraceuticals May Treat Negative Symptoms of Schizophrenia
Teaser: New randomized control trials show signs of the potential benefit of herbal and nutraceutical agents as adjunctive treatment for the negative symptoms of schizophrenia.

Headlines: Lower Survival With Checkpoint Inhibitors in Bladder Cancer
Teaser: Agencies in both the United States and Europe have warned about a decreased survival in patients treated with checkpoint inhibitors compared with those receiving chemotherapy.

Headlines: Esketamine Nasal Spray Safe, Effective in Elderly Depression
Teaser: Esketamine nasal spray, added to an oral antidepressant, is safe and effective in patients aged 65 years or older who have treatment-resistant depression (TRD).

Headlines: MDMA-Assisted Psychotherapy Mitigates PTSD Symptoms
Teaser: Pooled results from six double-blind, placebo-controlled phase 2 trials show benefit for adding MDMA, also known as ecstasy, to psychotherapy for chronic posttraumatic stress disorder.

Headlines: Computer Training May Improve Severe Schizophrenia
Teaser: Auditory-based computerized cognitive training for patients with schizophrenia appears to improve auditory information processing, cognitive function, and positive symptoms.

Headlines: After 30 Years, a 'Home Run' for Treating Rhabdomyosarcoma?
Teaser: Low-dose maintenance chemotherapy given after standard intensive chemotherapy improves both disease-free survival and overall survival in children with rhabdomyosarcoma. Are these new data paradigm changing?

Headlines: 'Oncologists Can Feel Optimistic,' Says NCI Director
Teaser: In announcing $10 million in new funding for cancer clinical trials, the NCI director told a packed hall of oncologists that there is 'enormous optimism in our field.'

Headlines: Taselisib Hits, but Barely Slows, PI3KCA-Mutated Breast Cancer
Teaser: The investigational targeted therapy is somewhat effective, but has the downside of significant additional toxicity.

Headlines: With Prostate Cancer, Race Is Not Entirely Black and White
Teaser: When black and white men receive the same treatment for prostate cancer, they have the same outcomes, according to two new studies. Why might this not hold true outside of clinical trials?

Headlines: Should Conference Data Change Clinical Practice?
Teaser: As the largest cancer meeting in the world unfolds here in Chicago, weigh in on whether the data released here should change clinical practice.

Headlines: Studies Find No Easy Predictors of Stroke Prevention in TAVR
Teaser: Embolic protection devices reduced 30-day stroke but not mortality in a new meta-analysis, while a SENTINEL substudy found no anatomic subset that benefitted most from the devices.

Headlines: Caution Needed With Artificial Intelligence in Medicine
Teaser: The hype surrounding artificial intelligence (AI) in medicine is enormous, and while experts say AI will eventually improve care they warn that moving it into clinic too quickly could cause "catastrophic" harm.

Headlines: On NYC's Skid Row, Prostate Cancer Screening's Brutal Start
Teaser: In a dark chapter of American medical history, homeless alcoholic men were investigated for prostate cancer -- through the performance of invasive perineal surgical biopsy of the prostate.

Headlines: Antidepressant Weight-Gain Risk May Be Greater Over Time
Teaser: A new study confirms increased risk for weight gain with antidepressant therapy -- while also noting that the risk is greatest in the second and third year of treatment.

Headlines: FDA OKs Novel Enzyme Therapy for Rare Disease Phenylketonuria
Teaser: Pegvaliase-pqpz (Palynziq) helps address a significant, unmet need in phenylketonuria (PKA) patients whose blood levels of PKA cannot be controlled with current treatment options, the FDA says.

Headlines: CR Rate of 30% With Agent for High-Risk Bladder Cancer
Teaser: With a complete response (CR) rate of 30%, the experimental agent CG0070 is in a race to be the first drug since 1998 for the treatment of BCG-unresponsive bladder cancer.

Headlines: Canakinumab Efficacy Confirmed In Recurrent Fever Disorders
Teaser: Canakinumab controlled flares in colchicine-resistant familial Mediterranean fever, mevalonate kinase deficiency, and tumor necrosis factor receptor-associated periodic syndrome.

Headlines: Patience Needed: WM Is Incurable, but Survival Is Long
Teaser: Management of the rare lymphoma Waldenstrom's macroglobulinemia (WM) takes patience and practice to maximize longevity and keep symptoms at bay over the long haul.

Headlines: AstraZeneca Wins Speedy Approvals for Cancer Drugs in Japan
Teaser: AstraZeneca has won rapid regulatory approval for new uses of two of its important cancer drugs in Japan, less than six months after the first global approvals in Western markets.

Headlines: rTMS No Better Than Sham Stimulation for Severe Depression
Teaser: Both sham and active magnetic brain stimulation yielded high remission rates for veterans with treatment-resistant depression, perhaps attesting to the placebo effect of clinical trial participation.

Headlines: Life-Saving Miltefosine for Leishmaniasis Unavailable to Those Who Need It Most
Teaser: Miltefosine, the only approved oral treatment for leishmaniasis, is a life-saving therapeutic advancement, but the people who need it most can't get it, researchers report.

Headlines: No Link Between Vitamin D and Preeclampsia, Gestational Hypertension
Teaser: A woman's vitamin D status is unlikely to affect her risk for gestational hypertension or preeclampsia, researchers say.

Headlines: A New Endpoint in Prostate Cancer: Metastasis-Free Survival
Teaser: With overall survival considered an impractical endpoint because survival is so long, metastasis-free survival has emerged as a new endpoint in prostate cancer trials.

Headlines: TECH Parenting Style Could Help Kids Manage Their Media Use
Teaser: The TECH parenting style, an acronym for Talk, Educate, Co-view and House Rules, could help families manage screen time at home, researchers say.

Headlines: FDA Repays Industry by Rushing Risky Drugs to Market
Teaser: As pharma companies underwrite three-fourths of the FDA’s budget for scientific reviews, the agency is increasingly fast-tracking expensive drugs with significant side effects and unproven health benefits.

Headlines: NIDA Releases New Online Screening Tool for Substance Abuse
Teaser: The Tobacco, Alcohol, Prescription Medication, and Other Substance Use Tool screens for multiple substances, eliminating the need for multiple screening and lengthy assessment tools.

Headlines: PIONEER: First Phase 3 Data on Oral Semaglutide in Diabetes
Teaser: Semaglutide, the first oral GLP-1 receptor agonist, shows HbA1c lowering and weight loss comparable to injectable version in type 2 diabetes; best efficacy confined to highest dose.

Headlines: Indivior Gets Breather After Court Extends Order Blocking Generic Rival
Teaser: Indivior Plc got a breather on Friday as a U.S. court extended a restraining order blocking a rival from launching a generic version of its bestselling opioid addiction treatment in the United States.

Headlines: 'Sacred' Word Repetition May Improve PTSD Symptoms, Insomnia
Teaser: A simple meditative technique known as mantram repetition, which involves repeating a sacred word, can reduce symptoms of combat-related PTSD and insomnia, new research shows.

Headlines: CBT Improves Function, Reduces Fatigue in Muscular Dystrophy
Teaser: A new study shows cognitive-behavioral therapy with optional exercise is associated with reductions in fatigue and increased activity levels, but increased falls are a concern.

Headlines: Immunotherapy Disappoints in Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
Teaser: Hopes of using immunotherapy, either alone or with targeted therapy, to improve survival in metastatic colorectal cancer have been dashed by poor results.

Headlines: Dietary Changes Can Lessen Severity of Psoriatic Disease
Teaser: The National Psoriasis Foundation Board strongly recommends a reduced-calorie diet in overweight patients with psoriasis. Researchers emphasized dietary changes should supplement medical therapies.

Headlines: Can We Afford the Cost of Myeloma Therapy?
