Teaser: Two experts square off on the issue of drug cost for multiple myeloma -- is care really not affordable, or are most patients able to access treatment?

Headlines: Herpesvirus May Drive Development, Progression of Alzheimer's
Teaser: In potentially game-changing research, a novel study of postmortem brain samples suggests human herpesvirus may be implicated in the neuropathology of Alzheimer's disease.

Headlines: Ramucirumab Improves Survival in Poor-Prognosis HCC
Teaser: Patients with hepatocellular carcinoma who have high levels of a protein linked to a poor prognosis derive a significant survival benefit with ramucirumab, the results of a pooled analysis reveal.

Headlines: Informed Consent Ruling Could Burden Physicians, Experts Say
Teaser: Excess caution after a Pennsylvania decision about informed consent may unnecessarily burden physicians and sideline other qualified medical professionals, say lawyers who studied the case.

Headlines: Lights Out on National Guideline Clearinghouse
Teaser: The National Guideline Clearinghouse website will shut down July 16 and its content will no longer be available, owing to lack of federal funding.

Headlines: Risk for Clot Increases After Surgery With Transfusion
Teaser: Perioperative RBC transfusion may double the odds of blood clot up to 30 days after surgery; more studies are needed, but the results highlight the importance of rigorous management and prophylaxis.

Headlines: Short-Term Acid-Suppression Advised for Pediatric Gastroesophageal Reflux
Teaser: Typical reflux symptoms in children should be treated with four to eight weeks of acid-suppression therapy, and in infants this should occur only after dietary modifications, according to a new Pediatric Gastroesophageal Reflux Clinical Practice Guideline.

Headlines: Israeli Firm Gets U.S. Nod for Advanced Trials for Non-Opiate Painkiller
Teaser: Israeli pharmaceuticals company PainReform has received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) to begin late-stage clinical studies for a pain relief drug that is a departure from opiate-based narcotics, it said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Babies Who Started Solids Slept Better: Study
Teaser: Babies who start on solids at four months sleep better than infants exclusively breastfed until six months of age, according to a new analysis of clinical trial data.

Headlines: Drug Combination Boosts Older Adults' Immunity in Early Trial
Teaser: A phase 2a randomized, placebo-controlled clinical trial showed that a combination of drugs decreases the incidence of infections, including influenza and pneumonia, in older adults.

Headlines: Proton Therapy Trials 'at Risk,' Slow to Enroll Patients

Headlines: FDA Approves Novel 'Tissue Agnostic' Cancer Drug

Headlines: U.S. Appeals Court Declines J&J Bid to Stop Generic Zytiga Sales
Teaser: In head-to-head comparisons, two of five dry eye screens showed a statistically significant ability to detect signs of the disorder, but all demonstrated relatively modest diagnostic accuracy, researchers say.

Headlines: Cannabis Might Relieve Symptoms in Some With IBD

Headlines: BioMarin Sets Stage Early for Hemophilia Cure Off-Broadway
Teaser: Standard automated perimetry (SAP) testing is often used to classify glaucoma severity but may fail to detect macular damage, according to New York City-based researchers.

Headlines: Frontal Lobe Epilepsy Tied to Higher Seizure Risk in Pregnancy
Teaser: Women with frontal focal epilepsy need closer monitoring during pregnancy because their seizures may worsen, although there appears to be a risk reversal in the postpartum period.

Headlines: MDMA Boosts Social Bonding, Improves Cooperation
Teaser: MDMA helps individuals regain trust, a finding that may ultimately pave the way for treating psychiatric disorders with the agent.

Headlines: Daratumumab Plus Len/Dex: New Standard of Care in Myeloma?
Teaser: Adding daratumumab to lenalidomide and dexamethasone increased progression-free survival in transplant-ineligible patients newly diagnosed with myeloma.

Headlines: Smoking Bans Tied to Lower Blood Pressure in Non-Smokers
Teaser: Non-smokers who live where smoking is banned in public places may have lower blood pressure than non-smokers who aren't protected by these types of laws, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Lipoprotein(a) Shows Linear Link With Aortic-Stenosis Progression
Teaser: Elevated levels of lipoprotein(a) -Lp(a) - and associated compounds are tied to a higher rate of calcific aortic-valve stenosis (CAVS), according to a secondary analysis of trial data.

Headlines: NIH-Funded Trial of Male Birth Control Gel Underway
Teaser: The study seeks to recruit 420 couples to test the gel, called NES/T, which includes the progestin compound segesterone acetate (Nestorone) plus testosterone.

Headlines: Ibrutinib Alone for Older Patients With Untreated CLL
Teaser: Ibrutinib alone and ibrutinib with rituximab were both superior to the bendamustine–rituximab combination for older patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL).

Headlines: Novel Schizophrenia Drug Shows 'Favorable Weight Profile'
Teaser: In topline results from the phase 3 ENLIGHTEN-2 trial, patients with schizophrenia who received olanzapine/samidorphan showed significant less weight gain than those who received olanzapine alone.

Headlines: Many Incidental Findings Spotted on MRIs, Few Turn Out to Be Cancer
Teaser: Many people who undergo magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) for a variety of common health problems may get an unexpected cancer scare that turns out to be a false alarm, a research review suggests.

Teaser: Insulin pumps may be less effective for glycemic control in pregnant women with type 1 diabetes (T1D) than multiple daily injections (MDI), new research suggests.

Headlines: Mandibular-Advancement Therapy Helps Sleep Apnea, but May Not Cut CVD Risk
Teaser: Two months of mandibular-advancement therapy significantly reduced the severity of obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) in patients with severe OSA, but had no effect on inflammatory and metabolic biomarkers, a new study from France shows.

Headlines: Brain Imaging May Help Predict Dementia Years Before Symptoms
Teaser: Diffusion-weighted magnetic-resonance imaging (MRI) can help identify older adults who will go on to develop Alzheimer's disease, according to new research.

Headlines: 'What We're Eating Is Killing Us' - Global Nutrition Report

Headlines: Patents on Pot? US Lawsuit Puts Cannabis Claims to the Test

Headlines: China Orders Halt to Gene-Editing After Outcry Over Babies
Teaser: The current CDC definition of acute flaccid myelitis may include several other diagnoses and may impede quick identification of this emerging threat to pediatric patients.

Headlines: Three Common Dementia Screens Faulty, Inaccurate
Teaser: Pregnant women may be less likely to have cesarean deliveries when they labor at a hospital with more obstetricians and midwives on staff, a French study suggests.

Headlines: Key Clinical Features of  Acute Flaccid Myelitis Identified
Teaser: Older adults with untreated hearing loss may develop additional health problems that lead to more frequent hospitalizations and higher health costs than their counterparts without hearing trouble, two U.S. studies suggest.

Headlines: No Need to Stop Hormones Before Surgery in Transgender Patients
Teaser: Transgender individuals don't need to stop taking exogenous hormones before surgery, researchers say, based on the limited evidence available for their systematic review.

Headlines: Higher Eye Pressure After Anti-VEGF Therapy Needs More Attention
Teaser: The elevated intraocular pressure (IOP) known to follow intravitreal injections of anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) agents may persist in certain patients, according to a report by the American Academy of Ophthalmology (AAO).

Headlines: Solriamfetol May Curb OSA-Associated Excessive Daytime Sleepiness
Teaser: Solriamfetol, an investigational norepinephrine-dopamine reuptake inhibitor, improved excessive daytime sleepiness associated with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) in a phase 3 trial reported last month in Chest.

Headlines: Scientists to Test Tailor-Made Vaccine Tech to Fight Epidemics
Teaser: A global coalition set up to fight disease epidemics is investing up to $8.4 million to develop a synthetic vaccine system that could be tailor-made to fight multiple pathogens such as flu, Ebola, Marburg and rabies.

Headlines: HIV-2 Is Deadlier Than Thought, Despite Slower Progression to AIDS
Teaser: HIV-2 is more pathogenic than previously believed, and without treatment, most infected individuals will progress to HIV-related disease and death - although more slowly than they would with HIV-1, an international study has found.

Headlines: Delivering a Baby Increases - Then Lowers - Risk of Breast Cancer: Study
Teaser: Having a baby temporarily increases the risk of breast cancer by about 80% compared to the risk in women who have never given birth, researchers behind a new study have concluded.

Headlines: Androgen-Deprivation Therapy Linked to Increased Risk of Heart Failure
Teaser: The use of androgen-deprivation therapy (ADT) in men with prostate cancer is associated with an increased risk of heart failure, researchers from Taiwan report.

Headlines: Top Doctors Aren't Disclosing Industry Ties in Journal Studies
Teaser: The dean of Yale's medical school, the incoming president of a prominent cancer group, and the head of a Texas cancer center are among those who have not accurately disclosed their ties with drug companies.

Headlines: Engineered Human-Tissue Platform Could Speed Vaccine Testing
Teaser: A three-dimensional tissue culture construct can reproduce certain human immune responses to vaccines in vitro, according to researchers at Boston Children's Hospital.

Headlines: After a Child's Dire Diagnosis, Hope and Uncertainty at the Frontiers of Medicine
Teaser: "I wish I didn't have this hand anymore," my 4-year-old son said as he woke one winter morning.

Headlines: Hyperglycemia After Intense Exercise Manageable in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Patients with type 1 diabetes (T1D) can correct hyperglycemia following high-intensity interval training (HITT) using their usual insulin correction factor (ICF), researchers say.

Headlines: Chemicals in Cosmetics, Soaps Tied to Early Puberty in Girls
Teaser: Girls who are exposed before birth to chemicals commonly found in toothpaste, makeup, soap and other personal care products may hit puberty earlier than their peers who aren't exposed to these chemicals in the womb, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Revance Therapeutics' Frown Lines Treatment Succeeds in Late-Stage Trial
Teaser: Medical aesthetics company Revance Therapeutics Inc said on Tuesday that its long-acting injectable drug was successful in reducing moderate-to-severe frown lines in a late-stage study.

Headlines: Go Low With Tamoxifen for DCIS
Teaser: In a potentially practice-changing result, use of a 5-mg daily dose of tamoxifen for patients with ductal carcinoma in situ (DCIS) prevented new and recurrent breast cancer events in comparison with placebo.

Headlines: Hypertonic-Saline Inhalation Boosts Lung Function in Infants With Cystic Fibrosis
Teaser: Inhalation of hypertonic saline improves lung function and growth in infants with cystic fibrosis (CF), according to the results of the PRESIS randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: Drug Buyers' Clubs Aim to Tackle HIV Prevention 'Crisis'
Teaser: Novartis said on Tuesday it was taking its experimental medicine ligelizumab to late-stage trials after the drug showed signs of outperforming existing product Xolair in treating severe urticaria.

Headlines: Novartis's New Treatment for Hives Outperforms Xolair in Trials
Teaser: T cells in peripheral blood and ileal biopsies show markedly different expression profiles in patients with Crohn's disease (CD), researchers report.

Headlines: Blood and Ileal T Cell Expression Profiles Differ in Crohn's Disease
Teaser: Takeda Pharmaceutical has won shareholder approval for its $59 billion takeover of London-listed Shire, creating a global powerhouse that has a stronger drugs pipeline but is also saddled with massive debt.

Headlines: Takeda Clears Key Hurdle as Investors Back $59 Billion Shire Deal
Teaser: The outcome of second solid cancers following hematopoietic stem cell transplantation (HSCT) is strongly related to cancer type, with pancreatic and lung cancer being among those with the poorest outcome, according to European researchers.

Teaser: Bariatric reoperations are more common after banding and vertical banded gastroplasty (VBG) than after gastric bypass (GBP), according to long-term follow-up of participants in the Swedish Obese Subjects (SOS) study.

Headlines: Honoraria, Consulting Linked to Positive RA Trial Results
Teaser: Author financial conflicts of interest were generally not associated with RA RCT results, but honoraria and consulting fees were associated with greater likelihood of positive study outcomes.

Headlines: Kids With Duarte Galactosemia Have Normal Developmental Outcomes
Teaser: Developmental outcomes in children with Duarte galactosemia do not differ from those in unaffected children, even with milk exposure in infancy, researchers report.

Headlines: Perioperative Continuation of Buprenorphine Appears Safe
Teaser: Buprenorphine can be safely continued during perioperative pain management in patients taking it for opioid use disorder, researchers report.

Headlines: Long-Term Exercise by Older Adults Tied to Lower Risk of Falls
Teaser: Older adults who have exercised regularly for at least a year may be less likely to experience falls or related injuries than their less active peers, a research review suggests.

Headlines: U.S. Drug Developer Capricor Places Duchenne Drug Trial on Hold
Teaser: Capricor Therapeutics Inc said on Wednesday it had put on hold a clinical trial of its drug to treat Duchenne muscular dystrophy (DMD), a muscle-wasting disorder, citing a safety review.

Headlines: Most Drug Treatments Fail to Control Long-term OA Pain
Teaser: Most commonly used drugs for osteoarthritis (OA) did not reliably control pain or improve function when used long term, a meta-analysis found.

Headlines: FDA Approves First-Ever Drug for Rare Cancer
Teaser: For the first time, the FDA has approved a drug for use specifically for the treatment of blastic plasmacytoid dendritic cell neoplasm (BPDCN), a rare disease with skin and leukemic involvement.

Headlines: FDA Approves Pembrolizumab for Advanced Merkel Cell Carcinoma
Teaser: With this approval, patients with advanced/metastatic MCC will now have another treatment option.

Headlines: Desmoid Tumors: Treatment Breakthrough With Sorafenib
Teaser: Desmoid tumors, a rare form of sarcoma, may finally have a standard of care after a National Cancer Institute trial showed that sorafenib was able to reduce progression rates by more than 85%.

Headlines: GLP-1 Receptor Agonists Not Linked With Diabetic Retinopathy
Teaser: Glucagon-like peptide 1 receptor agonists (GLP-1RAs) do not appear to increase patients' risk for diabetic retinopathy, according to an analysis of the U.S. Food and Drug Administration Adverse Event Reporting System database.

Headlines: Study Finds Chronic Fatigue Clues in Overactive Immune Response

Headlines: Nicox Teams Up With Chinese Firm to Develop and Sell Glaucoma Drug

Headlines: Brentuximab Vedotin and Chemotherapy Effective in Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma
Teaser: Brentuximab vedotin (Adcetris, Seattle Genetics) in combination with chemotherapy is significantly more effective than chemotherapy alone in patients with CD30-positive peripheral T-cell lymphomas, according to the multinational phase 3 ECHELON-2 trial.

Headlines: Crosswords and Sudoku May Not Stop Mental Decline
Teaser: Mental engagement through problem-solving games like crossword puzzles, sudoku and brain teasers may not offset cognitive losses due to age-related dementia, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Low MSH2 Expression Tied to Cisplatin Resistance in Bladder Cancer
Teaser: Low expression of MSH2, a component of the mismatch-repair pathway, is associated with resistance to cisplatin treatment in bladder cancer, researchers report.

Headlines: Metformin Does Not Improve Pregnancy Outcomes in Heavy Women
Teaser: Adding metformin to diet and lifestyle advice does not improve pregnancy or birth outcomes in women who are overweight or obese, according to a clinical trial from Australia.

Headlines: Off-Label Drug Research Generates 'Medical Uncertainty'
Teaser: Research that explores/supports off-label use of pregabalin and other medications may be misleading if early promising results are not subsequently validated, investigators suggest in a new review.

Headlines: Sperm Motility, Testosterone Levels Lower in Active IBD
Teaser: Severe active inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is associated with impaired sperm motility and reduced testosterone levels, according to results from a tertiary IBD center in Denmark.

Headlines: Longer Breastfeeding Tied to Lower Risk of NAFLD
Teaser: Mothers who breastfeed for six months or more may have less fat in their livers and a lower risk of liver disease, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Even 'Non-Problem' Drinking by Parents Tied to Mental Health Problems in Kids
Teaser: Kids may be more likely to develop depression and anxiety when their parents are regular drinkers, even when neither parent drinks enough to be considered an alcoholic, a Norwegian study suggests.

Headlines: Diagnosing, Treating Glioblastomas by Sex Could Improve Outcomes
Teaser: Sex-specific molecular subtyping of patients with glioblastoma (GBM) could help tailor treatments and improve survival, researchers say.

Headlines: Bioidentical Hormone Combo Improves Sleep After Menopause
Teaser: Treatment with a capsule containing bioidentical 17-beta-estradiol and progesterone (TX-001HR) improves sleep in postmenopausal women with vasomotor symptoms (VMS), according to a new analysis of industry research.

Headlines: Merck Loses Bid to Revive $200 Mln Gilead Verdict at U.S. High Court

Headlines: Lilly to Buy Loxo Oncology in $8 Bln Cancer Push
Teaser: Eli Lilly and Co said on Monday it would buy Loxo Oncology Inc for about $8 billion in cash, making its biggest bet on a cancer therapy market expected to be worth several billions of dollars.

Headlines: Pharma Marketing: Spending Surges, Oversight Lags
Teaser: During the past 2 decades, marketing to healthcare professionals by pharmaceutical companies rose by nearly one third, and direct-to-consumer advertising quadrupled.

Headlines: Genomic Sequencing Detects Risks in Seemingly Healthy Newborns
Teaser: Newborn genomic sequencing (nGS) can identify risk and carrier status for a wide range of conditions not detectable by currently available newborn screening assays or predicted based on an infant's clinical or family history, researchers say.

Headlines: Chinese Scientist Criticized for Risking 'Gene-Edited' Babies' Lives

Headlines: Sudden Income Drops in Early Adulthood Linked With Risk of Heart Disease Later

Headlines: Flavored Tobacco Use Rising in U.S. Kids as Vaping Takes Off
Teaser: The growing popularity of e-cigarettes among U.S. youth may be associated with increased use of potentially dangerous flavored tobacco products, a new study suggests.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court Rejects Amgen Over Cholesterol Medication Patent Fight
Teaser: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday declined to take up Amgen Inc's bid to reinstate a jury verdict it won against rivals Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc and Sanofi SA in patent dispute over PCSK9-inhibiting cholesterol medications.

Headlines: FDA Approved Record Number of Drugs in 2018

Headlines: After MSKCC, Baselga Heads Oncology R&D at AstraZeneca
Teaser: After stirring up heated controversy over failure to disclose industry relationships while at Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center (MSKCC),  Baselga now heads to a giant pharma company.

Headlines: Probiotics Effective for Functional Abdominal Pain in Children
Teaser: Probiotics can ease pain short-term in children with recurrent abdominal pain (RAP), according to a new report.

Headlines: Little Evidence That Non-Sugar Sweeteners Lead to Improved Health
Teaser: A review of research on artificial and natural sweeteners commonly used as alternatives to sugar failed to find strong evidence they provide significant health benefits, but also found no harm from using them.

Headlines: Sugary Soda Tied to Higher Risk of Chronic Kidney Disease
Teaser: People who drink lots of sugar-sweetened soda and fruit juices may be more likely to develop chronic kidney disease than those who don't, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Cellulitis Risk Score May Help Guide IV Antibiotic Therapy in Children
Teaser: Pediatricians from Australia have developed and validated a simple risk-assessment score to help guide decisions regarding antibiotic therapy for cellulitis in children.

Headlines: Bristol-Myers Bulks Up Cancer Portfolio With $74 Bln Celgene Deal
Teaser: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said on Thursday it would buy Celgene Corp for about $74 billion, creating a major pharma company with several blockbuster cancer drugs as competition in the immunotherapy space heats up.

Headlines: Latent TB Common in Child Contacts of Patients With Drug-Resistant TB

Headlines: Pegbelfermin Improves Non-Alcoholic Fatty Livers in Mid-Stage Trial
Teaser: Pegbelfermin reduced the hepatic-fat fraction in patients with non-alcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) in a phase 2a trial.

Headlines: Hearing Loss Under-Researched in Older Adults
Teaser: Hearing loss research in older adults lags far behind that in children, researchers report.

Headlines: Samsung Bioepis Biosimilar to Roche's Herceptin Wins FDA Nod
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Friday it had approved a biosimilar to Roche Holding AG's blockbuster breast cancer treatment, Herceptin.

Headlines: New Options Emerging for Painful Abscesses, Skin Scarring
Teaser: Much-needed therapies for a chronic inflammatory skin condition, a once-orphan disease, will be in the spotlight at the upcoming Conference of the European Hidradenitis Suppurativa Foundation.

Headlines: Lilly's Sarcoma Drug Lartruvo Fails Study

Headlines: FDA OKs ECG Feature on Verily Study Watch for Research
Teaser: The Verily Study Watch records, stores, transfers, and displays single-channel electrocardiogram data as part of clinical research studies.

Headlines: EMA Decision on Durvalumab in NSCLC Is 'Major Cause of Concern'
Teaser: Lung cancer experts say the recent decision to restrict the use of durvalumab immunotherapy to patients with high PD-L1 expression is 'a lost therapeutic opportunity.'

Headlines: Mesh Complications Linked to Greater Depression, Self-Harm Risk
Teaser: Women who suffer from transvaginal mesh complications are at increased risk of new-onset depression and self-harm, according to new research.

Headlines: US FDA Panel Split on Sotagliflozin for Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: The 8-8 tie reflected the FDA advisory panel's struggle in assessing the drug's glycemic and other benefits against an elevated risk for diabetic ketoacidosis.

Headlines: FDA Advisers Urge Approval of Romosozumab for Osteoporosis
Teaser: The risk for cardiac events, though not well defined, should not hold up marketing, said the FDA panel members.

Headlines: Fecal-Microbiota Transplant Beats Antibiotics for Recurrent C Diff
Teaser: Fecal-microbiota transplantation (FMT) is superior to 10 days of fidaxomicin or vancomycin for resolving recurrent Clostridium difficile infection (CDI), according to results from a randomized open-label clinical trial.

Headlines: Nef Gene Function and HIV Subtype Influence Viral Reservoir Size
Teaser: In patients with HIV, the size of the viral reservoir depends, at least in part, on their HIV subtype and the level of Nef gene activity, researchers say.

Headlines: Clinical Trials Too Often Exclude 'Real-World' Cancer Patients
Teaser: Restrictive clinical trial criteria frequently exclude patients with comorbidities from important cancer studies, but such patients might benefit from the treatment being study.

Headlines: Brain Metabolites Altered in First-Episode Psychosis
Teaser: Even in a first episode of psychosis (FEP), alterations in brain metabolite levels are associated with neurocognitive performance, according to findings from a 7-Tesla proton magnetic resonance spectroscopy (MRS) study.

Headlines: Lilly Eyes More Cancer Deals, but Wary of CAR-T, Gene Therapy
Teaser: Eli Lilly and Co remains in the hunt for cancer drugs even after announcing an $8 billion purchase of Loxo Oncology this week, but it plans to remain on the sidelines when it comes to two of the hottest areas of drug development.

Headlines: Avelumab May Benefit Some Patients With Advanced Unresectable Mesothelioma
Teaser: The anti-programmed cell death ligand 1 (PD-L1) monoclonal antibody avelumab is well tolerated and shows antitumor activity in some patients with previously treated unresectable mesothelioma, according to results from a single-arm trial.

Headlines: Pfizer to Shut Two Manufacturing Plants in India
Teaser: U.S. drugmaker Pfizer Inc said on Wednesday it was shutting down two manufacturing plants in India that make generic injectables like penicillin in response to falling demand.

Headlines: Daily Aspirin May Curb COPD Exacerbations
Teaser: Daily aspirin use appears to reduce the risk of exacerbations and have other beneficial effects in patients with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD), according to an observational study.

Headlines: Oral Postpartum Depression Treatment Succeeds in Trial
Teaser: Sage Therapeutics Inc said on Monday its oral treatment for postpartum depression met the main goal of reducing symptoms of the condition, when compared to a placebo in a late-stage study.

Headlines: WHO Study Likens Palm Oil Lobbying to Tobacco and Alcohol Industries
Teaser: The palm oil industry is deploying tactics similar to those of the alcohol and tobacco industries to influence research into the health effects of its product, a study published by the World Health Organization said on Tuesday.

Headlines: AHS Releases Updated Guidance on Migraine Treatment
Teaser: In response to recent advances in drug and device technology for treating migraine, the American Headache Society (AHS) has released new guidance on best preventive and acute strategies for clinical practice.

Headlines: Drugmaker Sanofi Says it is 'as Ready as Can Be' for Brexit
Teaser: Sanofi has nearly completed its preparations for Britain's planned exit from the European Union and is confident its additional stockpiling of medicines and other measures will prevent shortages for patients in the country.

Headlines: Experimental Phone App Works With Insulin Pumps to Control Diabetes
Teaser: An artificial pancreas system that uses a smart phone app coupled with a glucose sensor and an insulin pump has shown promise in a preliminary trial in people with type 1 diabetes, researchers report.

Headlines: Rising Readmission Rates for Children With Complex Chronic Conditions
Teaser: Pediatric hospitalization rates in the US declined between 2010 and 2016, but readmission rates increased, especially among children with complex chronic conditions, researchers report.

Headlines: More Restrictive Definition Reduces UTI Prevalence in Bronchiolitis
Teaser: The prevalence of urinary tract infection (UTI) in children with bronchiolitis declines when UTI is narrowly defined, according to a systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Ranibizumab and Aflibercept Prompt Comparable Visual Gain in AMD
Teaser: In patients with neovascular age-related macular degeneration (nAMD), aflibercept and ranibizumab achieve similar average visual acuity increases, according Australian researchers.

Headlines: Takeda Dengue Vaccine Meets Main Goal of Trial; Detailed Results to Come
Teaser: Takeda Pharmaceutical Co said on Tuesday that its experimental dengue vaccine appears to be safe and effective at preventing all four types of the mosquito-borne disease, meeting the main goal of the Japanese drugmaker's late-stage clinical trial.

Headlines: Models Predict Adverse Event Risk With Levetiracetam
Teaser: Two prediction models can determine the risk of adverse psychiatric events in patients with incident epilepsy prescribed levetiracetam, new findings in JAMA Neurology show.

Headlines: Israel's InterCure to Ramp Up Medical Cannabis Production - Chairman
Teaser: InterCure plans to expand into 10 countries in the next two years to meet growing demand for medical marijuana, chairman Ehud Barak said on Monday.

Headlines: New EPA Rule May Hinder Health Research
Teaser: A new rule proposed by the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) may make it almost impossible to uncover hazards such as dirty air, polluted water and environmental toxins, researchers say.

Headlines: Swiss Study Validates Spanish Tool for Stratifying Risk in ED Patients With Heart Failure
Teaser: The MEESSI-AHF score accurately stratifies patients by 30-day mortality, according to an external validation study.

Headlines: Global Drug Spending Forecast to Hit $1.5 Trillion by 2023
Teaser: The surge in innovation in the pharmaceutical market will continue over the next 5 years with an average of 54 new drugs forecast to hit the market each year until 2023.

Headlines: Nonprofit to Offer 20 Generic Drugs in 2019 to Alleviate Shortages
Teaser: A new not-for-profit supplier of generic drugs formed by a consortium of hospitals systems said it expects this year to be able to provide about 20 products to alleviate shortages of medicines used during surgeries and to treat life-threatening conditions

Headlines: 'Impressive' Activity with BRAF/MEK Inhibitors in Biliary Cancer
Teaser: Combination therapy with dabrafenib and trametinib produced promising results in patients with advanced BRAF V600E-mutated biliary cancers.

Headlines: TRPV1 Antagonist Cream Shows Promise Against Eczema in Adults
Teaser: An investigational nonsteroidal topical cream (PAC-14028, or Asivatrep) may be a safe, effective treatment for atopic dermatitis, Korean researchers suggest.

Headlines: Rotavirus Vaccination Tied to Lower Rates of Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Young kids who receive the rotavirus vaccine may be less likely to develop type 1 diabetes than children who don't get this routine childhood vaccination, an Australian study suggests.

Headlines: NAFLD in Adolescent Boys Improves With Low Sugar Diet
Teaser: Adolescent boys on a "low free sugar" diet show significant improvements in nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), according to results from an 8-week randomized clinical trial.

Headlines: Limited Evidence Supports Buprenorphine for Neonatal Abstinence Syndrome
Teaser: Buprenorphine might be the best pharmacological treatment for neonatal abstinence syndrome, based on limited evidence, according to a systematic review and network meta-analysis.

Headlines: Screen All New Cancer Patients for Hepatitis?
Teaser: With no identifiable risk factors in most cases, universal screening before cancer therapy may prevent life-threatening complications.

Headlines: Survival Benefit With Combo Immunotherapy in Advanced CRC
Teaser: Combined durvalumab and tremelimumab improved overall survival in patients with advanced refractory colorectal cancer who were unselected for mismatch repair deficiency.

Headlines: Routine Diversion After Sphincter-Sparing Rectal Surgery Tied to Poorer Outcomes
Teaser: Routine diversion after sphincter-sparing rectal cancer resection does not reduce anastomotic leaks and is associated with more reinterventions, readmissions, and higher costs, according to a database study.

Headlines: Treating Kids’ Sleep Apnea May Keep Them Safer on the Street
Teaser: Kids with obstructive sleep apnea may be at lower risk of accidents with oncoming vehicles during the day if they use positive airway pressure (PAP) therapy at night, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Emtricitabine in Dried Blood Spots Predicts HIV Viral Suppression
Teaser: The level of emtricitabine triphosphate (FTC-TP), an anabolite of emtricitabine, in dried blood spots (DBS) predicts HIV viral suppression and reflects short-term adherence to therapy, researchers report.

Headlines: Collagen Signature Helps Predict Lymph-Node Metastasis in Gastric Cancer
Teaser: In patients with early gastric cancer the collagen signature in the tumor microenvironment is an independent indicator of lymph-node metastasis, according to Chinese researchers.

Headlines: Antenatal Betamethasone Does Not Impair Neurocognitive Function in Fetal Growth Restriction
Teaser: Repeated antenatal doses of betamethasone does not impair neurocognitive function in elementary-school-aged children born with fetal growth restriction, according to a secondary analysis from the ACTORDS clinical trial.

Headlines: Hospitals Serving More Minorities May Offer Less Palliative Care
Teaser: Patients may have less access to palliative care at U.S. hospitals that primarily serve minorities, a study suggests.

Headlines: AstraZeneca's Infant Respiratory Drug Prioritized in Europe, U.S.
Teaser: Britain's AstraZeneca said a potential medicine to prevent respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) in babies and infants had been granted special status by U.S. and European regulators, designed to speed up the development of novel and better drugs.

Headlines: Recurrence Risk Constant After Ablation in Barrett's Esophagus
Teaser: Diligent surveillance remains important after remission of intestinal metaplasia (CRIM) following radiofrequency ablation (RFA) in Barrett's esophagus, researchers say.

Headlines: Borderline Personality Disorder: High Risk for Early Death
Teaser: It is well known that patients with borderline personality disorder have high suicide rates. However, new research shows they also have high rates of premature death from nonsuicidal causes.

Headlines: Medicare Won't Pay for Prostate Cancer Risk Test
Teaser: Flaws in clinical studies were cited by a Medicare contractor in rejecting reimbursement for 4Kscore, a blood test that predicts the likelihood of   aggressive prostate cancer.

Headlines: Roche Adapts Newer Breast Cancer Drug in Face of Herceptin Imitations
Teaser: Swiss drugmaker Roche aims to broaden the use of Kadcyla (ado-trastuzumab emtansine) for breast cancer as rivals crowd into the market with biosimilar copies of its older mainstay Herceptin (trastuzumab).

Headlines: Works in Mice, but Then? Publish Clinical Trial Data Alongside
Teaser: Preclinical data often raise hopes of a 'cure for cancer,' only for those hopes to be dashed by clinical results; these data should be published alongside, urge experts.

Headlines: Cancer Patients May Need Longer Support to Quit Smoking
Teaser: Cancer patients are more successful at giving up cigarettes for good if they take smoking-cessation medicine for 24 weeks instead of the usual 12 weeks, a small clinical trial suggests.

Headlines: U.S. Senator Sanders to Ask Why Drug, Once Free, Now Costs $375k
Teaser: U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders plans to send a letter to Catalyst Pharmaceuticals on Monday asking it to justify its decision to charge $375,000 annually for a medication that for years has been available to patients for free.

Headlines: Hypothermic Intraperitoneal Chemo Relatively Safe for Treating Metastases
Teaser: Cytoreductive surgery with hypothermic intraperitoneal chemotherapy (CRS/HIPEC) appears to be at least as safe as other high-risk surgical oncology procedures, according to a retrospective study.

Headlines: Mother's Friendships May Be Good for Babies' Brains
Teaser: When new mothers have friends ready to step in and help them, they have toddlers who score better on cognitive tests than the babies of women with smaller social support networks, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Glycemic Control Tied to Better Outcome of Anti-VEGF Therapy for Diabetic Macular Edema
Teaser: Strong glycemic control may optimize vision outcomes in patients with diabetic macular edema (DME) treated with anti-vascular endothelial growth factor (anti-VEGF) therapy, researchers say.

Headlines: Multiple Infliximab Doses Better for Acute Severe Ulcerative Colitis
Teaser: As salvage therapy for acute severe ulcerative colitis refractory to corticosteroids, multiple infliximab doses are superior to a single dose for improving colectomy-free survival, according to a new systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Teva's Generic EpiPen Launch Stalls Months After Approval
Teaser: Many of the largest U.S. pharmacies and drug distributors do not have Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd's generic version of the life-saving EpiPen allergy treatment five months after it was approved for sale in the United States, pharmacy chains and a group that tracks drug shortages told Reuters.

Headlines: Finally, Metastatic Breast Cancer Patients Get VIP Treatment
Teaser: A first-of-its-kind US clinic aims to change the care model for metastatic breast cancer patients, a subgroup that has been historically underserved.

Headlines: Undeterred by Sanofi's Stumble, Takeda Takes Similar Path With Dengue Shot
Teaser: A new vaccine for the dengue virus is taking a potentially risky road to prevent the mosquito-borne disease that infects nearly 400 million people each year.

Headlines: Joining a Clinical Trial Is Too Hard for Many Cancer Patients
Teaser: Only a small fraction of cancer patients volunteer for clinical trials. The reason, a new study suggests, is not that they don't want to, but that the system makes it too hard.

Headlines: Pembrolizumab Plus Axitinib a New Standard in Metastatic RCC
Teaser: First-line treatment with the anti-PD-1 immunotherapy pembrolizumab plus the VEGF-targeted tyrosine-kinase inhibitor axitinib extended overall survival and progression-free survival in patients with clear-cell metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC), compared with the current standard of care, sunitinib, in the phase 3 KEYNOTE-426 trial.

Headlines: Fluconazole Tied to Miscarriages
Teaser: Pregnant women who take oral fluconazole to treat vaginal yeast infections may be more likely to have miscarriages than women who don't take this pill during pregnancy, a Canadian study suggests.

Headlines: Intercept's Drug for Liver Fibrosis Due to NASH Meets Main Goal
Teaser: Intercept Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Tuesday its treatment in patients with nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) showed an improvement in liver fibrosis, taking the drug a step closer to approval.

Headlines: Tisotumab Vedotin Shows Some Promise in Early Trial of Solid Tumors
Teaser: A new cancer drug has shown promise against multiple tumor types, in a first-in-human trial.

Headlines: 'Young Blood' Clinics Shut Down After FDA Action
Teaser: Ambrosia Health has shut down its clinics that offered transfusions of plasma from persons aged 16 to 25 years after the FDA issued a statement saying benefits were not scientifically proven.

Headlines: Culture-Negative TB Likely Under-Recognized and Underdiagnosed Globally
Teaser: Culture-negative pulmonary tuberculosis (TB) is under-recognized and can lead to untreated disease, researchers say.

Headlines: Gastric Acid Suppression & Oral Cancer Therapy Should Not Mix
Teaser: Gastric acid suppressants may reduce absorption of oral cancer drugs, as shown in a study with pazopanib for sarcoma in which the interaction led to worse outcomes. Can this be practice changing?

Headlines: More Young Adults Binge-Drinking Well Into Their 20s
Teaser: More young men and women are binge-drinking into their mid- and late-20s today than a generation ago, increasing their risk of accidental injuries, deaths and a variety of chronic illnesses, researchers say.

Headlines: Outcomes Better With Arthroscopy for Femoroacetabular Impingement
Teaser: Arthroscopic hip surgery results in better outcomes than physiotherapy and activity modification in patients with symptomatic femoroacetabular impingement (FAI), according to a new clinical trial, but researchers still urge caution.

Headlines: Precious Antibiotics Still Being Used to Boost Animal Growth -OIE
Teaser: Farmers in 45 countries still use antibiotics to boost animal growth, despite warnings from health experts and bans on the practice in many parts of the world, the World Organization for Animal Health (OIE) said on Thursday.

Headlines: Glottic Cancer Rates Rising in Young People
Teaser: Glottic carcinoma rates in children and young adults have increased over the past three decades, according to a retrospective review.

Headlines: Tortoise-Inspired Device Delivers Insulin Pellets to Stomach Lining
Teaser: A small tortoise-inspired self-orienting device allows oral delivery of tiny insulin spears ("milliposts") to the stomach lining where they release insulin over several hours.

Headlines: Laparoscopic Gastrectomy Outcome Comparable to Open Surgery
Teaser: Patients with stage I gastric cancer who undergo laparoscopic distal gastrectomy have long-term-survival rates similar to those who have open distal gastrectomy, according to a clinical trial from South Korea.

Headlines: Heavier Red Meat Consumption Tied to Higher NAFLD Risk
Teaser: People who eat a lot of animal protein may be more likely to have excessive fat in their livers and a higher risk of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) than individuals whose main source of protein is vegetables, a Dutch study suggests.

Headlines: Sleep Boosts T-Cell Antiviral Potency
Teaser: It looks like your mother was right: when you've got a cold, sleep may be the best medicine.

Headlines: Support Team Selected by Suicidal Teens May Curb Mortality
Teaser: The Youth Support Team (YST) intervention for suicidal adolescents is associated with reduced mortality for up to 14 years, according to a post hoc analysis of the treatment program.

Headlines: Chemobrain: How It Happens, and Perhaps How It Can Be Stopped
Teaser: New insights into how chemotherapy affects the brain may lead to ways to treat and maybe even prevent the cognitive impact of cancer drugs.

Headlines: Gilead Misses Key Goal in NASH Liver Disease Trial, Shares Sink
Teaser: Gilead Sciences Inc said on Monday that a late-stage study of a key experimental drug aimed at treating NASH, a progressive fatty liver disease, failed to meet its main goal, sending the company's shares down 4.6 percent in after-hours trading.

Headlines: Longer Survival in Black Men on Newer Prostate Cancer Drugs
Teaser: Black men with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer had longer overall survival than white patients when treated with newer hormone therapies.

Headlines: Prompt UTI Antibiotics Cut Mortality, Sepsis Risk
Teaser: Guidelines to prevent antibiotic overuse have cut prescribing by 13% in the UK but may be putting older patients with UTIs at risk for bloodstream infections and death.

Headlines: California Oncologist Indicted for Selling Pineapple Remedy
Teaser: Benedict Liao, MD, faces 27 charges related to his alleged promotion and distribution of an unapproved cancer drug that is based on a pineapple enzyme.

Headlines: Epidemic Group Invests $34 Mln in Potential Vaccine Printer Tech
Teaser: A coalition seeking to get ahead of the next pandemic has agreed a $34 million deal with German biotech CureVac to develop vaccine "printing" technology that aims to rapidly produce shots against multiple diseases.

Headlines: Certain Parenting Behaviors May Tune Baby Brains to Angry Tones
Teaser: Parents who are very controlling when interacting with their infants may increase the likelihood that their babies tune in to angry voices, a new study shows.

Headlines: Smoking Tied to Peripheral Artery Disease in African-Americans
Teaser: African-Americans who smoke cigarettes are more likely than those who don't smoke to develop peripheral artery disease (PAD), a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Brazil Health Officials Find Weedkiller Glyphosate Non-Cancerous
Teaser: Analysts at Brazilian health agency Anvisa have determined that the weedkiller glyphosate does not cause cancer while recommending exposure limits as international pressure to reduce use of the chemical grows.

Headlines: Sanofi, Regeneron Lose U.S. Patent Challenge to Amgen Cholesterol Drug
Teaser: Biotech company Amgen Inc said on Monday a U.S. jury confirmed the validity of patents on its cholesterol drug Repatha (evolocumab), rejecting a challenge by Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc and Sanofi SA.

Headlines: Japan Scientists Win Backing for Work on Potential Nipah Vaccine
Teaser: A global coalition set up to fight emerging epidemics has struck a $31 million deal with scientists at Japan's University of Tokyo to speed up work on a vaccine against a brain-damaging disease caused by the Nipah virus.

Headlines: Patient Selection Key to DKA Prevention With SGLT Inhibitors in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: Selection of appropriate patients for sodium-glucose cotransporter (SGLT)-inhibitor therapy is "critical" to minimizing the risk of diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA), an expert panel advises in a new consensus report.

Headlines: Novartis Gene Therapy Is Cost Effective at Up to $900,000 -U.S. Group
Teaser: Zolgensma, an experimental gene therapy for spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) developed by Swiss drugmaker Novartis AG, would offer value at a price of $310,000 to $900,000, according an independent U.S. nonprofit organization that reviews the value of drugs and medical treatments.

Headlines: Physician-Directed Interventions Can Help With Depression, Anxiety, Suicidality
Teaser: Physician-directed interventions are moderately effective for reducing symptoms of depression, anxiety and suicidality, according to a systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Californian 'Holy Herb' a Potential Treatment for Alzheimer's?
Teaser: An extract from yerba santa, a native Californian plant that has been used for medicinal purposes, may be a promising new compound in the treatment of Alzheimer disease.

Headlines: Unproven Therapies Are 'Muddying' Cell and Gene Advances
Teaser: The explosion in unproven therapies could divert resources from proven treatments that have the potential to revolutionize patient care and could ruin the field's reputation, warn experts.

Headlines: Merck to Buy Immunotherapy Developer Immune Design for $300 Mln
Teaser: Merck & Co Inc said on Thursday it would buy drug developer Immune Design Corp for nearly $300 million, to gain access to its immunotherapy programs.

Headlines: Pharmacist Follow-Up Calls Could Help Curb Repeat Hospitalizations
Teaser: Patients sent home from the hospital and taking multiple prescription drugs may be less likely to have repeat hospitalizations when they receive follow-up calls from a pharmacist, a small study suggests.

Headlines: New Recombinant Vaccine Most Cost-Effective Alternative for Preventing Herpes Zoster
Teaser: The new recombinant zoster vaccine (RZV) is more cost-effective than both the zoster vaccine live (ZVL) and no vaccination for preventing herpes zoster and related complications, according to a model study.

Headlines: Clinical Diagnosis of Fibromyalgia Often Disagrees With Published Criteria
Teaser: Many patients with a clinical diagnosis of fibromyalgia do not satisfy published diagnostic criteria, according to findings from rheumatology clinic attendees.

Headlines: FDA OKs Turoctocog Alfa Pegol (Esperoct) for Hemophilia A
Teaser: Turoctocog alfa pegol is an extended half-life factor VIII molecule for treatment and prophylaxis of bleeding episodes and perioperative management in adults and children with hemophilia A.

Headlines: Checkpoint Inhibitors Seem Safe Against Cancer in HIV Patients
Teaser: In HIV-infected patients with a variety of advanced cancers, immune-checkpoint inhibitors (ICIs) appear to be effective and add no new risks, according to a new systematic review.

Headlines: U.S. Top Court Rejects Bid to Block Indivior Opioid Drug Copycat
Teaser: The U.S. Supreme Court dealt a blow to Indivior Plc on Tuesday, clearing the way for a copycat version of the British pharmaceutical firm's lucrative opioid addiction treatment Suboxone Film in a victory for India-based generic drug maker Dr. Reddy's Laboratories.

Headlines: Aerobic Exercise Eases Depression, Even in Chronically Ill
Teaser: People with chronic health problems who suffer from depression may find their mood improve when they do aerobic exercise, a research review suggests.

Headlines: Allergan Depression Treatment Fails Studies
Teaser: Allergan Plc said on Wednesday its experimental add-on treatment for depression failed three late-stage studies, casting doubts over its drugs pipeline.

Headlines: Prospect of Bright Light Therapy for MDD in Parkinson Dims
Teaser: Researchers report results from a randomized clinical trial to illuminate the effect of bright light therapy for the treatment of major depression in Parkinson disease.

Headlines: Cellulitis Readmissions Common, Costly, Preventable
Teaser: Readmission after hospitalization for cellulitis is "common and costly and may be preventable," researchers say.

Headlines: WHO Chief Unveils Reforms, With More Science, Apps and an Academy
Teaser: The World Health Organization unveiled a landmark reform on Wednesday that targets billions of people around the globe and puts a stress on primary care for all rather than "moonshot" projects like eradicating diseases.

Headlines: Bayer Launches Combination Insecticide to Fight Resistant Malaria
Teaser: German drugmaker Bayer AG launched on Wednesday the world's first combination indoor insecticide in Africa to help fight insecticide-resisant strains of malaria that have frustrated global attempts to stamp out the disease.

Headlines: Single-Patient Trials Help Find Best Medication for Hypertensive Kids
Teaser: There is no single blood pressure-lowering drug that works for most hypertensive children, but single-patient randomized crossover trials (n-of-1 trials) can be used to optimize their management, researchers report.

Headlines: Female Scientists Get Smaller First-Time Grants Than Men
Teaser: Women in science receive smaller research grants than men even when they have similar qualifications, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Rapid Weight Loss Keeps Promise of T2D Remission for 2 Years
Teaser: Two-year DiRECT data underlines how type 2 diabetes patients who achieve remission after rapid weight loss can remain disease-free and reduce their medication reliance and CVD risk, say UK clinicians.

Headlines: New Risk Score Helps Predict Intra-Abdominal Abscess in Crohn's Disease
Teaser: A new, five-parameter risk score accurately predicts intra-abdominal abscess in Crohn's disease (CD) patients presenting to the emergency department (ED), researchers from Israel report.

Headlines: Deep Electrodes May Outperform Subdural Grids in Epilepsy Localization
Teaser: Stereoelectroencephalography (SEEG) appears to be more versatile and have better procedural morbidity than subdural electrode (SDE) implantation for identifying the source of seizures in patients with intractable epilepsy, according to a comparative analysis.

Headlines: Explanted Mesh Doesn't Need Microscopic Assessment
Teaser: There is no value to sending a mesh specimen for microscopic pathology evaluation, regardless of the reason for removal, nor can any clinical claims be made based on pathology findings from explanted mesh, researchers say.

Headlines: Early Response to PD-1 Blockade Predicts Melanoma Outcomes
Teaser: The response to a single dose of neoadjuvant PD-1 blockade predicts clinical outcomes in patients with stage III/IV resectable melanoma, researchers report.

Headlines: Residual Disease May Predict Multiple Myeloma Prognosis
Teaser: Measuring minimal residual disease before, during, or after transplant may offer useful prognostic information for multiple myeloma patients, say US scientists.

Headlines: Philippines to Charge Officials of Sanofi, Gov't Over Deaths Linked to Vaccine
Teaser: The Philippine Department of Justice said on Friday it has found probable cause to indict officials from French drugmaker Sanofi and former and current Philippine health officials over 10 deaths it said were linked to use of a dengue vaccine.

Headlines: Low Rates of Viral Suppression Among Young Black Men With HIV
Teaser: Young black men with HIV have far lower rates of viral suppression than others with HIV, according to results from the Medical Monitoring Project (MMP).

Headlines: Lactobacilli Reduce Wheat-Induced Intestinal Inflammation in Mice
Teaser: Lactobacilli reduce wheat-induced intestinal inflammation in mice by degrading wheat amylase trypsin inhibitors (ATI), researchers report.

Headlines: New Consensus Statement on MS Imaging Strategies
Teaser: The North American Imaging in Multiple Sclerosis Cooperative has released a consensus statement and summary of benefits and limitations for 17 different imaging techniques.

Headlines: Macula May Not Benefit From a Blue-Light Filtering Intraocular Lens
Teaser: Inserting a blue light-filtering intraocular lens (IOL) during cataract surgery may not benefit the macula, researchers say.

Headlines: EU Panel Backs Risankizumab (Skyrizi) for Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: The interleukin-23 inhibitor is for treatment of moderate to severe plaque psoriasis in adults who are candidates for systemic therapy.

Headlines: Genes May Explain Why Some Women on the Pill Still Get Pregnant
Teaser: It's long been assumed that women who get pregnant on birth control pills somehow erred, possibly by forgetting a dose. But a new study suggests some women may inherit genes that break down contraceptive hormones more rapidly, leaving them with hormone levels that are too low to prevent pregnancy.

Headlines: No End in Sight, Bladder Cancer Drug Shortage Takes a Toll
Teaser: The immunotherapy BCG is in short supply in the United States. The American Urological Association and other groups have responded with a set of treatment strategies for clinicians, but problems are piling up.

Headlines: Eye Exam Detects Signs of Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Using an ultrasensitive scanning technique, researchers can detect signs of Alzheimer's disease in the tiny blood vessels at the back of the eye, according to a new report.

Headlines: Long-Term Androgen Deprivation Underused for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Long-duration androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) is widely underused in men, especially African Americans, who are undergoing definitive external beam radiotherapy (EBRT) for high-grade prostate cancer, a new U.S. study has found.

Headlines: 'No Smoking' at Home May Not Apply to Vaping
Teaser: Parents who use both traditional and e-cigarettes may vape around kids at home and in cars even when they don't smoke around their kids, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: FDA Approves Pfizer's Biosimilar to Roche's Herceptin
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration said on Monday it approved Pfizer Inc's biosimilar to Roche AG's blockbuster breast cancer treatment Herceptin (trastuzumab).

Headlines: Gene-Expression Signature in Blood Predicts Kidney Graft Rejection
Teaser: A multivariable gene-expression signature in peripheral blood of kidney-transplant recipients allows early identification of T cell-mediated rejection, according to results from the KALIBRE study.

Headlines: T Cell Clonal Expansion Linked to Postop Recurrence of Crohn's in Smokers
Teaser: Among smokers with Crohn's disease, increased T cell clonal expansion, especially in the CD8 compartment, is exaggerated and is associated with an increased rate of disease recurrence after ileocolonic resection, according to results from the REMIND Study Group.

Headlines: Remote Surveillance of Pacemakers, Defibrillators Adequate for at Least 2 Years
Teaser: Remote monitoring and remote interrogation every six months provide safe and efficient surveillance in patients with pacemakers and implantable cardiac defibrillators (ICDs), researchers from Spain report.

Headlines: Beyond Cancer: CAR T-Cell Therapy Now Investigated in Lupus
Teaser: CAR T-cell therapy extended survival and deferred manifestations of lupus in mouse models.

Headlines: Trump Budget Seeks 12% HHS Cut, Medicaid Work Rules, FDA Boost
Teaser: The White House on Monday unveiled a budget request that proposes changes in Medicare, including its payment approach for physician services provided in offices owned by hospitals.

Headlines: Hip Exercises May Improve Walking, Pain With Knee Arthritis
Teaser: Patients with knee osteoarthritis can add hip-strengthening exercises to their workout to improve the ability to walk and maybe reduce pain, according to a research review.

Headlines: Childhood Cancer Survivors at High Risk for Skin Malignancies
Teaser: As adults, childhood cancer survivors have a 30-fold higher risk than the general population of developing basal cell carcinoma, a Dutch study suggests.

Headlines: Dutch Join Backlash at Expensive Drugs by Making Their Own
Teaser: In a radiation-proof room at the Erasmus Medical Center in Rotterdam, Emar Thomasa sits behind shielded glass as he carefully measures and mixes lutetium octreotate, an intravenous treatment for certain types of cancer.

Headlines: Hidden FDA Reports Detail Harm Caused by Medical Devices
Teaser: The Food and Drug Administration has let medical device companies file reports of injuries and malfunctions outside a widely scrutinized public database, leaving doctors and medical sleuths in the dark.

Headlines: Resources Needed to Give DiRECT T2D Remission Hope to All
Teaser: More dietetics training and long-term follow-up are needed to take the T2D remission rates in DiRECT beyond the NHS England pilots, say UK clinicians who point to cost benefits with the approach.

Headlines: Low-Dose Aspirin May Not Reduce Prostate-Cancer Mortality
Teaser: Low-dose aspirin does not appear to reduce overall post-diagnosis prostate-cancer mortality, but it might reduce mortality several years from cancer diagnosis, according to results from the Danish Cancer Registry.

Headlines: Drug Concentrations, Immunogenicity Predict Anti-TNF Treatment Failure
Teaser: About one-quarter of patients with active luminal Crohn's disease (CD) do not respond to anti-tumor necrosis factor (TNF) drugs, while about two-thirds don't achieve remission, according to new research.

Headlines: Knee Surgery for Torn Cartilage May Not Be Worthwhile
Teaser: Many middle-aged and older adults with a meniscal tear and knee pain are not likely to benefit from arthroscopic partial meniscectomy (APM), a review of past studies suggests.

Headlines: J&J Prices Ketamine-Like Depression Treatment at $590-$885 for Two Doses
Teaser: Johnson & Johnson said on Wednesday its nasal spray depression treatment, called Spravato, will be priced at $590 for a 56 mg dose and $885 for 84 mg.

Headlines: More U.S. Youth Seeking Help During Psychiatric Emergencies
Teaser: The number of young people visiting U.S. emergency rooms with psychiatric problems is rising, driven largely by a surge in teens and minority youth seeking urgent help for mental illnesses, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Cancer Drugs Dominate Top 10 Best-Selling Drugs in 2018
Teaser: But Humira is the top seller in US 2 years running, while two immune checkpoint inhibitors break into the top 10.

Headlines: Long-Term Cancer Survivors at Higher Risk of Hospitalization for Other Diseases
Teaser: Survivors of the 12 most common cancers are at higher risk for a wide range of diseases that require hospitalization and should be monitored for new illnesses during follow-up visits, researchers say.

Headlines: Sleep Apnea Common in Pregnant Obese Women
Teaser: Undiagnosed, mild obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is common in late pregnancy among women who are obese, U.S. researchers report.

Headlines: User-Friendly Visual-Acuity Chart Shows Good Agreement With Existing Charts
Teaser: The Runge near-vision card is user-friendly and shows good agreement with the Early Treatment Diabetic Retinopathy Study (ETDRS) and Snellen visual-acuity charts, researchers report.

Headlines: Common Simple Tests for Dehydration Don't Work for Older Care-Home Residents
Teaser: Looking at someone's eyes, skin, the inside of their mouth, or asking them if they're thirsty, tired, or have a headache, doesn't reveal dehydration in older people living in care homes, according to new research from the U.K.

Headlines: New US Reference Standard for Amniotic Fluid Volume
Teaser: A new chart based on observations from more than 1,700 women can serve as a U.S. reference standard for amniotic fluid volume, researchers report.

Headlines: Better Lymphoma Outcomes With Bendamustine-Rituximab Combination
Teaser: The combination of bendamustine and rituximab provides better progression-free survival (PFS), event-free survival, and duration of response in patients with indolent non-Hodgkin lymphoma and mantle-cell lymphoma, compared with other regimens, according to five-year results from the BRIGHT follow-up study.

Headlines: Pulmonary Fibrosis Foundation Warns Against Stem Cell Infusions
Teaser: The foundation calls for-profit stem cell centers 'the modern-day equivalent of snake oil' and warned against having stem cell treatments except in clinical trials.

Headlines: TWiST Strengthens PARP Inhibitor Role in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: New analysis of the NOVA trial confirms clinical benefit from niraparib for patients with recurrent ovarian cancer. The benefit occurred both in patients with and in those without BRCA mutations.

Headlines: From Bench to Bedside: ENDO 2019 Ties Science to Clinical Care
Teaser: 'What distinguishes ENDO from other meetings is that you get a curated view of what is the newest, hottest, and best in science, which you know...is going to be impacting care.'

Headlines: Chemo for Early-Stage Prostate Cancer? RTOG 0521 Says Maybe
Teaser: In major clinical trial, docetaxel, which is typically used in metastatic disease, improved outcomes in high-risk, early-stage disease. However, the survival results fell short of the trial target.

Headlines: TAVR Low-Risk Studies Get Standing Ovation at ACC
Teaser: The success of the two trials of transcatheter aortic valve replacement in low-surgical-risk patients stole the show at the ACC today.

Headlines: Diagnosis, Treatment of Opioid Use Disorder in Pregnancy Tied to State Laws in US
Teaser: Patterns of diagnosis and treatment of opioid use disorder (OUD) in pregnant women in the U.S. vary significantly by region and by whether the disorder is criminalized by state laws, researchers say.

Headlines: Mosquito-Killing Drug Offers New Tool for Fighting Malaria
Teaser: Primary clinical outcomes were similar for catheter ablation and meds-only in the atrial fibrillation trial. But secondary ablation advantages could help inform shared decision-making, say observers.

Headlines: CABANA Published: Mixed Results, Helpful Insights
Teaser: Adult survivors of childhood cancer tend to have an incorrect perception of their infertility risk and need ongoing fertility care, a large single-site longitudinal study suggests.

Headlines: Childhood-Cancer Survivors Get Infertility Risk Wrong, Require Long-Term Fertility Care
Teaser: Having more than one pregnancy has long been linked to lower odds of breast cancer, and a new study suggests that may hold true even for some women with genetic mutations that put them at high risk for these malignancies.

Headlines: Pregnancies Tied to Breast Cancer Odds for High-Risk Women
Teaser: Certain women with breast cancer and untreated osteoporosis show accelerated progression of bone metastasis, according to a new study from Taiwan.

Headlines: Untreated Osteoporosis May Hasten Progression of Bone Metastasis
Teaser: The emails, tweets and blog posts in the "abuse" folder that Michael Sharpe keeps on his computer continue to pile up. Eight years after he published results of a clinical trial that found some patients with chronic fatigue syndrome can get a little better with the right talking and exercise therapies, the Oxford University professor is subjected to almost daily, often anonymous, intimidation.

Headlines: New Studies Support Dropping Long-term Aspirin After Stenting
Teaser: The STOPDAPT-2 and SMART-CHOICE trials both suggest extended therapy with clopidogrel or another P2Y12 inhibitor alone may be preferable to dual antiplatelet therapy.

Headlines: Higher Total Body Radiation Dose Before Haploidentical BMT Cuts Graft-failure Rates
Teaser: A higher dose of total body irradiation (TBI) before haploidentical transplant in patients with severe hemoglobinopathy can reduce graft failure rates without increasing transplant-related morbidity and mortality, according to results from a prospective clinical trial.

Headlines: Meet the Whistleblower Who Just Cost Duke $112.5 Million
Teaser: Joseph Thomas turned frustration about faulty research into more than $30 million -- and is hopeful for the future of scientific integrity.

Headlines: ADA and ACP Docs Debate Diabetes Goals: Outcome Is Surprise
Teaser: 'A reasonable HbA1c goal for many nonpregnant adults with diabetes is < 7%.' Debate follows controversy last year when the American College of Physicians issued looser HbA1c guidelines than ADA.

Headlines: IVIG Plus Cyclosporine Boosts Heart Outcomes in Resistant Kawasaki Disease
Teaser: Adding cyclosporine to intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) may prevent adverse coronary artery outcomes in Kawasaki disease patients at risk of not responding to IVIG alone, researchers say.

Headlines: Atezolizumab Safe in Advanced Urothelial Cancer
Teaser: The SAUL phase 3b trial met its primary safety endpoint, but the comparative efficacy of the anti-PD-L1 agent in a broader population is still up in the air.

Headlines: Seizure Freedom in TLE Tied to Piriform Cortex Resection
Teaser: Results from a study of individuals with temporal lobe epilepsy (TLE) who underwent surgery could have important implications in terms of a target for drug development and deep brain stimulation.

Headlines: Hopes Dashed for Aducanumab in Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: The phase 3 ENGAGE and EMERGE trials, which were assessing the novel amyloid-B-targeting agent aducanumab for Alzheimer's-related dementia, have been discontinued due to futility.

Headlines: Living Alone Does Not Appear to Worsen Heart Disease
Teaser: The Serious Illness Care Program helps oncologists have better serious-illness conversations with patients without creating anxiety or depression, according to results of a cluster-randomized clinical trial.

Headlines: Program Improves Communication Between Oncology Clinicians and Patients
Teaser: The FDA issued a partial hold on all ongoing clinical trials evaluating venetoclax in multiple myeloma because of an excessive number of deaths seen in the BELLINI study.

Headlines: Clinical Trials With Venetoclax on Hold Because of Deaths
Teaser: Total knee replacement (TKA) is increasingly being performed in younger patients and new research suggests that these patients have a higher risk for complications than older patients.

Headlines: Knee Replacement in Younger Patients Has Higher Complication Rate
Teaser: In the absence of whole-brain radiation, neurosurgical resection in patients with brain metastases may boost pachymeningeal seeding, a new study hints.

Headlines: Brain Surgery for Metastasis Tied to Distinctive Tumor Spread
Teaser: Sleep disturbances predict suicidal ideation in adolescents, according to a new systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Sleep Problems Linked to Suicidal Thoughts in Youth
Teaser: It would be irresponsible for any scientist to conduct human gene-editing studies in people, and a central registry of research plans should be set up to ensure transparency, World Health Organization experts said on Tuesday.

Headlines: WHO Panel Calls for Registry of All Human Gene Editing Research
Teaser: A semiautomated fact-checking tool, the Seek & Blastn tool, has found numerous errors in nucleotide-sequence reagents in biomedical research publications, researchers report.

Headlines: Fact-Checking Finds Many Errors in Published Nucleotide-Sequence Reagents
Teaser: In a comparison of gas versus needle, a new pragmatic trial has shown that using a volatile anesthesia agent during elective coronary-artery bypass grafting (CABG) did not produce fewer deaths after one year.

Headlines: No Survival Benefit for Volatile Anesthesia in Elective CABG Surgery
Teaser: A new study in patients with rifampin-resistant tuberculosis (TB) is providing the first strong evidence that the Bangladesh protocol for treating multidrug-resistant (MDR)-TB, which is used for 9 to 11 months, is not inferior to the standard regimen recommended by the World Health Organization, which requires treatment for 20 months.

Headlines: Shaving 10 Months Off Treatment Not Inferior Against Rifampin-Resistant TB
Teaser: Testosterone replacement therapy decreased the risk for biochemical recurrence in some men and delayed time to recurrence in others, findings that took investigators by surprise.

Headlines: Overturning Dogma -- Using Testosterone in Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Persistent chemotherapy-induced alopecia (pCIA) is often more severe than endocrine-induced alopecia after chemotherapy (EIAC), but both conditions are associated with a "negative emotional effect," researchers say.

Headlines: Dosing Calculations May Be Off in Children With Obesity
Teaser: Methods for calculating ideal body weight (IBW) are inconsistent in obese children and could lead to sub-therapeutic dosing of medications, according to new research.

Headlines: Pembrolizumab May Help Some With Advanced Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer
Teaser: Pembrolizumab (Keytruda, Merck) may have ongoing benefits for people with advanced non-small-cell lung cancer expressing programmed death ligand 1 (PD-L1), extended follow-up of an open-label study shows.

Headlines: New Monitoring System Reduces Blind Spots During Esophagogastroduodenoscopy
Teaser: The new WISENSE monitoring system reduces blind-spot rates during esophagogastroduodenoscopy (EGD), researchers from China report.

Headlines: Older Diabetes Patients Often Unaware of Hypoglycemia
Teaser: Older adults with type 1 diabetes typically spend more than an hour a day in the hypoglycemic range, while those who aren't aware their blood sugar is low can spend more than 100 minutes a day in the hypoglycemic range, a new study suggests.

Headlines: IVF Tied to Slight Increased Risk of Rare Childhood Cancers
Teaser: Certain rare childhood cancers may be more common in children conceived via in vitro fertilization (IVF), a U.S. study suggests, but parents needn't lose sleep over this finding, according to the researchers.

Headlines: Margin Guidelines Affect Breast-Cancer Surgical Trends
Teaser: Rates of breast-conserving surgery for early-stage breast cancer increased and repeat surgery decreased following dissemination of 2014 margin guidelines, according to new findings.

Headlines: DART: Success Story in High-Grade Neuroendocrine Carcinomas
Teaser: Patients with high-grade neuroendocrine carcinomas benefit from dual checkpoint inhibition with ipilimumab and nivolumab after single-agent checkpoint inhibition has failed. Is dual checkpoint blockade ready for prime time?

Headlines: Algorithm Automatically Detects Major Thoracic Diseases on Chest X-Rays
Teaser: A new deep-learning-based automated-detection (DLAD) algorithm accurately classifies major thoracic diseases on chest x-rays, researchers from South Korea report.

Headlines: Top US Public Health Schools Provide Insufficient Maternity Leave
Teaser: Like many medical schools and prestigious universities across the U.S., most of the top public health schools fail to provide as much maternity leave as doctors recommend for the health of mothers and babies, a recent study suggests.

Headlines: Ig Overused in Immune Thrombocytopenia, Flash Mob Audit Shows
Teaser: A novel form of audit that pooled data from a large number of centres over a short period of time has revealed that many UK immune thrombocytopenia patients are not receiving recommended therapy.

Headlines: Rituximab Fails to Improve Symptoms in ME/CFS
Teaser: New findings in treating myalgic encephalomyselitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS) contradict previous observations and preliminary trial results; illness heterogeneity was cited as a research challenge.

Headlines: Improvised Nasal Naloxone Devices Might Deliver Insufficient Medication
Teaser: Improvised nasal naloxone devices (INND) commonly used by first responders and the general public deliver significantly less naloxone than regulator-approved devices, according to a study from the National Institute on Drug Abuse (NIDA).

Headlines: Weight Gain, Blood Pressure Rise Seen With JAK Inhibitor Therapy
Teaser: Pharmacologic inhibition of Janus kinases (JAK) 1 and 2 is associated with significant weight gain and increased systolic blood pressure, according to a review of patients treated with the JAK1/2 inhibitor ruxolitinib.

Headlines: Enucleation Might Be Better Option for Men With Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia
Teaser: Enucleation might be a better option than resection of the prostate for men with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH), according to a new meta-analysis.

Headlines: Dana-Farber Opens First Center Devoted to Lynch Syndrome
Teaser: The new center will provide genetic testing, coordinated care, and research for individuals with Lynch syndrome.

Headlines: Combination Therapy for PTSD Provides No Added Benefit
Teaser: In the head-to-head PROGRESS trial, there were no significant differences in PTSD outcomes at 24 weeks for trauma-focused psychotherapy plus sertraline vs either treatment alone.

Headlines: Tighter SBP Target Could Harm Smokers With Severe Hypertension
Teaser: Intensive management of hypertension in smokers may increase their risk of cardiovascular events, according to a new secondary analysis of data from the Systolic Blood Pressure Intervention Trial (SPRINT).

Headlines: Artesunate Now First-Line Treatment for Severe Malaria in US
Teaser: With quinidine discontinued and no longer available in the US, artesunate is now the first-line treatment for severe malaria in the US, according to the CDC.

Headlines: Big Pharma Accused of 'endless Talk, No Action' on Antibiotic Threat
Teaser: The pharmaceutical industry should match its words with action on researching new antibiotics to address the threat posed by drug-resistant superbugs, a former UK government adviser said on Wednesday.

Headlines: Repeated Mass Treatment With Ivermectin Curbs Malaria in Young Children in West Africa
Teaser: Repeated mass administration of ivermectin in Burkina Faso reduced childhood malaria episodes by 20% during the transmission season without significantly increasing adverse events, according to a proof-of-principle study.

Headlines: Sleeping Pill Use Linked to Later Increase in BP Meds
Teaser: The use of sleeping tablets by older hypertensive patients was linked to a subsequent increase in the use of antihypertensive medication in a new study.

Headlines: Couple-Focused Program Reduces Risky Sex for Men Under Community Supervision
Teaser: A couple-based intervention for prevention of HIV and sexually transmitted infection (STI) reduces risky sexual behavior among men in community-supervision programs (CSPs), a new randomized clinical trial shows.

Headlines: Activated Charcoal Bag Tied to Big Rise in Proper Disposal of Unused Opioids After Surgery
Teaser: Post-op patients given an activated charcoal bag upon discharge showed close to a four-fold increase in appropriate disposal of unused opioids, researchers say.

Headlines: New Nursing Home Patients May Wait to See a Doctor
Teaser: When Medicare patients are discharged from a hospital to a skilled nursing facility, the time it takes for a doctor or advanced-level practitioner to see them for a first evaluation can vary widely, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Getting Ready for Resistance to First-Gen NTRK Inhibitors
Teaser: Just a few months ago, larotrectinib was approved for treating any NTRK+ tumor. Already, there are studies in place to address any mutations that emerge with the first-generation TRK-targeted agent.

Headlines: Surrogates Speed Cancer Drug Approvals, but Only by 11 Months
Teaser: Is a 12% reduction in time to market worth the uncertainty of overall survival, researchers ask. A commenter says the cost savings and potential benefit to patients and healthcare are worth the risk.

Headlines: Dozens of Clinics Market Risky Cell Therapies to Treat Eye Disorders
Teaser: Scores of clinics across the United States directly advertise expensive - but unproven - stem cell therapies to patients with serious eye diseases, often with devastating results, a new study warns.

Headlines: Fecal Microbiome Signature Detects Cirrhosis in Nonalcoholic Fatty-Liver Disease
Teaser: A fecal microbiome signature accurately detects cirrhosis in patients with nonalcoholic fatty-liver disease (NAFLD), researchers report.

Headlines: Hospitalized Teens Not Getting Needed Reproductive-Health Care
Teaser: Healthcare providers are missing numerous opportunities to identify and address the reproductive-health needs of hospitalized teens, a study by U.S. researchers has found.

Headlines: Biogen SMA Drug Price, Novartis Estimates for Its Treatment Far Too High -U.S. Group
Teaser: Biogen Inc should slash the price of its spinal muscular atrophy (SMA) drug, and the $4 million to $5 million Novartis has said its experimental gene therapy for the disease is worth is excessive, an independent U.S. organization that reviews the value of medical treatments said on Wednesday.

Headlines: ITP and B-cell Lymphoma Feature in Latest BSH Guidance
Teaser: Recommendations on tackling osteoporosis in immune thrombocytopenia and mediastinal B-cell lymphoma management are the latest guidance by the British Society for Haematology in a prolific year.

Headlines: Endoscopic Clip Closure After Large Polyp Resection in Right Colon Reduces Bleeding
Teaser: Endoscopic clip closure after resection of large sessile polyps in the proximal colon reduced the risk of post-procedure bleeding in a multicenter randomized trial, researchers say.

Headlines: Adjunctive IV Nitroprusside of No Value in Treatment-Resistant Schizophrenia
Teaser: Adjunctive intravenous sodium nitroprusside (IV SNP) is not effective for individuals with schizophrenia who have a history of treatment resistance, results of a proof-of-concept clinical trial reveal.

Headlines: Lenalidomide Plus Rituximab Ups Response in Relapsed Indolent Lymphoma
Teaser: In patients with relapsed or refractory indolent non-Hodgkin lymphoma, adding lenalidomide to rituximab improves response, according to a placebo-controlled trial.

Headlines: University of Illinois Missed Warning Signs of Research Going Awry
Teaser: UIC has played down its shortcomings in overseeing the work of a prominent child psychiatrist, but newly obtained documents show that the school acknowledged its lapses to federal officials.

Headlines: Sleep Problems, Exhaustion Worse in Moms of Children With Eczema
Teaser: Mothers of children with eczema sleep poorly, and the worse their child's eczema, the worse their sleep problems, according to new findings.

Headlines: Elite Hospitals Plunge Into Unproven Stem Cell Treatments
Teaser: Critics are concerned about the explosion in controversial stem cell procedures offered by clinics and, increasingly, respected hospitals.

Headlines: Chlorhexidine Does Not Reduce MDR Organisms in Non-ICU Hospital Areas
