Teaser: Chlorhexidine bathing is no better than routine bathing for preventing multidrug-resistant organisms and all-cause bloodstream infections in non-critical-care hospital patients, according to results from the ABATE Infection trial.

Headlines: Study Points to New Antibody Approach to Tackling Ebola, Other Infections
Teaser: For people with celiac disease, even tiny amounts of gluten in foods can cause trouble, and restaurants may be the hardest places to avoid the hidden protein, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Novo Nordisk and Gilead Team Up to Test Fatty Liver Disease Treatment
Teaser: Novo Nordisk and Gilead Sciences will join forces on a clinical trial combining drugs from the two pharmaceutical firms to treat a progressive fatty liver disease known as NASH.

Headlines: Insulin Pump No Better Than Multiple Daily Injections in Kids With Diabetes
Teaser: Continuous subcutaneous insulin infusion (CSII) provides no benefit over multiple daily injection (MDI) regimens in children and young people newly diagnosed with type 1 diabetes, researchers from U.K. report.

Headlines: HIV-1 Envelope Protein Opening Exposes Antibody Targets
Teaser: An asymmetric opening of the HIV-1 envelope protein (Env) exposes targets that induce antibody-dependent cellular cytotoxicity (ADCC), researchers report.

Headlines: Cool but Confused: Social Entrepreneurs Find It Harder to Explain Their Work
Teaser: Two rarely encountered genetic variants that already have roles in dementias also appear to be associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD), according to a large genetic study.

Headlines: Rare Genetic Variants Tied to Alzheimer's Disease
Teaser: Targeted drug delivery (TDD) reduces costs and healthcare utilization when added to conventional medical management (CMM) for patients with cancer-related pain, according to new findings.

Headlines: Targeted Drug Delivery for Cancer Pain Cuts Costs, Hospital Time
Teaser: Aripiprazole lauroxil once every 2 months provided similar significant improvement in schizophrenia symptoms as once per month paliperidone palmitate.

Headlines: Long-Acting Injectables Yield Similar Benefit in Schizophrenia
Teaser: A molecular classifier based on RNA-sequencing data from transbronchial lung biopsies can recognize an expression signature associated with usual interstitial pneumonia (UIP), the defining pathology of idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF).

Headlines: Molecular Classifier Helps Spot Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
Teaser: Fewer than one in 10 family caregivers receive training for assisting older adults with disabilities, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Few Family Caregivers Get Formal Training
Teaser: Scientists have mapped the genome of a strain of cholera extracted a century ago from a sick British soldier during World War One and found clues to how some cholera bacteria strains cause epidemics today.

Headlines: Century-Old Bacteria From Sick Soldier Offer Clues to Cholera Epidemics
Teaser: Babies who consume nothing but breast milk for their first three months of life may have healthier cholesterol levels by adolescence than infants who drink formula, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Exclusive Breastfeeding Tied to Healthier Cholesterol in Teens
Teaser: Extensive intraoperative peritoneal lavage (EIPL) during resection of peritoneal metastasis from gastric cancer increases safety and reduces short-term complications, according to Chinese researchers.

Headlines: Extensive Peritoneal Lavage Cuts Complications From Gastric-Cancer Surgery
Teaser: Imaging studies in children with unilateral sensorineural hearing loss (USNHL) generally don't yield clinically useful information, according to new findings.

Headlines: CT, MRI Don't Change Therapy in Children With Hearing Loss
Teaser: Patients with frontotemporal dementia (FTD) are more likely than patients with Alzheimer disease to manifest criminal or socially inappropriate behavior, according to a Swedish medical records review.

Headlines: Criminal, Socially Inappropriate Behavior More Common With Frontotemporal Dementia
Teaser: Medical marijuana users gradually shift to cannabis formulations higher in tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) over time, according to new findings.

Headlines: Medical Cannabis Use Differs for Patients With, Without Cancer
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Monday refused to fully review the marketing application for Zogenix Inc's treatment for seizures associated with Dravet syndrome, a rare form of childhood epilepsy.

Headlines: Zogenix's Seizure Drug Filing Fails to Pass U.S. FDA Scrutiny
Teaser: While it's possible that as many as one in 13 boys in the U.S. have sex before reaching their teens, the chance that they will do this varies widely depending on where they live, a study suggests.

Headlines: Up to 1 in 13 Boys in US Have Sex Before Adolescence
Teaser: PET using a gallium-labeled prostate-specific membrane antigen (68Ga-PSMA-11) as ligand accurately localizes recurrent prostate cancer, according to a new prospective study.

Headlines: PET Using Prostate-Specific Ligand Accurately Localizes Recurrent Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Alnylam Pharmaceuticals Inc and Regeneron Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Monday they agreed to jointly develop treatments for eye and central nervous system diseases using gene-silencing technology RNA interference (RNAi).

Headlines: Alnylam, Regeneron to Partner for RNAi Treatments
Teaser: Cognitive grief treatment surpasses antidepressants alone for complicated grief, but sleep disturbances, which are common, can derail treatment.

Headlines: Higher State Minimum Wage Tied to Lower Suicide Rates
Teaser: Suicide rates grow more slowly in states that increase their minimum wage, according to a U.S. study that suggests this might be one strategy for curbing deaths by suicide.

Headlines: Reminder Bell Improves Incentive Spirometer Use After CABG
Teaser: Following coronary artery bypass grafting (CABG) surgery, compliance with incentive spirometer use was improved by the SpiroTimer, an add-on use tracking device that sounds a reminder bell, researchers say.

Headlines: Rapid Initiation of Single-Tablet, Quadruple Anti-HIV Therapy Effective
Teaser: A high proportion of patients with newly diagnosed HIV-1 infection achieved an undetectable viral load through 48 weeks after starting Symtuza (Janssen) within two weeks of diagnosis, according to new data from the DIAMOND study.

Headlines: IBD Patients Who Switch From Infliximab to Biosimilar See Mixed Results
Teaser: Patients with inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) can safely switch from infliximab to the biosimilar CT-P13, though they may face a higher risk of clinical relapse, researchers from Spain report.

Headlines: Tailored Program Might Help Some With Severe Mental Illness Quit Smoking
Teaser: A smoking-cessation program tailored to people with schizophrenia and bipolar disorder may help some quit, new findings show.

Headlines: Yale Study Revives Cellular Activity in Pig Brains Hours After Death
Teaser: Yale University scientists have succeeded in restoring basic cellular activity in pigs' brains hours after their deaths in a finding that may one day lead to advances in treating human stroke and brain injuries, researchers reported on Wednesday.

Headlines: MRI Identifies Rectal-Cancer Patients Suitable for Primary Surgery
Teaser: MRI criteria can be used to identify "good prognosis" rectal-cancer patients for primary surgery (without chemoradiotherapy first), according to results from the QuickSilver clinical trial.

Headlines: Multiple Hep B Targets in Development for New Treatments
Teaser: Hepatitis B is a complex, 'clever' virus so several simultaneous approaches might be needed to eliminate it, experts say.

Headlines: Recordati to Seek Canadian Approval for Kidney Disease Drug
Teaser: Italy's Recordati said on Tuesday it plans to seek Canadian approval for its drug Cystagon, which treats a rare kidney disease, in a potential blow to Horizon Pharma, which makes the only drug approved for treatment in Canada.

Headlines: Gene Signature Linked to Survival After Pancreatic-Cancer Surgery
Teaser: In patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) presence of two single-nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) may help predict surgical outcome, according to European researchers.

Headlines: Immune Signatures Differ Between Healthy Vs Complicated Lupus Pregnancies
Teaser: Healthy and uncomplicated lupus pregnancies have similar immune signatures that differ from those in complicated lupus pregnancies, researchers report.

Headlines: Simplified MRI Index Assesses Crohn's Disease Activity and Severity
Teaser: A simplified four-item MRI-based index of activity (MARIAs) quickly assesses Crohn's disease (CD) activity and response to therapy, researchers from Spain report.

Headlines: Tool Calculates Competing Risks of Death in Older Women With Early Breast Cancer
Teaser: A risk calculator incorporating age, comorbidities and estrogen receptor status can estimate competing risks of death for older women with stage 1 breast cancer, potentially aiding therapeutic decision making, researchers say.

Headlines: Multidrug-Resistant Bacteria Found on Patient Hands, Surfaces
Teaser: Multidrug-resistant bacteria were found on many hospitalized patients' hands and on commonly touched surfaces in their rooms. They could be a reservoir for hospital-acquired infections, a study indicates.

Headlines: Extensive Repeat Biopsy May Be Useful for Some on Active Surveillance for Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Extensive transrectal repeat biopsy with anterior sampling lacks utility for general use in men on active surveillance for low-risk prostate cancer, but it may be appropriate for those with higher prostate-specific antigen (PSA) density, researchers from Sweden report.

Headlines: U.S. Supreme Court Rejects Allergan Bid to Use Tribe to Shield Drug Patents
Teaser: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday cast aside pharmaceutical company Allergan Plc's unorthodox bid to shield patents from a federal administrative court's review by transferring them to a Native American tribe.

Headlines: IBD Survey Accurately Captures Patient-Reported Symptoms
Teaser: The Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD) Symptom Inventory accurately captures patient-reported symptoms and can be used to monitor patients in clinic or research settings, researchers from Canada report.

Headlines: Patch Testing May Reveal Allergy to Implanted Cardiac Device
Teaser: Contact allergy to implanted devices is rare, but should be considered and tested for in certain situations, researchers say.

Headlines: Esophageal Reflux Common After Sleeve Gastrectomy
Teaser: About one in four patients will develop gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) after sleeve gastrectomy, but few will require conversion to gastric bypass for severe reflux, according to a systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Genetic Testing Under-Utilized in Ovarian Cancer
Teaser: Only a minority of women with ovarian or breast cancer undergo recommended genetic testing, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Earlier MMR Shot Linked to Faster Decline in Protection
Teaser: Children vaccinated early during a measles epidemic show a sharper drop-off in antibody concentrations over time than children vaccinated at the recommended time, according to new findings.

Headlines: Gilead's NASH Drug Fails to Meet Late-Stage Study Goal
Teaser: Gilead Sciences Inc's experimental drug aimed at treating nonalcoholic steatohepatitis (NASH) failed to meet the main goal of a late-stage study on Thursday, two months after it failed another.

Headlines: Emicizumab Prevents Bleeds in Hemophilia Regardless of FVIII-Inhibitor Status
Teaser: Emicizumab given every four weeks provides adequate bleeding prophylaxis in hemophilia patients, regardless of coagulation factor VIII inhibitor status, a phase 3 trial shows.

Headlines: German Scientists Create See-Through Human Organs
Teaser: Researchers in Germany have created transparent human organs using a new technology that could pave the way to print three-dimensional body parts such as kidneys for transplants.

Headlines: Adverse Skin Effects Tied to Anti-PD1 Response in Melanoma
Teaser: Cutaneous toxic effects (CT) following treatment with anti-programmed-cell-death 1 (anti-PD-1) inhibitors may be encouraging news in patients with advanced melanoma, a retrospective review suggests.

Headlines: Osteoporotic Fracture Rates Similar With Denosumab, Alendronate in Real World
Teaser: Rates of osteoporotic fracture were similar three years after starting either denosumab or alendronate in a real-world Danish population-based cohort study.

Headlines: Pesticide Exposure Linked to Worse Outcomes in Diffuse Large B-Cell Lymphoma
Teaser: Diffuse large B-cell lymphoma (DLBCL) patients exposed to pesticides on the job have worse overall survival (OS) and event-free survival (EFS) and are less likely to respond to treatment, according to new findings.

Headlines: Therapy by Phone or Web Improves Patient-Reported Outcomes in IBS
Teaser: Cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) delivered by phone or online leads to improvements in patient-reported outcomes in irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), according to a clinical trial from the U.K.

Headlines: Teva Scraps Cluster Headache Program
Teaser: Teva Pharmaceutical Industries Ltd said on Tuesday it would stop developing its migraine drug, Ajovy, for treating cluster headaches.

Headlines: Cancers, Infectious Diseases Get Large Portion of New Drugs
Teaser: A report also shows that nearly half of all drugs launched in 2018 were approved after trials with fewer than 500 participants, as the need grows for niche treatments. Mean development is 13.7 years.

Headlines: Promising Strategy Identifies Triple-Negative Breast Cancers That Might Respond to Tamoxifen
Teaser: Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) tumors with estrogen receptor-beta and a mutated p53 tumor suppressor might be responsive to tamoxifen, a series of preclinical studies suggests.

Headlines: Promising Results in Mice Prompt Human Trial of Novel Lymphoma Vaccine
Teaser: An in situ vaccine (ISV) combined with immune stimulants and radiotherapy showed efficacy in mice, prompting a phase 1 trial of patients with advanced indolent non-Hodgkin's lymphoma (INHL), researchers say.

Headlines: Merck's Keytruda Wins FDA Approval as Combination Therapy for Kidney Cancer
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration has approved Merck & Co Inc's cancer therapy Keytruda (pembrolizumab) as part of a combination therapy for previously untreated patients with the most common type of kidney cancer, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: China Draws Up Tighter Rules on Human Gene and Embryo Trials - Xinhua
Teaser: China's top legislature will consider tougher rules on research involving human genes and embryos, the first such move since a Chinese scientist sparked controversy last year by announcing he had made the world's first "gene-edited" babies.

Headlines: Non-Adherence to Antiplatelet Therapy After PCI Ups Risk of MACE in Anemic Patients
Teaser: In anemic patients who have undergone percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), non-adherence to dual antiplatelet therapy (DAPT) - but not physician-recommended discontinuation - is associated with a higher risk of major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE) in the two years following the procedure, researchers say.

Headlines: Research Needed on Long-Term Osteoporosis Drug Therapies
Teaser: A variety of drugs are effective for preventing osteoporotic fractures, but there are gaps in the evidence supporting their safety and effectiveness beyond three years, according to a National Institutes of Health Pathways to Prevention Workshop.

Headlines: Lower Dose of Pfizer-Lilly Painkiller Misses Main Goals in Late Stage Study
Teaser: A lower dose of non-opioid painkiller developed by Pfizer Inc and Eli Lilly and Co failed to meet main goals in a late-stage study in patients with moderate-to-severe osteoarthritis of the hip or knee, the companies said on Thursday in releasing topline results of the study.

Headlines: Certain Factors Predict Celiac Disease Risk in Children With Positive Serology but Negative Biopsy
Teaser: In children with "potential" celiac disease - positive serology but negative biopsy - who are not on gluten-free diets, factors that may help predict risk for eventual villous atrophy include age at diagnosis, gamma delta lymphocytes and HLA haplotype, researchers say.

Headlines: Budget Limits Major Constraint on Heart-Failure Research
Teaser: Insufficient funding is generally the most important of limitations on heart-failure research, but enrolling subjects and contract completion are also significant obstacles, according to a survey by the Heart Failure Society of America (HFSA).

Headlines: Evolocumab Lowers LDL-C in Diabetic Patients on Maximum Statins
Teaser: In patients with type 2 diabetes and hyperlipidemia or mixed dyslipidemia on a maximally tolerated statin, treatment with evolocumab lowers low-density-lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) and improves levels of other lipids, researchers say.

Headlines: New Dementia Subtype That Mimics Alzheimer's Identified
Teaser: Limbic-predominant age-related TDP-43 encephalopathy mimics Alzheimer's disease but is caused by TDP-43 protein deposits rather than beta-amyloid accumulation and is underrecognized.

Headlines: Watchful Waiting OK in Diabetic Macular Edema With Good Vision
Teaser: New trial suggests no difference in risk for vision loss over 2 years with aflibercept, laser treatment, or observation; experts stress importance of adherence to follow-up and tight glycemic control.

Headlines: Adverse Events Common With PD-1 and PD-L1 Inhibitors
Teaser: Most cancer patients treated with programmed cell death (PD-1) and programmed cell death ligand 1 (PD-L1) inhibitors experience at least one treatment-related adverse event, according to a new systematic review and meta-analysis.

Headlines: Longer Course of Solifenacin Does Not Reduce Overactive Bladder Recurrence
Teaser: Prolonged anti-muscarinic treatment with solifenacin does not decrease the risk for retreatment of overactive bladder, researchers say.

Headlines: Teens With Chronic Pain May Find Support on YouTube
Teaser: Teens with painful chronic illnesses may find that YouTube can provide a support network, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Experimental Agent Shows Promise in Slowing Genetic Form of ALS
Teaser: Researchers successfully target elevated levels of a harmful protein, offering hope to people with a genetic form of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis.

Headlines: Clinical Trials of New Cancer Drugs 'Frequently Flawed'
Teaser: Many randomized clinical trials that lead to approvals for cancer drugs have suboptimal control arms, biasing outcomes in favor of the experimental arm.

Headlines: Dads' Smoking Linked With Fetal Heart Problems
Teaser: Unborn babies are at higher risk of heart defects not just when mothers smoke, but when fathers smoke, too, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Higher Radiation Doses Tied to Increased Longevity in Node-Negative Lung Cancer
Teaser: Patients with node-negative stage-II non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who receive higher radiation doses survive longer, researchers have found.

Headlines: African American Women at Higher Risk of Revascularization, MI After PCI
Teaser: African American women are three times as likely as white women to have a myocardial infarction (MI) in the year following stent placement, and their risk of target vessel revascularization is almost doubled, new research shows.

Headlines: European Commission Approves Risankizumab for Plaque Psoriasis
Teaser: In clinical studies, patients with moderate to severe plaque psoriasis saw significantly higher rates of skin clearance with risankizumab compared to current standards of care.

Headlines: Deep-Learning Model May Help Predict NSCLC Outcomes, Survival
Teaser: A deep-learning model that uses serial imaging scans of tumors from patients with non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) may predict treatment response and survival better than standard clinical parameters alone, researchers say.

Headlines: Childhood Mortality Declining Globally but Disability on the Rise
Teaser: Children today are more likely to survive to early adulthood than they were in years past, but progress has been concentrated in higher-income countries and a growing number of kids worldwide are living with disabling health problems, a new study suggests.

Headlines: Indoor Tanning May Trigger Gene Mutation That Boosts Melanoma Risk
Teaser: Indoor tanning is associated with a higher risk of developing the deadly skin cancer melanoma at younger ages, and a recent study suggests the ultraviolet (UV) light in tanning beds may be triggering genetic mutations that can lead to skin malignancies.

Headlines: Obscure Advisory Committees at Heart of U.S. Drug Pricing Debate
Teaser: 'Philly Spectacular' is the theme of this year's AAN Annual Meeting, says the event's science committee chair, adding that more than 15,000 attendees are expected at the 'robust and spirited' event.

Headlines: What's Hot at AAN 2019?
Teaser: In the UK, universal late pregnancy ultrasound in nulliparous women could be cost-effective, "virtually eliminate" undiagnosed breech births and reduce related fetal mortality, researchers say.

Headlines: Universal Ultrasound in Late Pregnancy May Be Cost-Effective, Potentially Life-Saving in the UK
Teaser: Oral immunotherapy for peanut allergy is safe in preschool-aged children when given as routine treatment in a hospital or clinic, a new study has found.

Headlines: Peanut Oral Immunotherapy Safe for Preschoolers in Real-World
Teaser: The investigational test, based on differential responses to hyperosmotic stress, may serve as a low-cost diagnostic for myalgic encephalomyelitis/chronic fatigue syndrome (ME/CFS).

Headlines: Biomarker May Be a Diagnostic Test for ME/CFS
Teaser: Both drugs have received a positive opinion from the European Medicine Agency's Committee for Medicinal Products for Human Use, which is the first step in obtaining marketing approval in the European Union.

Headlines: Numerous New Anticancer Drugs Not Proven Superior to Standard of Care
Teaser: Seventeen percent of randomized controlled trials that led to new anticancer drug approvals in the U.S. had suboptimal control arms and did not prove superiority to standard-of-care treatments, a quality-improvement study shows.

Headlines: Bristol-Myers' Opdivo Fails Late-Stage Brain Cancer Trial
Teaser: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said on Thursday its immunotherapy Opdivo (nivolumab) failed to meet the main goal of a late-stage trial testing it in patients with an aggressive form of tumor that affects the brain or the spine.

Headlines: AstraZeneca-Daiichi Breast Cancer Treatment Shows Promise in Latest Study
Teaser: An experimental breast cancer drug being developed by British drugmaker AstraZeneca and Japan's Daiichi Sankyo's met its main goal in a mid-stage study, bolstering their position in a highly competitive oncology market.

Headlines: Results From Many Large Clinical Trials Remain Unpublished Years Later
Teaser: Results from a substantial proportion of large, registered, randomized controlled trials (RCTs) can go unpublished for years after their completion, researchers report.

Headlines: Fundoplication Success in Laryngopharyngeal Reflux Hard to Assess
Teaser: The heterogeneity among studies makes it "impossible" to reliably estimate the effectiveness of fundoplication in controlling laryngopharyngeal reflux disease, according to a review of more than 30 studies.

Headlines: 'Ultra-Short' Iron Boost Day Before Cardiac Surgery Reduces RBC Transfusions
Teaser: A combination treatment given to patients with anemia or iron deficiency the day before cardiac surgery significantly reduces their need for red blood cell (RBC) transfusions, according to new findings in The Lancet.

Headlines: LEGATO-HD: Laquinimod Misses Primary Aim in Huntington's
Teaser: No significant changes on a clinical motor rating scale emerged after 1 year, but researchers report some intriguing differences on brain imaging.

Headlines: Worse Outcomes for Patients Not Achieving Sustained Viral Remission After HCV Treatment
Teaser: Patients who do not achieve sustained viral remission (SVR) after completing direct-acting antiviral treatment for hepatitis C virus (HCV) infection experience worsening health-related quality of life (HRQoL), according to a registry study.

Headlines: WHO Experts Recommend Ramping Up Ebola Vaccine After Congo Cases Surge
Teaser: World Health Organization experts recommended on Tuesday a dramatic expansion of vaccination against Ebola in Congo after a surge in cases showed that the strategy of vaccinating those known to be exposed to the disease was no longer sufficient.

Headlines: Arsenic Exposure Linked to Heart Thickening
Teaser: Drinking water that is contaminated with even moderate levels of arsenic may lead to an increase in left ventricular wall thickness and LV hypertrophy, a new U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Coca-Cola Contracts Allow Research to Be Suppressed, Says Report
Teaser: Coca-Cola's "transparency initiative was window dressing," says a study author. "They're still trying to do everything they can to evade their responsibility for their role in the global obesity epidemic."

Headlines: 'Outside the Box': Tamoxifen for Bladder Cancer
Teaser: Widely used in the treatment of breast cancer because of its estrogen-blocking activity, tamoxifen has now been tested for the first time in bladder cancer.

Headlines: Laparoscopic Surgery Effective for Chronic Reflux-Linked Cough
Teaser: Laparoscopic antireflux surgery (LARS) is an effective treatment for chronic cough associated with gastroesophageal reflux disease, with three-quarters of patients having complete resolution of symptoms, researchers report.

Headlines: Rates of Lung Cancer Screening Discussions Are Low, and Falling Further
Teaser: Too few physician-patient discussions are taking place to address lung cancer screening and smoking cessation for at-risk individuals, researchers say.

Headlines: Low-Dose Tamoxifen Prevents Recurrence of in Situ Breast Cancer
Teaser: Tamoxifen at a low dose helps reduce local and contralateral recurrence of breast intraepithelial neoplasia, according to a new randomized controlled trial.

Headlines: FDA OKs Two Tafamidis Formulations for Rare Cardiomyopathy
Teaser: These are the first FDA-approved treatments for transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis cardiomyopathy, a rare and often fatal disease caused by deposition of amyloid fibrils in the myocardium.

Headlines: Icing Kidneys Unnecessary in Cancer Surgery
Teaser: A first-of-its-kind clinical trial showed that use of soft ice to cool the kidney during open partial nephrectomy did not improve outcomes at 1 year. It's time to get to forgo the slush, investigators say.

Headlines: Drusen Characteristics Linked With AMD Risk in Fellow Eyes
Teaser: In patients with unilateral neovascular age-related macular degeneration (AMD), certain drusen features are associated with conversion to neovascular AMD in the fellow eye, according to a secondary analysis of data from a clinical trial.

Headlines: High-Dose, Single-Fraction SBRT Likely Effective for Non-Spine Bone Metastases
Teaser: Single-fraction stereotactic body radiotherapy (SBRT) seems to be an effective option for patients with painful non-spine bone metastases and achieved higher pain response rates than standard multifraction radiotherapy (MFRT) in a phase 2 noninferiority study.

Headlines: Merck Steps Up U.S. Measles Vaccine Production With Increased Demand
Teaser: Merck & Co said on Wednesday it has increased production of the measles vaccine to meet an uptick in demand in the United States in the midst of the country's biggest outbreak in 25 years.

Headlines: Now Evidence Supports Reducing Chemo in Frail Elderly Patients
Teaser: A lower dose of chemotherapy produced comparable outcomes in elderly patients with advanced gastroesophageal cancer but with lower toxicity and better quality of life.

Headlines: Research Needed to Unravel Pieces of Thyroid-CVD Jigsaw
Teaser: An international working group recommends a research agenda focusing on subgroups and the effects of thyroid medications on cardiovascular health.

Headlines: 'Hidden Health Crisis' of Snakebites Gets $100 Million Funding Injection
Teaser: Cancer patients with HIV in the U.S. are more likely to be diagnosed at advanced disease stages and experience higher cancer-related mortality than cancer patients without HIV, researchers say.

Headlines: Advanced Stage at Cancer Diagnosis, Higher Mortality in US Patients With HIV
Teaser: Roche said on Thursday that the U.S. Food and Drug Administration had approved Venclexta (venetoclax) in combination with Gazyva (obinutuzumab) for the treatment of people with previously untreated chronic lymphocytic leukaemia (CLL) or small lymphocytic lymphoma (SLL).

Headlines: FDA Okays Venclexta Plus Gazyva for Previously Untreated Chronic Lymphocytic Leukaemia
Teaser: In acute pancreatitis, the opioid pentazocine relieves pain better than the nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) diclofenac, a randomized controlled trial from India shows.

Headlines: Pentazocine Cuts Acute Pancreatitis Pain Better Than Diclofenac
Teaser: A machine-learning model correctly identifies more children with head trauma who could avoid CT imaging than does the Pediatric Emergency Care Applied Research Network (PECARN) head-trauma decision rules, according to a database study.

Headlines: Machine-Learning Classifier Cuts Unnecessary CT in Kids After Head Trauma
Teaser: Charcoal toothpaste may be having a moment as a go-to brightening and whitening tool, but some dentists say these products might actually damage tooth enamel and make cavities more likely.

Headlines: Charcoal Toothpaste May Do Harm and Not Much Good
Teaser: Dabigatran, sold under the brand name Pradaxa by Boehringer Ingelheim to prevent stroke in people with atrial fibrillation, is no more effective than aspirin for preventing a subsequent stroke in patients who have experienced a cryptogenic stroke.

Headlines: Pradaxa Fails to Prevent Recurrence After Cryptogenic Stroke
Teaser: Individualized performance reports delivered to surgeons appear to reduce extreme overuse of Mohs micrographic surgery (MMS), according to results from a nonrandomized intervention study.

Headlines: Performance Reporting Could Cut Overuse of Mohs Micrographic Surgery
Teaser: Short-term respiratory responses to use of e-cigarettes and tobacco cigarettes are similar, researchers say.

Headlines: E-Cigarettes and Tobacco Cigarettes Induce Similar Acute Respiratory Response
Teaser: Migraine patients with dry eye (DE) are more likely to have symptoms suggestive of neuropathy than DE patients who don't have migraines, according to new findings.

Headlines: Neuropathy May Drive Dry Eye in Migraine Patients
Teaser: A novel PIK3 inhibitor combined with fulvestrant nearly doubled progression- free survival (PFS) in PIK3CA-mutated breast cancer.

Headlines: Alpelisib Nearly Doubles PFS in PIK3-Mutated Breast Cancer
Teaser: An international team of researchers headed by The University of British Columbia has made it their mission to critically appraise "high-impact" observational studies published in the medical literature and inform healthcare providers, policymakers, researchers and the general public about the strengths and limitations of these studies. And they'll do it through a first-of-a-kind website calle...

Headlines: New Website "Unravel Medicine" Aims to Do Just That
Teaser: A 17-gene classifier can predict the course of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) at diagnosis, helping to set the stage for personalized therapy, researchers in the UK say.

Headlines: Novel Test Predicts IBD Course at Diagnosis
Teaser: About 44% of cancer patients may be eligible for an FDA-approved checkpoint inhibitor drug, yet approximately 13% will respond to them, researchers say.

Headlines: Only 13% of Patients Eligible for Checkpoint Inhibitors Respond to Them
Teaser: Herpes simplex viruses 1 and 2 (HSV-1 and HSV-2) are recombining, suggesting that live attenuated HSV-2 vaccine candidates carry a "significant risk" of recombining with circulating HSV-1 strains to form an infectious virus, researchers say.

Headlines: HSV Strains Recombining, Potentially Impacting Vaccine Development
Teaser: Although the Descemet Endothelial Thickness Comparison Trial (DETECT) showed better visual acuity with a newer, more demanding corneal transplantation method, this did not translate into greater patient satisfaction, according to a secondary analysis of outcome data.

Headlines: Patients Equally Pleased With Different Keratoplasty Approaches
Teaser: A device that uses ultrasonic energy to seal pulmonary blood vessels during minimally invasive lung cancer surgery is a promising alternative to staplers and clips, researchers reported in a late-breaking clinical trial session May 4 at the American Association for Thoracic Surgery (AATS) annual meeting in Toronto.

Headlines: New Technique for Minimally Invasive Lung Cancer Surgery Promising
Teaser: More women with breast cancer can benefit from less-invasive nipple-sparing mastectomy, according to an analysis of data from the Mayo Clinic presented at the American Society of Breast Surgeons (ASBrS) annual meeting.

Headlines: Weight-Training May Help Reduce Hot Flashes
Teaser: Postmenopausal women can fight off hot flashes and night sweats through weight-training, a new clinical trial shows.

Headlines: WHO Drug Pricing Talks May Fail to End Secrecy, Activists Fear
Teaser: Governments are working on a drug pricing transparency deal at the World Health Organization's (WHO) annual assembly, but activists said on Thursday they fear crucial costs may be left out, enabling pharmaceutical firms to keep prices high.

Headlines: 'Smart' Hearing Aids Would Identify Speakers in Crowded Room
Teaser: People wearing hearing aids often struggle to differentiate between speakers in a crowded environment, but a small experiment suggests that brain-controlled assistive hearing devices would be able to detect which voice the user is paying attention to, and enhance it.

Headlines: A Third of Reviews of Corneal-Disease Treatments Not Reliable
Teaser: A third of the systematic reviews of corneal-disease treatments are unreliable, according to a new study.

Headlines: Overall Diet Quality in Many With IBS Is Poor
Teaser: Many people with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) don't get the nutrition they need, according to new research from the United Kingdom.

Headlines: Children of Opioid Users More Likely to Attempt Suicide - U.S. Study
Teaser: The U.S. opioid crisis is taking a toll on children of users as a study published this week showed they were more likely to attempt suicide.

Headlines: Machine-Learning Models Help Predict Remission in Crohn's
Teaser: Machine learning models can help identify patients with Crohn's disease likely to be durable responders to ustekinumab before committing to long-term treatment, researchers report.

Headlines: UN Creates New Ebola Chief Role to Tackle Security, Political Issues in Congo
Teaser: The United Nations named an Emergency Ebola Response Coordinator on Thursday, creating a new position to boost efforts to contain a 10-month epidemic in the Democratic Republic of Congo that has killed more than 1,200 people.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Mesothelioma Treatment in 15 Years
Teaser: The NovoTTF-100L System is approved for use in combination with pemetrexed plus platinum-based chemotherapy in patients with malignant pleural mesothelioma.

Headlines: Congo Wants More Use of Merck Vaccine Rather Than J&J Newcomer - Minister
Teaser: Democratic Republic of Congo called on Wednesday for Merck's experimental Ebola vaccine to be fully licensed to facilitate its use in the Ebola-hit country, while saying Johnson & Johnson's rival drug would complicate matters.

Headlines: Many Negative Phase 3 Cancer Trials Done Without Supporting Evidence From Phase 2 Trials
Teaser: Negative phase 3 trials in oncology are often done without a supporting phase 2 trial, suggests a pooled analysis.

Headlines: Flash Glucose Monitoring Helps Control Type 2 Diabetes
Teaser: A flash glucose monitoring (FGM) system, the FreeStyle Libre from Abbott, helps achieve significant hemoglobin (Hb)A1c reductions in patients with type 2 diabetes using insulin, and may improve satisfaction, according to a company-funded study.

Headlines: Merck's Keytruda Fails as Monotherapy in Breast Cancer Study
Teaser: The Phase 3 KEYNOTE-119 trial evaluating Merck's Keytruda (pembrolizumab) as monotherapy for the second- or third-line treatment of patients with metastatic triple-negative breast cancer did not meet its pre-specified primary endpoint of superior overall survival compared to chemotherapy (capecitabine, eribulin, gemcitabine or vinorelbine), the company announced Monday.

Headlines: Myovant Sciences' Uterine Fibroids Combo Therapy Meets Main Goal in Study
Teaser: Myovant Sciences Ltd said on Tuesday its combination therapy met the main goal of a late-stage study testing the treatment in women with uterine fibroids.

Headlines: NIH Suspended Some Grants to Duke Amid Concern for Patient Safety
Teaser: Case followed misconduct finding in oncology research, and lung research that led to $112.5 million settlement with the US government.

Headlines: What's Happening at ASCO 2019?
Teaser: The largest meeting in the oncology world is taking place in Chicago yet again, but this year some novel topics are in the spotlight, as well as the usual clinical data.

Headlines: More U.S. Mothers Diagnosed With Depression at Childbirth
Teaser: Growing numbers of new mothers are being diagnosed with depression before they leave the hospital with their newborns, according to a U.S. study that suggests screening women at childbirth could help get treatment for those who need it.

Headlines: Some Systemic Psoriasis Drugs May Carry Lower Risk of Serious Infection
Teaser: Psoriasis patients who start treatment with apremilast, etanercept or ustekinumab have a lower risk of developing a serious infection than those prescribed methotrexate, new findings show.

Headlines: Targeting Vasopressin May Improve Social Deficits in Autism
Teaser: There are currently no medications to address social deficits in autism, but two new studies suggest that vasopressin, a hormone associated with social bonding, may be a viable target for drug development.

Headlines: Lenalidomide Delays Onset of Multiple Myeloma
Teaser: In patients with both high-risk and intermediate smoldering myeloma, treatment with single-agent lenalidomide significantly delayed progression to full-blown disease.

Headlines: Methylphenidate Dose Titration in ADHD Should Be Based on Outcomes
Teaser: Dose titration of methylphenidate in patients with attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) should aim to maximize the ratio of benefit to adverse effects, as there appears to be no scientific rationale for published maximum doses, according to a meta-analysis.

Headlines: New Lymphoma Drugs Build on BTK Inhibitor Success
Teaser: Life expectancy for patients with Waldenstrom's macroglobulinemia has improved considerably in the past decade, and new treatments on the horizon could mean that trend continues.

Headlines: Scientists Accuse Hungary of Seeking 'Total Political Control' Over Research
Teaser: Hungary's oldest and biggest scientific institute accused the government on Wednesday of trying to take "total political control" of vital research through plans to set up a new state body to oversee funding and work.

Headlines: Laparoscopic Gastrectomy Effective for Locally Advanced Gastric Cancer
Teaser: Laparoscopic gastrectomy is noninferior to open distal gastrectomy in patients with locally advanced gastric cancer, researchers from China report.

Headlines: Upadacitinib Monotherapy Effective in Refractory Rheumatoid Arthritis
Teaser: Monotherapy with the JAK1-selective inhibitor upadacitinib is effective in patients with active rheumatoid arthritis who have an inadequate response to methotrexate, according to results from the SELECT-MONOTHERAPY phase 3 trial.

Headlines: When Shots Start Younger, More Teens Get Meningococcal Vaccine
Teaser: Teens are more likely to get at least one of two recommended doses of the meningococcal vaccine when they receive their first shot by early adolescence, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Early Endoscopic Remission Linked to Altered Course of Crohn's Disease
Teaser: Patients with early Crohn's disease who achieve endoscopic or deep remission after one year of intensive treatment are less likely to experience disease progression over the next several years, new research shows.

Headlines: Waterfall Plots Oversell Response Rates in Cancer Trials
Teaser: Graphs known as waterfall plots exaggerate cancer-treatment response rates, and their use in oncology literature is increasing, according to new findings.

Headlines: BioMarin Says Data Shows Hemophilia Gene Therapy Effects Could Wane
Teaser: BioMarin Pharmaceutical Inc said on Tuesday early trial data for its gene therapy for hemophilia A suggested the one-time infusion's effect on some patients' bleeding disorders would last eight years.

Headlines: Breast-Cancer Risk Increased in Trans Women on Hormones
Teaser: Transwomen on hormone treatment face a much higher risk of breast cancer than cisgender men but a lower risk than cisgender women, according to new findings.

Headlines: Allergan's Vraylar Wins U.S. FDA Approval for Bipolar Depression
Teaser: Allergan Plc's Vraylar won U.S. regulatory approval to treat depressive episodes of bipolar I disorder, expanding its scope of treatment to a full spectrum of symptoms related to the condition, the company said on Monday.

Headlines: WHO Agrees Watered-Down Resolution on Transparency in Drug Costs
Teaser: Countries at the World Health Organization agreed on Tuesday to push for clearer drug pricing, after watering down a draft resolution that would have also required pharmaceutical firms to disclose the cost of making medicines.

Headlines: Ibrutinib and Venetoclax Combo 'Impressive' in Front-Line CLL
Teaser: The combination of ibrutinib and venetoclax has shown 'impressive results' in the front-line treatment of chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL), and may not need to be continued indefinitely.

Headlines: Sustained Lower BP After Acute ICH Linked to Better Outcomes
Teaser: Researchers combined data from two large trials with divergent findings to determine how lowering of blood pressure after acute intracranial hemorrhage (ICH) affects 90-day outcomes.

Headlines: Daratumumab Triplet for First-Line Myeloma, but Questions Remain
Teaser: The daratumumab, lenalidomide, and dexamethasone triplet is a new frontline option for patients with multiple myeloma who are not candidates for transplant, but how practice-changing are the data?

Headlines: Skin Microbiome's Emerging Role in Eczema
Teaser: A combination Janus and spleen tyrosine kinase inhibitor improves eczema scores, but now researchers are examining its effect on Staphylococcus aureus in patients with atopic dermatitis.

Headlines: Vision Loss Linked With Anxiety, Depression - and Vice Versa
Teaser: Older adults with impaired vision are more likely to have symptoms of anxiety and depression, and older adults with symptoms of anxiety or depression are more likely to develop vision impairment, according to findings from the U.S. National Health and Aging Trends Study.

Headlines: Incyte's Jakafi Gets FDA Approval to Treat Graft vs Host Disease
Teaser: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration on Friday approved Incyte Corp's treatment for acute Graft versus Host disease (GvHD), an inflammatory response by the immune system after a bone marrow transplant.

Headlines: Seniors Who Feel Their Life Has Purpose May Live Longer
Teaser: Seniors who feel their life has purpose may be less likely to die from heart, circulatory and digestive diseases and more likely to live longer, new data suggest.

Headlines: FDA OKs First Gene Therapy for Spinal Muscular Atrophy
Teaser: A single, one-time infusion of onasemnogene abeparvovec-xioi (Zolgensma) can minimize the progression of SMA and improve survival in children younger than age 2 years — and will cost over $2 million.

Headlines: TITAN Solidifies Place for Apalutamide in Metastatic CSPC
Teaser: The next-generation androgen receptor inhibitor extended overall survival over ADT alone for men with metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer.

Headlines: Venetoclax Combination Better Than Chlorambucil in CLL Patients With Coexisting Conditions
Teaser: Among patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) and coexisting conditions such as heart, lung or digestive disease, adding venetoclax to obinutuzumab therapy produces longer progression-free survival than adding chlorambucil, newly-published results of the CLL14 trial have concluded.

Headlines: Five-Year Study Showed Benefits of Dabrafenib/trametinib Therapy for Metastatic Melanoma
Teaser: Researchers combining the results of two large studies of volunteers with unresectable or metastatic melanoma have concluded that first-line therapy with dabrafenib combined with trametinib produces a 5-year benefit in about a third of patients with a BRAF V600E or V600K mutation.

Headlines: Case-Report Authorship Shows Gender Bias
Teaser: Women are underrepresented as both first and last authors of case reports, new findings show.

Headlines: U.S. Health Agency Cancels Research Contract Involving Use of Fetal Tissue
Teaser: The Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) said on Wednesday it would cancel its research contract involving human fetal tissue from elective abortions with the University of California.

Headlines: Melanoma Can Occur on Skin That Doesn't Get Much Sun
Teaser: Enfortumab vedotin could become the 'next-in-line' treatment for patients with advanced and metastatic urothelial cancer, in whom there is a 'high unmet need.'

Headlines: Novel Drug for Advanced Urothelial Cancer: Enfortumab Vedotin
Teaser: Germany's highest civil court on Tuesday rejected French drugmaker Sanofi's bid to fend off a legal challenge by U.S. rival Amgen against Sanofi's cholesterol drug Praluent.

Headlines: Sanofi Loses German Patent Case Against Amgen Over Cholesterol Drug
Teaser: Clinical calculator could spare breast cancer patients 5 years of unnecessary hormone therapy.

Headlines: Free Online Tool Predicts Late ER+ Breast Cancer Recurrence
Teaser: People who have mild traumatic brain injuries may be more likely to have lasting functional deficits that get in the way of daily activities than patients who experience other types of injuries, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: Even Mild Brain Injuries Tied to Lasting Functional Deficits
Teaser: Low serum cholesterol levels in people with type 2 diabetes were associated with diabetic polyneuropathy in a cross-sectional study.

Headlines: Without Older Subjects, Cancer Drug Trials Rely on Atypical Patients
Teaser: A rogue Chinese scientist who caused outrage last year when he said he had created the world's first "gene-edited" babies in an attempt to protect them from HIV may also have put them at risk with a "foolish" choice of gene, experts said on Monday.

Headlines: Diabetic Polyneuropathy Tied to Low Cholesterol Levels
Teaser: An experimental Amgen Inc drug that targets a specific genetic mutation significantly reduced tumor size in half of evaluated patients with advanced lung cancer in a small, early-stage trial, researchers said on Monday.

Headlines: Rogue Chinese Scientist Made 'Foolish' Choice in Gene-Edited Babies
Teaser: Cancer drugs receiving accelerated approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) commonly fail to prolong overall survival in later "confirmatory" trials, researchers report.

Headlines: Amgen Drug Shows High Response Rate in Small Lung and Colon Cancer Trial
Teaser: The androgen receptor inhibitor is an effective first-line option for men with metastatic hormone-sensitive prostate cancer, but the cost is high.

Headlines: Cancer Drugs With Accelerated Approval Often Fail to Prolong Survival
Teaser: A specially designed board book can be used to reliably, quickly - and enjoyably - assess emergent literacy skills in preschool-age children, new findings show.

Headlines: Enzalutamide Joins Initial Tx List for Metastatic Prostate Cancer
Teaser: Seniors with declining vision are more likely than peers with good eyesight to experience discrimination as well as depression that may result from this bias, a new study from the UK suggests.

Headlines: Board-Book Screener Rates Emergent Literacy Skills at Well Child Visits
Teaser: Structural changes and volume loss seen in gray matter can explain cognitive, clinical symptoms that are elusive on standard MRI in patients with primary progressive MS, researchers say.

Headlines: Seniors With Vision Loss Experience Discrimination, Depression
Teaser: The percentage of smokers advised to quit by their primary-care physician (PCP) has inched up in recent years, but men, younger people and minorities are significantly less likely to get this advice, new findings show.

Headlines: FDA Overlooked Red Flags in Drugmaker's Testing of New Depression Medicine
Teaser: In March, esketamine was approved by the FDA for the treatment of intractable depression, but critics say the FDA was given little evidence of the drug's efficacy and its safety for long-term use.

Headlines: Postpartum Depression in New Dads Often Missed
Teaser: While many people can pick up on signs of postpartum depression in new mothers, the same signs are often mistaken for something else or missed entirely in fathers, a British study suggests.

Headlines: 'Liquid Biopsy' for Pediatric Fatty Liver Disease on the Horizon
Teaser: A blood test could replace the need for liver biopsy in the management of non-alcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD) in children within five years, European researchers predict.

Headlines: Eculizumab Changed the Course of Atypical Hemolytic Uremic Syndrome
Teaser: The approval of the monoclonal antibody eculizumab for treatment of atypical hemolytic uremic syndrome led to significant improvements in outcomes, according to a study of French patients presented June 3 at American Transplant Congress 2019 in Boston.

Headlines: Pembro Now Approved for First-Line Use in Head and Neck Cancer
Teaser: The FDA has now approved first-line use in head and neck cancer on the basis of clinical trial results that were recently described as 'practice changing.'

Headlines: Post-Approval Study Finds No Surprises With Argus II Retinal Implant
Teaser: Post-approval follow-up of the Argus II Retinal Prosthesis System shows safety and visual function outcomes similar to those in previous trials, according to a company-funded study.

Headlines: Some Patients Subject to Resuscitation-Discontinuation Rule Could Survive
Teaser: Some patients subject to the so-called UN10 rule to discontinue resuscitation during in-hospital cardiac arrest (IHCA) could survive, based on data from the American Heart Association Get With the Guidelines-Resuscitation-IHCA registry.

Headlines: Increased Fracture Risk in Kids Given Early Acid-Suppression Therapy
Teaser: Acid-suppression therapy early in life is associated with an increased risk of fracture in childhood, according to a retrospective study.

Headlines: FDA Approves First Chemoimmunotherapy for R/R Lymphoma Type
Teaser: The FDA has granted accelerated approval to polatuzumab for previously treated diffuse large B-cell lymphoma.

Headlines: More Evidence Endorses Benefits of Long-Acting Antipsychotics
Teaser: New research shows that long-acting injectable antipsychotics improve medication adherence and reduce suicide attempts compared to oral drugs, but physicians aren't prescribing them as per guidelines.

Headlines: Jury Still Out on Best Settings, Duration of Ultrasound Treatment for Chronic Joint Pain
Teaser: It is still too early to make definite recommendations on the settings or duration of therapeutic ultrasound for chronic pain in the knee, hip or shoulder, the authors of a systematic review say.

Headlines: Low Risk for Adverse Events With DAAs Cause for Reassurance
Teaser: In a nationally representative sample, patients taking direct-acting antivirals for chronic HCV infection did not experience higher rates of treatment-related adverse events than patients not taking the drugs.

Headlines: Long-Standing AF Tied to Outcomes of Left-Atrial-Appendage Occlusion
Teaser: Long-standing persistent atrial fibrillation (LSPAF) is associated with more residual leak following percutaneous left atrial appendage (LAA) occlusion with the Watchman device, according to one of two new studies of LAA closure.

Headlines: Liquid Biopsies Predict Early ER+ Breast Cancer Progression
Teaser: Biomarkers in ctDNA "could detect right at the start of treatment women whose cancers were most likely to develop resistance quickly to palbociclib". Nicholas Turner, Institute of Cancer Research.

Headlines: Previous Seasons' Flu Shots Protective, Less So for Elders
Teaser: Influenza vaccines given in previous seasons still provide some protection against infection, according to a new study.

Headlines: CYP2C19-Metabolizer Status Rarely Prompts P2Y12-Inhibitor Switching
Teaser: Mandatory reporting of CYP2C19-metabolizer status rarely prompted physicians in the GEMINI-ACS-1 clinical trial to switch P2Y12 inhibitors, researchers report.

Headlines: Cardioprotective Drugs Can Help Avoid Chemo Disruption in Some Breast Cancer Patients
Teaser: ACE inhibitors or beta blockers can preserve cardiac function and avoid chemotherapy disruption in HER2-positive breast cancer patients treated with anthracyclines followed by trastuzumab, researchers say.

Headlines: Broadening Eligibility for Lung Cancer Trials Could Have Huge Impact
Teaser: Adopting expanded inclusion criteria for clinical trials would nearly double the percentage of patients with advanced non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) who are eligible to enroll, according to new research.

Headlines: Many US Kids Still Eating Laundry Pods
Teaser: Many American children are still being poisoned by laundry pods, according to a new study that suggests voluntary safety standards many not do enough to prevent kids from eating them.

Headlines: Uganda Clears Three Experimental Ebola Treatments, Watches for Spread
Teaser: Health workers have got the all-clear to use three experimental Ebola treatments in Uganda, a week after the deadly disease spread over the border from Democratic Republic of Congo, authorities said on Tuesday.

Headlines: Pneumococcal Conjugate Vaccine in Infancy Cuts Otitis Media
Teaser: Administration of pneumococcal conjugate vaccine (PCV) in early infancy substantially reduces the risk of pneumococcal acute otitis media (AOM), according to a new Cochrane review.

Headlines: Physical Un-Fitness Linked With Depression, Anxiety in Middle-Aged Women
Teaser: Mid-life women with weak upper and lower body fitness may be more prone to depression and anxiety, a study from Singapore suggests.

Headlines: MABs Successfully Treat Immunotherapy-Related Myocarditis
Teaser: Alemtuzumab and abatacept were both successfully used in patients with steroid-refractory myocarditis that developed during treatment with immune checkpoint inhibitors.

Headlines: Ebola's Spread Shows How Science Needs Societies to Succeed
Teaser: Researchers have harnessed the power of social media to build a genetic database, according to a new report.

Headlines: Genetics Research Gets Help From Social Media
Teaser: VBI Vaccines Inc said on Monday a late-stage study testing its hepatitis B vaccine against GlaxoSmithKline's Engerix-B in adults met its main goals.

Headlines: VBI Hepatitis B Vaccine Meets Main Goals in Late-Stage Trial
Teaser: Quality of life in patients with ambulatory advanced heart failure is worse among women than among men, according to findings.

Headlines: QOL With Ambulatory Advanced Heart Failure Worse for Women Than Men
Teaser: A newly identified lymphocyte that expresses both T-cell receptors (TCR) and B-cell receptors (BCR) appears to play an important role in type 1 diabetes, researchers report.

Headlines: New Lymphocyte Type Plays Important Role in Type 1 Diabetes
Teaser: For several decades, certain cancer centers have been allowed by the U.S. government to charge more for the care they give. A new study finds the care given at these centers isn't very different from that received at other top-notch facilities.

Headlines: Eleven US Cancer Centers Get to Charge More for Care
Teaser: The human B-cell response to Ebola virus evolves significantly during the three years after infection, according to detailed studies of four survivors of the 2014 West African outbreak.

Headlines: Human B-Cell Response Evolves During the Years After Ebola Infection
Teaser: Enanta Pharmaceuticals Inc said on Friday its treatment for a highly contagious respiratory infection met the main goal of reducing virus levels in the body in a mid-stage study.

Headlines: Enanta's Lung Infection Therapy Succeeds in Mid-Stage Trial
Teaser: In patients with localized muscle-invasive bladder cancer, radical cystectomy appears to have better outcome and may be much less costly than combining radiation, chemotherapy and endoscopic treatments, according to a retrospective study of Medicare data.

Headlines: Radical Cystectomy Cheaper Than Trimodal Therapy in Some Bladder Cancers
Teaser: Several different types of mesh implant surgery may be effective for treating bladder leaks, but the long-term safety and effectiveness of the procedures isn't yet clear, a new analysis suggests.

Headlines: Mesh Implants Work for Bladder Leakage, Long-Term Safety Unclear
Teaser: Two variables, gestational age at phototherapy initiation and the difference between starting threshold and post-phototherapy total serum bilirubin (TSB), accurately predict rebound hyperbilirubinemia in infants, researchers report.

Headlines: Two Variables Accurately Predict Rebound Hyperbilirubinemia
Teaser: British drugmaker GSK said it has struck a research deal with the early pioneers of a prominent gene-editing technology at the University of California, in a boost to its prospects for developing new drugs.

Headlines: GSK Signs Up Gene-Editing Pioneers in Drug Discovery Alliance
Teaser: Measurable residual disease, detected with next-generation genomic sequencing, is associated with a significantly increased risk for relapse. Experts question the prognostic ability of other assessment tools.

Headlines: Measurable Residual Disease in AML Ups Post-HSCT Relapse Risk
Teaser: Different conclusions have been drawn from similar findings, perhaps as a result of subjective margins for equivalence in HER2+ breast cancer research.

Headlines: Shorter-term Herceptin Sufficient? No Agreement
Teaser: French technology company Dassault Systemes SE is nearing a deal to acquire U.S.-based software firm clinical trials Medidata Solutions Inc, CNBC reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

Headlines: France's Dassault Nears Deal to Buy Health Software Maker Medidata - CNBC
Teaser: Compared to smaller facilities, hospitals that provide complex care for critical illness or serious injury may find it harder to make patients happy, a U.S. study suggests.

Headlines: TAVR Speedier Stenosis Fix Than SAVR in Patients With Prior CABG
Teaser: In patients who have previously undergone coronary-artery bypass grafting (CABG) and have symptomatic aortic stenosis (AS), transcatheter aortic-valve replacement (TAVR) using the Medtronic Corevalve System may offer advantages over surgical aortic-valve replacement (SAVR).

Headlines: Proactive Drug Monitoring Improves Outcomes in Kids With Crohn’s
Teaser: Proactive therapeutic-drug monitoring (TDM) in children with Crohn's disease on adalimumab reduces clinical exacerbations compared to reactive TDM, a randomized controlled trial shows.

Headlines: FDA Declines to Approve Acer Therapeutics' Treatment for Rare Genetic Disorder
Teaser: Acer Therapeutics Inc said on Tuesday its treatment for a severe, rare genetic disorder that can cause blood vessels to fatally rupture was declined approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

Headlines: Primary Anastomosis Better Than Hartmann's Procedure for Treating Perforated Diverticulitis
Teaser: For stable patients with perforated diverticulitis and peritonitis, sigmoidectomy with primary anastomosis provides better outcomes than does Hartmann's procedure, according to results from the LADIES trial.

Headlines: Androgen Deprivation Therapy Affects Multiple Bone Properties
Teaser: Beyond the well-known association of androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) with an accelerated decline in areal bone mineral density (aBMD), the treatment also affects bone in other ways, according to a cross-sectional study.

Headlines: 'Out-of-the-Box' Approaches Needed for Glioblastoma
Teaser: More radical approaches to the treatment of glioblastoma are called for as long-term survival remains grim and unchanged, despite efforts to improve outcomes for patients with this disease.

Headlines: Early-Life Gluten Intake Linked to Increased Risk of Celiac Disease
Teaser: Higher intake of gluten early in life is associated with an increased risk of celiac disease (CD) and CD autoimmunity, according to new findings.

Headlines: Venetoclax for Myeloma: Trial on Hold, Now Details of Benefit
Teaser: Although the BELLINI trial was put on partial hold, the trial was allowed to continue for patients for whom the addition of venetoclax showed benefit. New data now identify this subgroup.

Headlines: Targeted Therapies Linked to Survival Benefits for Older Patients With Advanced Renal Cancer
Teaser: Targeted therapies were associated with "modest survival advantages" in elderly Medicare patients with metastatic renal cell carcinoma (mRCC) in a retrospective study.

Headlines: Niraparib-Pembrolizumab Combo May Have Benefit in Ovarian, Breast Cancers
Teaser: Niraparib in combination with pembrolizumab may show promise in women with recurrent platinum-resistant ovarian carcinoma (PROC) and in those with advanced or metastatic triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC), according to results from two industry-sponsored phase 2 trials.

Headlines: Peritoneal Carcinomatosis Profiles Highlight Gastric Cancer Targets
Teaser: Sequencing of whole exome and transcriptome of peritoneal carcinomatosis (PC) in patients with gastric adenocarcinoma (GAC) has given novel insights and opened up new therapeutic opportunities, according to Texas-based researchers.

Headlines: When Coronary CTA Is Most Appropriate for Suspected Heart Disease
Teaser: New research helps zero in on which patients with suspected coronary artery disease (CAD) will derive the most benefit from coronary computed tomography angiography (CTA).

Headlines: Dr Eric Rubin to Take the Helm at NEJM
Teaser: The new editor will face challenges in managing conflicts of interest and maintaining a subscription model.

Headlines: Could Chinese Cancer Retraction Point to Drive for Higher Standards?
Teaser: The authors of a scientific article retracted it just months after publication, invoking Chinese regulators as an explanation.

Headlines: Varying Vaccine Trust Leaves Populations Vulnerable, Global Study Finds
Teaser: The marketplace introduction of infliximab for the treatment of IBD did not reduce hospitalization or surgery rates in a large population of patients with Crohn disease and ulcerative colitis.

Headlines: Biologics in IBD: More Thoughtful Use Could Improve Outcomes
Teaser: One in five surgeons who do hemodialysis access procedures continue to use arteriovenous grafts (AVG) instead of the recommended best practice of arteriovenous fistula (AVF), researchers say.

Headlines: One in Five Surgeons Still Using Low-Value Arteriovenous Graft for Dialysis Access
Teaser: Flashing light effects that have become the norm for electronic dance music concerts could bring on epileptic seizures in young people who may not know they have a vulnerability, Dutch researchers say.

Headlines: Strobing Stage Lights Could Up Risk of Epileptic Seizures
Teaser: Cholecystectomy is associated with a reduced risk of stroke, according to a new retrospective cohort study.

Headlines: Cholecystectomy Linked to Lower Stroke Risk in Gallstone Disease
Teaser: Following a low-FODMAP diet for a limited period appears not to reduce the mean daily intake of most micronutrients in adults with irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) with diarrhea, a new study suggests.
